The original script for Nu , pogodi ! was created for the animation studio Soyuzmultfilm in Moscow by the writers Felix Kandel , Arkady Khait and Aleksandr Kurlyandsky , whose works included humourist and satirical writings .
Man on a Balcony ( also known as Portrait of Dr. Théo Morinaud and ' L'Homme au balcon ) , is a large oil painting created in 1912 by the French artist , theorist and writer Albert Gleizes ( 1881 - -1953 ) .
Arii Matamoe , also titled The Royal End ( French : La Fin royale ) is a painting on coarse cloth by the French artist Paul Gauguin , created in 1892 during the painter 's first visit to Tahiti .
Janov Pelorat is a character in the Foundation Series of books by Isaac Asimov .
The Jester Don Diego de Acedo is one of a series of portraits of jesters at the court of Philip IV of Spain by Diego Velázquez .
The Palazzo Branconio dell'Aquila is a lost palace in the rione Borgo of Rome ( west of Castel Sant'Angelo ) , designed by Raphael for Giovanbattista Branconio dell'Aquila , a papal advisor and goldsmith .
The Animals of Farthing Wood is a children 's animated series commissioned by the European Broadcasting Union between 1992 and 1995 , and is based on the series of books written by English author Colin Dann .
Father Brown is a fictional Roman Catholic priest and amateur sleuth created in the early 1900s by English novelist G. K. Chesterton .
Commentary on the Apocalypse ( Commentaria In Apocalypsin ) is a book written in the eighth century by the Spanish monk and theologian Beatus of Liébana .
Palaban ( English : Tough ) is a news and public affairs program of GMA Network hosted by Winnie Monsod , former Miss Universe Runner - Up Miriam Quiambao and Malou Mangahas .
The Ghosts of Motley Hall is a British children 's television series written by Richard Carpenter .
Portrait of an African is a painting by Allan Ramsay , painted c. 1757 - -1760 , and believed to be of Ignatius Sancho .
The Hettangian was introduced in the literature by Swiss palaeontologist , Eugène Renevier , in 1864 .
Personnage Oiseaux is one of Joan Miró 's largest works in the United States and his only glass mosaic mural , ( Bird Characters ) , 1972 - -1978 .
The Venus of Urbino is a 1538 oil painting by the Italian master Titian .
This Is America , Charlie Brown is an eight - part animated television miniseries , depicting events in American history with characters from the Charles M. Schulz comic strip Peanuts .
The Elder Sister ( French : La soeur aînée ) is a painting by nineteenth century French artist William - Adolphe Bouguereau in 1869 .
The Berlin Foundry Cup ( German : Erzgießerei - Schale ) is a red - figure kylix ( drinking cup ) from the early 5th century BC . It is the name vase of the Attic vase painter known conventionally as the Foundry Painter .
The Story of America 's Elite Counter terrorist Unit ( ISBN 0 - 440 - 23733 - 5 ) , The Unit was created for television and executive produced by David Mamet and Shawn Ryan .
Portrait of a Commander or A Commander Being Dressed for Battle is a portrait of an unknown man in plate armour , normally attributed to Peter Paul Rubens .
Pope Paul III and His Grandsons ( Italian : Paolo III e i nipoti Alessandro e Ottavio Farnese ) is a painting in oil on canvas by Titian , housed in the Museo di Capodimonte , Naples .
Boats du Rhône is a series of two sketches ( a small one in a letter , the other very large and detailed with a reed pen ) and three oil paintings , listed below , created by the Dutch artist Vincent van Gogh while living in Arles , France , during August , 1888 .
The Magic Land of Allakazam was the name of a groundbreaking series of network television shows featuring American magician Mark Wilson .
Levitated Mass is a 2012 large - scale sculpture by Michael Heizer on the campus of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art . The installation consists of a 340-ton boulder affixed above a concrete trench through which visitors may walk .
The Sorceress is a painting by John William Waterhouse completed between 1911 and 1915 .
The Spirit of Polonia , also known as Solidarity , by Edmund Lewandowski is a sculpture commissioned as part of the fifteenth anniversary of Polanki , the Polish Women 's Cultural Club of Milwaukee .
A Charlie Brown Thanksgiving is the tenth prime - time animated TV special based upon the popular comic strip Peanuts , by Charles M. Schulz .
Vahine no te vi ( English : Woman of the Mango ) is an 1892 painting by Paul Gauguin , currently in the collection of the Baltimore Museum of Art . It is one of many works of modern art purchased by the Cone sisters .
En Canot , referred to in various publications as I m Boot , Le Canot , Femme au Canot et à l'Ombrelle , En Bâteau , In the Canoe , The Boat , On the Beach , Am Strand , I m Schiff , V Člunu and I m Kanu , is an oil painting by Jean Metzinger .
Painting ( Blue Star ) ( French : Peinture ( Étoile Bleue ) ) is a 1927 painting by the Catalan artist Joan Miró .
There 's No Time for Love , Charlie Brown is the ninth prime - time animated TV specials based upon the popular comic strip Peanuts , by Charles M. Schulz .
Figure with Meat is a 1954 painting by the Irish - born artist Francis Bacon .
The Arrival of the Hungarians ( Hungarian : A magyarok bejövetele ; commonly known as Feszty Panorama or Feszty Cyclorama , Hungarian : Feszty - körkép ) is a large cyclorama -- a circular panoramic painting -- by Hungarian painter Árpád Feszty and his assistants , depicting the arrival of the Hungarians in the Carpathian Basin in 895 .
Scène d'été , or Summer Scene , is an oil on canvas painting by Frédéric Bazille , completed in 1869 , a year before his death in 1870 .
The Bugle is a satirical news podcast , hosted by John Oliver and Andy Zaltzman .
At Home with the Braithwaites is a British comedy - drama television series , created and written by Sally Wainwright ( except for the final four episodes ) .
Landscape Near Figueras ( 1910 ) is a painting by the Spanish artist Salvador Dalí .
The Woodwright 's Shop is a traditional woodworking show hosted by master carpenter Roy Underhill on PBS in the United States .
The Melun Diptych is a two - panel oil painting by the French court painter Jean Fouquet ( 1425 - -1480 ) created around 1452 .
Caliban ( /ˈkælᵻbæn/ KAL - ə - ban ) is one of the main antagonists in William Shakespeare 's play The Tempest .
The Mild Mild West is a mural by graffiti artist Banksy .
Rock & Roll Jeopardy ! is an American television game show created by Scott Sternberg and adapted from the quiz show Jeopardy !
The Beethoven Frieze is a painting by Gustav Klimt on display in the Secession Building , Vienna , Austria .
Twittering Machine ( Die Zwitscher - Maschine ) is a 1922 watercolor and pen and ink oil transfer on paper by Swiss - German painter Paul Klee .
Derek and Simon is a 2007 web based series created by Derek Waters , Simon Helberg , and Bob Odenkirk , which aired on the now - defunct website , Super Deluxe .
Madame X or Portrait of Madame X is the informal title of a portrait painting by John Singer Sargent of a young socialite named Virginie Amélie Avegno Gautreau , wife of Pierre Gautreau .
The Laughing Cavalier ( 1624 ) is a portrait by the Dutch Golden Age painter Frans Hals in the Wallace Collection in London , which has been described as `` one of the most brilliant of all Baroque portraits '' .
The Adventure of English is a British television series ( ITV ) on the history of the English language presented by Melvyn Bragg as well as a companion book , also written by Bragg .
The World of Stainboy is a series of flash animation shorts created in 2000 by director Tim Burton and animated by Flinch Studio .
Warming Up is a long - running daily blog and podcast , written by British comedian and writer Richard Herring .
Woman with a Parasol - Madame Monet and Her Son , sometimes known as The Stroll ( French : La Promenade ) is an oil - on - canvas painting by Claude Monet from 1875 .
Charlie Brown 's Christmas Tales is one of many prime - time animated TV specials based on characters from the Charles M. Schulz comic strip Peanuts .
Babar the Elephant is a fictional character who first appeared in 1931 in the French children 's book Histoire de Babar by Jean de Brunhoff .
Bent Propeller ( also known as World Trade Center Stabile ) was a sculpture by Alexander Calder , commissioned by the Port of New York Authority in 1969 and installed in 1970 at the World Trade Center in New York .
The Scoutmaster is a 1956 painting by Norman Rockwell .
The Amazing World of Gumball ( known also as Gumball ) is a British - American children 's animated television series created by Ben Bocquelet for Cartoon Network .
Fluffy Gardens is an Irish preschool animation television show created , written and directed by Jason Tammemagi and produced by Monster Animation & Design Ltd. Each seven - minute episode tells the story of a different character .
Joseph Salamé ( born on 25 December 1914 in Antelias , Lebanon - 29 March 2004 ) was an apostolic administrator of the Maronite Catholic Eparchy of Latakia and Archeparch of the Maronite Catholic Archeparchy of Aleppo .
Varun Chopra ( born 21 June 1987 in Barking , Greater London ) is an English cricketer , and has captained the English U-19 cricket team in series against Sri Lanka in 2005 and India in 2006 .
Sedapatti Suryanarayana Devar Rajendran , commonly known by his stage name S. S. Rajendran ( SSR ) , ( Tamil : எஸ். எஸ். ராஜேந்திரன் ; January 1928 -- 24 October 2014 ) was an Indian film actor , director , producer and politician .
Charles Frederic Moberly Bell ( 2 April 1847 in Alexandria -- 5 April 1911 in London ) was a prominent British journalist and newspaper editor during the late 19th and early 20th centuries .
Burkard Hillebrands , Prof . Dr. ( * 1957 ) is a German physicist and professor of physics .
Nigel Kennedy ( born 28 December 1956 ) is a British violinist and violist .
Jörgen Augustsson , born 28 October 1952 , is a former Swedish footballer .
Mohamed Sabry ( Arabic:محمد صبري ) ( born 7 April 1974 ) was an Egyptian football Midfielder , he played for Zamalek , Kazma and Ittihad Alexandria .
Tang Hao ( Chinese : 唐豪 ; pinyin : Táng Háo ) or Tang Fan Sheng ( 1887 - -1959 ) was a Chinese lawyer and expert on chinese martial arts .
Dave Benton ( born 31 January 1951 , real name Efrén Eugene Benita ) is a pop musician and 2001 winner of the Eurovision Song Contest .
Talay Riley ( born 10 July 1990 ) is a Nigerian / British singer - songwriter signed to Island Records .
Eli Berman ( born 1960 ) is the Research Director for International Security Studies at the UC Institute on Global Conflict and Cooperation and since 2010 a Professor of economics at the University of California , San Diego .
Edward Buncombe ( 1742 - -1778 ) was a plantation owner from the Province of North Carolina who served as a colonel in the Continental Army ( the army of the Patriot side ) in the American Revolutionary War .
Slaven Musa ( born 21 June 1971 ) is a football coach and former football player .
Gao Xixi ( Chinese : 高希希 ; born 1962 ) is a Chinese television director and producer , famous for directing a number of commercially successful Chinese television series .
Ümit Bilican ( born 29 March 1981 ) is a Turkish professional footballer who has played for several clubs in Europe .
Torleiv Maseng ( born 1946 ) is a prominent Norwegian engineer , who made some contribution to the Global System for Mobile Communications project .
Edgars Eriņš ( born 18 June 1986 ) is a Latvian decathlete and bobsledder .
Simone Ritscher ( born 1 September 1959 ) is a German actress , known for her roles as Doris van Norden in Sturm der Liebe and as Maria di Balbi in Verbotene Liebe .
Gaby Roslin ( born 12 July 1964 ) is an English television presenter and actress , who rose to fame co - presenting The Big Breakfast on Channel 4 between 1992 and 1996 .
Rozalla Miller ( born 18 March 1964 ) , better known as simply Rozalla , is a Zambian dance music performer .
Svein Nymo ( 10 June 1953 - 15 August 2014 ) was a Norwegian violinist and composer from Målselv in Troms , and the son of the traditional Norwegian folk musician Johan Nymo .
Giuseppe Turbini ( Piacenza , 1702- Piacenza , 1788 ) was an Italian painter , specializing in quadratura .
Ernst Schweninger ( 15 June 1850 -- 13 January 1924 ) was a German physician who developed the Schweninger method , a reduction of obesity by the restriction of fluids in the diet .
Momtaz Begum - Hossain ( Bengali : মমতাজ বেগম - হোসেন ; born 1981 ) is an English freelance journalist , craft expert and presenter .
Ken Okuyama ( born 1959 ) is a Japanese industrial designer and owner of the Ken Okuyama Design company .
José Riga ( born 30 July 1957 ) is a Belgian former football player and current manager .
Kathy Tremblay ( born 16 June 1982 in Ste - Foy , Quebec ) is a professional Canadian triathlete and member of the National Team .
Jozef van Wissem ( born 1962 ) is a Dutch minimalist composer and lute player based in Brooklyn .
Timofey Lapshin ( Russian : Тимофей Алексеевич Лапшин ; born 3 February 1988 ) is a Russian biathlete .
Nils Gösta Christer Sturmark , born 7 September 1964 in Danderyd , Stockholm County , is a Swedish author , IT - entrepreneur and prominent debater on religion and humanism in Swedish media .
Mille Dinesen ( born 17 March 1974 ) is a Danish actress best known for starring in the film Nynne , as well as the title role in the television series Rita .
Faustino Rupérez Rincón ( born 29 July 1956 in Piquera de San Esteban , Soria ) is a retired Spanish professional road racing cyclist who raced between 1979 and 1985 .
Scott Von Doviak ( born 1967 ) is the film critic for the Fort Worth Star - Telegram .
Conseslus Kipruto ( born 8 December 1994 ) is a Kenyan middle distance runner who competes in the steeplechase .
Frederik Du Chau ( born 15 May 1965 ) is a film director , screenwriter and animator .
Ge Xiaoguang ( Chinese : 葛小光 ) , born in 1953 in Beijing , is a Chinese artist best known for painting the massive 6 x 4.6 meter portrait of Mao Zedong that hangs at Tiananmen Gate in Tiananmen Square .
Lars - Erik Nelson ( 1941 -- November 20 , 2000 ) was an American journalist , political columnist and author best known for his syndicated column in The New York Daily News .
David Stanley Evans ( 28 January 1916 -- 14 November 2004 ) was a British astronomer , noted for his use of lunar occultations to measure stellar angular diameters during the 1950s .
Crispin Whittell ( born 19 December 1969 in Nairobi , Kenya ) is a British director and playwright .
Frances Fyfield ( born 18 November 1948 ) is the pseudonym of Frances Hegarty , a lawyer and crime - writer .
Norm McDougall ( 23 April 1892 -- 10 February 1938 ) was an Australian rules footballer who played with Melbourne in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) .
Mustafa Polutak ( born 1 January 1946 ) is a former soldier in the Bosnian Army during the Bosnian War .
Aref Dalila ( Arabic : عارف دليلة‎ ) ( born 1942 ) is a Syrian economist and former Dean of the Faculty of Economics in Damascus University .
Richard Lopag ( born 13 September 1989 in Huddersfield , West Yorkshire , England ) is a rugby league player for Swinton in the Co - operative Championship 1 .
Manuela Bosco ( Mikkeli , 11 June 1982 ) is a Finnish actress and former hurdler .
Constant Mews ( born 1954 ) , D. Phil ( Oxon ) is Professor of Medieval Thought and Director , Centre for Studies in Religion and Theology , Monash University , Melbourne .
Rosalia Maggio ( 1 May 1921 -- 25 July 1995 ) was an Italian actress , dancer , singer and showgirl .
Fabrice Boutique ( born in Zaire ( now Congo ) on 26 May 1970 ) is a Belgian actor of Braine - l'Alleud who is active on cinema , television , theater , musicals and dance .
Zhou Tao ( simplified Chinese : 周涛 ; traditional Chinese : 周濤 ; pinyin : Zhōu Tāo ; born 23 March 1968 ) is a Chinese television host and actress .
The Reverend Lal Behari Dey ( Bengali : লাল বিহারী দে - also transliterated as Lal Behari Day ) ( 18 December 1824 -- 28 October 1892 ) was a Bengali Indian journalist , who converted to Christianity , and became a Christian missionary himself .
Marion Margaret Violet Manners , Duchess of Rutland ( née Lindsay ; 7 March 1856 -- 22 December 1937 ) was a British artist and noblewoman .
Poppy Corbett ( born 1986 ) is a playwright , director and teacher of creative writing .
Nikos Stratakis ( born 1960 ) is a Greek painter of the contemporary period .
John Bowtell ( 1753 - -1813 ) was an English topographer .
Stephen Nye ( 1648 - -1719 ) was an English clergyman , known as a theological writer and for his Unitarian views .
Derek Birdsall ( born 1 August 1934 ) is an internationally renowned British graphic designer .
Willi Lippens ( born 10 November 1945 ) is a former German - Dutch football player .
Lam Bun - Ching ( Chinese : 林品晶 ; Jyutping : Lam4 Ban2 Jing1 ; b. Macau , 1954 ) is a composer , pianist , and conductor .
Dustley Mulder ( born 27 January 1985 ) is a Curaçaoan footballer who currently plays right back for NAC Breda in the Dutch Eerste Divisie .
Judith Herbison ( born 26 December 1971 ) is a former Irish international cricketer who played for the Irish national team between 1990 and 1997 .
Hon . Noël Olivier ( 1893 - -1969 ) who trained and practiced as a medical doctor , is now best known for her relationship with Rupert Brooke .
Arne Larsen Økland ( born 31 May 1954 ) is a former Norwegian footballer that played as a striker for Vard Haugesund , Bryne , Bayer Leverkusen and Racing Club de Paris .
Tadhg Kennelly ( born 1 July 1981 ) is an Irish sportsperson known for his top level careers in both Gaelic football and Australian rules football .
Juan Leal Goraz ( 1676 - -1742 or 1743 ) , also called Juan Leal Gonzal , was a Spanish settler and politician who served as the first alcalde ( a municipal magistrate who had both judicial and administrative functions ) of La Villa de San Fernando , which later would become the city of San Antonio , Texas .
The French physicist Christian Colliex ( b. 1944 ) is known for his pioneering work on the use of electron energy loss spectroscopy ( EELS ) in transmission electron microscopy .
Lieutenant general Josef Bečvář ( born 11 August 1958 ) is a Czech army officer .
William Stainton Moses ( 1839 - 1892 ) was an English cleric and spiritualist medium .
Alexander Strehmel ( born 20 March 1968 ) is a German former footballer who played in defence or midfield .
Fred D. Anderson ( born c. 1945 ) is an American business executive known for his time with Apple Inc. and as a managing director and co - founder of Elevation Partners .
Barnes Ratwatte ( known as Barnes Ratwatte Dissawa ) ( 1883 -- September 20 , 1957 ) was a Ceylonese colonial - era legislator and a headmen .
Annette Shun Wah ( born 26 March 1958 ) is a prominent figure in the Australian media , but particularly in television , film and radio .
Vikas Gowda ( Kannada:ವಿಕಾಸ್ ಗೌಡ ) ( born 5 July 1983 ) is an Indian discus thrower and Shot putter .
Karen Ordahl Kupperman ( born 23 April 1939 ) is an American historian who specializes in colonial history in the Atlantic world of the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries .
Li Yiu - bor , OBE , JP ( 22 October 1909 -- 6 September 1976 ) was a Hong Kong teacher , publisher , politician and religious leader .
Pio Siotto ( Rome , May 3 , 1824 - ? ) was an Italian artist active as a cameo engraver ( gem engraver ) .
Timothy Holme ( 1928 - 1987 ) was an English born , but latterly Italian resident , author .
Gemma Calvert , FRSA ( born in Dulwich , 1 August 1967 ) is a British neuroscientist and pioneer of Neuromarketing .
Edwin McArthur ( 24 September 1907 -- 24 February 1987 ) was a celebrated American classical music conductor , pianist and accompanist .
Cem Hakko ( Istanbul , 1955 ) is a Turkish fashion designer and businessman .
Ali Haydar Konca ( born 1 February 1950 ) is a Turkish politician who served as the Minister of European Union Affairs and Chief Negotiator in the interim election government led by Ahmet Davutoğlu between 28 August and 22 September 2015 .
Daniel Baron ( born 1949 ) is an American winemaker .
Arthur John Masaracchia ( December 20 , 1950 -- January 12 , 2015 ) , better known as A. J. Masters was an American country music singer .
Joe Marr ( born 9 August 1880 ) was a former Australian rules footballer who played with Carlton and Essendon in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) .
Andrew Shapter ( born 30 December 1966 ) is an American film director , writer and photographer .
Jean - François de La Clue - Sabran ( 30 September 1696 - 4 October 1764 ) was a French Admiral best known for his command of the French fleet in the Mediterranean Sea during the Seven Years ' War .
Borghild Holmsen ( 22 October 1865 -- 4 December 1938 ) was a Norwegian pianist , music critic and composer .
Dragiša Burzan ( born 1950 in Titograd , Montenegro , Federal People 's Republic of Yugoslavia ) has been the Serbia and Montenegro ambassador to London since 2004 .
Murugesan Dickeshwashankar Thirush Kamini ( born 30 June 1990 in Madras ) is an Indian cricketer who has played 21 women 's one - day internationals for the Indian women 's cricket team .
B. Lynn Winmill ( born 1952 ) is the Chief Judge on the United States District Court for the District of Idaho .
Melodie McDaniel ( born 1967 ) is a Los Angeles , CA - based American still life , celebrity , and advertising photographer and film director .
Bayeté Ross Smith ( born 1976 ) is a contemporary African American multi - media artist , film maker and educator .
Michael Meaker ( born 18 August 1971 ) is a Welsh footballer who plays for Yate Town in the Southern League South and West Division .
Thupden Bhutia ( born 6 January 1987 ) is an Indian footballer playing for United Sikkim .
Sarah Bixby Smith ( 1871 - -1935 ) was a California writer and an advocate of women 's education .
Kerthney Carty ( born 4 February 1962 ) is an English professional football manager .
Chance Sumner ( born 1977 ) is an American Paralympic wheelchair rugby player from Colorado Springs , Colorado .
Jesse Rosenfeld ( born 17 October 1983 ) is an Australian stage , television and film actor , best known for playing Marco Silvani on the soap opera Neighbours .
Pablo Cardozo ( born 23 December 1972 ) is a former Australian football ( soccer ) striker .
Pamela Rae Huteson ( 1957- ) is an Alaska Native author and illustrator , from Prince of Wales Island in Southeast Alaska .
Marchetto da Padova ( Marchettus of Padua ; b. 1274 ? ; fl . 1305 -- 1319 ) was an Italian music theorist and composer of the late medieval era .
Nikolaus Georg von Reigersberg ( 1598 -- 7 June 1651 ) was an imperial official , Chancellor in the Electorate of Mainz and Mayor of Aschaffenburg .
Gigi Edgley ( born 16 November 1977 ) is an Australian actress and recording artist .
Roslyn Walker ( b. Russel Erwood on 19 March 1981 Brislington , Bristol , England ) is an entertainer .
Richard Lindon ( 30 June 1816 -- 10 June 1887 ) was an English leatherworker who was instrumental in the development of the modern - day rugby ball by advancing the craft for ball , rubber bladder , and air pump .
Marius Ebbers ( born 4 January 1978 ) is a German footballer , who plays for SC Victoria .
Bruno Gonçalo Fernandes Silva ( born 4 May 1991 , in Faro ) .
Georgios Kazantzis ( Greek : Γιώργος Καζαντζής ; born 6 February 1979 ) is a Greek football player .
Adam van Vianen ( 1568 - - 1627 ) was a Dutch Golden Age medallist , engraver and silversmith .
Nicholas Ribic ( born 1974 ) is a Canadian who fought in the Bosnian Serb Army where he was also known as Nikola Ribić .
Ian Schuback is a former Australian lawn and indoor bowler and was born in Australia on 4 September 1952 .
Ian Blakemore ( born 13 May 1965 , in Ironbridge , Shropshire ) was an English cricketer .
Martin Odersky ( born 5 September 1958 ) is a German computer scientist and professor of programming methods at EPFL in Switzerland .
Bruno Beltrão ( born 19 September 1979 in Niteroi ) is a Brazilian choreographer who has worked since 1996 with his Grupo de Rua ( GRN ) .
Richard Hook Richens ( 1919 - -1984 ) was a Director of the Commonwealth Bureau of Plant Breeding and Genetics ( part of the Commonwealth Agricultural Bureaux ) at Cambridge University , and became best known for his studies of elm ( Ulmus ) .
Tørres Christensen ( 10 May 1664 -- 15 February 1721 ) was a Norwegian merchant , landowner and ship owner .
Stana Katic ( /ˈstɑːnə ˈkætᵻk/ ; born 26 April 1978 ) is a Canadian - American film and television actress .
Pim Walsma ( born 3 February 1987 , Amsterdam ) is a Dutch baseball player who currently plays for the Amsterdam Pirates and the Dutch national team .
Celia Barker Lottridge ( born 1936 ) is an award - winning Canadian children 's writer .
Capel Bond ( 14 December 1730 -- 14 February 1790 ) was an English organist and composer .
Darren Lim ( Chinese : 林明伦 ; pinyin : Lín Mínglún , born 30 September 1972 ) is a Singaporean actor and television host .
Sir Richard Torin Kindersley ( 1792 - -1879 ) was an English lawyer and judge .
Juan Tomás Ávila Laurel was born on 6 November 1966 in Malabo , Spanish Guinea ( now Equatorial Guinea ) , the son of Manuel Ávila Fernández and Luisa Laurel Bizantino , both teachers and Spanish settlers from Annobón island .
Osama Elsamni ( Japanese : エルサムニー・オサマ Erusamunī Osama , Arabic : أسامة السمني‎ ) ( born 29 September 1988 ) is an Egyptian - Japanese footballer who plays as a striker for YSCC Yokohama .
Angela Martini ( born Angjela Martini on 23 May 1986 ) is an Albanian model and beauty pageant titleholder .
Panagiotis Spyropoulos ( Greek : Παναγιώτης Σπυρόπουλος , born 21 August 1992 ) is a Greek professional football player , who last played Panathinaikos in the Superleague .
Otto Decker ( born 19 September 1930 ) is a retired German - American soccer player who earned one cap , scoring two goals , with the U.S. national team in 1953 .
Jiha Moon ( born 1973 ) is a contemporary artist who focuses on painting , printmaking , and sculptural ceramic objects .
Uzi Vishkin ( born 1953 ) is a computer scientist at the University of Maryland , College Park , where he is Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Maryland Institute for Advanced Computer Studies ( UMIACS ) .
Lý Tự Trọng ( Thailand 20 October 1914-Saigon , 21 November 1931 ) was a Vietnamese revolutionary executed by the French when he was only 17 years old .
Hélène Pelosse ( born 5 March 1970 ) was the first elected Interim Director - General of the International Renewable Energy Agency ( IRENA ) .
Ranini Cundasawmy ( born 19 May 1984 ) is a Mauritian Muay Thai , Savate fighter , and winner of several national championships .
Tarek Natour ( Arabic : طارق ناطور‎ , Hebrew : טארק נאטור‎ ; born 18 August 1990 ) is an Israeli footballer .
Daniel Bayne ( c 1730 -- 1769 ) was a Scottish born merchant and trader who came to Quebec City after the British Conquest .
Rico Lieder ( born 25 September 1971 in Burgstädt ) is a retired German sprinter who specialized in the 400 metres .
Sir Francis Bond Head , 1st Baronet KCH PC ( 1 January 1793 -- 20 July 1875 ) , known as `` Galloping Head '' , was Lieutenant - Governor of Upper Canada during the rebellion of 1837 .
Douglas Scale ( more commonly known as Doug Scale ; born 24 January 1954 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played for Geelong in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) now known as the Australian Football League ( AFL ) .
Iruthayanathan Charles Nirmalanathan ( Tamil : சார்ல்ஸ் நிர்மலநாதன் ; born 24 November 1975 ) is a Sri Lankan Tamil politician and a Member of Parliament .
Enzo Liberti ( 20 April 1926 -- 4 May 1986 ) was an Italian actor , voice actor , director and television personality .
Øystein Paasche ( born 3 May 1963 ) is a Norwegian musician and drummer in deLillos .
Tony Herman ( born 18 August 1967 ) is a retired rugby league footballer of the ' 80s and ' 90s .
Liu Shifu ( Chinese : 劉師復 ; 1884 -- 27 March 1915 ) was an influential figure in the Chinese revolutionary movement in the early twentieth century , and in the Chinese Anarchist movement in particular .
Eric L. Schwartz ( born 1947 ) is Professor of Cognitive and Neural Systems , Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering , and Professor of Anatomy and Neurobiology at Boston University .
Rev. Bradford Leavitt ( born 1868 ) was a Harvard - educated Unitarian minister named pastor of San Francisco 's First Unitarian Church in 1900 -- six years before the San Francisco earthquake .
Washington Iza , ( 1947 - -present ) is an Ecuadorian artist known chiefly for his radical surrealistic style of painting that contrasted sharply with more traditional styles used by fellow Ecuadorian painters such as Oswaldo Guayasamin , Eduardo Kingman and Bolivar Mena Franco .
Nan Yik - Pong , better known by his stage name Pong Nan ( Chinese : 藍奕邦 ; born 15 May 1978 ) , is a Cantopop musician , singer - songwriter and actor in Hong Kong .
Andrés F. Dasso ( 16 June 1893 in Lima -- ? ? ) , was a Peruvian politician .
Sebastian Israël ( Hebrew : סבסטיאן ישראל‎ , born 21 December 1977 ) is a former French - Israeli footballer .
Sabeena Saleem Athika ( born 1968 ) is an Indian bowler from Tamil Nadu .
Anders Flodström ( born 1944 ) is a Swedish professor of materials physics at the Royal Institute of Technology .
Ian Fahey ( born 29 June 1994 ) is an Irish Gaelic footballer who plays as a centre - forward for the Tipperary senior team .
Dr. Peter Finke ( born 1944 ) is a German theoretical physicist who participated in Project-706 , Pakistan 's clandestine nuclear research project .
Kristin Espinasse ( 22 December 1968 ) is an American born author and photographer who lives with her French husband Jean - Marc and their two children near Orange , France .
Raleigh DeGeer Amyx ( born 1938 ) is an American collector of Presidential , Americana , military , sports , NASA , and Olympic artifacts , including gold , silver , and bronze winners medals presented to athletes .
Ronald Hanmer ( 2 February 1917 -- 23 May 1994 ) was a British conductor , composer and arranger of light music , who spent his latter years in Australia .
Christian Wetklo ( born 11 January 1980 ) is a German footballer who plays for Schalke 04 II . He made his professional debut in the Bundesliga for 1 .
Walter Copland Perry ( 1814 -- December 1911 ) was a noted British author and barrister - at - law .
David Downton ( 1959 ) is a fashion illustrator .
Jiang Shuo ( Chinese : 蔣朔 ; pinyin : Jiáng Shuò ) ( born 1958 , Beijing , China ) is a Chinese contemporary sculptor .
Rainer Ohlhauser ( born 6 January 1941 in Dilsberg , Rhein - Neckar - Kreis ) is a German former footballer who played as a striker during the 1960s and 1970s .
Carl Pontus Wikner ( 19 May 1837 - 16 May 1888 ) was a famed Swedish lecturer in philosophy and professor of aesthetics in Oslo ( Christiania ) from 1884 .
Wang Yongpo ( Chinese : 王永珀 ; pinyin : Wáng Yǒngpò , born 19 January 1987 ) is a Chinese footballer who currently plays for Shandong Luneng in the Chinese Super League .
Eric Wan Tin - chiu ( born 28 October 1964 ) is a Hong Kong television actor best known for his role as `` Fong Tin - yau '' in the My Date with a Vampire television series trilogy produced by the Hong Kong television network ATV .
Stefan Czerpak ( 1951 - -1998 ) was a rugby union coach and physical education teacher .
Teten Masduki ( 1963 ) is an Indonesian social activist involved in public clearinghouse for information about corruption , collusion , and nepotism of Indonesia .
Kase2 ( also known as King Kase2 and Case2 ; born Jeff Brown in New York City , 1958 ) was a graffiti writer and a significant contributor to the hip - hop movement .
Ji Hyun - woo ( born Joo Hyung - tae on 29 November 1984 ) is a South Korean actor and musician .
Beth A. Brown ( 1969 -- October 5 , 2008 ) was a NASA astrophysicist .
David Sammel ( born in 1961 in Johannesburg , South Africa ) is a tennis coach , sports consultant and writer .
Mike Teasdale ( born 28 July 1969 in Elgin , Moray ) is a Scottish former footballer , who played for Elgin City , Dundee and Inverness Caledonian Thistle .
Hans Egede Saabye ( July 1746 -- August 31 , 1817 ) was a Danish priest and a missionary to Greenland .
Elisa Oricchio ( born 1979 ) is an Italian cancer researcher who discovered that EphA7 activates the tumor suppressor gene for patients with follicular lymphoma .
Claudine Rinner ( born 1965 ) is a French amateur astronomer who has given her name to a minor planet and was awarded the Edgar Wilson Award award for discovering three comets .
Rozalia Mancewicz ( born 27 June 1987 ) is a Polish beauty pageant titleholder who was crowned Miss Polonia 2010 and represented her country in Miss Universe 2011 and in Miss International 2012 .
Bindo Maserati ( 1883 - September , 1980 ) was an Italian automotive engineer and businessman , known as the manager of Maserati and one of the Maserati Brothers .
John Robert McCrum ( born 7 July 1953 ) , is an English writer and editor .
Jakub Holuša ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈjakup ˈɦoluʃa ) , born 20 February 1988 ) is a Czech middle - distance runner .
Tim Reeves ( born 28 August 1972 ) is an English sidecar racer from Maidstone , Kent .
Vanessa Winship ( born 1960 ) is a British photographer who works on long term projects of portrait , landscape , reportage and documentary photography .
Umberto Raho ( 4 June 1922 -- 9 January 2016 ) was an Italian stage , film and television actor .
Jin Qiaoqiao ( born 21 April 1975 ) is a Chinese actress , singer and hostess of ethnic Manchu origin .
Maya Jackson Randall ( 1979 - 2013 ) was an American news reporter for The Wall Street Journal ( WSJ ) .
Tatyana Talysheva ( Russian : Татьяна Талышева ) ( born 15 October 1937 ) is a Soviet athlete who competed mainly in the Long Jump .
Armand Point ( 23 March 1860 or 23 March 1861 -- February 1932 or March 1932 ) was a French painter , engraver and designer who was associated with the Symbolist movement and was one of the founders of the Salon de la Rose + Croix .
Manuel Fettner ( born 17 June 1985 ) is an Austrian ski jumper .
Besim Bey , full name Mehmed Besim Bey born in 1828 in the Ottoman Empire was an Ottoman public administrator and politician .
Elkouria Amidane ( born 29 September 1985 ) is a Sahrawi student and human rights activist .
Aminata Kamissoko ( born 9 July 1985 ) is a Mauritanian sprint athlete .
Yasra Rizvi ( born 15 November 1982 ) , is a Pakistani film , television and theatre actress and writer from Islamabad best known for working in television serials .
Daniela Lavender , Lady Kingsley ( born 14 December 1974 , former name Daniela Barbosa ) is a Brazilian actress , appearing on Brazilian television , and English - language television , film and stage , including touring with the British Shakespeare Company .
John Brake ( born 22 April 1988 in London , England ) is a professional rugby union player for England Sevens in the IRB Sevens World Series .
Christopher Busby ( born 1 September 1945 ) is a British scientist known for his controversial theories about the negative health effects of very low - dose ionising radiation .
Jozef Bubenko ( born 21 March 1951 ) is a Slovakian football coach who recently worked as a manager for MFK Zemplín Michalovce .
John Brian Christopherson CBE ( 30 April 1868 -- 21 July 1955 ) , was a British physician and a pioneer of chemotherapy .
Gustav Engelbert Holm ( 1883 - -1957 ) was a Swedish farm worker and member of parliament .
Brian Finnegan ( born 20 August 1969 ) is an Irish flute and tin whistle player from Armagh , Northern Ireland .
Leigh Ashton ( born 11 April 1956 in Manchester , England ) is a South African singer , songwriter , pianist , performer and recording artist from Johannesburg , South Africa .
Luis Carone , born in 1984 , began working with Post and FX at 14 .
Ursula Bruhin ( born 19 March 1970 ) is a Swiss snowboarder , World Champion in Parallel Giant Slalom in 2001 and 2003 .
Dai Chunning ( simplified Chinese : 戴春宁 ; traditional Chinese : 戴春寧 ; pinyin : Daì Chūnníng ; born February 1962 ) is a former Chinese business executive .
Enda Bonner ( born October 1949 ) is an Irish politician and sportsperson .
Salih Mahmoud Osman ( born Darfur , 1957 ) is a Sudanese human rights lawyer .
George Tinline ( 28 October 1815 -- 4 February 1895 ) was a nineteenth - century South Australian banker and politician .
Stacy Dittrich ( born 2 March 1973 ) , a former police detective from Ohio , is an American mystery novelist and true crime author .
Lydia Stahl ( 1890- ? ) was a secret agent who worked for Soviet Military Intelligence ( GRU ) in New York and Paris .
Annie Von Behren ( 1857-November 30 , 1882 ) was an American stage actress of the 19th century from New York .
Clive Christian , OBE ( born 12 July 1951 ) is a British designer best known for his designer kitchens and his creation of Clive Christian No . 1 , the world 's most expensive perfume .
Eoghan Hickey ( born 29 October 1981 in Dublin , Ireland ) is a former professional rugby union player who played for seven professional clubs throughout four countries .
Thangam Thennarasu ( Tamil : தங்கம் தென்னரசு ) ( born 3 June 1966 ) is an Indian politician and the minister for School Education of Tamil Nadu during 2006 - 2011 .
Nicholas Frances Chase ( born Nebeil Mahayni , 1966 in Roseburg , Oregon ) is an Arab - American composer and performer .
Renata Scaglia ( born 24 April 1954 in Turin ) is a former Italian discus thrower .
Emma Forster ( born 1976 ) is a South Australian television presenter , director of tourist attraction Swim with the Tuna and advisor for the company , Oceanic Victor .
Giovanni Cimbalo was born in Rose ( Cosenza ) on 31 August 1947 and graduated in Ecclesiastic Law at the Faculty of Law of Florence in 1972 discussing the final thesis `` I rapporti tra Stato e Chiesa in Italia dallo scioglimento dell'opera dei congressi alla marcia su Roma '' .
Alfred Wilm ( 1869 - -1937 ) was a German metallurgist who invented the alloy Al-3.5 - -5.5%Cu - Mg - Mn , now known as duraluminium , which is used extensively in aircraft .
The eldest son of Joseph Phillimore , vicar of Orton - on - the - Hill , Leicestershire , by Mary , daughter of John Machin of Kensington , was born on 14 September 1775 .
Gutierre Tibón ( 16 July 1905 -- 15 May 1999 ) was an Italian - Mexican author .
Silas Cooper ( 1778 at Wadhurst , Sussex -- 30 May 1816 at Wadhurst , Sussex ) was an English professional cricketer .
Mark Trevorrow ( born 4 February 1959 in Melbourne , Victoria ) , is an Australian comedian , television host and media personality .
Torkel Wetterhus ( born 29 June 1944 ) is a Norwegian businessperson and politician .
Adam Janowski ( /jəˈnɒfski/ ; born 19 September 1987 in London ) is a rugby league player for Harlequins Rugby League in the European Super League .
Annie Man Chung - Han ( Chinese : 文頌嫻 ) , born 20 July 1976 , is an actress from Hong Kong .
V. Yuvaraj ( b 1964 ) is an Indian politician from Tamil Nadu who belongs to Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam- DMDK .
George Gallo , Jr. ( born 1956 ) is an American screenwriter , film director , producer , painter and musician .
Yaneer Bar - Yam ( born 1959 ) is an American physicist , systems scientist , and founding president of the New England Complex Systems Institute .
Sophie Charlotte Elisabeth Ursinus ( née Weingarten ; 5 May 1760 -- 4 April 1836 ) was a German serial killer believed to have been responsible for poisoning her husband , aunt , and lover , and of attempting to poison her servant .
Ralf Gyllenhammar , born 1966 , is the Grammis award winning lead guitarist and vocalist of Swedish hard rock band Mustasch as well as the presenter at the Swedish TV channel TV7 .
Nicolaes de Giselaer , also Nicolaes de Geijselers , Nicolaes de Geyselers , Nicolaas de Gijselaer , Nicolaas de Gijzelaer , Nicolaes de Gyselaer , Nicolaas de Gyzelaer , Nicolaes de Ghyselaer ( 1583 - -c.1654 ) was a Dutch painter and draughtsman .
Vanessa Guerra ( born 1989 ) is a Democratic politician from Michigan who represents the 95th District in the Michigan House of Representatives .
Annita Pania ( born Anastasia Pania , 1970 ) is a Greek television hostess .
Ian Spink ( born 8 October 1947 ) is an Australian - British choreographer .
Senga Nengudi ( born 1943 ) is an African - American visual artist best known for her abstract sculptures that combine found objects and choreographed performance .
So Loi Keung ( Chinese : 蘇來強 ; Jyutping : sou1 loi4 koeng4 ; born 27 October 1982 in Hong Kong ) is a football player currently playing for Kitchee SC .
Willie Bermingham ( March 1942 -- April 1990 ) was an Irish firefighter and campaigner , who founded A.L.O.N.E. ( A Little Offering Never Ends ) , an organisation highlighting the plight of old people living alone .
Paul Wallace Gates ( 1901 - -1999 ) was a professor of history and general historian who is widely considered to be the foremost authority on the history of federal land policy in the United States .
Vin Arthur ( 23 March 1905 -- 6 November 1970 ) was an Australian rules footballer who played with Carlton and St Kilda in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) .
Dr. Serhy Yekelchyk ( born 13 November 1966 in Kiev ) is a Ukrainian Canadian historian of Ukrainian and Russian history .
Robin Luke ( born 20 March 1942 , Los Angeles , California ) is an American rockabilly singer who is best known for his 1958 song , `` Susie Darlin ' '' .
Toni Santagata , stage name of Antonio Morese ( born 9 December 1935 ) is an Italian folk singer , composer , comedian and actor .
Pope John XXII ( Latin : Ioannes XXII ; 1244 -- 4 December 1334 ) , born Jacques Duèze ( or d'Euse ) , was Pope from 7 August 1316 to his death in 1334 .
Absar Ahmad ( born 1945 ) is a distinguished Pakistani philosopher .
Per Inge Torkelsen ( born 21 March 1953 ) is a Norwegian comic , author , radio personality , and self declared clown .
Mick Stallard ( 1944 - -2002 ) was an English racing cyclist .
Boris Dežulović ( born 20 November 1964 ) is a Croatian journalist and writer , best known as one of the founders of the now defunct satirical magazine Feral Tribune .
Jennarong Muengtaweepongsa ( Thai : เจนณรงค์ มุ่งทวีพงษา , born 19 March 2000 ) , also known as VanaticalDesign , is a Thai automobile designer known for designs such as the Koenigseggs Utagera and Legera concepts and the Aston Martin DB11 concept , among others .
Mats Lidström ( born 1959 ) is a solo cellist , recording artist , chamber musician , composer , teacher and publisher .
Avi Barot ( born 25 June 1992 ) is an Indian first - class cricketer who plays for Haryana .
Steven Polack ( born 10 January 1961 ) is an English football manager and former footballer who also holds a Finnish citizenship .
Luke Barnatt ( born 13 April 1988 ) is an English mixed martial artist who fought as a Middleweight for the Ultimate Fighting Championship .
Thomas Tulis ( born 1961 ) is an American photographer and painter living and working in Atlanta , Georgia .
John McEntee Bowman ( 1875 -- October 28 , 1931 ) was a Canadian - born businessman , American hotelier and horseman , and the founding president of Bowman - Biltmore Hotels Corp.
Libby Sharpe ( born 27 November 1991 ) is an Australian football ( soccer ) player currently playing for Newcastle United Jets .
Andrea Ehrig - Mitscherlich ( née Mitscherlich , also known as Andrea Schöne - Mitscherlich , born 1 December 1960 ) is a retired East German speed skater .
Vratislav Hugo Brunner ( 15 October 1886 - July 13 , 1928 ) was a Czech typographer , illustrator , graphic designer , cartoonist , author , toy and stage designer and painter .
Orion Ximenes Filho ( 1945 - -unknown ) is a Brazilian actor and voice - over artist .
Augustus Hemenway ( 1853 - -1931 ) was a philanthropist and public servant in Boston , Massachusetts , in the latter part of the 19th century .
Katalin Marton is a Hungarian mathematician born 1941 in Budapest .
William Beach ( c. 1815 Auburn , Cayuga County , New York -- March 14 , 1860 Albany , New York ) was an American politician from New York .
Yul Edochie ( born Yul Chibuike Daniel Edochie 7 January 1982 ) is a Nigerian actor , named after popular Russian actor Yul Brynner .
Heinrich Gustav Flörke ( 24 December 1764 , Altenkalden in Mecklenburg -- 11 June 1835 ) was a German botanist and lichenologist .
Ophelia S. Lewis ( born 7 November 1961 ) is a Liberian author and publisher and humanitarian .
Field Marshal Sir Patrick Grant , GCB GCMG ( 11 September 1804 -- 28 March 1895 ) was a senior Indian Army officer .
Thomas Lüthi ( born 6 September 1986 ) is a professional motorcycle road racer currently competing in the Moto2 Grand Prix World Championship .
John Shum Kin - Fun ( born 1952 ) is a Hong Kong actor and film producer .
Lewis Combs ( 1895 -- May 1996 ) , was a United States Admiral who helped found and direct the famed `` Seabees '' construction battalions in World War II . He died at age 101 in Red Hook , New York .
Paine Proffitt ( born 1972 ; Phoenix , Arizona ) is an American - born artist living in England , best known for his sporting works and for his depiction of the `` working man 's life '' .
Henry William Petre ( 1820 -- 3 December 1889 ) was colonial treasurer of New Munster Province .
Max Kahn ( 1902 - -2005 ) was a Litvak lithographer , painter and sculptor born in Slonim , Belarus in 1902 .
Richard Mark Elson ( born 10 February 1979 ) is an English writer , director and editor for film and television .
Matt O'Mahoney ( 19 January 1913 -- 1992 ) was an Irish footballer who played for , among others , Bristol Rovers and Ipswich Town .
Julio Roloff ( b. Havana , 1951 ) is a Cuban composer that has collaborated with the Laboratorio Nacional de Música Electroacústica ( LNME ) founded by composer Juan Blanco , where he created numerous electroacoustic pieces .
Kseniia Levkovska , Ukrainian Ксенія Левковська ( patronymic : Юріївна ) , born 13 October 1989 in Kharkiv ( Ukrainian : Харків ) , is a professional Ukrainian triathlete and reserve member of the National Team .
Malik Rahim ( born Donald Guyton in 1948 ) is a former Black Panther , and a long - time housing and prison activist in the U.S. state of Louisiana .
Karine Vallières ( born 19 March 1978 ) is a member of the National Assembly of Quebec for the riding of Richmond , first elected in the 2012 election .
Ralph Verney , 1st Earl Verney ( 18 March 1683 -- 4 October 1752 ) , styled The Honourable from 1703 to 1717 and subsequently known as The Viscount Fermanagh until 1742 , was an Irish peer and Tory politician .
Marisa Laurito ( born 19 April 1951 ) is an Italian actress , singer and television personality .
Swami Sundaranand ( born 1926 in India ) is a Yogi , photographer , author and mountaineer who lectures widely in India on threats to the Ganges River and the loss of Himalayan glaciers due to global warming .
Adam Kuban ( born 1974 in Milwaukee , Wisconsin ) is the current editor and founding publisher of Slice NY , a weblog devoted to the subject of pizza .
Andrew Mawson , Baron Mawson , OBE ( born 8 November 1954 ) is an English social entrepreneur .
Rafat Muhammad ( born 6 July 1977 ) is a former Syrian footballer and current coach of Al - Wahda .
Hugh Harra ( born 29 March 1936 ) was a Scottish footballer who played for Falkirk and Dumbarton .
Rena Sinakin Oliver ( born March 1949 ) is an American record producer , singer / songwriter and artist .
Alan Clayson ( born 3 May 1951 , Dover , Kent ) is an English singer - songwriter , author and music journalist .
Ximena Zomosa ( born 1966 , Santiago , Chile ) is a visual artist and curator who works in contemporary art and conceptual art , whose work demonstrates -- from the perspective of gender-- a discourse that is fundamentally feminine .
Henry Walter ( 1611 - -1678 ? ) was a Welsh Anglican priest who became a Puritan .
Mario Gjurovski or Mario Đurovski ( Macedonian : Марио Ѓуровски ; born 11 December 1985 ) is a Macedonian footballer who plays for Bangkok United .
Matthias Brändle ( born 7 December 1989 ) is an Austrian professional road bicycle racer for UCI world tour team IAM Cycling .
Vladimir IV Rurikovich ( Ukrainian : Володимир Рюрикович ; Russian : Владимир Рюрикович ) ( 1187 -- March 3 , 1239 ) , Prince of Pereyaslavl ( 1206 - -1213 ) , Smolensk ( 1213 - -1219 ) and Grand Prince of Kiev ( 1223 - -1235 ) .
Gene Kelton ( 10 April 1953 -- 28 December 2010 ) was an American guitarist , harmonica player and singer - songwriter , based in Houston , Texas .
Gedhun Choekyi Nyima ( born 25 April 1989 ) is the 11th Panchen Lama of Tibetan Buddhism as recognised by the Dalai Lama and various other Tibetan Buddhist leaders .
Mark Anthony Jarman ( born 11 June 1955 in Edmonton , Alberta ) is an award - winning Canadian fiction writer .
Norbert Michelisz ( born 8 August 1984 , Himesháza ) is a Hungarian auto racing driver , who currently competes in the World Touring Car Championship .
Abebech Afework Bekele ( born 11 December 1990 ) is an Ethiopian long - distance runner who specialises half marathon races .
Johann Faber ( 1478 -- May 21 , 1541 ) was a Catholic theologian known for his writings opposing the Protestant Reformation and the growing Anabaptist movement .
Peter Zummo ( born 1948 ) is an American composer and musician .
Charles Weissmann ( born 14 October 1931 ) is a Hungarian - born Swiss molecular biologist .
Zoltán Vasas ( born 5 November 1977 ) is a Hungarian football player who plays for Vecsés FC in the Hungarian second division .
Tsao Chang ( Chinese : 张操 born 1942 in Shanghai , China ) is a Chinese - American physicist .
George Ward Cole F.R.G.S. , Commander R.N. ( 15 November 1793 -- 26 April 1879 ) was a Royal Navy officer and politician in Australia , member of the Victorian Legislative Council .
James Waddel ( or Waddell , July 1739 -- September 17 , 1805 ) was an Irish American Presbyterian preacher from Virginia noted for his eloquence .
Rod J. Rosenstein ( born in 1965 ) is the United States Attorney for the United States District Court for the District of Maryland and a former nominee to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit .
Henry Richards Luard ( 25 August 1825 , London -- 1 May 1891 , Cambridge ) was a British medieval historian and antiquary .
Vladimir Nesterov ( Russian : Нестеров Владимир Евгеньевич ) ( born 1 July 1949 ) is the general director of Khrunichev State Research and Production Space Center , one of the world 's leading space launch providers .
Magomed Kurugliyev ( born 16 January 1974 in Dagestan ) is a Lezgin from Dagestan .

Pier Silvio Berlusconi ( born on 28 April 1969 ) is an Italian entrepreneur in the media business .
