Thomas Lindrup ( born 21 May 1976 ) is a former Danish professional football winger .
Tex G. Hall ( `` Ihbudah Hishi '' `` Red Tipped Arrow '' ) , ( born 18 September 1956 ) is a Native American who was tribal chairman of Three Affiliated Tribes from 1998 to 2006 .
Aislín McGuckin is a Northern Irish actress who was born in Newry , County Down , Northern Ireland in 1974 .
Martin Kree ( born 27 January 1965 in Wickede , North - Rhine Westphalia ) is a former German footballer , who played mostly as a central defender .
Kennedy Katende ( born 15 March 1985 ) is a Swedish amateur boxer from Sundsvall who qualified for the 2008 Olympics in the light - heavyweight division .
Håkan Lidbo ( born 20 July 1965 in Malmö , Sweden ) is a Swedish music producer , primarily active in electronica , but also other genres .
Ustad Sakhawat Hussain Khan or Sakhawat Hussain ( 1877 - 1955 ) was a virtuoso Indian sarod player , a contemporary of Hafiz Ali Khan and one of the major exponents of the instrument in the 20th century .
Ellen Bass ( born 1947 in Philadelphia ) is an American poet and co - author of The Courage to Heal .
Father Joseph - Noël Ritchot ( 25 December 1825 -- 16 March 1905 ) , commonly known as Father Noël - Joseph Ritchot , was a Roman Catholic priest noted for his role in negotiating with the Government of Canada on behalf of the Métis during the Red River Rebellion of 1869 - -1870 .
Giuseppe Coco ( 1936 -- 4 August 2012 ) was an Italian comics artist and illustrator .
Sabri Jaballah ( Arabic : صبري جاب الله‎ ) ( born 28 June 1973 ) is a Tunisian footballer .
Jane Ash Poitras ( born 1951 ) is a Canadian painter and printmaker of Cree descent .
Nathan Wegman ( born 4 June 1977 ) in Launceston , Tasmania is an Australian cricket player , who plays for the Tasmanian Tigers .
Julia Middleton ( born 1958 in London ) is the founder and chief executive officer of Common Purpose UK , an international charity that runs leadership development programmes in 18 countries across the world .
Peter O. Price ( born 1940 ) is the Chairman of Qubed , a University Ventures Fund portfolio company .
René Aubry is a French composer born in 1956 .
Alan Ralsky ( born c. 1945 ) is a convicted American fraudster , best known for his activities as a spammer .
Layton Williams ( born 13 September 1994 ) is an English stage actor , best known as one of the boys who played the title role in Billy Elliot the Musical at the Victoria Palace Theatre in London 's West End , and as the character Kylie in the BBC UK TV series Beautiful People 2008 and 2009 .
Clark G. Kuebler ( c. 1908 -- 1974 ) was an American professor and educator .
John Byam Liston Shaw ( 13 November 1872 -- 26 January 1919 ) , commonly known as Byam Shaw , was an Indian - born British painter , illustrator , designer and teacher .
Dan Waern ( born 17 January 1933 ) is a retired Swedish middle - distance runner , who in 1957 became the first Swede to run a sub - four - minute mile .
Dennis J. Hutchinson ( born 1946 ) is a Senior Lecturer in Law at the University of Chicago , and Master of the undergraduate College 's New Collegiate Division where he directs the Law , Letters , and Society program .
Clint Newton ( born 18 June 1981 ) is an American - born retired professional rugby league footballer .
Ezequiel Dero ( born 10 July 1968 ) , known by his stage name DJ Dero , is a DJ , producer and remixer of house , electro house , techno and Eurodance styles .
Torsti Lehtinen , Finnish writer and philosopher , was born in Helsinki in 1942 .
Roman Novotný ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈroman ˈnovotniː ) ; born 5 January 1986 ) is a Czech long jumper .
Basil Biggs ( 1819 - -1906 ) was a free African American laborer and veterinarian .
Hans Bloesch ( 26 December 1878 - 28 April 1945 ) was a Swiss author , editor , correspondent and librarian .
Sven Martinek ( born 18 February 1964 ) is a German actor , best known for portraying the main character Max Zander on the German TV series Der Clown .
Allan Holdsworth ( born 6 August 1946 ) is a British guitarist and composer .
Robert Linssen ( 11 April 1911 -- 15 May 2004 ) was a Belgian Zen Buddhist and author .
Ron Akana ( born 1928 in Honolulu ) is a former US - American Flight attendant , who spent 63 years working as cabin crew for United Airlines and who logged an estimated 200 million airmiles .
Hamid bin Abdallah al - Ali ( born 1960 ) has been described as `` an influential Salafi cleric '' based in Kuwait , whom the U.S. Treasury department has described as `` an Al Qaeda facilitator and fundraiser . ''
David Grissom ( fl . since 1978 ) is an American guitarist who has played and toured with several of America 's leading bands and recording artists .
George Wild Galvin ( 20 December 1860 -- 31 October 1904 ) , better known by the stage name Dan Leno , was a leading English music hall comedian and musical theatre actor during the late Victorian era .
Nettie Wild ( born 18 May 1952 ) is a Canadian documentary film filmmaker .
Hou Xuemei ( born 27 February 1962 in Zhejiang ) is a retired Chinese discus thrower .
Richard Gottehrer ( born 1940 ) is an American songwriter , record producer and record label executive .
Eufrasia Burlamacchi ( 1482 - -1548 ) was an Italian nun who practiced the art of manuscript illumination .
Maria Karagiannopoulou ( Greek : Μαρια Καραγιαννοπουλου ; born 22 September 1972 in Ludwigshafen , Germany ) is a Greek judoka .
Wacław Tokarz ( 1873 - 1937 ) was a Polish historian and military officer .
Colonel Nicholas Gassaway ( Baptized 11 March 1634 , died between 10 and 27 January 1691 Julian Calendar ) was a colonial military and political leader and justice in early Maryland .
Charles Dale ( born 28 November 1963 ) is a Welsh actor who is well known for playing Dennis Stringer in Coronation Street , Gary `` Chef '' Alcock in The Lakes , Clive Eustace in The Eustace Bros. & Big Mac in Casualty .
Tommy McCue ( born 23 September 1913 in Widnes -- death unknown ) was an English professional rugby league footballer of the 1930s and ' 40s , playing at representative level for Great Britain , and England , and at club level for Widnes , as a Scrum - half / Halfback , i.e. number 7 .
John Murray Irvine ( 19 August 1924 -- 14 September 2005 ) was an Anglican priest .
José Gumilla ( 1686 , Cárcer -- 1750 , Los Llanos ) was a Jesuit priest who wrote a natural history of the Orinoco River region .
Frederick Gymer Parsons FRCS FZS ( 1863 -- 11 March 1943 ) was a British writer and scientist , specialising in the fields of anatomy and anthropology .
Itay Manzor ( born 2 July 1994 ) is an Israeli footballer who play in Hapoel Beit She'an .
Zhang Lie ( simplified Chinese : 张烈 ; traditional Chinese : 張烈 ; Pinyin : Zhāng Liè ; born 25 May 1982 ) is a Chinese footballer who currently plays for Guizhou Renhe in the Chinese Super League .
Victor Mensah ( born 25 December 1985 ) is a Ghanaian footballer who has won the Thailand Premier League with club side Provincial Electricity Authority .
Brian Wenning ( born 1981 in Monmouth Beach , New Jersey ) is a professional skateboarder formerly affiliated with Plan B Skateboards , Habitat Skateboards , and DC Shoes .
Jiyul ( born 1957 ) is a South Korean Buddhist nun belonging to the Jogye Order , the largest in Korean Buddhism .
Yu Minzhong ( Chinese : 于敏中 ; pinyin : Yú Mǐnzhōng , 1714 - -1779 ) was an official of the Qing Dynasty , who served as chief grand councilor for part of the reign of the Qianlong Emperor .
Anuar Manan ( born 11 October 1986 ) is a Malaysian professional cyclist , currently riding for the Terengganu Cycling Team .
Jozef Liščák ( born 18 January 1947 ) is former Minister of Justice of Slovakia in third government of Vladimír Mečiar .
Gracie Gilbert ( born 20 October 1992 ) is an Australian actor , best known for her role as Tammy Lane in the Fox8 teen drama series , SLiDE , as Vicki in Lockie Leonard , and as Annie in Love Child .
Terence Croucher ( born 1944 in Jutogh , India ) is a British composer and performer based in north Cumbria , England .
Joseph Gales , Jr. ( 1786 -- July 21 , 1860 ) was an American journalist and the ninth mayor of Washington , D.C. from 1827 to 1830 .
Dingeman Adriaan Henry van der Sluijs ( born 28 December 1947 ) , better known by his stage name Dick Diamonde , is a retired Dutch - Australian bass guitarist .
Ming Bridges ( Chinese : 喬毓明 ; pinyin : Qiáo Yùmíng ) ( born 5 November 1992 ) is a Singaporean singer - songwriter , actress and model .
Sir Tangaroa Tangaroa MBE , ( 6 May 1921 -- 23 May 2009 ) , was a Cook Islands politician .
Margarita Lozano ( born 14 February 1931 , in Tetuan ) is a Spanish - born actress known for her career in Italian films .
Hugh II of Cyprus ( or Hugues II de Lusignan ) ( June -- August , 1252 or 1253 -- November or December 5 , 1267 ) was king of Cyprus and , from the age of 5 years , also Regent of the Kingdom of Jerusalem .
Maria Domitilla Galluzzi ( 1595 - -1671 ) was a Catholic mystic , never canonized .
William Chadwell ( born 1614 ) was an English lawyer and politician who sat in the House of Commons between 1640 and 1644 .
Tom Cheeseman ( born 22 March 1986 ) is a Welsh rugby union footballer currently playing for Esher .
Abby Jackson ( born 1982 ) is a British artist , Stuckist painter , writer and art activist .
Garth Taylor ( born 10 July 1980 ) is an Australian rules footballer who played for the Fremantle Dockers between 1999 and 2000 .
Alexander Kennedy Isbister ( June 1822 -- 28 May 1883 ) was born at Cumberland House in what is now Saskatchewan .
Clarence Lemuel Elisha Moore ( 12 May 1876 , Bainbridge , Ohio -- 5 December 1931 ) was an American mathematics professor , specializing in algebraic geometry and Riemannian geometry .
Birendra Narayan Chakraborty ( 1904 -- March 26 , 1976 ) was an Indian politician and second governor of Haryana .
Yolanthe Sneijder - Cabau ( née Cabau van Kasbergen ; 19 March 1985 ) is a Spanish - Dutch actress and television host .
Fredrik Hagemann ( born 4 March 1929 ) is a Norwegian geologist and bureaucrat He was born in Andenes as the son of literary historian and literary critic Sonja Hagemann .
Diane Kennedy ( born 1956 ) is an American CPA , speaker , and financial writer .
Caterina Klusemann ( born 8 February 1973 in Lucca , Italy ) is an independent filmmaker and documentarist .
Babette Haag ( born 31 October 1967 ) is a German percussionist , who specialises in Marimba playing .
Samuel Vilozny ( born 10 January 1954 ) ( Hebrew : שמואל וילוז'ני‎ ) is an Israeli comedian , actor and director as well as a political activist .
Kenneth Roth ( born 23 September 1955 ) is an American attorney who has been the executive director of Human Rights Watch since 1993 .
George Washington Bowie , ( 1827 - -1901 ) was a Civil War Union officer , commander of 5th Regiment California Volunteer Infantry , brevetted Brigadier General of Volunteers .
Hafsa Bekri - Lamrani ( born 1948 ) is a poet and writer of a book of short stories , Jellabiates ( 2001 ) .
Lennart Fremling ( 1946 - 2013 ) was a Swedish Liberal People 's Party politician , member of the Riksdag 1991 - -1998 and again 2002 - -2006 .
André Kouprianoff ( born 19 October 1938 ) is a retired French speed skater who won three all - round medals at the European and world championships in 1960 - -1962 .
Edwin Adams Davis ( 1904 -- April 24 , 1994 ) was an American historian who specialized in studies of his adopted state of Louisiana .
William Percival Johnson ( 12 March 1854 in St Helens , Isle of Wight -- October 1928 in Liuli , Tanganyika ) was an Anglican missionary to Nyasaland .
Grant Stockdale ( 1915 -- December 2 , 1963 ) was a Florida businessman and friend of President John F. Kennedy who served as United States Ambassador to Ireland in 1961 - 62 .
Fred Boot ( Groningen , 1965 ) is a Dutch theatre producer .
Alessio Morosin ( Noale , 20 June 1955 ) is a Venetian lawyer , separatist and Venetist politician .
Hannah Pritchard ( 1711 - -1768 ) was an English actress who regularly played opposite David Garrick .
Angelo Vincenzo Zani ( born 24 March 1950 ) is the current Secretary of the Congregation for Catholic Education ( second - highest official ) since his appointment was announced by the then - Pope , Benedict XVI , on 9 November 2012 , not long before Benedict 's resignation .
Otto Herrigel ( 27 June 1937 -- 13 May 2013 ) was a Namibian lawyer , businessman , and politician .
Ashley Lloyd ( billed as Ashley Luke Lloyd ) ( born 6 July 1991 ) is a British actor and dancer , who has performed in hit musical theatre shows such as Billy Elliot the Musical and Whistle Down the Wind .
Bengt Fahlström ( born 28 August 1938 ) is a Swedish journalist and television presenter , he presented Barnjournalen at SVT between 1972 and 1988 .
Veljko Paunović ( Serbian Cyrillic : Вeљкo Пауновић ; born 21 August 1977 ) is a retired Serbian footballer , and the current head coach of American club Chicago Fire Soccer Club .
Sir Hugh Owen , 1st Baronet ( 4 May 1604 -- October 1670 ) was a Welsh politician who sat in the House of Commons variously between 1626 and 1660 .
Marmaduke Furness , 1st Viscount Furness and 2nd Baron Furness ( 29 October 1883 -- 6 October 1940 ) , was a British shipping magnate .
Cecil Patteson Nickalls , D.S.O. ( 14 October 1877 - 7 April 1925 ) was a Colonel in the Royal Field Artillery .
Pir Zia Inayat Khan ( born 1971 ) is a scholar and teacher of Sufism in the lineage of his grandfather , Hazrat Inayat Khan .
Mihalj Kečkeš ( Serbian Cyrillic : Михаљ Кечкеш ) ( 24 September 1913 -- 31 December 1985 ) was a Serbian / Yugoslav footballer .
Charles Hanbury - Tracy , 1st Baron Sudeley ( 28 December 1778 -- 10 February 1858 ) , known as Charles Hanbury until 1798 and as Charles Hanbury Tracy from 1798 to 1838 , was a British Whig politician .
Peter B. Bensinger ( born 1936 in Chicago , Illinois ) is a former Administrator of the Drug Enforcement Administration ( DEA ) .
Emil Stepanek ( 21 February 1895 - -12 April 1945 ) was an Austrian set designer and film architect .
Karsten Lippmann ( born 21 June 1958 in Hannover , Germany ) is a retired German swimmer who won a bronze medal in the 4×200 m freestyle relay at the 1978 World Aquatics Championships .
Karapet Mikaelyan ( Armenian : Կարապետ Միքայելյան , born 27 September 1969 , Moscow , Soviet Union ) is a former Russia born Armenian football striker .
Hans Børli ( 8 December 1918 -- 26 August 1989 ) was a Norwegian poet and writer , who besides his writings worked as a lumberjack all his life .
Zsuzsanna Szőcs ( born 10 April 1962 ) is a Hungarian fencer , who won two Olympic medals in the foil team competitions .
Cilibi Moise or Cilibi Moisi ( born Froim Moise ; 1812 -- January 31 , 1870 ) was a Moldovan - born Wallachian and Romanian peddler , humorist , aphorist , and raconteur .
Felice Beato ( 1832 -- 29 January 1909 ) , also known as Felix Beato , was an Italian--
Newport Gardner ( born Occramer Marycoo , 1746 - -1826 ) was an African American singing school master and composer .
Karl - Heinz Priester ( 1913 -- 16 April 1960 ) was a German far right political activist .
Lillian Willoughby ( c. 1916 -- January 15 , 2009 ) was a Quaker activist who advocated for world peace , founded Take Back the Night , and conducted nonviolent protests against war and preparations for war for nearly 70 years .
Stanisław Julian Ostroróg ( 1830 - -1890 ) was an early professional portrait photographer who created photogravures of many famous contemporaries including Victor Hugo and Sarah Bernhardt .
Chester Alwyn Barr , Jr. ( born January 18 , 1938 ) is an American historian who specializes in African American studies , the American South , the American Civil War , and Reconstruction .
Fred Gainous was born in 1947 , and his hometown is Tallahassee , Florida .
Günter Baum ( born 1960 ) is an openly gay man , who founded two Christian ministries in Germany .
Alf Daniel Moen ( born 2 February 1950 ) is a Norwegian forester and politician for the Labour Party .
Helen Vita ( 7 August 1928 -- 16 February 2001 ) was a Swiss chanson singer , actress , and comedian .
Jenny Munro ( born 1956 ) is an Australian Wiradjuri elder and a prominent activist for the rights of Indigenous Australians .
Eunice Spry ( born 28 April 1944 ) is a British woman from Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire , a Jehovah 's Witness who was convicted of 26 charges of child abuse against children in her foster care in April 2007 .
Ossama Khalil ( Arabic : أسامة خليل‎ ; born 5 February 1954 ) is a retired Egyptian footballer .
The Reverend James Bulwer ( 21 March 1794 -- 11 June 1879 ) was an English collector , naturalist and conchologist .
J.W. Buckley ( born 1978 ) is a writer originally from Tewksbury , Massachusetts .
Basil Bernstein ( 1 November 1924 -- 24 September 2000 ) was a British sociologist known for his work in the sociology of education .
India Jane Birley ( born 14 January 1961 ) is a British artist , heiress and businesswoman .
Ferenc Nyúl ( 1896 -- ? ) was a Hungarian footballer and manager .
Anthony Genaro Acosta ( 1942 -- May 7 , 2014 ) , known professionally as Tony Genaro , was an American film , television and stage actor .
Maureen Paley ( born 1953 ) is the American owner of a contemporary art gallery in Bethnal Green , London , where she lives .
Gary Madine ( born 24 August 1990 ) is an English footballer who currently plays for Bolton Wanderers .
Günter Hirsch ( born 30 January 1943 ) is a German legal scholar and a former president of the Federal Court of Justice of Germany .
Nikolay Tatarinov ( born 14 December 1927 in Leningrad ) is a former Soviet modern pentathlete and Olympic medalist .
Joseph Glasco ( 1925 -- May 31 , 1996 ) was an American Abstract Expressionist painter and sculptor , best known for being at one time the youngest artist represented in the permanent collection of The Museum of Modern Art .
Frère Jacques Beaulieu ( 1651 - -1720 ) , also known as Frère Jacques Baulot , was a travelling lithotomist with scant knowledge of anatomy and was also a Dominican friar .
Veaceslav Iordan ( born 12 June 1966 , in Chircăieşti , Causeni ) is a Moldovan politician who served as interim general mayor of Chișinău ( January -- June 2007 ) .
Michael Bingham ( born 13 April 1986 ) is a British 400 m athlete .
Douglas R. White ( born 1942 ) is an American complexity researcher , social anthropologist , sociologist , and social network researcher at the University of California , Irvine .
Shirley Cothran ( born 1953 ) is an American beauty pageant titleholder from Texas .
Hal Becker ( born 1954 in Cleveland , Ohio ) is an American author and nationally known expert on the subjects of sales , customer service , and negotiating .
Gordon Hookey ( born 1961 Cloncurry ) is an Australian aboriginal artist from the Waanyi people .
Sam Speakman ( born 9 August 1884 in Liverpool , England ) was an English footballer who played as a defender for Liverpool F.C. in The Football League .
Grand Ayatollah Sayyid Ahmad Hassani Baghdadi ( Arabic : السيد احمد الحسني البغدادي ) ( born 1944 ) is an Iraqi Twelver Shi'a Marja .
Lewis Fitz - Gerald ( born 15 November 1958 ) is an Australian actor and television director who has obtained a master 's degree in Creative Writing , majoring in Communications Studies .
George A. Cooper ( born 7 March 1925 ) is a retired English actor and voice artist .
Jordon Bourke ( born 11 November 1994 ) is a former professional Australian rules footballer who played for the Brisbane Lions in the Australian Football League ( AFL ) .
Tim Tadlock ( born 21 December 1968 in Denton , Texas ) is a collegiate baseball coach and former player .
Surendra Prakash Goyal ( born 1 January 1946 ) , is an Indian politician from Gaziabad , Uttar Pradesh .
Maxwell Kofi Jumah ( born 26 June 1950 ) is a Ghanaian politician and a former Mayor of Kumasi , former Member of Parliament for the Asokwa Constituency in the Ashanti Region
Jean - Louis Lalonde ( 17 June 1923- 30 May 2007 ) was a Montréal based Canadian architect , perhaps most famous for his pioneering work with the Montréal Municipal Housing Corporation , Place Saint - Henri Metro Station and his involvement with the promotion of architecture worldwide .
Gretchen Osgood Warren ( 19 March 1868 -- September 1961 ) , the wife of Fiske Warren , was an actress , singer and poet .
Sean Street ( born 2 June 1946 , Waterlooville , Hampshire ) is a writer , poet , broadcaster .
Daniel Mangeas , ( born 10 April 1949 ) is a former baker who has been the commentator of the Tour de France and other important cycle races in France and Belgium since 1974 .
Marie Dähnhardt , born 1818 in Gadebusch , Mecklenburg - Western Pomerania , Germany , the daughter of an apothecary , was a German suffragette avant la lettre , for some time associated with the Berlin debating club Die Freien .
Graham V. Hartstone ( born in 1944 ) is a British sound engineer .
Bariša Čolak ( 1 January 1956 ) is Bosnian Croat politician and lawyer .
Levent Kazak ( born 5 May 1967 in Ankara , Turkey ) is a Turkish screenwriter and actor .
Jozef Gábriš ( 25 June 1933 -- 1994 ) was a controlline aerobatics pilot ( F2B ) from the former Czechoslovakia .
Johannes Conrad ( b. 28 February 1839 in West Prussia ) was a German political economist .
Chi Peng ( Chinese : 迟鹏 born 1981 ) is a Chinese - born artist , Lives and Works in Beijing , China .
David Edward Cronin , also known by his pseudonym Seth Eyland , ( 12 July 1839 -- 9 June 1925 ) was an American painter , illustrator and journalist .
Joey Welz ( born 1940 ) is an American musician born in Baltimore , Maryland who is best known for his tenure as pianist with Bill Haley and His Comets .
Joshua Meyer ( born 1974 , Lubbock , Texas , United States ) is an American artist , based in Cambridge , Massachusetts .
Charlotte Haslund - Christensen ( born 1963 ) is a Danish lens - based visual artist born and based in Copenhagen .
Konrad Junghänel ( born 27 February 1953 ) is a German lutenist and conductor in the field of historically informed performance , the founder and director of the vocal ensemble Cantus Cölln .
Krste Velkoski ( Macedonian : Крсте Велкоски ; born 20 February 1988 ) is a Macedonian footballer who currently plays for Bosnian Premier League club FK Sarajevo .
Charline von Heyl ( born 1960 ) is a German artist best known for her abstract painting .
Hugh Skinner ( born 6 January 1985 ) is an English actor best known for playing Joly in the 2012 film Les Miserables and Will Humphries in W1A.
Squadron Leader Charles George Gass MC ( 18 April 1898 -- March 1977 ) was the highest scoring observer ace during the First World War , with a total of 39 victories ( 16 solo ) scored serving as a gunner flying with various pilots .
Darren Porter ( born 8 May 1984 ) is an English DJ and trance music producer from Sunderland , UK , living in Germany .
Héctor Zumbado Argueta ( born in Havana in 1932 ) , also known as H. Zumbado is a Cuban writer , journalist , critic , humorist , and essayist .
Snehal Ambekar ( Marathi : स्नेहल आंबेकर ) ( born July 31 , 1972 ) is Shiv Sena Politician from Mumbai .
Violinist Peter Sheppard Skærved ( born 1966 ) is the dedicatee of over 150 new works .
Wilner Piquant ( born 4 December 1951 ) was a Haitian international footballer with Haitian club Violette A.C. and was part of the Haitian Squad at the World Cup in Germany in 1974 .
Roy Lockwood , ( 8 June 1907 to 25 April 2002 ) was a pioneering British film , television and radio director .
Grant H. Palmer ( born 1940 ) is an American educator best known for his controversial work , An Insider 's View of Mormon Origins , which ostensibly led to his disfellowshipment in 2004 from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter - day Saints ( LDS Church ) .
Jon Ortner ( Jonathan Ortner ) ( born 1951 , Great Neck , Long Island , New York ) is an American photographer known for his work in the Himalaya Mountains of Nepal , Bhutan , and Ladakh .
Emil Stanisław Rappaport ( 8 July 1877 -- 10 August 1965 ) was the son of Feliks Rappaport and Justyna Bauerertz and a Polish Jewish lawyer .
Lu Wenhui ( 卢文辉 ; born 19 May 1994 ) is a water polo player of China .
Antoine Bangui - Rombaye ( born 1933 ) is a Chadian political figure and author .
Ganesh Patro ( 22 June 1945 -- 5 January 2015 ) was an Indian playwright and screen writer in Telugu cinema .
Bob Harrington ( born 1912 ) was an American jazz vibraphonist .
Rob Doran ( born 1976 ) was the original bassist of the Chicago punk band Alkaline Trio , formed in 1996 .
Harry Plackett ( born 1870 ) was an English footballer who played for Derby County and Nottingham Forest .
Stuart Maxfield ( born 9 April 1972 ) is a retired Australian rules footballer who played for Richmond and the Sydney Swans in the Australian Football League ( AFL ) .
Kevin Ball ( born 12 November 1964 ) is an English former footballer who holds the position of senior professional development coach at Sunderland .
Marcelle Deschênes - Harvey née Price ( b. 2 March 1939 ) is a Canadian multi - media artist , music educator and composer .
Prescott Lecky ( 1892 - -1941 ) was a lecturer of Psychology at Columbia University from 1924 to 1934 .
Dauvit Broun ( English : David Brown ) ( born 1961 ) is a Scottish historian , Professor of Scottish History at the University of Glasgow .
Timmy O'Neill ( born 1969 ) is an American professional rock climber , guide , and comedian .
James P. Leddy ( born 1942 ) was a Democratic member of the Vermont State Senate , who represented the Chittenden senate district .
Hsiang Chun - Hsien ( Chinese : 向俊賢 ; born 4 September 1993 ) is a Taiwanese athlete specialising in the high jump .
Pearl Thompson ( born Paul Stephen Thompson 8 November 1957 in Surrey ) , previously known as Porl Thompson , is an English musician best known for his work with The Cure .
Christopher Colles ( 1739 - -1816 ) was an Irish and American engineer and inventor , known for his work on numerous inland improvement projects , among them a water distribution system in New York City , canals to link the Atlantic seaboard to the American interior , and a road atlas of the northeastern United States .
Juan José Haedo ( born 26 January 1981 ) is an Argentine former professional road racing cyclist and track cyclist , who rode professionally between 2003 and 2014 .
Orhan Aytür ( born 1965 ) is a Turkish professor of optoelectronics and world champion amateur underwater photographer .
Bruno Oldani ( born 14 March 1936 ) is a Swiss designer .
Petros Tampouris , Petros Tabouris ( Πέτρος Ταμπούρης ) ( b. Athens , 1967 ) is a Greek musician , composer and musicologist .
Madison de Rozario ( born 24 November 1993 ) is an Australian Paralympic athlete .
Fujiwara no Korenari ( 藤原 惟成 ) ( 953 - -989 ) was a Japanese courtier of the Heian era .
Andrej Poljanec ( born 10 November 1984 ) is a Slovenian track & field athlete who specializes in the pole vault .
Hussain Ghuloum Abbas Ali ( Arabic : حسين غلوم عباس‎ ) ( born 24 September 1969 ) , is a UAE football ( soccer ) player who played as a left winger for the UAE national football team and Sharjah Club in Sharjah .
Žarko Grabovač ( born 16 June 1983 ) is a former Serbian professional footballer who played as a striker .
Victor Sillon ( born 23 December 1927 ) is a French athlete who specialises in pole vault .
Kristian Jaksch ( born 7 October 1994 ) is a professional Australian rules football player at the Carlton Football Club .
John Reis ( born 1969 ) and also known by the pseudonyms Speedo , Slasher , and The Swami is an American musician , singer , guitarist , record label owner , and disc jockey .
Paolo Limiti ( born 8 May 1940 ) is an Italian lyricist , journalist , radio and television writer and presenter .
Miriam Leone ( born 14 April 1985 ) is an Italian television personality and beauty pageant titleholder who won the Miss Italia 2008 beauty contest .
Leigh Sprague ( born Leigh Elisha Sprague ; 7 April 1970 ) is a former New York attorney and formerly prominent international lawyer who specialized in representing Russian oligarchs in their international activities .
Bartley Christopher Frueh ( born 1963 ) is a clinical psychologist and American author .
George Augustus Simcox ( 1841 - -1905 ) was a British classical scholar and poet .
Zdravko Velimirović ( 11 October 1930 -- 7 February 2005 ) was a Yugoslavian film director and screenwriter , University Professor , a member of the Academy of Arts and Sciences .
Tomo Razmilovic ( born 31 May 1942 ) is a Croatian - born businessman , formerly the chief executive officer of Long Island , New York - based Symbol Technologies .
George Barclay Richardson CBE ( born 19 September 1924 ) is a British economist , who was Warden of Keble College , Oxford , from 1989 to 1994 .
Heikki Kirkinen ( 22 September 1927 in Kuusjärvi ) , is a professor in history at Joensuu University .
Joseph Greco ( born 1972 ) is a writer , director and producer living in Los Angeles .
Wayne Sanders ( born 29 May 1969 ) is a Christian worship leader and songwriter who is Music Director at Cambridge Community Church , an Evangelical church in central Cambridge , England .
Donna Morrissey ( born in 1956 at The Beaches , Newfoundland ) is a Canadian author .
Nebojša Todorović ( Serbian Cyrilic : Небојша Тодоровић ; born on 2 September 1957 , in Leskovac , Yugoslavia - now Serbia ) is a Serbian musicologist and university professor .
Helena Mattsson ( born 30 March 1984 ) is a Swedish actress living and working in Hollywood .
Derek Scrimgour ( born 29 March 1978 ) is a former professional footballer , who played for St. Mirren in the 2000 - -01 Scottish Premier League .
Hasan Vezir ( 7 September 1962 ) is a Turkish former footballer and currently a football manager .
Marino Drake ( born 18 June 1967 in Limonar , Matanzas ) is a retired Cuban athlete competing in the high jump .
Mary Sadler was born on 2 May 1941 in the Netherlands and emigrated with parents to South Africa while still a child .
Leo Sheffield ( 15 November 1873 -- 3 September 1951 ) was an English singer and actor best known for his performances in baritone roles of the Savoy Operas with the D'Oyly Carte Opera Company .
Yasmin Alibhai - Brown ( born Yasmin Damji on 10 December 1949 ) is a Ugandan - born British journalist and author , who describes herself as a `` leftie liberal , anti - racist , feminist , Shia Muslim , part - Pakistani , and ... a very responsible person '' .
Rafael Navarro Garralaga is a Spanish photographer born in Zaragoza in 1940 .
Sir Simon Baskerville , M.D. ( 1574 - -1641 ) was an English physician .
Vicky Krieps ( born 4 October 1983 ) is a Luxembourgish actress who has starred in a number of Luxembourgish , French and predominantly German productions .
Jairo Arrieta Obando ( born 25 August 1983 ) is a Costa Rican footballer , who plays for New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League .
Belinda Stewart - Wilson ( born 16 April 1971 ) is an English actress , best known for her role as Polly McKenzie in The Inbetweeners .
Although it was an accepted part of Hadrian 's personal history that he was born in Spain , his Historia Augusta biography states that he was born in Rome on 24 January 76 , of an ethnically Hispanic with vague paternal links to Italy .
Kwabena Sarkodee Adjepong better known by his stage name Kwabs ( born 24 April 1990 ) is a British Ghanaian singer and songwriter .
Bernard Deconinck ( born 26 April 1936 ) is a retired French track cyclist who won a silver medal in the motor - paced racing at the 1959 World Championships .
John Izard Middleton ( 1785 - -1849 ) was an American archeologist and artist .
Karol Adwentowicz ( 19 October 1871 -- 19 July 1958 ) was a Polish actor and theater director .
Ilona Kabos ( 7 December 1893 -- 27 May 1973 ) was a Hungarian - British pianist and teacher .
Ernst Wilhelm Moes ( 1864 -- 1912 ) , was a Dutch art historian and director of the print cabinet for the Rijksmuseum .
Sir Humphrey Arundell ( c. 1513 -- 27 January 1550 ) was the leader of Cornish forces in the Prayer Book Rebellion early in the reign of King Edward VI .
Bill Lokan ( born 1 October 1959 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with North Adelaide in the South Australian National Football League ( SANFL ) and Fitzroy in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) .
Jonathan Horowitz ( born 1966 ) is a New York based artist working in video , sculpture , sound installation , and photography .
Are Nakkim ( born 13 February 1964 ) is a retired Norwegian long - distance runner who specialized in the 10,000 metres .
Alan Cumyn ( born 8 January 1960 ) is a Canadian novelist who lives in Ottawa , Ontario .
Marie Gahéry ( 1867 - 1932 ) was a pioneering French Catholic social worker and educationalist .
Harm Haijo Apotheker ( born 5 June 1950 , Loppersum ) is a Dutch politician for the Democraten 66 party .
Stephen Garlick is an English actor , born in Stockwell , London , on 7 July 1959 .
Alexander Ivanovich Cherepanov ( 21 November 1895 ( O.S. 9 November ) - 6 July 1984 ) was a Soviet military leader .
Edward Shearmur ( sometimes known as Ed Shearmur ; born 28 February 1966 ) is a British film composer .
Kathleen MacInnes ( born 30 December 1969 ) is a Scottish singer , television presenter and actress , who performs primarily in Scottish Gaelic .
Ronald Lee ( born 1934 ) is a Romani Canadian writer , linguist and activist .
Salim Mvurya , Salim Mvurya Mgala or Mvurya Salim Mgalla ( born 1970 ) is a Kenyan politician .
Lawrence Power is a British violist , born 1977 , noted both for solo performances and for chamber music with the Nash Ensemble and Leopold String Trio .
Alastair Fothergill ( born 10 April 1960 ) is a British producer of nature documentaries for television and cinema .
Matthew Brettingham the Younger ( 1725 -- 18 March 1803 ) was an architect .
Aleksander Kolkowski ( born 1959 in London ) is a British musician and composer whose work combines instruments and machines from the pioneering era of sound recording and reproduction ( Stroh violins , wind - up Gramophones , shellac discs and wax - cylinder Phonographs ) to make live mechanical - acoustic music .
Jeffrey Bub ( born 1942 ) is a physicist and philosopher of physics , and Distinguished Professor in the Department of Philosophy and the Institute for Physical Science and Technology at the University of Maryland , College Park .
Vedanayagam Sastriar 1774 -1864 of Thanjavur , poet - lyricist , court poet in the palace of Serfoji II . He was a poet and writer with 133 books and over 500 lyrics to his credit .
Markus Gellhaus ( born 9 June 1970 ) is a former German football player who last managed SC Paderborn .
Filaret Galchev ( Russian : Филарет Гальчев ; born 26 May 1963 in Tbilisi , Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic ) is a Russian businessman , Chairman of Eurocement group .
Jamal Zougam ( c. 1973 , Tangier ) was one of six men implicated in the 2004 Madrid train bombings .
Limmie Snell ( 1945 -- 1986 ) was an American soul singer , born in Dalton , Alabama .
Patrick Clinch ( 1790 -- March 10 , 1868 ) was a farmer , newspaper owner and political figure in New Brunswick .
Nabila Ebeid ( Arabic : نبيلة عبيد‎ ) ( born 21 January 1945 in Cairo ) , also spelled Nabila Obeid , is an Egyptian actress .
Suellen Rocca ( born 1943 ) is a Chicago artist , one of the original Chicago Imagists , a group in the 1960s and 1970s who turned to representational art . She exhibited with them at the Hyde Park Art Center from 1966 through 1969 .
James F. Hutchinson ( born 1932 ) is a painter .
Paul Kleinert ( 23 September 1837 -- 29 July 1920 ) was a German theologian , born at Vielguth in Prussian Silesia .
Erick Keter ( born 22 July 1966 , in Kabarusu , Kericho ) is a retired Kenyan athlete who specialized in the 400 metres hurdles .
Rogelio Bernal Andreo ( born 9 January 1969 ) is a Spanish - American astrophotographer .
Juan Gustavo Scheps Grandal ( Montevideo , 1 December 1954 ) is a Uruguayan architect and professor .
Syed Mahmood Naqvi ( 28 August 1941 - -4 September 2009 ) was an Indian Earth scientist specialising in geochemistry at the National Geophysical Research Institute ( NGRI ) in Hyderabad .
Katrín Jónsdóttir ( born 31 May 1977 ) is an Icelandic former football player .
Raymond Obstfeld ( born 1952 , Williamsport , Pennsylvania ) is an American novelist , screenwriter and non - fiction writer .
Michael Monaghan ( born 13 May 1980 ) is an Australian former professional rugby league footballer who played for Canberra Raiders and Manly - Warringah Sea Eagles in the National Rugby League , and for Warrington in the European Super League .
Joseph Robert Sealy ( b. 1907 - d. August 1 , 2000 ) was an English botanist .
Roy C. Booth ( born August 26 , 1965 ) is a United States speculative fiction , fantasy and horror author .
Andrew Sant ( born 1950 ) is an English born Australian poet .
Tasawar Hayat ( born 1 January 1969 ) is a Pakistani mathematician who has made pioneering research in mechanical engineering , Newtonian mechanics and physics .
Tim Lokiec ( pronounced `` lock - itch '' ) ( born 1977 ) is an artist based in New York City , New York .
Karl Richard Hanitsch ( 22 December 1860 -- 11 August 1940 ) was a German - born entomologist and museum curator who served as the director of the Raffles Museum in Singapore in the early 20th century .
Tim Nedow ( born 16 October 1990 ) is a Canadian track and field athlete who competes in the shot put and discus throw .
Mopidevi Venkataramana Rao ( born 1964 , Nizampatam ) is an Indian National Congress politician , who has been the Excise minister under Kiran Kumar Reddy and most recently represented the Repalle , Guntur constituency in the Andhra Pradesh Legislature .
Vanessa Borgli ( born 4 October 1972 ) is a Norwegian actress , known primarily for her role as `` Sue - Astrid Wallace '' in the soap opera Hotel Cæsar .
Kay Sekimachi ( born 1926 ) is an American fiber artist .
Guy McElwaine ( 1936 - 2008 ) was a Hollywood agent , producer and studio head .
Pat Liddy ( Irish : Pádraig Ó Lideadha , born 1944 in Dublin ) is an Irish artist , historian , writer , illustrator , broadcaster , mapmaker , and environmental lobbyist who has helped make Dublin a global tourist attraction .
Julius Meinl V ( born 9 July 1959 ) is a British businessman , resident in Prague Czech Republic ( since end of August 2013 ) .
Luigi Pezzuto ( born 30 April 1946 ) is an Italian prelate of the Roman Catholic Church .
Wojciech Skupień ( born 9 March 1976 ) is a Polish former ski jumper who competed from 1993 to 2008 .
Du Jiang ( pinyin : Dù Jiāng , born on November 1964 ) is the incumbent Vice Chairman of China National Tourism Administration ( CNTA ) .
Nick Harkaway ( born 1972 ) is a novelist and commentator .
Pradip Bhattacharya ( born 24 January 1945 ) is a member of parliament representing Indian National Congress in the Rajya Sabha from West Bengal .
Mariano Stendardo ( born 2 May 1983 ) is an Italian footballer who plays for the Lega Pro side Fidelis Andria .
Moussa Sanoh ( born 20 July 1995 ) is a Dutch professional football player who currently plays as a winger for RKC Waalwijk in the Dutch Eerste Divisie .
John Crome ( Norwich 22 December 1768 -- 22 April 1821 ) was an English landscape artist of the Romantic era , one of the principal artists of the Norwich School art movement .
Nae Caranfil ( Romanian pronunciation : ( ˈna.e karanˈfil ) ; also Nicolae Caranfil ) ( born 1960 , Bucharest ) is a Romanian film director and screenwriter .
Igli Tare ( Albanian pronunciation : ( ˈiɡli ' taɾɛ ) ; born 25 July 1973 ) is an Albanian retired football who played as a striker .
Dick Tuck ( born January 25 , 1924 ) is a former American political consultant , campaign strategist , advance man , and political prankster for the Democratic National Committee .
Karl Taro Greenfeld ( born 1964 in Kobe , Japan ) is a journalist and author known primarily for his articles on life in modern Asia and both his fiction and non - fiction in The Paris Review .
George Swain ( 1919 - -2000 ) was a local legend from Boron , California .
Henry Budd ( circa 1812 -- April 2 , 1875 ) , the first Native American ordained an Anglican priest , spent his career ministering to First Nations people .
Rigdzin Namkha Gyatso Rinpoche ( born December 1967 ) is a Tibetan Buddhist teacher .

Marc Bolan ( pron . BOE - lən ; born Mark Feld ; 30 September 1947 -- 16 September 1977 ) was an English singer - songwriter , musician , guitarist , and poet .
Harald Dahlstrøm ( born 2 March 1961 in Bergen ) is a Norwegian jazz musician ( piano and Hammond B3 organ ) , known for participation on a series of records , from collaborations with musicians like Kenneth Sivertsen and Dance with a Stranger , and as band leader for his own lineups .
Rabbi Nachum Shifren ( born c. 1951 ) , also known as the surfing rabbi , is an Orthodox Lubavitcher Chassidic rabbi and accomplished surfer .
Mehdi Khalis ( born 6 January 1989 ) is a professional football player who currently plays for Moroccan side FUS de Rabat .
Ove Pihl ( born 2 May 1938 ) is a Swedish art director , book publisher and graphic designer .

Yoni Bloch ( Hebrew : יוני בלוך‎ ; born August 11 , 1981 ) is an Israeli musician , song writer , composer , rock singer and hi - tech entrepreneur .

Anastasia Karpova ( Russian : Анастасия Карпова ; born 2 November 1984 ) is a Russian singer , best known as a member of girl group Serebro .
Juan Guillermo Aguirre ( born 1951 ) , better known as Memo Aguirre , is a famous Chilean singer whose voice has been heard all over Latin America , particularly during the opening acts of superhero cartoon shows during the 1980s .
Ben Zonneveld ( Bernardus Joannes Maria Zonneveld ) ( b. 1940- ) is a Dutch plant scientist and botanist known for his work on the genetics of Tulips and Daffodils , and their infrageneric classification .
Charles John Bond , F.R.C.S. , CMG ( 27 October 1856 -- 23 November 1939 ) , was a medical doctor during the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries , who served at the Leicester Royal Infirmary and was a proponent of eugenics and euthanasia .

Mirosław Nahacz was a Polish writer and screen writer , born on 9 September 1984 in Gorlice .
Prakash Tandon ( 1911 - -2004 ) was one of India 's most influential business leaders in the second half of the 20th century .
Lawson Oyekan ( born in London , England 1961 ) , is a British Nigerian contemporary ceramic sculptor and the first recipient of the Grand Prix Award for the 1st World Ceramic Biennale 2001 in Korea .
Odd Bergh ( born 28 June 1937 ) is a former Norwegian athlete who specialized in the triple jump and long jump .
Cornelis Mahu ( 1613 -- 16 November 1689 ) was a Flemish painter of still lifes , genre paintings and seascapes who showed a very high level of craftsmanship in his compositions .
Roger Knox ( born in 1948 ) is an Australian country singer , known as the Black Elvis and the Koori King of Country .
Čestmír Kožíšek ( born 9 November 1991 ) is a Czech ski jumper from club LSK Lomnice nad Popelkou .
Pádraig Ó Siadhail was born in Derry , Northern Ireland , in 1957 , and now lives in Halifax , Nova Scotia , Canada .
Jacob Hen - Tov ( born 1932 , Tel Aviv , Israel ) is an academician specializing in the history and politics of Russia and the Middle East and the legal system of the former Soviet Union .
Ethel Ayler ( born 1934 ) is a veteran African - American character actress with a career spanning over five decades .
Juan José Torres González ( 5 March 1920 -- 2 June 1976 ) was a Bolivian socialist politician and military leader .
Camilla Rutherford ( born 20 September 1976 ) is an English actress and fashion model .
K. T. K. Thangamani , born in 1913 , was a politician from Indian state of Tamil Nadu .
Marguerite Donlon ( born 31 May 1966 ) is an Irish dancer , choreographer and ballet director .
Bruce Foxton ( born 1 September 1955 ) is an English singer , musician , and composer .
Maryvonne Huet ( born 1 December 1936 ) is a former French figure skater who competed in ladies singles .
Falima Teao ( born 1931 ) was the ulu , or head of government , of Tokelau from February 1997 to February 1998 .
Antonis Manikas ( Greek : Αντώνης Μανίκας ) ( born 9 February 1959 ) is a Greek football manager and former player .
Chin Kung , AM ( 淨空 ; pinyin : Jìngkōng ) ( b. 1927 ) is a Buddhist monk from the Mahayana tradition .
Miodrag Vukotić ( Serbian Cyrillic : Миодраг Вукотић , born 8 November 1973 ) is a retired Montenegrin football player .
Sir George Paish ( 7 November 1867 -- 1 May 1957 ) was a British liberal economist of international renown , author of `` The Defeat of Chaos '' ( 1941 ) , as well as `` Railways in Great Britain '' ( 1904 ) , and co - author of `` Road To Prosperity '' in 1927 .
Kavyen Temperley ( born Finlay Beaton on 3 July 1978 ) is the lead singer , songwriter , bassist and occasional keyboard player of the Australian band Eskimo Joe .
William P. Leahy , SJ ( born 1948 ) is the 25th President of Boston College , a post he has held since 1996 .
Linda Thorson ( born Linda Robinson on 18 June 1947 ) is a Canadian actress , best known for playing Tara King in The Avengers ( 1968 - -69 ) .
Michel Bernholc ( 1941 - -2002 ) was a French composer , arranger and producer .
Judith Tarr ( born in Augusta , Maine , January 30 , 1955 ) is an American Fantasy and Science Fiction author .
Joëlle van Noppen ( 20 January 1980 -- 12 May 2010 ) was a Dutch singer .
Brigitte Lin ( Chinese : 林青霞 ; pinyin : Lín Qīngxiá ) or Brigitte Lin Ching - hsia ( born 3 November 1954 ) is a Taiwanese actress .
Grace Mott Johnson ( 1882 - -1967 ) was an American artist married to Andrew Michael Dasburg .
Bernd Hölzenbein ( born 9 March 1946 ) is a former German football player ( winning the World Cup in 1974 ) .
Elizabeth Parke Firestone ( 1897 - -1990 ) was the mother of Martha Firestone , who we d William Clay Ford , Sr . , grandson of Henry Ford .
Michael Zemski ( born 10 September 1953 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with Hawthorn in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) and Preston in the Victorian Football Association ( VFA ) .
James F. Brooks ( born 1955 ) is an American historian whose work on slavery , captivity and kinship in the Southwest Borderlands was honored with major national history awards : the Bancroft Prize , Francis Parkman Prize , the Frederick Jackson Turner Award and the Frederick Douglass Prize ( second prize ) .
Dominique Pinto ( born 1989 ) , known by her stage name Dom La Nena , is a Brazilian - born cellist , singer and songwriter .
Christophe Didillon ( born 1971 in Aurich , Germany ) is an artist ( acrylic paintings , collages , photos ) .
Colin Fowles ( 6 August 1953 − 1 September 1985 ) was a Jamaican - American soccer player who died as a result of random gunfire while playing recreational soccer .
Kailash Satyarthi ( born ' Kailash Sharma ' ; 11 January 1954 ) is an Indian children 's rights and education advocate and an activist against child labour .
Feiz Mohammad ( born 1970 ) is an Australian Muslim preacher of Lebanese descent , noted for his Islamic fundamentalism .
Robert Vikestad ( born 15 December 1983 ) was a Norwegian footballer who played on the wing for Bodø / Glimt .
Gordon MacCreagh ( 1886 in Perth , Indiana -- 1953 ) was an American writer .
Alexander Prent ( born 25 May 1983 ) is a Dutch football player who plays as a winger for JVC Cuijk in the Dutch Topklasse .
Theodore Sunday Wrobeh ( born 21 October 1981 ) is a Liberian football player who is currently free agent .
Joseph C. Burke ( born 1932 ) is an American educator who is most notable for having served as President of the State University of New York at Plattsburgh and Acting Chancellor of the State University of New York .
Jacob de Formentrou or Jacob de Fourmentrou ( b. between 1620 and 1625 - d. after 1668 ) was a Flemish Baroque painter active in Antwerp who specialized in the genres of merry companies and gallery paintings .
Petr Brdičko ( born 7 May 1988 ) is a Czech songwriter who was born and raised in Prague .
Modesto Varischetti ( 1873 - 1930 ) was a gold miner in Western Australia who was trapped in a gold mine for nine days after a thunderstorm flooded the mine in March 1907 .
William C. Pfefferle ( April 24 , 1923 - December 28 , 2010 ) was an American scientist and inventor .
Hendrik Niehoff ( 1495 -- c. 1561 ) was a Dutch pipe organ builder , who learned with noted builder , Jan van Covelen ( c. 1470 - 1532 ) .
Enrica von Handel - Mazzetti ( 10 January 1871 -- 8 April 1955 ) was an Austrian poet and writer , known for writing historical romances , notably `` Die Hochzeit von Quedlinburg '' .
Fernando Maciel Gonçalves ( born 16 August 1980 ) , commonly known as Fernandão , is a Spanish - Brazilian futsal player who plays for Dinamo as a Pivot .
Zoran Simjanović ( pronounced ( zǒran simjǎːnoʋitɕ ) ; born 11 May 1946 ) is a Serbian composer .
Keli Carender ( born c. 1981 ) is an American blogger credited with being the first Tea Party protest activist when she was the principal organizer of a protest of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 on February 16 , 2009 .
Li Xiaolin ( Chinese : 李小琳 ; born 1961 ) is a Chinese businesswoman , current serving as vice - president of the China Datang Corporation , a state - owned power generation enterprise .
Taibi Kahler ( born 1943 ) is a psychologist , author , expert interviewer , and presidential communications advisor .
Bob Ducsay ( born c. 1962 ) is a film editor , screenwriter and producer who has worked on over 20 film and television productions .
David Rams ( born 1961 in Ontario , Canada ) is a music , celebrity and beauty photographer .
Peter Johan Schei ( born 5 January 1945 ) is a Norwegian biologist and civil servant .
Chokey Nima ( born 1969 or 1970 ) is a former Bhutanese international footballer and also was the head coach the Bhutan national football team .
Hans Nobel ( 1657 -- 26 August 1732 ) was a Danish landowner and civil servant .
Ivan Vekić ( Croatian pronunciation : ( ǐʋan ʋěːkit͡ɕ ) , 18 October 1938 -- 17 December 2014 ) was a Croatian politician and lawyer .
Claus Michael Møller ( born 3 October 1968 ) is a Danish former professional cyclist .
Clemente de Lantaño Pino ( ca . 1774 in Chillán -- ? in Chillán ) was a royalist military officer during the Chilean War of Independence .
Mohammed Christophe Bilek ( born 1950 ) is an Algerian former Muslim who lives in France since 1961 .
Dai Weimin ( born May 1962 ) is a general in the People 's Liberation Army of China .
Dawson McAllister ( born 1946 in New Kensington , Pennsylvania ) is an American speaker , radio host , and author .
Trond Bergh ( born 16 September 1946 ) is a Norwegian economic historian , and researcher at the Department of Innovation and Economic Organisation of the BI Norwegian Business School .
Rein Ahas ( born 10 December 1966 in Tartu ) is an Estonian geographer and a professor at the University of Tartu .
Jean - Marc Joguet ( born 29 March 1965 ) from Beaufort , Savoie is a French ski mountaineer and long - distance runner .
Juliet Rylance ( born Juliet van Kampen ; 26 July 1979 ) is an English actress and producer , known for the film Days and Nights .
Maycol Andriani ( born 17 September 1987 ) is an Italian footballer who plays for the Serie D club Castellana .
Alexandre Darracq ( 10 November 1855 - -1931 ) was a French automobile manufacturer .
Philip Bouquett or Bouquet ( 1669 - -1748 ) was a French linguist who became Regius Professor of Hebrew at the University of Cambridge .
Prince Józef Klemens Czartoryski ( 1740 - -1810 ) was a Polish nobleman ( szlachcic ) who owned Korets Castle .
Shaunaka Rishi Das ( born 18 February 1961 ) is the Director of the Oxford Centre for Hindu Studies ( OCHS ) , a position he has held since the Centre 's foundation in 1997 .
Joël Mercier ( born 5 January 1945 ) is a prelate of the Roman Catholic Church who serves in the Curia as Secretary of the Congregation for the Clergy .
Veronica Henry ( born 1963 ) is a British writer of Romance novels , TV script writer and journalist .
Betty Neumar ( November 1931 -- June 13 , 2011 ) was an American woman charged with arranging the murder of her fourth husband , Harold Gentry , who died in 1986 .
Steven Bosch ( born 6 June 1978 ) is a South African artist ( working primarily in the medium of photography ) and creative director in Johannesburg .
Ricarda Lisk ( born 1 February 1981 in Schorndorf , Baden - Württemberg ) , is a German professional triathlete , National Elite Champion of the year 2010 , and a permanent member of the German Kader , i.e. the National Team .
Manon von Gerkan ( born 1972 in Hamburg ) is a German model and actress .
Dr Sampurnanand ( 1 January 1891 -- 10 January 1969 ) was a teacher and politician in Uttar Pradesh , India .
Jacob Minah ( born 3 April 1982 ) is a decathlete from Germany .
Kaevan Gazdar ( born 1951 ) is a journalist , and lecturer writing about economic and socio - economic issues .
Keith Dunne ( born 10 February 1982 ) is an Irish footballer .
John H. Oberholtzer ( 10 January 1809 -- 15 February 1895 ) was a North American Mennonite leader who advocated for Mennonite cooperation for the purpose of higher education and mission work .
Henrique Walter Pinotti ( 1929 -- June 21 , 2010 ) was a Brazilian physician and gastric surgeon , and a full professor of surgery at the University of São Paulo 's Medical School .
David Tangata - Toa ( born 15 July 1981 in Gold Coast , Queensland ) is currently the assistant coach of the Penrith Panthers New South Wales Cup ( rugby league)Competition squad .
John H. Thompson ( born 1951 ) is an American statistician who has been serving as the 24th Director of the United States Census Bureau since 2013 .
Rev. John Dyfnallt Owen ( 7 April 1873 -- 28 December 1956 ) , was a Welsh poet , and served as Archdruid of the National Eisteddfod of Wales from 1954 until his death .
Sir William MacMahon , 1st Baronet ( 1776 - -1837 ) was an Irish judge and member of a Limerick family which became prominent largely through personal influence over the Prince Regent .
Carl Breus ( 12 April 1852 -- 1914 ) was an Austrian obstetrician born in Vienna .
Alí Rodríguez Araque ( born in Ejido , Mérida , 9 September 1937 ) is a Venezuelan politician , lawyer , and diplomat .
Hugo Salmela ( 13 June 1884 -- 28 March 1918 ) was one of the Red Guard military leaders in the 1918 Finnish Civil War .
John Howard Sanden ( born 1935 in Austin , Texas ) is an American portrait artist .
Bohumil Němeček ( 2 January 1938 -- 2 May 2010 ) was a Czechoslovak welterweight boxer .
Bill Warrington ( 1910 -- September 11 , 1981 ) was a special effect 's artist .
Sylvia Stanfield ( born 1943 ) is an American former diplomat who served as the nation 's first African - American woman ambassador to Brunei , from 1999 to 2002 .
Önder Turacı ( Turkish pronunciation : ( øndeɾ tuɾadʒɯ ) , born 14 July 1981 ) is a Turkish footballer who is currently a free agent .
Andrzej Sakson ( b. 1950 in Elbląg ) is a Polish sociologist and historian .
Annie Cooper ( born 1983 ) is a British actress , singer and dancer .
Ričardas Bartkevičius ( born 1959 in Vilnius ) is a prominent Lithuanian painter and educator .
Chen Bolin ( traditional Chinese : 陳柏霖 ; simplified Chinese : 陈柏霖 ; pinyin : Chén Bólín ; Cantonese Yale : Chan Pak Lam ) was born 27 August 1983 .
Hristo Karastoyanov ( born on 22 February 1950 in Topolovgrad ) is a contemporary Bulgarian novelist .
Simcha Zissel Halevi Levovitz ( 1908 - -2001 ) was a rabbi and founder of a yeshiva in Boro Park , Brooklyn .
Ioan Bengliu ( born 1881 - died 1940 ) was a Romanian Lieutenant - General .
Thomas Hylkema ( born 20 August 1988 ) is a Dutch racing driver , who drove for Tech 1 Racing in the GP3 Series in 2011 .
Vincy Chan ( born 16 October 1982 ) is a Hong Kong cantopop singer .
Federico Pisani ( 25 July 1974 --12 February 1997 ) was an Italian professional footballer who played for Atalanta and Monza .
Ahmed Bukhatir ( Arabic : أحمد بوخاطر‎ ; born 16 October 1975 ) is an Emirati Nasheed singer .
Cornelia Hilda Kühn ( born 11 December 1944 ) is an Afrikaans writer known under the pen - name Corlia Fourie .
John L. Rotz ( born . c. 1934 in Warrensburg , Illinois ) is a retired American Thoroughbred horse racing jockey and an active World Champion in Western riding competitions .
Salvatore Puccio ( born 31 August 1989 ) is an Italian racing cyclist who rides for UCI World Tour team Team Sky .
Jānis Eglītis ( January 23 , 1961 -- May 6 , 2013 ) was a Latvian politician and a Deputy of the 9th Saeima .
Paul Haslinger ( born 11 December 1962 ) is an Austrian - born composer and music producer based out of Los Angeles , California .
Takuya Kita ( 北卓也 , born 29 May 1972 ) is a retired Japanese basketball player .
Liu Zhengcheng ( Simplified Chinese : 刘正成 ; Hanyu Pinyin : Liú Zhèngchéng ) ( 1946 - ) is a contemporary Chinese calligrapher based in Beijing , China particularly noted for his use of the cursive script .
Faruk Sokolović ( born 18 September 1952 ) is a Bosnian film director , producer , actor and screenwriter .
Vanley Burke ( born 1951 ) is a British Jamaican photographer and artist .
Hon . Dr. Christian Cardona was born in 1972 and graduated as Notary Public and Doctor of Laws from the University of Malta .
Mike Imlach ( born 19 September 1962 ) is a footballer who played as a full back in the Football League for Peterborough United and Tranmere Rovers .
Heather Mitchell ( born 1958 ) is an Australian actress , appearing in Australian productions of Stage , television and film .
Christopher Tietze ( 1908 - April 4 , 1984 ) was a United States physician best known for his stance in the United States pro - choice movement to permit abortion in the United States .
Fouad M'Roudjaé ( born 24 June 1994 ) is a Comorian international footballer who plays for Marseille , as a left back .
Shankar Pannu ( 18 November 1949 ) is a former Member of Parliament from Ganganagar constituency .
Leelawathy Ramanathan ( née R. L. Harrison in 1870 ) was the Australia - born wife of Ponnambalam Ramanathan . Lady Ramanathan was an Englishwoman who was born in Australia where her father was into gold mining .
Gary Mex Glazner , ( born 1957 ) , is a poet and author .
Flying Childers was a famous undefeated 18th century Thoroughbred racehorse , foaled in 1714 at Carr House , Warmsworth , Doncaster , and is often cited as the first truly great racehorse in the history of Thoroughbreds .
Kanchan Wali - Richardson ( born 1990 ) is an American interdisciplinary visual artist who currently lives and works in Nashville , Tennessee .
James Alexander Lyons ( 1861 - 1920 ) was an American accountancy author , and publisher , known for publishing a series of books on bookkeeping and accountancy in the early 20th century .
John Albert Raven FRS FRSE ( born 25 June 1941 ) is a British botanical scientist , and emeritus professor at University of Dundee .
Aleksandar Subić ( Serbian Cyrillic : Александар Субић ; born 27 September 1993 ) is a Bosnian professional footballer who plays as a left back for Serbian club Partizan .
Marija Gluvakov - Medenica ( Serbian Cyrillic : Марија Глуваков - Меденица ) ( born 3 April 1973 ) , is a Serbian pianist and piano teacher .
José Filipe Torres ( born 13 April 1976 ) is a Portuguese entrepreneur , spokesperson , country branding and nation branding expert .
Valter Alessandro Salvioni best known as Sandro Salvioni ( born 8 October 1953 ) is an Italian football manager , and a former player , last in charge as head coach of Lugano .
Laurence Jalbert ( born Lise Jalbert 18 August 1959 in Rivière - au - Renard , Quebec ) is a pop singer - songwriter from Quebec .
Walter S. Rogers ( born 1871 ) was the primary illustrator used by the Stratemeyer Syndicate for most of its series from the 1910s-1930s .
Elise , Countess of Edla ( born Elise Friedericke Hensler ; 22 May 1836 -- 21 May 1929 ) , was a Swiss - born American actress and singer and the morganatic second wife of the former King Ferdinand II of Portugal .
Oksana Okuneva ( Ukrainian : Окунева Оксана ; born 14 March 1990 in Mykolaiv ) is an Ukrainian high jumper .
Søren Skou ( born 20 August 1964 ) has been the CEO of Maersk Line since January 2012 .
Gideon Nieuwoudt ( 1951 - 2005 ) was a former apartheid - era security policeman involved in the torture and murder of several anti - apartheid activists , including Steve Biko .
Lorenzo Kom'boa Ervin ( born 1947 ) is an American writer , activist , and black anarchist .
James McGrahan ( 3 March 1898 -- after 1948 ) , also known as Jimmy McGrahan or McGraham , was an English footballer who made 85 appearances in the Football League playing for Lincoln City ( in two spells ) and Wigan Borough .
Susan Mohl Powers ( born 1944 in Saint Paul , Minnesota ) is a contemporary artist who sculpts in polygon and planar metal as well as sewn fabric , blending art and science to design sculptures and fabric - on - canvas paintings .
Chih - Fu Cheng ( 鄭志富 , born 1956 ) from Penghu , Taiwan , is currently the vice president of the National Taiwan Normal University ( NTNU ) and Distinguished professor at the Department of Physical Education and the Graduate Institute of Sport , Leisure , and Hospitality Management , NTNU .
Jan Raa ( born 11 October 1939 ) is a Norwegian biologist .
Bahia Boussad ( born 31 January 1979 ) is a retired Algerian athlete who competed in racewalking events .
M. Ann McCaig ( née Schnell ; June 1939 ) was the chancellor of the University of Calgary in Alberta from 1994 until 1998 .
Aníbal González Ramírez ( born 8 April 1995 ) is a Mexican - Chilean footballer that currently plays for the Primera División club Colo - Colo as striker .
Manoranjan Shill Gopal ( Bengali : মনোরঞ্জন শীল গোপাল ; born 1 January 1964 ) , also known as Gopal , is a Bangladeshi politician who has served as Member of Parliament for Dinajpur-1 since 2005 .
Raffaella Carrà ( Italian : ( raffaˈɛlla karˈra ) ; born 18 June 1943 in Bologna ) , often simply known as la Carrà ( the Carrà ) and in some Latin American countries sometimes simply as Raffaella , is an Italian singer , dancer , television presenter , and actress .
Nanda Kishore Bal ( 22 December 1875 -- 1 July 1928 ) , was an Indian poet of the era of initial modernity in Odia poetry .
Archibald Bower ( 17 January 1686 -- 3 September 1766 ) was a Scottish historian , now noted for his complicated and varying religious faith , and the accounts he gave of it , now considered by scholars to lack credibility .
Arthur Okowa Ifeanyi ( born 8 July 1959 ) is the incumbent Governor of Delta State .
Drisana Levitzke - Gray ( b 1993 ) is a deaf woman from Perth , Western Australia , who advocates for deaf people and culture .
Anna Hruby ( born 19 October 1960 ) is an Australian actress who has appeared in many Australian television series and theatre productions .
Sir George Shenton ( 4 March 1842 -- 29 June 1909 ) was a prominent businessman in colonial Western Australia , the first Mayor of Perth , and a Member of the Western Australian Legislative Council for over thirty years .
Séamus Roche ( born 8 September 1969 ) is an Irish retired hurling referee .
Amy Kwolek ( born Amy Kwoleková , 7 May 1986 ) is an English actress , who is best known for her role as Nadine in Girls in Love ( 2003 - -05 ) which has been an incredible success .
Eldar Vågan ( born 30 August 1960 ) is best known as the songwriter and guitarist in Vazelina Bilopphøggers .
Zsolt Hamar ( born 1968 Budapest ) is a Hungarian conductor .
Gregory Wm . Gunn ( born 1960 in Windsor , Ontario ) is a Canadian poet of the New Formalist tradition .
Chapman Mortimer was the pen name of William Charles ( `` W. C. '' ) Chapman Mortimer ( born 15 May 1907 died 1988 ) , a Scottish novelist .
Charles Congden Carpenter ( June 2 , 1921 -- January 10 , 2016 ) was an eminent naturalist and herpetologist who has won numerous awards for excellence as an educator , researcher , and communicator .
Joanne Horniman ( born 1951 ) is an Australian author who has won several awards for her books for children , teenagers and young adults .
Steve Haskin ( born 1947 in New York ) is an award - winning American horse - racing journalist and author .
Harold Roper Robinson FRS ( 1889 - -1955 ) was a physicist and , in later life , an outstanding figure in university administration .
Jeannine Savard ( born 1950 ) is an American poet , born in the Adirondack Mountain Region of New York State .
The Honourable Paul Tiensten , born 1966 , is a former Papua New Guinean politician and former National Alliance Member of Parliament for Pomio Open .
Zheng Xuan ( 127 - -200 ) , courtesy name Kangcheng ( 康成 ) , was an influential Chinese commentator and Confucian scholar near the end of the Han Dynasty .
Bruno Edgar Silva Almeida ( born 18 March 1994 ) , known as Bruno Ramires , is a Brazilian professional footballer who plays as a Defensive Midfielder for Cruzeiro .
Thomas Eagles ( 1746 - -1812 ) , was an English classical scholar .
Humphrey Burton , CBE ( born 25 March 1931 ) is a British classical music television presenter , broadcaster , TV director , producer , impresario , lecturer and biographer of musicians .
Li Daozong ( 李道宗 ) ( 603?-656 ? ) , courtesy name Chengfan ( 承範 ) , was an imperial prince of the Chinese dynasty Tang Dynasty .
Donie O'Sullivan ( Irish : Dónal Ó Súilleabháin ) ( born 1940 in Killarney , County Kerry ) is a former Irish sportsperson .
Dr. Edward Kopówka ( born 12 October 1963 ) is a Polish writer and professional historian , graduate of the Faculty of History at the Podlasie Academy in Siedlce , political and social activist known for his active participation in the democratic process beginning with the so - called Second circulation publishing of delegalized books under the Communist rule .
William Henry Oliphant Smeaton ( 24 October 1856 -- 31 March 1914 ) , sometimes using the pen name Oliphant Smeaton , was a Scottish writer , journalist , editor , historian and educator .
Ioannis Velissariou ( Greek : Ιωάννης Βελισσαρίου , 26 November 1861 -- 13 July 1913 ) was a Greek Army officer and hero of the Balkan Wars .
Bård Jørgen Elden ( born 17 June 1968 ) is a former Norwegian nordic combined skier who competed from 1987 to 1997 .
Fredrik Fors ( born 1973 , Borlänge ) is a Swedish , classical music clarinetist .
Wen Shaoxian ( Chinese : 溫紹賢 ) , born 4 December 1934 ) also known as Wan Siu Yin is a literary writer , famous for his short stories about the lives of the new immigrants from the mainland in Hong Kong .
Josh Kumra ( born 19 April 1991 ) is a British singer - songwriter , signed to Sony RCA .
Kangana Ranaut ( pronounced ( kəŋɡənaː raːɳoːʈʰ ) ; born 23 March 1987 ) is an Indian film actress .
Carla Gravina ( born 5 August 1941 ) is an Italian actress and politician .
Jules - Charles Le Bozec ( 1898 - -1973 ) was a French sculptor , whose work reflects a commitment to the local design traditions of his native province of Brittany .
Richard Veryard ( born 1955 ) is a British computer scientist , author and business consultant , known for his work on service - oriented architecture and the service - based business .
Brian Joseph Davis ( born 1975 ) is a Canadian writer and media artist .
Justus Danckerts ( 11 November 1635 in Amsterdam -- 16 July 1701 in Amsterdam ) was a Dutch engraver who worked his entire life at Amsterdam .
Michael Bisping ( born 28 February 1979 ) is an English mixed martial artist who competes in the middleweight division of the Ultimate Fighting Championship ( UFC ) .
Daniel Sales ( 1958 - -2005 ) , usually credited as Dan Sales , was an American film producer .
Bob Loughman , born 8 March 1961 , is a ni - Vanuatu politician .
Mihail Formuzal ( in Gagauz : Mihail Formuzal , in Russian : Михаил Формузал ; born 7 November 1959 , in Beșghioz ) is a Moldovan politician of Gagauz ethnicity , who was Governor ( Başkan ) of the Autonomous Territorial Unit of Gagauzia ( Gagauz Yeri ) from December 2006 to March 2015 .
Richard Martino ( born 1961 ) is a member of the New York Gambino crime family who was involved in Internet and phone scams that cost consumers $ 750 million .
Andrew Diamond ( born 1969 , Stanford , California ) is an American reggae artist and music producer .
Bruno Giglio de Oliveira ( born 20 August 1985 in São Vicente ) , commonly known as Oliveira , is a Brazilian central defender who plays for Treze Futebol Clube .
Erik Parker ( born 1968 ) is a New York - based artist .
George Herbert Walker IV ( born April 1969 ) is the chairman and CEO of Neuberger Berman , one of the largest private , independent , employee - controlled investment management firms .
Euphemia of Greater Poland ( Polish : Eufemia Odonicówna ) ( c. 1230 -- 15 February after 1281 ) , was a Polish princess member of the House of Piast from the Greater Poland branch and by marriage was Duchess of Kalisz , Wieluń and Opole - Racibórz .
Stephen Grant Serpell ( born 4 February 1944 ) was a member of several bands during the 1960s and 1970s , including Affinity and Sailor .
Mark Furze ( born 7 May 1986 ) is an Australian actor and singer who is best known for his role as Eric `` Ric '' Dalby on the popular Australian soap opera Home and Away .
James Stephens Bulloch ( 1793 -- February 18 , 1849 ) was an early Georgia settler and planter .
Colin Eales ( born 3 July 1944 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with Geelong in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) .
C. K. Nandan ( born 14 October 1963 ) is an Indian cricket umpire and former player .
Judith Margaret Bailey ( born 18 July 1941 ) is an English clarinetist , composer and conductor .
Mohd Zulkifli Affendi Mohd Zakri ( born on 14 July 1982 ) is a Malaysian football player .
Monsignor Raphaël Bayan ( 28 February 1914 -- 21 September 1999 ) was Armenian Catholic Bishop Emeritus of Iskandariya of the Armenians ( Egypt ) .
Margaret Smith Polson ( née Murray ; Paisley 20 July 1865 -- 27 January 1927 Montreal ) , who after her marriage often signed herself Margaret Polson Murray , was a Canadian social reformer , magazine editor , and founder of the Imperial Order Daughters of the Empire .
Jobe Murphy ( born 16 October 1992 in Huddersfield , England ) is an Irish rugby league footballer who plays for Dewsbury Rams .
Andrew Norman ( born 27 June 1980 ) is a former English professional snooker player from Bristol .
Sachith Shanaka Pathirana , or commonly Sachith Pathirana ( born 21 March 1989 ) , is a professional Sri Lankan cricketer , who plays One Day Internationals , First class , List A and Twenty20 matches .
Kristoffer Weckström ( born 26 May 1983 ) is a Finnish footballer who has played for IFK Uppsala , a Swedish amateur club .
Nika Kvekveskiri ( Georgian : ნიკა კვეკვესკირი ; born 29 May 1992 ) is a Georgian footballer who currently plays as a midfielder for Inter Baku .
Lauma Grīva ( born 27 October 1984 ) is a Latvian athlete , competing in the long jump .
Emma Rice ( Born 1967 ) is an actor , director , and theatre professional who currently serves as the artistic director of Shakespeare 's Globe in London , England .
Péter Tereánszki - Tóth ( born 12 December 1980 ) is a former Hungarian football player who played the majority of his career in Hungarian , and Austrian leagues .
Lady Nina Bracewell - Smith ( born 14 November 1955 ) is an Indian - born , businesswoman who has since March 2013 been based in Monaco .
Lam Tai - fai , SBS , JP ( Chinese : 林大輝 , born 1959 ) is a member of the Legislative Council of Hong Kong ( Functional constituency , Industrial ( Second ) ) .
Yoh Iwasa ( born 1952 ) is a Japanese Mathematical Biologist who is considered the leading mathematical biologist in Japan .
Kadene Vassell ( born 29 January 1989 ) is a Jamaican born Dutch athlete , who competes in the sprint with personal best times of 11.67 seconds at the 100 m and 23.49 seconds at the 200 m event .
Louisa Watson Peat , born Louisa Watson Small , ( 1883 - -1953 ) was an Irish - born writer and lecturer .
Beate Sturm ( 1951 - ? ) was briefly a member of the Baader - Meinhof gang between 1970 and 1971 .
Leslie Charlotte Benenson , R.E. ( born 13 January 1941 , London ) is an English artist who works in a variety of different mediums including sculpture , oils , watercolours , ceramics and calligraphy .
Daisurami Bonne Rousseau ( born 9 March 1988 ) is a Cuban track and field sprint athlete who specialises in the 400 metres .
Rahman Rezaei ( Persian : رحمان رضايی ‎‎ , born 20 February 1975 in Noor ) is an Iranian retired football player and coach .
Yisrael Borochov ( born in Tel Aviv in 1950 ) , is an Israeli musician , composer , and arranger .
Sig Arno ( 27 December 1895 -- 17 August 1975 ) was a German - Jewish film actor who appeared in such films as Pardon My Sarong and The Mummy 's Hand .
Janko Kos ( born 9 March 1931 ) is a Slovenian literary historian , theoretician , and critic .
Stefan Schmidt ( born 7 November 1975 ) is a Danish professional footballer who most is playing for Brønshøj Boldklub in the Danish 1st Division .
Solomon Wilbur Denton , Sr . ( 1816 - -1864 ) was an early member of the Latter Day Saint movement .
Hayat Ahmed Mohammed ( born 1982 ) is an Ethiopian model and beauty queen Her name in Arabic means `` life . ''
Marie - Thérèse Colimon - Hall ( née Colimon , 1918 - -1997 ) , was a Haitian writer .
Rene Daalder ( born René Daalder in 1944 on Texel , North Holland , sometimes credited as Renee Daalder ) is a Dutch writer and director .
Vimala Devi is the pseudonym of Teresa da Piedade de Baptista Almeida ( b. 1932 ) , a Goan writer , poet and translator .
Dean Laidley ( born 27 March 1967 ) is an Australian rules football assistant coach and former player , who played for the West Coast Eagles and North Melbourne in the Australian Football League ( AFL ) from 1987 to 1997 , including in North Melbourne 's 1996 premiership side .
Alessandro Venezia ( born 17 August 1989 ) is an Italian professional footballer who can play in various positions in the midfield , both attacking and defensive .
Marc Zellweger ( born 17 October 1973 ) is a Swiss former football defender and current coach .
Genevieve Morris ( born 1967 ) is an Australian actress best known for appearing on the popular comedy series Comedy Inc. She has also appeared in Blue Heelers and the detective series City Homicide as pathologist , Rhonda Lafferty .
Johannes Kaleschke ( born 1977 ) is a German classical tenor in opera and in concert .
Blessed Simon of Cascia ( or Simeone Fidati ) ( c. 1295 - -1348 ) was an ascetic and preacher from Cascia , Italy .
Clarissa Munger Badger ( 1806 - -1889 ) was a mid 19th century American botanical illustrator best known for several volumes of flower paintings , some accompanied by poetry .
Chief Bernard Ominayak was born in 1950 at Lubicon Lake and is the Chief of the Lubicon Lake Indian Nation .
Adam Wishart ( born 1969 ) is an award - winning documentary filmmaker .
Finlay MacRae ( born 1986 ) is a shinty player from Kintail who plays for Kinlochshiel .
Laurent Beauvais ( born 24 June 1952 ) is a French politician and the incumbent President of the Regional Council of Basse - Normandie .
Patrick Hokonya ( born 19 December 1972 ) is a Zimbabwean soccer administrator .
Hu Nai - yuan ( Chinese : 胡乃元 ; pinyin : Hú Nǎiyuán ; Pe̍h - ōe - jī : Hô͘ Nái - gôan , born 1961 at Tainan , Taiwan ) is a Taiwanese violinist .
Fra ' Juan de Homedes y Coscon ( c. 1477 -- 1553 ) was a Spanish Hospitaller .
Sundaram Perumal Rajadurai ( born 26 March 1967 ) is a Sri Lankan attorney - at - law , politician and former Member of Parliament .
Bothwell Browne ( born Walter Bothwell Bruhn ; 1877 - 1947 ) was a Danish - American stage and film performer , best known as a female impersonator .
Flavia Fortunato ( born 16 March 1964 ) is an Italian singer , actress and television presenter .
Mohamed Badawi ( born 1965 in Omdurman ) is a Sudanese linguist and publisher , singer and composer , as well as founder of the `` Sudan Education Project '' .
Tony Clarkin ( born Anthony Michael Clarkin , 24 November 1946 ) is an English musician , best known as the guitarist of the rock band Magnum .
Nick Wallace ( born 1972 in Yeovil ) is a novelist and short story writer based in Tunbridge Wells , best known for his work in Doctor Who spin - offs .
Rory Elrick ( born 23 February 1995 ) is Scottish actor best known for starring as the title character Fletcher Moon in the BBC television series Half Moon Investigations based on the best - selling novel by Eoin Colfer .
Henri O'Kelly ( full name : Joseph Pierre Henri O'Kelly ) ( 23 June 1859 -- 15 March 1938 ) was a Franco - Irish composer , pianist , organist and choir director , based in Paris .
Roberto Cavalli ( Italian pronunciation : ( roˈbɛrto kaˈvalli ) ) ( born 15 November 1940 ) is an Italian fashion designer .
Brian H. Rowe ( 1931 -- February 22 , 2007 ) was a British - born American engineer , chief executive officer of General Electric Aviation , a member of the National Academy of Engineering , a fellow of the Royal Aeronautical Society and a fellow of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics .
John Youngs ( about 1598 in Reydon , England - February 24 , 1672 Southold , New York ) was a Puritan minister who founded Southold , New York .
Mani Hussaini ( Persian : مانی حسینی‎‎ ; born 25 October 1987 ) is a Norwegian politician who is the leader of the Workers ' Youth League ( AUF ) since October 2014 .
Stefanos Kragiopoulos ( Greek : Στέφανος Κραγιόπουλος ; born 31 January 1990 ) is a Greek footballer who plays for Iraklis Ambelokipi in the Greek Football League 2 as a centre back .
Alec Coppen ( born 29 January 1923 in London , England ) is a British psychiatrist .
David Roos ( born 29 May 1982 in Queenstown , RSA ) is a Paralympian athlete from South Africa competing mainly in category F46 sprints , long and high jump events .
Petter Myhre ( born 21 February 1972 ) is a retired Norwegian footballer and current coach and commentator .
Luke Simpkin ( born 5 May 1979 in Derby ) is a British light heavyweight boxer based in Swadlincote , Derbyshire , England .
Hadley Kay ( born February 22 , 1973 ) is a Canadian - born voice actor who appeared in the first two Care Bears movies : as the voice of magician Nicholas in The Care Bears Movie and as the villain Dark Heart in Care Bears Movie II :
Albert Jenkinson ( birth registered January→March 1884 -- date of death unknown ) birth registered in Hunslet , was an English professional rugby league footballer of the 1910s .
Wataru Hashimoto ( 橋本 和 , born 14 September 1986 in Takatsuki , Shiga ) is a Japanese football player .
John Elderfield ( born 25 April 1943 ) was Chief Curator of Painting and Sculpture at the Museum of Modern Art , New York , from 2003 to 2008 .
Jim Torrey ( born 1940 ) is a politician in the U.S. state of Oregon .
Giuseppe Sturani ( 1855 -- January 17 , 1940 ) was an Italian conductor who was known for his work in the field of opera .
Abdulaziz Fadhil ( also Abdulaziz Fadel ) ( born 22 August 1979 ) He is a Kuwaiti football centre - back .
Carsten Klee ( born 15 September 1970 ) is a former German footballer .
