David A. Kolb ( born 1939 ) is an American educational theorist whose interests and publications focus on experiential learning , the individual and social change , career development , and executive and professional education .
Libby Titus ( born Elizabeth Jurist , 6 July 1947 ) is an American singer , songwriter , actor , and concert producer .
Claus Christian Gulmann ( born 1942 ) is a Danish judge , Advocate General and Judge at the European Court of Justice .
Ebenezer Landells ( Newcastle 1808 -- 1 October 1860 London ) was an English wood - engraver , illustrator , and magazine proprietor .
Anthony Chemut ( born 17 December 1992 ) is a Kenyan middle distance runner that specialises in the 800 metres .
Nathaniel Gubbins ( 1893 - -1976 ) , born Norman Gubbins , was a British journalist and humourist .
Sharin Anderson ( born 26 October 1959 ) is an Australian singer , guitarist , songwriter , and artist from the outer northern suburbs of Melbourne .
Levy Matebo Omari ( born 3 November 1989 ) is a Kenyan long - distance runner who competes mainly in marathon races .
Lucy van Dael ( born in 1946 ) is a Dutch baroque violinist and member of the faculty of the Amsterdam Conservatory .
Asha Philip ( born 25 October 1990 ) is an English sprinter and former junior gymnast specialising in mini - trampoline .
Edward Fella ( born 1938 ) is an American graphic designer , artist and educator .
Flávio Alex Valêncio ( better known just as Flavinho ; born 27 July 1983 ) is a Brazilian professional footballer who plays for CRB in the Série B. He formerly played for the Brazilian club Grêmio Barueri in the Campeonato Paulista and the Campeonato Brasileiro Série A and Neftchi Baku in the Azerbaijan Premier League
Massimo Barbolini ( born 29 August 1964 ) is an Italian volleyball coach .
George Tuka or Heorhiy / Georgiy Tuka ( Ukrainian : Георгій Борисович Тука ; born 24 November 1963 ) is a Ukrainian politician and activist .
Gina Ford ( born c. 1960 ) is the bestselling author of childcare books in the United Kingdom and a former maternity nurse who has cared for over 300 babies during her career .
Oliver Koenig ( born 31 January 1981 ) is a German sprinter and long jumper .
Cristina Sandu ( born 4 March 1990 ) is a Romanian athlete who competes in the long jump and the triple jump .
Jonathan Michie ( born 25 March 1957 , London , England ) is a British economist and holds the joint post of Director of the Department for Continuing Education , and President of Kellogg College , University of Oxford , where he is Professor of Innovation & Knowledge Exchange .
Kristof Vandewalle ( born 5 April 1985 ) is a professional Belgian road cyclist , who rides with Trek--
Herbert Noel Hollingdale ( 1911 - 2000 ) was a rugby league player in the New South Wales Rugby League competition .
Mehmet Bekaroğlu ( born in 1954 ) is a Turkish human rights activist , a scientist , professor , a psychiatrist , a writer , and a politician of Laz origin .
Spinvis is a Dutch one - man project centred on Erik de Jong ( born 2 February 1961 , Spijkenisse ) .
Bruce Ashmore ( born c. 1959 in Cambridge , England ) is a race car designer who designed and developed 11 championship winning IndyCars with two different race car manufacturers , first with Lola Cars and then with Reynard Motorsports .
Paul Esposti ( born 1 November 1972 ) is a Welsh racing cyclist , from Cardiff , Wales .
Angelos Roufos ( Greek : Άγγελος Ρούφος , born 1852 ) was a Greek politician from Achaea .
Vincenzo Spampinato ( born in 1953 ) is an Italian pop - rock singer - songwriter , composer and lyricist .
Ergün Poyraz ( born 31 January 1963 ) is a best - selling and prolific Turkish author known for his controversial books about the ruling Justice and Development Party , the Islamic preacher Fethullah Gülen , and people associated with them .
Souren Bose ( born 25 June 1924 ) was one of the leading figures in the Naxalite movement in India .
James Basire ( 1730 - -1802 ) , also known as James Basire Sr . , was an English engraver .
Mark Hales ( born 7 November 1950 ) is a British auto racing driver and instructor .
James Russell McCoy ( 4 September 1845 -- 14 February 1924 ) served as Magistrate of the British Overseas Territory of Pitcairn Island 7 times , between 1870 and 1904 .
Lieven De Cauter ( Koolskamp , 1959 ) is a Belgian philosopher , art historian , writer , and activist based in Brussels .
Genovaitė Ramoškienė ( née Šidagytė on 12 May 1945 ) is a retired Lithuanian rower .
Frederick Graham ( born 29 November 1964 ) , who writes under the name Cork Graham , is an American author of political thriller novels and adventure memoirs .
Colin Prockter ( born 4 June 1946 ) is an actor and TV writer who has appeared on many TV series and films since the 1960s .
Harshad Arora ( born 3 September 1987 ) is an Indian model and television actor .
Jacob Weitering ( born 23 November 1997 ) is an Australian rules footballer playing for the Carlton Football Club in the Australian Football League ( AFL ) .
Levan Tediashvili ( Georgian : ლევან თედიაშვილი ; born 15 March 1948 in Gegmoubani , Georgian SSR ) is a former Soviet ( Georgian ) wrestler and Olympic champion in Freestyle wrestling in 1972 and 1976 .
Suhaimi Yusof ( born 1969 ) is a Singaporean actor , comedian , entertainer and radio personality , known for playing exaggerated Malay stereotype characters and for his spontaneity .
Darko Damjanovski ( Macedonian : Дарко Дамјановски , born 15 July 1981 ) is a Macedonian biathlete and cross - country skier who has competed since 1999 and 2005 , respectively .
Lake Sagaris ( born 1956 in Montreal ) is a Canadian journalist , poet and translator who lives in Chile .
Richard Sinnott ( born 5 June 1963 ) is a professional actor , writer and director based in Manchester .
Ike Landvoigt ( born 19 September 1973 ) is a retired German rower who won a gold and a silver medal in the eights at the world championships of 1995 and 1998 , respectively .
Denho Acar ( born 1974 in Midyat ) , also known as Dano and Djingis Khan , is a Turkish mobster of Assyrian / Syriac descent and founder of the Swedish crime syndicate Original Gangsters .
Sally Ellis ( born 17 May 1958 ) is an English long - distance road and cross - country runner .
Eliza Berkeley ( née Frinsham ; 1734 - -1800 ) was an English author .
Leon Mestel ( born 5 August 1927 ) is a British astronomer and astrophysicist and Emeritus Professor at the University of Sussex .
JD Miller ( born 1953 ) is a contemporary painter known for his 3-D technique of oil paint application .
Geoff Garin ( born 1953 ) is an American pollster , who served as co - chief strategist for the latter part of Senator Hillary Clinton 's 2008 Presidential campaign .
Mary Louise Coulouris ( 17 July 1939 -- 20 December 2011 ) was an American - British artist .
Manuela Ósk Harðardóttir ( born 29 August 1983 ) is an Icelandic beauty queen and a model .
Andy Frain ( born 2 November 1959 ) is an animation producer and the founder & managing director of Touchwood Animation Ltd.
Peter Sjögren ( born in 1983 ) is a Swedish floorball player ( goalkeeper ) who is ranked as the best goalie in the world .
Ginevra Sforza ( 1440 -- 16 May 1507 ) was the wife and counselor of Giovanni II Bentivoglio , lord of Bologna .
Diana Mary Villiers Negroponte ( born 1947 ) is an English - born American trade lawyer and adjunct professor of law at Fordham University whose professional name is Diana Villiers Negroponte .
Mabel Beardsley ( 24 August 1871 - 8 May 1916 ) was an English Victorian actress , and elder sister of the famous illustrator , Aubrey Beardsley , who according to her brother 's biographer , `` achieved mild notoriety for her exotic and flamboyant appearance '' .
James Cromar Watt ( 14 July 1862 -- 19 November 1940 ) was a Scottish artist , architect and jeweller .
Xu Jiayu ( born 19 August 1995 ) is a Chinese competitive swimmer , swimming backstroke .
Christopher Phiri ( born 26 May 1975 ) is a Zimbabwean former List A cricketer .
Lynn Colliar ( born 22 November 1967 in St. Andrews ) is a Canadian television anchor .
Omar Ali - Shah ( Hindi : ओमर अली शाह , Urdu : عمر علی شاہ‎ ; 1922 -- 7 September 2005 ) was a prominent exponent of modern Naqshbandi Sufism who lived from 1922 to 2005 .
Chris DeWolfe ( born 1966 ) is an American entrepreneur , and one of the creators of Myspace ( along with Tom Anderson ) , of which he is also the former CEO .
Paul Krewer ( 10 June 1906 -- 2000 ) was a German professional cyclist who won two silver and one bronze medals at the UCI Motor - paced World Championships in 1927 , 1929 and 1934 .
Johnson Lee ( Chinese : 李思捷 , born 11 April 1974 ) is a Hong Kong TVB actor and celebrity impersonator .
Anthony Robin Ellis ( born 8 January 1942 ) is an English actor best known for his role as Captain Ross Poldark in 29 episodes of the BBC classic series Poldark , adapted from a series of books by the late British author Winston Graham .
Marcin Ciesielski ( born 12 August 1976 in Inowrocław ) is a Polish footballer ( goalkeeper ) who plays for Goplania Inowrocław .
The Ven John Ryves ( 1593- 1665 ) was Archdeacon of Berkshire from 1634 until his death .
Gyula Kádár ( 16 December 1898 - 14 March 1982 ) was a Hungarian military officer who was the head of the Hungarian military intelligence from August 1943 until the occupation of Hungary by Nazi German forces during World War II . From 1912 to 1916 he studied at the Royal Hungarian Military High School , in Sopron .
Warrick Brownlow - Pike ( born 28 January 1985 ) is a British puppeteer .
Vivian Adelberg Rudow ( born 1936 ) is an American composer , performance artist , conductor and concert producer .
Radovan Fuchs ( born 5 September 1953 ) is a Croatian scientist and former Minister of Science , Education and Sport .
Eilert Waldemar Preben Ramm ( 4 May 1769 -- 15 March 1837 ) was a Norwegian military officer and representative at the Norwegian Constitutional Assembly in 1814 .
Sushila Chanu Pukhrambam ( born 25 February 1992 ) is an Indian field hockey player and is the current captain of Indian women 's junior field hockey team .
Arvid E. Gillstrom ( 13 August 1889 -- 21 May 1935 ) , was a Swedish film director and screenwriter .
Nicklas Nygren ( born 6 January 1983 ) , better known by the handle `` Nifflas '' , is a Swedish video game developer .
William Earl Lynd ( January 1955 -- May 6 , 2008 in Jackson , Georgia ) was an American murderer .
Bryan Kneale RA ( born 19 June 1930 ) is a Manx artist and sculptor , described by BBC News Online as `` one of the Isle of Man 's best known artists . ''
Rino Della Negra ( 18 August 1923 -- 21 February 1944 ) was a French footballer who was active in the Resistance during World War Two .
Dirar Abu Seesi or Abu Sisi ( Arabic : ضرار أبو سيسي‎ ; born in 1969 in Jordan ) was a Deputy Engineer for the Gaza Strip 's sole electrical plant , which provides 25 % of Gaza 's power , Israel alleges that he is a Hamas weapons engineer .
Bernard Caleo ( born Melbourne , 20 May 1968 ) is a Melbourne - based Australia comic artist , comic book editor , performer , and presenter .
Henning Stensrud ( born 20 August 1977 ) is a Norwegian former ski jumper who debuted with the Norwegian World Cup team in 1996 .
Daniel Fitter ( born in Worcestershire , England , 1628 ; died at St. Thomas ' Priory , near Stafford , 6 Feb. , 1700 ) was an English Catholic clergyman who was affected by but managed to navigate his way through the religious strife of the late seventeenth century .
Robert Lelangue ( born 4 February 1940 ) is a retired Belgian cyclist who was active between 1958 and 1969 .
Adityawarman was born around 1294 - -1310 in Trowulan , East Java , the capital of the kingdom of Majapahit , as recorded in the poem of Pararaton .
Gonzalo Aguirre Ramírez ( born 1940 ) is a Uruguayan politician , lawyer and newspaper columnist .
David Montejano ( born 1948 ) is an American sociologist and historian .
Jessica Hammond ( born 28 November 1994 ) is an Irish singer songwriter .
Mick Schumacher ( German pronunciation : ( ˈmɪk ˈʃuːmaxɐ ) ; born 22 March 1999 ) is a German racing driver .
Nemanja Tubić ( Serbian Cyrillic : Немања Тубић ; born 8 April 1984 ) is a Serbian professional footballer who is currently playing for Haugesund .
Doug Ralph ( 10 July 1948 -- 24 February 2015 ) was an Australian historian , environmentalist and activist .
Michael McCrudden ( born 31 July 1991 ) is a footballer from Northern Ireland , who currently plays for Institute .
Bruce Beresford ( born 16 August 1940 ) is an Australian film director who has made more than 30 feature films over a 50-year career .
Elena Miramova ( pronounced Yell - AH - na Mee - RAH - mova ; 27 May 1901 -- 8 July 1992 ) was a Russian - born actress and playwright .
George Wheatcroft ( 25 December 1799 -- 17 August 1860 ) was an English cricketer with possibly amateur status who was active from 1831 to 1844 .
Sir Thomas William Shakespeare , 3rd Baronet ( born 11 May 1966 ) , better known as Tom Shakespeare , is an English sociologist and broadcaster .
Jamil Sahid Mohamed Khalil ( born 1936 in Freetown , Sierra Leone ) was a Lebanese - Sierra Leonean businessman and diamond tycoon who made millions of dollars in the diamond trade , fisheries , tourism and an airline .
Tracey Richardson ( born on 26 October 1982 , Hornchurch , Essex , England ) is a British diver .
Martin McNamara ( born 11 November 1966 ) is a famous Gaelic footballer from Corofin , County Galway .
Hosbet Suresh ( born 20 July 1929 ) is a former judge of the Bombay High Court who has led a number of commissions that investigated violations of human rights .
Noman Çelebicihan ( Numan Çelebi Cihan ) ( 1885 - -1918 ) was a Crimean Tatar politician , lawyer , Mufti of Crimean Muslims , and writer .
Professor Henrik Verder ( born 1942 ) is a pediatrician and the inventor of the INSURE ( Intubation Surfactant Extubation ) method combined with nasal CPAP ( Continuous Positive Airway Pressure ) .
Sun Xianhong was born in Inner Mongolia in 1962 , and received his bachelor 's degree from Shanxi Mining College in July 1985 .
Erhan Kartal ( born 1 March 1993 ) is a Turkish footballer who plays as a right - back for Şanlıurfaspor .
Air Chief Marshal Sir David Harcourt - Smith GBE , KCB , DFC ( born 14 October 1931 ) is a former Royal Air Force officer who became Air Officer Commanding - in - Chief at RAF Support Command .
Michael Schjønberg Christensen ( born 19 January 1967 ) is a Danish Association football manager , club official , and former player , is currently a manager without a job .
Pik - Sen Lim ( Chinese : 林碧笙 , born 15 September 1944 ) is a Malaysian - Chinese - British actress who has appeared on British television since the 1960s .
Mary Angeline Teresa McCrory , O.Carm . , ( 21 January 1893 -- 21 January 1984 ) , was an Ulster - born immigrant to the United States .
John Gordon Purvis Jr. ( born 1942 ) is man who spent nine years in prison for a murder he did not commit .
Azerin ( Azerbaijani : Azərin ) ( born 9 May 1971 , Baku ) is an Azerbaijani singer and senior lieutenant .
Jeremy Summers ( born 1931 in St Albans ) is a retired British television director and film director , best known for his directorship of ITC productions in the 1960s and 1970s , most notably The Saint .
Geoff Holder was born in Cardiff , Wales in 1958 , and grew up within the city , before later relocating to Perthshire .
Len Gaynor ( born 1944 ) is an Irish retired hurler who played as a left wing - back for the Tipperary senior hurling team .
Basant Kumar Birla ( born 4 February 1921 ) is an Indian businessman of the Birla family .
Kolbjørn Fjeld ( 4 June 1901 -- 4 May 1978 ) was a Norwegian librarian and publisher .
Amanda Douge ( born December 1976 ) is an Australian actress , best known from a range of television and feature film roles .
Pesamino Taputai ( born 20 March 1949 ) was the president of the Territorial Assembly of Wallis and Futuna , a French territory in the Pacific Ocean , from April 11 to December 11 , 2007 .
Janko Tumbasević ( Cyrillic : Jaнкo Tумбaceвић ; born 14 January 1985 ) is a Montenegrin football player who plays for Spartak Subotica .
Tanios El Khoury ( born on 4 May 1930 in Saghbine , Lebanon ) is an emeritus eparch of the Maronite Catholic Eparchy of Sidon .
Zeba Kohli ( born 19 February 1966 ) is an Indian chocolatier , philanthropist and entrepreneur .
Fred Begay ( July 2 , 1932 - April 30 , 2013 ) , also Fred Young or Clever Fox , was a Navajo / Ute nuclear physicist .
Mons Lid ( 8 April 1896 -- 3 March 1967 ) was Norwegian Minister of Finance in 1955 - 1956 .
Iain Fairley ( born 29 August 1973 ) is a rugby union player who made three appearances for the Scotland national rugby union team .
Charles Enderby ( 1798 - -1876 ) was one of three sons of Samuel Enderby Junior ( 1756 - 1829 ) .
Terry Sylvester ( born 8 January 1947 ) was the English guitarist / singer with The Escorts , The Swinging Blue Jeans ( 1966 - -69 ) and The Hollies .
Odhavram ( 1889 - -1957 ) was an Indian religious teacher and a follower of Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi .
Peter Verhelst ( 28 January 1962 ) is a Belgian Flemish novelist , poet and dramatist .
Mustafa Cüneyd Düzyol ( born 1964 ) is a Turkish academic and civil servant who served as the Minister of Development in the interim election government led by Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoğlu between 22 September and 17 November 2015 .
Jalmari Helander ( born 21 July 1976 , Helsinki ) is a Finnish screenwriter and film director .
John Lewis Phipps ( 1801 - -1870 ) , of Leighton House , Westbury , Wiltshire , was a Brazil merchant , briefly Conservative MP for Westbury ( 1868 ) and High Sheriff of Wiltshire ( 1864 ) .
Dag Coward ( 1910 - -2000 ) was a Norwegian Economist who served as the fourth rector of the Norwegian School of Economics ( NHH ) from 1964 - 1972 .
Thomas Harpur ( born 16 May 1944 in Sion Mills , County Tyrone , Northern Ireland ) is an Irish former cricketer .
Daron Joffe ( born 1975 ) is a U.S. agribusiness and nonprofit executive who is prominent in the organic farming and biodynamic agriculture movements .
Neil R. Grabois ( born 1935 ) is a mathematician and a former university administrator .
James Morone ( born 1951 ) is an American political scientist and author , noted for his work on health politics and policy and on popular participation and morality in American politics and political development .
Arnold Šimonek ( born 19 September 1990 ) is a Slovak football striker who plays for FK Poprad in the DOXXbet liga .
Nalin Pekgul ( née Baksi ) ( born 1967 ) is a Swedish Social Democratic politician .
Josef Obajdin ( born on 7 November 1970 in Poděbrady ) is a former Czech footballer striker .
Les O'Neill ( born 4 December 1943 ) is an English former professional football player and manager .
Adam of Fulda ( ca . 1445 -- 1505 ) was a German musical author of the second half of the 15th century .
Daniel London ( born 1973 ) is an American actor , best known for his roles in Patch Adams and Rent .
Robert Lacey ( born 3 January 1944 ) is a British historian and biographer .
Pamela Soprani ( born 1987 ) is a Chilean model and a beauty pageant contestant .
Keith Rossiter ( born 16 January 1984 in Oulart , County Wexford ) is an Irish sportsman .
Nella Last ( née Nellie Lord ; 4 October 1889 -- 22 June 1968 ) was a housewife who lived in Barrow - in - Furness , Lancashire , England .
Aaron Shurin ( born 1947 ) is an American poet , essayist , and educator .
Joanna P. Adler ( born 1964 ) is an American actress , known for her roles in Off - Broadway plays .
Paul Chantler ( born 12 October 1959 ) is a radio programming consultant based in the United Kingdom .
Enzo Prono ( born 27 June 1991 ) is a Paraguayan footballer who plays for Mexican club Atlante , as a striker .
Sallie Ann Glassman ( born 1954 ) is an American practitioner of Haitian Vodou , a writer , and an artist .
Milla Saari ( née Jauho ; born 10 July 1975 ) is a Finnish former cross country skier who competed from 1994 to 2007 .
Keti Papanika ( Greek : Καίτη Παπανίκα ; born 1942 ) , aka Ketty Papanika or Kaiti Papanika , is a Greek actress .
Louis Lasagna ( 22 Feb 1923 - 6 Aug 2003 ) was an American physician and professor of medicine , known for his revision of the Hippocratic Oath .
William Clere Leonard Brendan Parsons , 7th Earl of Rosse ( known as Brendan ; born 21 October 1936 ) , is an Irish peer .
Moses Leavitt ( 1650 - -1730 ) was an early settler of Exeter , New Hampshire , where he worked as a surveyor .
Dmitri Dovgalenok ( Sometimes listed as Dmitry Dovgalenok , born 14 December 1971 ) , is a Soviet - born Belarusian sprint canoer who competed from the early 1990s to the early 2000s ( decade ) .
Arun Maira ( born 15 August 1943 ) is a management consultant and former member of Planning Commission of India .
Gennaro Tutino ( born 20 August 1996 ) is an Italian footballer who plays for Serie B side Bari on loan from Napoli and also represents the Italian U-18 national team .
Christine Cicot ( born 1964 ) is a French judoka , Olympic medalist and world champion .
Martin Plowman ( born 3 October 1987 ) is a British professional racing driver from Tamworth currently competing in the FIA World Endurance Championship for OAK Racing .
Cathy J. Cohen ( born 1962 ) is an American author , feminist and social activist whose work has focused on the African - American experience in politics from a perspective which is underlined by intersectionality .
Michael Davis ( born 1945 ) , best known as Bugsy McGraw , is a retired American professional wrestler .
Bill Mayman ( 1 May 1887 -- 20 April 1970 ) was a former Australian rules footballer who played with Sturt in the South Australian Football League ( SAFL ) .
Wanderley Paiva Monteiro ( born 7 April 1946 ) , commonly known as Wanderley Paiva or as Vanderlei Paiva , is a Brazilian professional football coach and former player .
Svetlana Guskova ( born 19 August 1957 ) is a Moldovan runner who competed for the Soviet Union .
Cankurd , ( born 1948 in Maydan ) , is a contemporary Kurdish poet and writer .
Cornelis Gerard Anton de Kom ( 22 February 1898 -- 24 April 1945 ) was a Surinamese resistance fighter and anti - colonialist author .
Wouter Sybrandy ( born 20 February 1985 ) is a Dutch professional road racing cyclist who currently rides for the Nuun - Sigma Sport - London team .
DeBarra Mayo ( born 1953 , Omaha , Nebraska ) is an American health and fitness advocate , writer and media personality .
Walter Sykes George CBE , FRIBA , ARCA , FIIA , FIFA ( 1881 - -1962 ) was an English architect active in India during the first half of the 20th century , most known for being part of the team of architects who designed New Delhi , the new capital of India , from 1911 - 1931 .
Iyad Ag Ghaly was born in 1954 , into a noble family of the Ifogha tribal group ( an influential Tuareg clan in the Kidal region ) .
Kim Yusob ( born 1959 in Gwangju ) is a South Korean artist who lives and works in Berlin , Germany and Seoul , South Korea .
Lars Knutzon ( born 1 October 1941 ) is a Danish actor and director , best known to international audiences for his role in the Danish TV drama Borgen .
Séamus Bannon ( born 1927 ) is an Irish retired sportsman .
Rachel Goswell ( born 16 May 1971 ) is an English singer - songwriter and musician who rose to prominence as vocalist and guitarist of the shoegaze band Slowdive .
Jerzy Antczak ( born 25 December 1929 in Włodzimierz Wołyński ) is a Polish film director .
Frederick Boyle ( 1841 - 1914 ) was an English author , journalist , barrister , and orchid fancier .
Bertha Frensel Wegener - Koopman ( 17 September 1874 , Bloemendaal -- 17 July 1953 , Amsterdam ) was a Dutch composer and music educator .
Jimmy Daly ( born 1905 , date of death unknown ) was an Irish football player .
Richard Royston ( 1601 , Oxford -- November 1686 ) was an English bookseller and publisher , bookseller to Charles I , Charles II and James II . Royston , the son of an Oxford tailor Richard Royston and Alice Tideman , was admitted a freeman of the Stationers ' Company in 1627 .
Michael Parkes ( born in 1944 in Sikeston , Missouri ) is an American - born artist living in Spain who is best known for work in the areas of fantasy art and magic realism .
Born in 1947 , Ajahn Candasiri was raised as a Christian in Edinburgh , Scotland .
Pilar Savone ( born June 16 , 1971 ) is a film producer and assistant director .
Sir Frederick Oscar Warren Loomis ( 1870 - -1937 ) enlisted as a private in the Canadian Militia in 1886 and served there until retiring in 1919 .
Bart Cambré ( born 1970 ) is a Belgian organizational theorist , Associate Professor of Business Research Methods and Research director at the Antwerp Management School , and consultant , known for his work on voluntary and temporary organizations .
Christopher Bono ( pronounced /ˈboʊnoʊ/ ) ( born 1979 ) is an American composer , producer , and songwriter .
Hans Henrich Hock ( born September 26 , 1938 ) is Professor Emeritus of Linguistics and Sanskrit at the University of Illinois at Urbana - Champaign .
Fred D'Ignazio ( born January 6 , 1949 in Bryn Mawr , Pennsylvania ) is an American author , educator , and television commentator .
Richard Marshal , 3rd Earl of Pembroke ( 1191 -- 16 April 1234 ) was the son of William Marshal , 1st Earl of Pembroke and brother of William Marshal , 2nd Earl of Pembroke , whom he succeeded to the Earldom of Pembroke and Lord Marshal of England upon his brother 's death on 6 April 1231 .
Behrouz Rahbar ( Persian : بهروز رهبر‎ , born 23 September 1945 ) is a Iranian former cyclist .
Percy Sutcliffe ( 1889 -- after 1923 ) was an English footballer who made 72 appearances in the Football League playing as a centre half for Darlington and Hartlepools United in the 1920s .
Rens Blom ( born 1 March 1977 ) is a Dutch athlete competing in pole vault .
Vicky Parnov ( born 24 October 1990 in Moscow , Russia ) is an Australian athlete who competes in pole vault .
John M. Puente ( born 1971 ) is a fifth generation Sacramentan currently serving as Vice Chair of the City of Sacramento 's Utilities Rate Advisory Commission .
The Honourable Hugh Hare ( 1668 -- 1707 ) was an English translator and politician .
Leroy S. Bendheim ( February 12 , 1906 -- June 18 , 1987 ) was a two - term mayor of Alexandria , Virginia and three - term Virginia state senator .
Jacques Kosciusco - Morizet ( or Kosciusko ) ( 31 January 1913 -- 15 May 1994 ) was a noted French university professor and diplomat .
John D. Zeglis ( born 1947 ) served as the President of AT&T and the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer ( CEO ) of AT&T Wireless .
Dave Ladley ( born 29 September 1975 ) is an English darts player that competes in Professional Darts Corporation events .
Emma Ihrer ( 3 January 1857 -- 8 January 1911 ) was a German feminist and trade unionist who was active in founding societies to defend the rights of women workers .
Andrew Hacker ( born 1929 ) is an American political scientist and public intellectual .
Georgios Saridakis ( Greek : Γεώργιος Σαριδάκης , born 1885 , date of death unknown ) was a Greek athlete who competed mainly in the 3000 metre walk .
Ali Rahmani ( علی رحمانی ) was born in Kashmar ( 25 May 1967 ) .
Sir William Wilde , 1st Baronet ( ca . 1611 -- 23 November 1679 ) was an English judge and politician who sat in the House of Commons in 1660 .
John McLevy ( born Dundee , Scotland , 2 January 1927 -- 27 November 2002 ) was a Scottish jazz trumpeter .
Pavlos Kontides ( Greek : Παύλος Κοντίδης , born 11 February 1990 ) is a Cypriot sailor .
Souhalia Alamou ( born 31 December 1979 ) is a retired Beninese athlete specialising in the sprinting events .
Reinardt Janse van Rensburg ( born 3 February 1989 ) is a South African professional road bicycle racer who rides for South African UCI Professional Continental team MTN - Qhubeka .
Brian L. Burgess ( born January , 1951 ) is a justice of the Vermont Supreme Court , serving on the high court since 2005 .
Barry May ( born 1 November 1944 ) is a South African - born former English cricketer who played first - class cricket for Oxford University in the early 1970s .
Shlomo Dayan ( Hebrew : שלמה דיין‎ , born 6 November 1952 ) is an Israeli rabbi and former politician .
Mogens Frey Jensen ( born 2 July 1941 ) is a retired Danish amateur cyclist who competed successfully both on the road and on track .
Obo Aba Hisanjani ( 24 November 1949 ) is a Nigerian poet .
Emma Rendel , born 1976 in Uppsala is a Swedish graphic novel author , artist and illustrator who lives and works in Stockholm .
Juan Maeso ( born in 1942 ) is a Spanish anaesthetist infected with hepatitis C who was sentenced to 1,933 years in prison for infecting hundreds of patients with the virus .
Salih Šehović ( born 22 November 1936 ) is a retired Bosnian professional footballer who spent most of his career in FK Sarajevo .
Paolo Malco ( born 10 April 1947 ) is an Italian film actor , best known for his roles in horror films , and later in many Italian TV mini - series .
John Merlo ( 1912 - August 9 , 1992 ) was an American politician , who served for seven terms as an Illinois State Representative , for three years as an Illinois state senator , as well as for two years as a Chicago City Council alderman for Chicago 's 44th Ward .
Shafiul Islam ( Bengali : শফিউল ইসলাম , born 6 October 1989 ) is a Bangladeshi cricketer .
Mary Erskine ( 1629 -- 2 June 1707 ) was a Scottish businesswoman and philanthropist , who donated money to set up the girls ' school which is now known as The Mary Erskine School and also the Trades Maiden Hospital ( now known as the Trades Maiden Fund ) .
Dame Tamsyn Imison , DBE ( b. 1 May 1937 ) was a prominent British educator and `` educational strategist '' whose first career was as a scientific illustrator .
Igor Yevgrafov ( Russian : Игорь Евграфов ; born 1955 ) is a retired Soviet swimmer who won a bronze medal in the 1500 m freestyle event at the 1974 European Aquatics Championships He also won national titles in the same event in 1973 and 1975 and set a European record in the 800 m freestyle in 1975 .
Conor O'Mahony ( born 18 October 1984 ) is an Irish hurler who played as a centre - back for the Tipperary senior team from 2005 up to 2015 .
Sir John Bourchier , 2nd Earl of Bath , PC ( 1499 in Devon -- 10 February 1560/61 ) was an Earl in the peerage of England .
Constantin Cristescu ( 2 December 1866 -- 9 May 1923 ) was a Romanian General during World War I , and Chief of Staff of the Romanian Army .
Steve J. Langdon ( b. 1948 ) is an American anthropologist noted for his work with the Tlingit people of southeastern Alaska .
Lieutenant - Colonel Francis Cecil Campbell Balfour CIE CVO CBE MC ( 8 December 1884 -- 16 April 1965 ) was a British military officer and colonial administrator .
Chris Geddes ( born 15 October 1975 ) is the keyboardist for and a founding member of the Scottish indie pop band Belle & Sebastian .
Hasan Yousefi Eshkevari ( born 1950 ) is an Iranian cleric , researcher , journalist , reformist and former political prisoner .
Edhem Bičakčić ( c. 1884 -- 31 December 1941 ) was a Bosnian politician who became the only Mayor of Sarajevo to serve two nonconsecutive terms , first from 1928 to 1929 , then again from 1935 to 1939 .
Seraina Mischol ( born 1 December 1981 ) is a Swiss skier competing in cross country skiing .
Nigel Ah Wong ( born 30 May 1990 ) is a rugby union footballer who can play either as a loose forward or as an Outside Centre .
Aldo Di Clemente ( born 1948 ) is an Italian amateur astronomer ( active 1996 - -1997 ) .
Pieter van Bleiswijk ( 1724 , Delft -- October 29 , 1790 , The Hague ) was grand pensionary of Holland from December 1 , 1772 to November 1787 .
Peter Rowley - Conwy , FSA ( born 1951 , Copenhagen , Denmark ) is an archaeologist and academic .
Mykhailo Bolotskykh ( Ukrainian : Михайло Васильович Болотських ; Russian : Михаил Васильевич Болотских ; born 28 October 1960 ) is a Ukrainian statesman and military serviceman , Colonel General ( Civil Defense Service ) .
Seamus Blake ( born 8 December 1970 ) is a Canadian tenor saxophonist .
Mahvash Shafaei ( Persian : مهوش شفاعی‎ ; born 15 May 1956 ) is an Iranian fencer .
Zhou Tiehai ( Chinese : 周铁海 ; born 1966 ) is a contemporary Chinese artist whose art work attempts to satirize much of modern Chinese art . Zhou does not paint his own works , though he earned an arts degree from the School of Fine Arts at Shanghai University in 1989 .
Katriona Mackey ( born 1992 in Cork ) is a camogie player and an accountant , winner of an All Ireland camogie medal in 2009 .
Renato Talamini ( born 19 November 1948 ) is an Italian Epidemiologist .
Derkoi is a musician from Kingston upon Hull , England real name Steve Cawood who is also an award winning filmmaker & visual effects artist , born in Kingston upon Hull on 18 February 1977 .
Leo Sewell ( born 7 September 1945 ) is an American `` found object '' artist .
Luis P. Valdivieso ( ca . 1845 - ca . 1920 ) was the Mayor of Ponce , Puerto Rico in 1905 .
Sigmund von Haimhausen ( 28 December 1708 -- 16 January 1793 ) was a Bavarian aristocrat , mining operator , head of the Bavarian Mint and Mines commission , porcelain manufacturer and first president of the Bavarian Academy of Sciences .
Esteban Siller Garza ( 17 April 1931 -- 23 October 2013 ) was a Mexican voice actor from Monterrey , Nuevo León .
Irene Dölling ( also known as Irene Mayer - Dölling ) ( born 23 December 1942 ) is a German sociologist .
Laurent Roussey ( born 27 December 1961 ) is a French former footballer , who played as a striker and current manager .
Van de León ( born 1925 ) was a Filipino actor known for his villain roles under Sampaguita Pictures where he played villain , and yet sometimes he played a father roles for some of the Sampaguita 's player .
Levi Asher ( born Marc Eliot Stein ; 18 November 1961 in Queens , New York ) is a New York - based writer , blogger and web developer responsible for Literary Kicks , one of the earliest popular literary websites and now the oldest continuously - running literary website on the Internet .
Attila Grandpierre ( born 4 July 1951 ) is a Hungarian musician , astrophysicist , physicist , self - taught historian , writer and poet .
Maja Hoffmann ( born 1956 ) is an avid Swiss art collector , art patron , documentary filmmaker , impresario , and entrepreneur .
Feng Jialiang ( Chinese : 封加梁 ; b. 1966 ) is a painter from Wuxi , Jiangsu province , China , specializing in oil painting .
Renen Schorr ( Hebrew : רנן שור‎ ; born Jerusalem , Israel , 1952 ) is a film director , screenwriter , film producer .
Harvey Withers ( born 26 October 1965 ) is a British author and military antiques dealer .
Drew Cheshire ( born 6 September 1991 ) is an English professional rugby union player who plays for Moseley .
Hisashi Yokoshima ( 横島 久、born 28 December 1957 ) is a retired Japanese racing driver .
Prommin Lertsuridej , M.D. ( Thai:พรหมินทร์ เลิศสุริย์เดช ) ( born 5 November 1954 ) was a Thai politician , former student leader , former Secretary General to Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra , former Deputy Prime Minister in charge of economic affairs , and former Minister of Energy in the Thaksin government .
Worth G. Ross ( 19 April 1854 -- 24 March 1916 ) is known as the third Commandant of the Coast Guard , although he was never formally appointed to that position .
Nikoloz Mnatobishvili ( Georgian : ნიკა მნათობიშვილი ; born 27 September 1992 ) is a Georgian footballer playing currently for FC Gagra .
Terenc Toçi was born Terenzio Tocci on 9 March 1880 in San Cosmo Albanese , Calabria , Kingdom of Italy , so he was Italian by birth .
Mark Buckley ( born 25 August 1962 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with Carlton , St Kilda and the Brisbane Bears in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) during the 1980s .
Emma Donoghue ( born 24 October 1969 ) is an Irish - Canadian playwright , literary historian , novelist , and screenwriter .
The Land of the Wandering Souls , or La terre des âmes errantes , is a 2000 French - Cambodian documentary film directed by Rithy Panh .
The Great Prince Shan is a 1924 British silent drama film directed by A.E. Coleby and featuring Sessue Hayakawa , Ivy Duke , Tsuru Aoki , Valia , David Hawthorne , Fred Raynham and Henry Vibart in important roles .
A Slipping - Down Life is a 1999 romantic drama film directed by Toni Kalem .
Chicago Cab , also known as Hellcab , is a 1997 American film directed by Mary Cybulski and John Tintori .
Breakup Buddies is a 2014 Chinese romantic comedy and road film , directed by Ning Hao .
Kirai Dada is a 1987 Telugu film drama produced by V.Doraswamy Raju on VMC Productions , directed by A. Kodandarami Reddy .
The Law They Forgot ( Spanish : La ley que olvidaron ) is a 1938 Argentine musical film drama directed by José A. Ferreyra .
Ilona Arrives with the Rain ( Spanish : Ilona llega con la lluvia , Italian : Ilona arriva con la pioggia ) is a 1996 Colombian - Spanish - Italian drama film directed by Sergio Cabrera .
Me and Morrison ( Finnish : Minä ja Morrison ) is a 2001 Finnish romantic drama film directed by Lenka Hellstedt .
Bandhak is a South Asian American film directed by Hyder Bilgrami and produced by Ramzan Lakhani .
These Are the Rules ( Croatian : Takva su pravila ) is a Croatian 2014 drama film written and directed by Ognjen Sviličić .
Jalolsavam is a 2004 Malayalam - language Indian feature film directed by Sibi Malayil , starring Kunchacko Boban and Navya Nair in lead roles .
The Black Duke ( Italian : Il duca nero ) is a 1963 Italian historical adventure film directed by Pino Mercanti .
Santiago Files , directed by Cetywa Powell , is a documentary film about Salvador Allende 's topple from Chile 's unstable government and the players in his downfall : the CIA , Chile 's military , and Allende himself .
Vanya on 42nd Street is a 1994 film by Louis Malle and Andre Gregory .
Johnny Flynton ( 2002 ) is a short film directed and co - written by Lexi Alexander .
You Ca n't Save Yourself Alone ( Italian : Nessuno si salva da solo ) is a 2015 Italian romantic drama film directed by Sergio Castellitto .
Le Boulet is a French film directed by Alain Berbérian and Frédéric Forestier , released in 2002 .
Chandi Kori is a 2015 Indian Tulu film directed by Devadas Kapikad also appearing in a supporting role .
Mon père avait raison is a 1996 French TV movie directed by Roger Vadim starring Marie - Christine Barrault , Claude Rich and Nicolas Vaude .
Mystery of the Wax Museum is a 1933 American Pre - Code mystery - horror film released by Warner Bros. in two - color Technicolor and directed by Michael Curtiz .
Black Is White is a 1920 American silent drama film starring Dorothy Dalton and directed by Charles Giblyn .
Jana Nayaka ( Kannada : ಜನ ನಾಯಕ ) is a 1988 Indian Kannada film , directed by H. R. Bhargava and produced by Bhargava and Rajaram .
Lu , the Coquette ( Hungarian : Lu , a kokott ) is a 1918 Hungarian film directed by Michael Curtiz .
A Further Gesture is a 1997 film directed by Robert Dornhelm .
Which Woman ? is a 1918 American silent drama film directed by Tod Browning and Harry A. Pollard .
Daltry Calhoun is a 2005 comedy film , written and directed by Katrina Holden Bronson and produced by Danielle Renfrew , Erica Steinberg , Quentin Tarantino , and Todd King .
Wars and Treasure ( Persian : جنگ و گنج‎ ) is a 2000 Iranian drama film directed by Hossein Shahabi ( Persian : حسین شهابی )
She - Devils on Wheels is a 1968 American exploitation film about an all - female motorcycle gang called The Man - Eaters , directed and produced by Herschell Gordon Lewis .
Zinda Lash ( The Living Corpse ) is a 1932 Indian costume drama directed by Premankur Atorthy .
Death of a Legend was the first of three documentary films by Bill Mason about wolves , helping to dispel the image of wolves as `` evil '' and demonstrating their role in maintaining the balance of nature .
West 32nd is a 2007 film and the second feature film by Michael Kang .
Marked for Death is a 1990 American action film directed by Dwight H. Little .
Rekrut 67 , Petersen is a 1952 Danish family film directed by Poul Bang .
Rabhasa ( English : Passion ) is a 2014 Telugu action masala film written and directed by Santosh Srinivas .
Clear All Wires ! is a 1933 American pre - Code comedy film directed by George W. Hill and written by Bella Spewack , Sam Spewack and Delmer Daves .
Dominick and Eugene is a 1988 American drama film directed by Robert M. Young about twin brothers , Dominick and Eugene .
L'uomo dagli occhi di ghiaccio ( internationally released as The Man with Icy Eyes ) is a 1971 Italian giallo film directed by Alberto De Martino .
My Life with Morrissey is a 2003 independent feature film written , produced and directed by Andrew Overtoom .
Due once di piombo ( internationally released as My Name Is Pecos , also known as Il mio nome è Pecos ) is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Maurizio Lucidi .
Kann Sivanthaal Mann Sivakkum ( When eyes turn red , the soil too will ) is a 1983 Tamil film directed by debutant Sreedhar Rajan .
The Fighting Blade is an American silent film directed by John S. Robertson and released in 1923 .
The Mystery of the Mary Celeste ( 1935 ) is one of the early films from Hammer Film Productions and was directed by Denison Clift .
Karuppu Vellai ( Tamil : கருப்பு வெள்ளை ) is a 1993 Indian Tamil film , directed by Manobala and produced by B. Venkatrama Reddy .
Mudda Mandaram ( Telugu : ముద్ద మందారం ) is a 1981 Telugu Drama film written and directed by Jandhyala Subramanya Sastry .
Gambling Daughters is a 1941 American mystery film directed by Max Nosseck and starring Cecilia Parker , Roger Pryor and Robert Baldwin .
En Thambi ( Tamil : என் தம்பி ) is a 1968 Indian Tamil film , directed by A. C. Tirulokchandar .

A Couple of Down and Outs is a 1923 British silent drama film directed by Walter Summers and starring Edna Best , Rex Davis and George Foley .
Pooparika Varugirom ( English : We are coming to Steal Flowers ) is a 1999 Tamil language film directed by A. Venkatesh .
I Am a Ghost , is a 2012 American horror film directed by H.P. Mendoza .
Hogan 's Romance Upset is a 1915 short comedy film directed by Charles Avery and featuring both Fatty Arbuckle and Harold Lloyd in uncredited roles as a spectators .
Dance Me Outside is a 1994 drama film directed and co - written by Bruce McDonald .
I Hate Blondes ( Italian : Odio le bionde ) is a 1980 Italian crime comedy film directed by Giorgio Capitani .
Boond Jo Ban Gayee Moti ( English : The Drop That Became a Pearl ) is a 1967 Hindi social drama film , produced & directed by V. Shantaram on Rajkamal Kalamandir banner .
It 's a Wonderful Afterlife is a 2010 British comedy film directed by Gurinder Chadha .
The Coming of the Padres is a 1914 American silent short film Western film directed by Lorimer Johnston .
Madea 's Family Reunion is a 2006 comedy - drama film adaptation of the stage production of the same name written by Tyler Perry and sequel to Diary of a Mad Black Woman .
Jack the Dog is a 2001 American comedy - drama film , written and directed by Bobby Roth and starring Nestor Carbonell , Barbara Williams , Barry Newman , and Anthony LaPaglia .
Touched By Evil , is a 1997 television drama film directed by James A. Contner .
Drums of Africa is a 1963 adventure film set in Africa , directed by James B. Clark .
Two Gophers from Texas is a 1948 Merrie Melodies short starring the Goofy Gophers directed by Arthur Davis and produced by Eddie Selzer .
Sabotage at Sea is a 1942 British , black - and - white , drama , mystery , war film , directed by Leslie S. Hiscott and starring Jane Carr , Margaretta Scott , David Hutcheson and Ronald Shiner as Ernie the Cook .
Countess Sarah ( Italian : La contessa Sara ) is a 1919 Italian silent film directed by Roberto Roberti and starring Francesca Bertini .
Deduce , You Say ! is a 1956 Warner Bros. cartoon short of the Looney Tunes series , directed by Chuck Jones and written by Michael Maltese , with musical arrangements by Milt Franklyn .
Is Your Daughter Safe ? , also known as The Octopus , was an early silent exploitation film produced and directed by S. S. Millard .
Nadia and the Hippos ( French : Nadia et les hippopotames ) is a 1999 French drama film directed by Dominique Cabrera .
A Cry for Help is a 1912 American drama film directed by D. W. Griffith .
Njan Gandharvan ( Malayalam : ഞാന്‍ ഗന്ധര്‍വന്‍ , translation : I , Celestial Lover ) is a 1991 Malayalam fantasy romance film written and directed by P. Padmarajan .
Air Devils is a 1938 American comedy and action film directed by John Rawlins , based on an original story , `` The Fighting Marines '' by Harold Buckley .
Directed by Tom Cherones , `` The Ex - Girlfriend '' was the first episode of the show filmed at CBS Studio Center in Los Angeles , California , the previous season having been filmed at Desilu Cahuenga in Hollywood .
You Do n't Have to Die is a 1988 American short documentary film about a young boy 's successful battle against cancer , directed by Malcolm Clarke and Bill Guttentag .
Veera Madakari ( English : Brave Madakari ) is a 2009 Kannada action thriller film directed by Sudeep featuring Sudeep , Ragini Dwivedi in the lead roles .
Nightclub Hostess ( French title : L'Entraîneuse ) is a 1940 French language motion picture drama directed by Albert Valentin .
The Runestone is an American 1991 adventure / horror film , the first film written and directed by Willard Carroll .
Stealing a Nation was written and directed by John Pilger , and produced and directed by Christopher Martin ; reconstruction footage was directed by Sean Crotty .
3X3D is a 2014 anthology film comprising three short 3D films directed by French / Swiss filmmaker Jean - Luc Godard , British filmmaker Peter Greenaway and Portuguese filmmaker Edgar Pêra .
The Police Commissioner ( Italian : Il commissario ) is a 1962 Italian comedy film directed by Luigi Comencini .
Spring in Park Lane is a 1948 British romantic comedy film directed by Herbert Wilcox .
Saandhram is a 1990 Indian Malayalam film , directed by Thaha and produced by Thaha and Asokan .
He Learned About Women is a 1932 American Pre - Code comedy film directed by Lloyd Corrigan and written by Lloyd Corrigan , Ray Harris and Harlan Thompson .
Murder at 1600 is a 1997 American thriller film directed by Dwight H. Little .
How Hitler Lost the War is a 1989 World War II documentary created and produced by David Hoffman and Robert Denny , and narrated by Norman Rose .
Scary Movie 3 is a 2003 American science fiction horror comedy film , which parodies the horror , sci - fi , and mystery genres , as well as the third film of the Scary Movie franchise , and the first to be directed by David Zucker .
Just Pals is a 1920 American Pre - Code Western film directed by John Ford , and was Ford 's first film for Fox Film Corporation .
Seeing the World , also known as A Roamin ' Holiday , is a 1927 silent Our Gang film , directed by Robert F. McGowan and Robert A. McGowan .
Of Horses and Men ( Icelandic : Hross í oss ) is a 2013 Icelandic drama film written and directed by Benedikt Erlingsson and produced by fellow director Friðrik Þór Friðriksson .
The Kid with the Golden Arm ( original title : Jin Bei Tong / Gam Bei Tung ( Cantonese ) ) is a 1979 Shaw Brothers kung fu film directed by Chang Cheh and produced by Mona Fong .

The Glass Sphinx ( Italian : La sfinge d'oro ) is an Italian - American 1967 adventure film directed by Luigi Scattini .
The Book of Law ( French : Livre de loi ; Persian : کتاب قانون‎ , transliteration : Ketabe ghanoun ) is a 2009 Iranian film directed by Maziar Miri , written by Mohammad Rahmanian , and produced by Mohsen AliAkbari .

Castle Sinister was a 1932 British horror film produced , written and directed by Widgey R. Newman .
Tanjuska and the 7 Devils ( Finnish : Tanjuska ja 7 perkelettä ) is a 1993 documentary film by Finnish director Pirjo Honkasalo about a ten - year - old Belarusian girl who is believed to have been possessed by the devil .

Three Faces of Sin ( French : Le Puits aux trois vérités ) is a 1961 French language motion picture comedy directed by François Villiers , based on novel by Jean - Jaques Gauthier .
The New Exploits of Elaine is a 1915 American action film serial directed by Louis J. Gasnier , Leopold Wharton and Theodore Wharton .
Osmosis Jones is a 2001 American live - action / animated buddy cop comedy film directed by Tom Sito and Piet Kroon for the animated segments and the Farrelly brothers for the live - action ones .
The Big Broadcast of 1936 is a 1935 American comedy film directed by Norman Taurog , and is the second in the series of Big Broadcast movies .
Greptar is a 2007 Bengali film directed by Swapan Saha and produced by Rashika Chatterjee under the banner of Maa Karunamoyee Films .

Big Calibre is a 1935 American horror Western film produced by Supreme Pictures and directed by Robert N. Bradbury .
The Arizonian is a 1935 American western film directed by Charles Vidor from an original screenplay by Academy Award winner Dudley Nichols .
Oh Mong - nyeo ( 오몽녀 ) is a 1937 Korean film , the last film directed by Na Woon - gyu .

Poikkal Kudhirai is a 1983 Tamil - language Indian comedy feature film directed by K. Balachander and produced by Kalaivani .

The Search is a 1948 Swiss - American film directed by Fred Zinnemann which tells the story of a young Auschwitz survivor and his mother who search for each other across post - World War II Europe .

Robert Wilson and the Civil Wars is a 1987 documentary by Howard Brookner about Robert Wilson 's ambitious attempt to stage an epic , twelve - hour , multinational opera for the 1984 Summer Olympics .
Traffic with the Devil is a 1946 American short documentary film about traffic problems in Los Angeles , directed by Gunther von Fritsch .

The House in Dragon Street ( German : Das Haus in der Dragonerstrasse ) is a 1921 German silent crime film directed by Richard Oswald and starring Edmund Löwe , Werner Krauss and Lilly Flohr .

The Sins of Rosanne is a surviving 1920 American silent drama film starring Ethel Clayton and directed by actor / director Tom Forman .

Crazy Affairs ( Italian : Cose da pazzi ) is a 1954 Italian drama film directed by Georg Wilhelm Pabst .
What Will You Do When You Catch Me ? is the English title of Co mi zrobisz , jak mnie złapiesz ? a Polish comedy film released in 1978 , directed by Stanisław Bareja .
Boys of the City is a 1940 black - and - white comedy / thriller film directed by Joseph H. Lewis .
Kaalam Maari Kadha Maari ( Malayalam : കാലം മാറി കഥ മാറി ) is a 1987 Malayalam film directed by M. Krishnan Nair , written by Devan .
Paropakari ( Kannada : ಪರೋಪಕಾರಿ ) is a 1970 Indian Kannada language romantic drama film written and directed by Y. R. Swamy .
Chinnada Gombe ( Kannada : ಚಿನ್ನದ ಗೊಂಬೆ ) is a 1964 Indian Kannada film , directed and produced by B. R. Panthulu .
State of Bacon is a 2014 mockumentary written and directed by Jason Cook , and produced in conjunction with the Blue Ribbon Bacon Festival .
The Vampire 's Ghost is 1945 American horror film directed by Lesley Selander written by Leigh Brackett and John K. Butler .
The Comebacks is a 2007 American satirical comedy film directed by Tom Brady .
Murder by Rope is a 1936 British mystery film directed by George Pearson and starring Constance Godridge , D.A. Clarke - Smith and Sunday Wilshin .
Noukadubi ( Bengali : নৌকাডুবি , `` Boat wreck '' ) is a Bengali film directed by Rituparno Ghosh , released on January 2011 .
The Marriage Circle is a 1924 silent film produced by Ernst Lubitsch and Warner Brothers with direction by Lubitsch and distribution by the Warners .
BaadAsssss Cinema is a 2002 documentary film , directed by Isaac Julien .
Ormakalundayirikkanam ( English : Memories and Desires ) is a 1995 Malayalam political drama film directed by T. V. Chandran .
Ghosts of War is a short film made in 2010 , written and directed by David Sander and produced by Enzo Tedeschi , and starring Graham Brissett and Simon Broadhurst .
To Sleep with Anger is a 1990 American drama film directed and written by Charles Burnett .
Professor Creeps is a 1942 American comedy film directed by William Beaudine .
Prem Tapasya is a 1983 Bollywood Romantic film produced by Akkineni Nageswara Rao on Annapurna Studios banner and directed by Dasari Narayana Rao .
Rainbow on the River is a 1936 American musical film directed by Kurt Neumann from a screenplay by Harry Chandlee , Earle Snell , and William Hurlbut , based upon the novel Toinette 's Philip by C. V. Jamison .
Mrs. Sen is a 2013 Bengali film directed by Agnidev Chatterjee and produced by Pankaj Agarwal .
Chup Chup Ke ( Hindi : चुप चुप के ; English : Quietly , Quietly ) is a 2006 Bollywood film directed by Priyadarshan .
The Vows ( Portuguese : A Promessa ) is a 1973 Portuguese drama film directed by António de Macedo .
Brought by the Sea ( Turkish : Denizden Gelen ) is a 2010 Turkish drama film , directed by Nesli Çölgeçen , about an ex - cop who accidentally kills an African immigrant and retreats with a guilty conscience back to his hometown .
Solo for Sparrow is a 1962 film directed by Gordon Flemyng , part of the Edgar Wallace Mysteries series of British second - features .
Sugar Is Not Sweet ( Thai : น้ำตาลไม่หวาน or Namtarn mai warn ) is a 1965 Thai romantic comedy film written and directed by Rattana Pestonji .
Putani Agent 123 ( Kannada : ಪುಟಾಣಿ ಏಜೆಂಟ್ಸ್ ೧೨೩ ) is 1979 Indian Kannada Kannada children 's film directed by Geethapriya .
The Texas Promise was produced and directed by Academy Award winning filmmaker Vanessa Roth .
Thirteen Women is a 1932 American Pre - Code psychological thriller film , produced by David O. Selznick and directed by George Archainbaud .
Bob and Mary ( German : Bob und Mary ) is a 1923 German silent film directed by Max Glass and starring Helga Molander , Anton Edthofer and Paul Biensfeldt .
The Sidelong Glances of a Pigeon Kicker , also known as Pigeons , is a 1970 American comedy film directed by John Dexter and written by Ron Whyte .
Curse of the Komodo is a 2004 film that was directed by Jim Wynorski .
The Stronger Sex is a 1931 British drama film directed by Gareth Gundrey and starring Colin Clive , Adrianne Allen and Gordon Harker .
Catty Cornered is a 1953 Merrie Melodies cartoon directed by Friz Freleng , written by Warren Foster and distributed by Warner Bros ..
Kong Bukseløs ( English : His New Grey Trousers ) is a 1915 Danish silent film directed by Lau Lauritzen Sr ..
Mugdha Manava ( Kannada : ಮುಗ್ದಮಾನವ ) is a 1977 Indian Kannada film , directed by K. S. L. Swamy ( Ravi ) and produced by Lalithamma .
Mooru Janma ( Kannada : ಮೂರು ಜನ್ಮ ) is a 1984 Indian Kannada film , directed by H. R. Bhargava and produced by S N Parthanath Brothers .
Strings of Steel is a 1926 action film serial directed by Henry MacRae .
Bangarwadi ( Marathi : बनगरवाडी ) is a critically acclaimed Marathi film , directed by Amol Palekar .
Kulamagal Radhai ( Tamil : குலமகள் ராதை ) is a 1963 Indian Tamil film , directed by A. P. Nagarajan and produced by Spider Films .
Love Matters ( Chinese : 幸福万岁 ) is a Singaporean film written and directed by Jack Neo and Gilbert Chan , and produced by Neo Studios , mm Studios and Grand Billiance .
Pava Mannippu ( English : Clemency ) is a 1961 Tamil language drama film directed by A. Bhimsingh .
Ingmar Bergman Makes a Movie ( Swedish : Ingmar Bergman gör en film ) is a 1963 Swedish documentary film directed by Vilgot Sjöman which depicts the making of Ingmar Bergman 's film Winter Light from screenwriting to the film 's premiere and critical reaction .
Zoebaida is a 1940 film from the Dutch East Indies directed by Njoo Cheong Seng .
Without the King is a 2007 documentary film by Michael Skolnik , an American filmmaker .
Thalaimuraigal ( English : Generations ) is a 2013 Tamil film written and directed by Balu Mahendra .
Slaves of Beauty is a 1927 film directed by John G. Blystone and starring Olive Tell , Holmes Herbert , Earle Foxe , Margaret Livingston and future talent agent Sue Carol .
Women in Cages is a 1971 film in the women in prison sexploitation subgenre , co - produced by Roger Corman and directed by Gerardo de León .
Woman Doctors ( German : Ärztinnen ) is a 1984 German crime film directed by Horst Seemann .
James and the Giant Peach is a 1996 British - American musical fantasy film directed by Henry Selick , based on the 1961 novel of the same name by Roald Dahl .
Morality Above All Else ( Czech : Mravnost nade vše ) is a Czech comedy film directed by Martin Frič .
Wet and Wild Summer ! is a 1990 Australian - American comedy film directed by Maurice Murphy and starring Christopher Atkins , Julian McMahon and Elliott Gould .
Demon of the Sea ( German : Dämon des Meeres ) is a lost 1931 film directed by Michael Curtiz .
A Kiss on the Nose is a short film first released in the USA on August 15 , 2004 during the Rhode Island International Film Festival , written and directed by Laura Neri .
Ram ke Naam ( English : In the Name of God ) is a 1992 documentary by Indian filmmaker Anand Patwardhan .
Miss Suwanna of Siam ( Thai : นางสาวสุวรรณ ; rtgs : Nang Sao Suwan ) , was a 1923 romance film written and directed by Henry MacRae , set in Thailand ( then Siam ) and starring Thai actors .
Le Déshabillage impossible , released in the United States as Going to Bed Under Difficulties and in the United Kingdom as An Increasing Wardrobe , is a 1900 French short silent comedy film , directed by Georges Méliès .
Kaiyethum Doorath(English : Within the hand 's reach ) , alternatively called also as Kai Ethum Doorathu is a 2002 Malayalam romance film written , directed and produced by Fazil .
The Other Lover is a 1985 television film directed by Robert Ellis Miller and executive produced by Larry A. Thompson .
Some Girl is a 1998 American romantic comedy drama film directed by Rory Kelly and written by actress Marissa Ribisi , who also appeared in the film .
13 Days to Die or Der Fluch des schwarzen Rubin is a 1965 Italian and West German spy film drama , directed by Alberto Cardone and Manfred R. Köhler .
Chandrajit Banerjee is a Post - Graduate ( MA ) in Economics with specialisation in Economics of Planning and Econometrics from the University of Calcutta .
Gregory G. Colomb ( September 5 , 1951 -- October 11 , 2011 ) was a professor of the English language and literature and Director of Writing Programs at the University of Virginia .
Jack Ernest Vincent ( born December 26 , 1932 , Portland , Oregon ) is a Borah Professor Emeritus of the Department of Political Science at the University of Idaho .
Yalcin Ayasli received his M.S.E.E. and Sc . D. degrees from Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1973 and worked as a faculty member and Deputy Department Chair at the METU Electrical Engineering Department for six years .
Kathryn Tanner began her career at Yale University .
Henry Ledyard graduated from Columbia College in 1830 , and began practicing law in New York .
Irwin Kremen ( born 1925 ) is an American artist who at 41 began making art while Director of the Duke University Graduate Program in Clinical Psychology , after earning a Ph.D. six years earlier in clinical psychology at Harvard University .
Educated at North London Collegiate School and the University of Bristol , Victoria Sharp was called to the Bar , Inner Temple in 1979 .

Edmond Warre C.B. C.V.O. ( 12 February 1837 -- 22 January 1920 ) was an English rower and head master of Eton College from 1884 to 1905 .
Moses Gomberg ( February 8 , 1866 -- February 12 , 1947 ) was a chemistry professor at the University of Michigan .
Born in Washington , D.C. , Grover Furr graduated from McGill University in Montreal , Canada in 1965 with a BA in English .

Jay Burson was a college basketball player at The Ohio State University and former player in the Continental Basketball Association .

Schooled in South Africa , Timothy Moloi went on to complete a Bachelor of Arts degree at Ohio Wesleyan University in Delaware , Ohio , in the United States .

James Kinsella served in the United States Marine Corps , achieving the rank of sergeant , during World War II . He received a bachelor 's degree from Trinity College of Connecticut in 1947 and a law degree from University of Nebraska College of Law in 1952 .

UNESCO has offices in many locations across the globe ; its headquarters are located at Place de Fontenoy in Paris , France .
The Chester Pipe and Tube Company was a company incorporated in 1877 in Chester , Pennsylvania by shipbuilder John Roach for the manufacture of iron pipes and boiler tubes for the steamships built at his Chester shipyard , the Delaware River Iron Ship Building and Engine Works .
Schneider 's Bakery , Inc. is a television production company founded by Dan Schneider .
Notable individuals such as American actor Leonard Nimoy , American authors Michael Chabon and Ayelet Waldman , and Israeli authors David Grossman and Amos Oz support Peace Now 's objectives .
The Benaki Museum , established and endowed in 1930 by Antonis Benakis in memory of his father Emmanuel Benakis , is housed in the Benakis family mansion in downtown Athens , Greece .
Campaign Against Psychiatric Abuse was a group that was founded by Soviet dissident Viktor Fainberg in April 1975 and participated in the struggle against political abuse of psychiatry in the Soviet Union from 1975 to 1988 .
Balaji Telefilms is an Indian company owned by actor Jeetendra , which produces Indian soap operas , reality TV , comedy , game shows , entertainment and factual programming in several Indian languages .
Austrian Service Abroad is a non - profit initiative and was founded in 1998 by Andreas Maislinger and Andreas Hörtnagl .
In honor of his great - grandfather and grandfather , Maybach heir Ulrich Schmid - Maybach formed the Wilhelm and Karl Maybach Foundation .
Lettuce Entertain You Enterprises ( LEYE ) is a group of approximately 90 restaurants founded by Rich Melman and Jerry A. Orzoff in Chicago , IL in 1971 .
Ramoji Film City was established by Indian film producer Ramoji Rao , head of Ramoji Group , in 1996 .
The Society of Mary ( Marists ) , is a Roman Catholic religious institute , founded by ( later ) Father Jean - Claude Colin and a group of other seminarians in France in 1816 .
The AlloSphere was developed by a team of scientists , led primarily by Professor JoAnn Kuchera - Morin , a professor in the field of Composition , of the Media Arts & Technology Program of UCSB .
KiK was founded in 1994 by Stefan Heinig and the holding company Tengelmann Group .

The Metro Health / Grand Rapids Marathon is a 26.219-mile ( 42.195 km ) race run every October in Grand Rapids , Michigan , USA since 2004 .

Cidade Nova Station ( Portuguese : Estação Cidade Nova ) is a subway station on the Rio de Janeiro Metro that services the neighbourhood of Cidade Nova in the North Zone of Rio de Janeiro . The station was opened in 2010 .

Bloomberg News , originally known as Bloomberg Business News , was co - founded by Michael Bloomberg and Matthew Winkler in 1990 to deliver financial news reporting to Bloomberg Terminal subscribers .
Stuckism is an international art movement founded in 1999 by Billy Childish and Charles Thomson to promote figurative painting as opposed to conceptual art . By July 2012 the initial group of 13 British artists had expanded to 233 groups in 52 countries .

The Standish Group International , Inc. or Standish Group is an independent international IT research advisory firm founded in 1985 , known from their reports about information systems implementation projects in the public and private sector .
The Office of the Australian Information Commissioner ( OAIC ) is an independent Australian Government agency , acting as the national data protection authority for Australia , established under the Australian Information Commissioner Act 2010 , headed by the Australian Information Commissioner .
Qatar News Agency was established by a decree issued on 25 May 1975 .
Latham & Watkins LLP , founded in 1934 , is the world 's highest - grossing law firm , with US$ 2.6 billion in annual revenue , and one of the highest - paying law firms in the world .
New Writing North was established in 1996 in Newcastle upon Tyne , working with writers across the North East of England .

The Order of Mendi for Bravery is a South African honour , instituted on 30 November 2003 .
The Orange Award for New Writers was a prize given by telecommunications company Orange between 2006 and 2010 .

The Ukrainian Liberation Army ( Ukrainian : Українське Визвольне Військо , Ukrainske Vyzvolne Viysko , UVV ) was a collective name given to all dispersed Ukrainian units serving with the Wehrmacht Heer in 1943 during World War II . A single formation by that name did not exist .

Not finding what he was looking for musically , however , Ontronik put his solo project on an indefinite hiatus and founded VoKee in early 2004 .
Fliflet / Hamre ( established 1991 in Bergen , Norway ) Norwegian traditional music duo comprising Gabriel Fliflet and Ole Hamre .
Lava Hay were a Canadian folk rock duo formed in 1989 in Toronto , Ontario , consisting of Suzanne Little and Michele Gould .
Since the Hopman Cup was founded in 1989 , it has been attended each year by Harry Hopman 's widow , his second wife Lucy , who travels to the tournament annually from her home in the United States .
Bluebird Airways is a Greek airline , established in 2008 in Heraklion Crete Greece and is mainly involved in the transportation of passengers and cargo according to schedule and charter flights .
AirSpace Studio was founded in January 2011 by Creative Director Mark Woodward .
The Nikon D3100 is a 14.2-megapixel DX format DSLR Nikon F - mount camera announced by Nikon on August 19 , 2010 .
Treyarch is an American video game developer company , founded in 1996 by Peter Akemann and Doğan Köslü ( aka Don Likeness ) , and acquired by Activision in 2001 .
The Australian Police Rugby Union Association Inc. ( A.P.R.U. ) was first established in 1998 with a view to travelling to the 1999 IRB Rugby World Cup in Wales , Ireland and England .
Darzamat is a Polish symphonic black metal band formed in 1995 .
Blackstreet , often stylized as BLACKstreet , is an American R&B group founded in 1991 by Teddy Riley and Chauncey Hannibal , also known as `` C. Black . ''
The HVO ( Croatian Defence Council ) was established on April 8 , 1992 in Grude by the political leadership of Croats , mainly members of Croatian Democratic Union ( Hrvatska Demokratska Zajednica ) as a military formation of Herzeg - Bosnia .
The Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement ( BSEE ) is an agency under the United States Department of the Interior , established by Secretarial Order in 2011 .
Slow Food is a grassroots organization founded by Carlo Petrini in Italy in 1986 .
The present - day Zumtobel Group originated as `` Elektrogeräte und Kunstharzpresswerk W. Zumtobel KG '' , which was founded in Dornbirn / Vorarlberg in 1950 .
The Port Arthur Sea Hawks were a Gulf Coast League ( 1950 - 1953 ) , Evangeline League ( 1954 ) and Big State League ( 1955 - 1956 ) baseball team based in Port Arthur , Texas , USA .
The Province of Posen ( German : Provinz Posen , Polish : Prowincja Poznańska ) was a province of Prussia from 1848 and as such part of the German Empire from 1871 until 1918 .
After years of wrangling over commercial development proposals and lawsuits to block development , New York State bought the property in 1987 and opened the Minnewaska State Park Preserve in 1993 .
Jaded Era is an unsigned American alternative rock / pop band from Cuyahoga Falls and Akron , Ohio that formed around 1996 .
Border City Wrestling ( BCW ) was founded in 1993 by Scott D'Amore , Chuck Fader , and `` The Canadian Destroyer '' Doug Chevalier .
Arnold Motorsports was formed in 2003 after the purchase of the race shop and equipment of Melling Racing .
Samsung SDS , established in 1985 , as a subsidiary of Samsung group has been providing information technology services .
Classics of Love is an American punk rock band from the San Francisco Bay Area , formed in 2008 .
The European Urban Knowledge Network ( EUKN ) was created in Rotterdam in 2004 as a result of an agreement between European ministers on urban policies .
E@I started as an informal international work group in 1999 , before it was officially registered in Slovakia in 2005 .
The London Docklands Development Corporation ( LDDC ) was a quango agency set up by the UK Government in 1981 to regenerate the depressed Docklands area of east London .
The Tasmania Senate Team was a minor Australian political party that operated from 1992 to 1996 .
Cinco Puntos Press , established in 1985 , is an independent book publishing company located in El Paso , Texas .
The Dance Music Hall of Fame was an organization established in 2003 to honor and remember significant contributors to the genre of dance music .
ThanatoSchizO is a metal group from Santa Marta de Penaguião ( Trás - os - Montes e Alto Douro , Portugal ) , founded in late 1997 .
The Social Democratic Federation ( SDF ) was established as Britain 's first organised socialist political party by H. M. Hyndman , and had its first meeting on 7 June 1881 .
Spring Zouk is the name of a festival in which was held February 3 - -5 , 2012 at Udupi beach on at St Mary 's Islands in Karnataka , India .
The Republican Moderate Party of Alaska is a political party in Alaska formed by Ray Metcalfe in 1986 as an alternative to what Metcalfe perceived to be a Republican Party dominated by the Religious Right .
Survivors of the Abortion Holocaust was founded in 1998 by Jeff White , who was previously involved in the leadership of another anti - abortion group , Operation Rescue .
SAGE - AU was originally formed to provide the same services for Australian system administrators as the SAGE organisation did in the United States , but is completely independent of that entity , and has been since SAGE - AU 's formation in 1993 .
Musica Fiata , also Musica Fiata Köln , is a German instrumental ensemble , founded in Cologne in 1976 by director Roland Wilson .
Capitol Films was a British film production and distribution company , founded in 1989 .
Thieves and Villains are an American indie rock band from the Hudson Valley region of New York , formed in 2007 , and signed to Victory Records .
London Hackspace ( abbreviated LHS ) is a non - profit hackerspace in London , UK , established in 2009 .
Though formed in 1989 , Xome did not perform live until 1994 in Tokyo .
The Ian Gillan Band were an English jazz - rock fusion band formed by Deep Purple singer Ian Gillan in 1975 .
The BBC Choice Northern Ireland service launched alongside the other BBC Choice variants on 23 September 1998 and ceased on 30 March 2001 ; it was replaced by a fully networked BBC Choice .
Jimmy , John Morris , Cookie , Raylene and Heather Rankin released their own independent cassettes , The Rankin Family ( 1989 ) and Fare Thee Well Love ( 1990 ) , featuring original songs and a combination of traditional jigs , reels and Celtic folk songs .

Bandhan tv is a Hindi Language Movies entertainment channel , part of Viacom 18 family , which was announced on 15 Augest 2015 .
Bolshoy Kamen began as a naval support base in 1947 and was granted urban - type settlement status in 1956 , followed by town status on August 31 , 1989 .
Originally formed in 1999 , Bandwidth.com began as a home office start - up company in a spare bedroom of co - founder David Morken 's Park City , Utah home .
Gambit Gaming is a European esports organization formed in January 2013 after the acquisition of the previous League of Legends roster of Moscow Five .
Eretz Hadasha ( Hebrew : ארץ חדשה‎ , lit . New Land ) is a political party in Israel , founded in 2012 to run in the 2013 parliamentary elections .

Nick Blinko ( born 4 September 1961 ) is a British musician , lyricist and artist best known as the lead singer , lyricist and guitar player for the British band Rudimentary Peni .
Jimmy Murrison ( born 8 November 1964 ) is a Scottish lead guitar player , a member of the band Nazareth .

Manny Albam ( June 24 , 1922 in Samana , Dominican Republic -- October 2 , 2001 in Croton - on - Hudson , New York , USA ) was a jazz baritone saxophone player who eventually became a composer , arranger , producer , and educator .
Don Wayne Reno ( born February 8 , 1963 in Roanoke , Virginia ) is a bluegrass musician and banjo player , and also an ordained minister .
Jakob Lindberg ( born 16 October 1952 ) is a Swedish lutenist , performing solo , in small and large ensembles , and also directing operas , using instruments of the lute and guitar families .
Trygve Seim ( born 25 April 1971 in Oslo , Norway ) is a Norwegian jazz musician ( saxophone ) and composer .
Andy Piercy is a singer - songwriter who came to prominence in the Gospel beat acoustic guitar duo , Ishmael and Andy , together with Ian Smale ( Ishmael ) .
Olli Haavisto ( born 30 May 1954 , Pori , Finland ) is a Finnish musician best known for playing the pedal steel guitar and the guitar .
Johan Niemann began playing bass guitar at age eleven .
Sandy Rothman ( born 30 January 1946 , Miami , Florida ) is a San Francisco Bay Area bluegrass multi - instrumentalist and record producer , who plays mandolin , dobro and banjo , and was a friend and colleague of Grateful Dead bandleader Jerry Garcia , and a member of the Jerry Garcia Acoustic Band .
Rob Dehlinger is a trumpet player , composer , and singer / songwriter in the San Francisco Bay Area of California , United States .
Ignace Michiels ( born 7 December 1963 ) is a Belgian organist , choral conductor and organ teacher .
Charlie Poole ( March 22 , 1892 -- May 21 , 1931 ) was an American old time banjo player and country musician and the leader of the North Carolina Ramblers , an American old - time string band that recorded many popular songs between 1925 to 1930 .
Erdal Kızılçay ( born c. 1950 ) is a multi - instrumental ( bass guitar , oud ) musician of Turkish birth who has worked with , among others , David Bowie .
Willie Ruff ( born September 1 , 1931 ) is an American jazz musician , specializing in the French horn and double bass .
Philip J. Bone ( 1873 in Luton -- 17 June 1964 in Luton ) was an English mandolinist and guitar player in the late 19th and early 20th centuries .
Born and raised in south central Wisconsin , Owen Mays began playing guitar at the age of 16 .
Dutch composer and conductor Johan de Meij ( Voorburg , 1953 ) received his musical training at the Royal Conservatory of Music in The Hague , where he studied trombone and conducting .
Chris Walden grew up in Hamburg , Germany where he learned to play the recorder at age 5 , the piano at age 8 , and the trumpet at age 13 , which then became his main instrument .
Bart Maris is a Belgian trumpet player .
Jan Koemmet ( born 18 August 1961 ) is a German guitar player and an international designer .
Matt Lavelle ( born 1970 in Paterson , New Jersey ) is a jazz trumpet , flugelhorn and bass clarinet player .
Georg Kopprasch ( c. 1800 -- c. 1850 ) was a German composer and horn player primarily known for his second set of sixty horn studies ( op . 6 ) , currently used by most horn students studying at an advanced level .
Pedro Laurenz ( born Pedro Blanco Acosta ) was a bandoneon player , director and composer of Argentine tango music .
Hanna Paulsberg ( born 13 November 1987 in Rygge , Norway ) is a Norwegian Jazz musician ( tenor saxophone ) , daughter of folk singer and jazz musician Håkon Paulsberg , and known as leader for her own quartet the H.P. Concept .
Friedrich Pollock ( 22 May 1894 -- 16 December 1970 ) was a German social scientist and philosopher .

Georg Wilhelm Steller ( 10 March 1709 -- 14 November 1746 ) was a German botanist , zoologist , physician and explorer , who worked in Russia and is considered a pioneer of Alaskan natural history .
Pietro Antonio Martini ( 1738 - -1797 ) was an Italian painter and engraver , active in a late Baroque style .

Jesmyn Ward is an American novelist and an associate professor of English at Tulane University .

Joseph Quesnel ( 15 November 1746 -- 2 or 3 July 1809 ) was a French Canadian composer , poet , and playwright .
Blessed Giuseppe Toniolo ( 1845 - 1918 ) was an Italian Catholic economist and sociologist .
Ernst Moritz Arndt ( 26 December 1769 -- 29 January 1860 ) was a German patriotic author and poet .
Thomas Simonsson ( 1350 -- 1443 ) was a Swedish theologian and poet and the Bishop of Diocese of Strängnäs 1429 -- 1443 , in the Church of Sweden .
Guy Bono ( born 30 April 1953 in Béja , Béja Governorate , Tunisia ) is a French politician and Member of the European Parliament for the south - east of France .

Pietro Aldobrandini ( 31 March 1571 -- 10 February 1621 ) was an Italian Cardinal and patron of the arts .

Phillips Gybbon ( 11 October 1678 -- 12 March 1762 ) , of Hole Park , Rolvenden , in Kent , was an English Member of Parliament .
Don Antonio Osorio de Acuña ( 1459 in Valladolid -- 23 March 1526 ) was a Spanish bishop of Zamora , appointed 4 January 1507 , during the reigns of Ferdinand II and Charles V. He filled that see in 1519 , when the civil war broke out in Spain .
Jens Kraft ( 1720 - -1756 ) was a Danish mathematician and philosopher of Norwegian birth .

Paul de Barry ( born at Leucate in 1587 ; died at Avignon , 28 July 1661 ) was a French Jesuit and writer .

Nils Bengt Folke Ekerot ( sometimes credited as Bengt Ekeroth ) ( 8 February 1920 -- 26 November 1971 ) was a Swedish actor and director .
François Mansart ( 13 January 1598 -- 23 September 1666 ) was a French architect credited with introducing classicism into Baroque architecture of France .
Dawid Jackiewicz ( born March 18 , 1973 in Wrocław ) is a Polish politician , and the current Minister of State Treasury , serving since 2015 .
Vasil Kanchov ( Bulgarian : Васил Кънчов Vasil Kǎnčov ) ( 26 July 1862 -- 6 February 1902 ) was a Bulgarian geographer , ethnographer and politician .
William James Clement ( 1802 -- 29 August 1870 ) was an English surgeon and a Liberal Party politician who was active in local government and sat in the House of Commons from 1865 to 1870 .
Lise Tremblay ( born 13 June 1957 ) is a French Canadian novelist .
Jean - Pierre Serre ( French : ( sɛʁ ) ; born 15 September 1926 ) is a French mathematician who has made fundamental contributions to algebraic topology , algebraic geometry , and algebraic number theory .
Taddeo Crivelli ( fl . 1451 , died by 1479 ) , also known as Taddeo da Ferrara , was an Italian painter of illuminated manuscripts .
Börje Dorch ( 17 October 1929 in Malmö -- 9 January 2004 ) was a Swedish draughtsman , journalist and writer who was very active in sports .
Jean - Antoine Houdon ( French pronunciation : ​(ʒɑ̃n‿ɑ̃twan udɔ̃ ) ) ( 25 March 1741 -- 15 July 1828 ) was a French neoclassical sculptor .

Alejandro Blanco is the current President of the Spanish Olympic Committee .
Francisco de Sande Picón ( 1540 - -1627 ) was the third Spanish governor and captain - general of the Philippines from August 25 , 1575 to April 1580 .
