Robert Mertens ( 1 December 1894 -- 23 August 1975 ) was a German herpetologist .

Miroslav Tyrš ( 17 August 1832 -- 8 August 1884 ) was a Czech art historian , sports organizer and founder of the Sokol movement .
Vital - Casimir Cuinet , commonly known as Vital Cuinet ( Longeville- December 19 , 1833 - Istanbul , September 6 , 1896 ) was a French geographer and orientalist .
Mukesh Rishi is an Indian film actor who has worked in Hindi , Punjabi , Telugu , Tamil , Malayalam and Kannada films .
Mohamed Ali Yousfi ( Tunisian Arabic : محمد علي اليوسفي‎ ) ( born March 3 , 1950 , Béja , Tunisia ) is a Tunisian writer and translator .

Juan Ignacio González del Castillo ( Cadiz 1763 -- September 14 , 1800 ) was a Spanish author of comic theatre .
Charlotte Mary Yonge ( 11 August 1823 -- 24 May 1901 ) was an English novelist known for her huge output , now mostly out of print .
Daniel Berkeley Updike 's parents were both English .
Antonio Carbonell Muñoz ( born 30 November 1969 in Madrid ) is a Spanish singer - songwriter of Romani heritage , known for his participation in the 1996 Eurovision Song Contest .
Samuel Plimsoll ( 10 February 1824 -- 3 June 1898 ) was an English politician and social reformer , now best remembered for having devised the Plimsoll line ( a line on a ship 's hull indicating the maximum safe draft , and therefore the minimum freeboard for the vessel in various operating conditions ) .
Yves Rocher ( 7 April 1930 -- 26 December 2009 ) was a French businessman and founder of the cosmetics company that bears his name .
Barthold Georg Niebuhr ( 27 August 1776 -- 2 January 1831 ) was a Danish - German statesman , banker , and historian who became Germany 's leading historian of Ancient Rome and a founding father of modern scholarly historiography .
Margarethe Schreinemakers ( born 27 July 1958 in Krefeld ) is a German television presenter , talk show host and journalist .
Jüri Vilms ( 13 March ( O.S. 1 March ) 1889 , Arkma , now in Türi Parish , Järva County , Estonia - May 2 , 1918 , Hauho near Hämeenlinna , Finland ) was a member of the Estonian Salvation Committee and the first Deputy Prime Minister of the Republic of Estonia .
Santhosh Pandit is a Malayalam film actor , , singer , director and an internet celebrity .
Pauline - Marie Jaricot ( 22 July 1799 ; died there , 9 January 1862 ) was a French laywoman , the foundress of the Society of the Propagation of the Faith and the Living Rosary Association .
Juan de Ayolas ( died c. 1537 ) was a conquistador born in Briviesca who explored the watershed of the Río de la Plata for the Spanish Crown .
Masri Feki is a French writer , researcher in the Paris 8 University , and a specialist of the geopolitics and the Middle East who lives in Paris .
Constant Pierre ( 24 August 1855 -- 12 February 1918 ) was a French musicologist .
Marc - Antoine Charpentier ( French : ( maʁk ɑ̃.twan ʃaʁ.pɑ̃.tje ) ; 1643 -- 24 February 1704 ) was a French composer of the Baroque era .

Charles Waterton ( 3 June 1782 -- 27 May 1865 ) was an English naturalist and explorer .
Friedrich Ludwig Jahn ( 11 August 1778 -- 15 October 1852 ) was a German gymnastics educator and nationalist .
David Ruhnken ( 2 January 1723 -- 14 May 1798 ) was a Dutch classical scholar of German origin .
Anna Rosmus , also known as Anja Rosmus - Wenninger , is a German author and researcher born in 1960 in Passau , Bavaria .
Mileva Marić ( Serbian Cyrillic : Милева Марић ; December 19 , 1875 -- August 4 , 1948 ) was a Serbian physicist .
Rolf Hochhuth ( born 1 April 1931 in Eschwege ) is a German author and playwright .
Altaf Hussain Hali ( 1837 - -31 December 1914 , Panipat district , British India ) ( Urdu : الطاف حسین حاؔلی‎ -- Alṭāf Ḥusain Ḥālī ) , known with his honorifics as Maulana Khawaja Hali , was an Urdu poet and writer .
Nachum Gutman ( alternate romanization : Nahum Gutman ; Hebrew : נחום גוטמן‎ : born October 15 , 1898 , died November 28 , 1980 ) was an Israeli painter , sculptor , and author .
Bento de Góis ( 1562 , Vila Franca do Campo , Azores , Portugal - 11 April 1607 , Suzhou , Gansu , China ) , was a Portuguese Jesuit Brother , Missionary and explorer .
Edward Waugh ( 1816 -- 26 March 1891 ) was an English solicitor and Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1880 to 1885 .
Jean - Baptiste Noulet ( 1 May 1802 - 24 May 1890 ) was a French scientist and naturalist who helped to prove the archæological existence of humans and was one of the pioneers of the scientific discipline of prehistoric archaeology .
Trond Berg Eriksen ( born 3 October 1945 ) is a Norwegian historian of ideas , non - fiction writer and magazine editor .
György Klapka ( Hungarian : Klapka György ) , also known as German :
Kadhal Dhandapani ( died 20 July 2014 ) was an Indian film actor who appeared in Tamil , Telugu and Malayalam films .
Wilhelmine von Hillern ( 11 March 1836 Munich -- 15 December 1916 Hohenaschau ) was a German actress and novelist .
Joseph Le Brix ( 22 February 1899 - 12 September 1931 ) was a French aviator and a capitain de corvette ( lieutenant commander ) in the French Navy .
Robert Caby ( Venette , March 25 , 1905 - Paris , October 3 , 1992 ) was a French composer and writer .
Laurent Lafforgue ( French : ( lafɔʁɡ ) ; born 6 November 1966 ) is a French mathematician .
George Becali ( Romanian pronunciation : ( ˈd͡ʒe̯ord͡ʒe beˈkali ) , commonly known in Romania as Gigi Becali ; born 25 June 1958 ) is a controversial Romanian politician and businessman , mostly known for his ownership of the Steaua Bucureşti football club .
Géza von Bolváry ( full name Géza Maria von Bolváry - Zahn ; 26 December 1897 -- 10 August 1961 ) was a Hungarian actor , screenwriter and film director , who worked principally in Germany and Austria .
Giovanni Baglione ( 1566 -- 30 December 1643 ) was an Italian Late Mannerist and Early Baroque painter and art historian .
Franz Fühmann ( 15 January 1922 -- 8 July 1984 ) was a German writer who lived and worked in East Germany .
Pope Pius XI , ( Italian : Pio XI ) born Ambrogio Damiano Achille Ratti ( Italian pronunciation : ( amˈbrɔdʒo daˈmjano aˈkille ˈratti ) ; 31 May 1857 -- 10 February 1939 ) , reigned from 6 February 1922 to his death in 1939 .
Hrant Dink ( Western Armenian : Հրանդ Տինք , pronounced ( həˈɾɑnt diŋkʰ ) ) ( September 15 , 1954 -- January 19 , 2007 ) was a Turkish - Armenian editor , journalist and columnist .
Robert Storm Petersen ( September 19 , 1882 -- March 6 , 1949 ) was a Danish cartoonist , writer , animator , illustrator , painter and humorist .
Remy Chauvin ( 10 October 1913 -- 8 December 2009 ) at Sainte - Croix - aux - Mines , Haut - Rhin , was a biologist and entomologist , and a French Honorary Professor Emeritus at the Sorbonne , PhD , senior research fellow since 1946 .
Ehrenfried Günther Freiherr von Hünefeld ( 1 May 1892 - -5 February 1929 ) was a German aviation pioneer and initiator of the first transatlantic aeroplane flight from East to West .
Johann Leo Weisgerber ( February 25 , 1899 , Metz -- August 8 , 1985 , Bonn ) was a Lorraine - born German linguist who also specialized in Celtic linguistics .
Michl Ebner ( born on 20 September 1952 in Bolzano , Italy ) is an Italian politician and Member of the European Parliament for North - East with the Südtiroler Volkspartei , Member of the Bureau of the European People 's Party and sits on the European Parliament 's Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development .
Paul - Claude Racamier ( French : ( ʁakamje ) ; 20 May 1924 -- 18 August 1996 ) was a French psychiatrist and psychoanalyst , born in Doubs .
Sönke Neitzel ( born June 26 , 1968 ) is a German historian who has written extensively about the Second World War .
Alice Vieira ( born March 20 , 1943 in Lisbon ) is a Portuguese children 's book author .
Karl Gustav Cassel ( 20 October 1866 -- 14 January 1945 ) was a Swedish economist and professor of economics at Stockholm University .
Manuel Polo y Peyrolón ( 1846 -- 1918 ) was a Spanish novelist , philosopher , academic and a Carlist politician .
Pamela Vivien Kirkham , 16th Baroness Berners ( born 30 September 1929 ) is an English hereditary peeress and former member of the House of Lords , who served as an NHS nurse .
Ljubomir Nenadović ( 14 September 1826 -- 21 January 1895 ) was Serbian writer , poet , translator , diplomat , minister of education and member of the Serbian Royal Academy .
Lars Norén ( born 9 May 1944 ) is a Swedish playwright , novelist and poet .
Brankica Stanković ( Serbian Cyrillic : Бранкица Станковић ; born October 1975 in Belgrade ) is a prominent Serbian investigative journalist reporting on topics of crime and political corruption in Serbia .
Viktor Dyk ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈvɪktor ˈdɪk ) ) ( 31 December 1877 -- 14 May 1931 ) was a nationalist Czech poet , prose writer , playwright , politician and political writer .
René Vautier ( French : ( votje ) ; 15 January 1928 -- 4 January 2015 ) was a French film director .
Joaquín Bau Nolla ( 1897 - 1973 ) was a Spanish Carlist and Francoist politician .
Monica Elizabeth Jolley AO ( 4 June 1923 -- 13 February 2007 ) was an English - born writer who settled in Western Australia in the late 1950s .
Andrés Ortiz - Osés ( born 1943 , Tardienta ) is a Spanish philosopher .
Antoine Thomson d'Abbadie d'Arrast ( 3 January 1810 -- 19 March 1897 ) was a French explorer , geographer , ethnologist , linguist and astronomer notable for his travels in Ethiopia during the first half of the 19th century .
Aïda Mady Diallo is a French - born Malian novelist and director .
Henri - Edmond Cross , born Henri - Edmond - Joseph Delacroix , ( 20 May 1856 -- 16 May 1910 ) was a French painter and printmaker .
Félicien Menu de Ménil ( 16 July 1860 -- 28 March 1930 ) was a French composer and Esperanto enthusiast best known for his musical setting of Ludwig Zamenhof 's poem La Espero .
Hans Ernst Schneider ( 15 December 1909 -- 18 December 1999 ) , was a German professor of literature under his alias Hans Schwerte .
Jean Baubérot ( born 26 July 1941 in Châteauponsac , Haute - Vienne ) , is a French historian and sociologist specialist in sociology of religions and founder of the sociology of secularism .
Joaquim Maria Puyal i Ortiga ( born March 24 , 1949 ) is a Catalan journalist known for his work in television and radio .
Joseph Henri Ferdinand Douvillé ( 16 June 1846 -- 19 January 1937 ) , also known as Henri Douvillé , was French paleontologist , geologist and malacologist .
Serafino dell'Aquila alias Serafino Cimini di Bazzano alias Serafino dei Ciminelli ( 1466 - 1500 ) , Italian and prominent member of the Cimino family , poet and improvisatore .
András Kepes ( born October 11 , 1948 ) Hungarian journalist , documentary filmmaker and author , has been one of the most prominent and popular TV personalities in Hungary for more than 30 years .
Giovanni Battista Palatino ( c. 1515 - c. 1575 ) , also known as Giambattista , was an Italian calligrapher .
Leo Valiani ( Leo Weiczen ; 9 February 1909 -- 18 September 1999 ) was an Italian historian , politician and journalist .
Sergio Panunzio ( July 20 , 1886 -- October 8 , 1944 ) was an Italian theoretician of revolutionary syndicalism .
Ismaël Ferroukhi ( born 1962 ) is a French - Moroccan film director .
Gyula Kristó ( 11 July 1939 -- 24 January 2004 ) was a Hungarian historian and member of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences .
Albert Giraud ( French : ( ʒiʁo ) ; 23 June 1860 -- 26 December 1929 ) , was a Belgian poet who wrote in French .
Louis Favoreu ( September 5 , 1936 -- September 1 , 2004 ) was a French academic , specialized in public law , and a jurist .
Catherine Fradonnet ( December 1542 -- November 1587 ) , called Catherine Des Roches , was a French writer of the Renaissance .
Ernest Ange Duez ( also known as Ernest - Ange Duez and Ernest Duez , 8 March 1843 -- 5 April 1896 ) was a French painter of genre scenes , portraits , landscapes and religious subjects .
Amalric of Bena ( French : Amaury de Bène , Amaury de Chartres ; Latin : Almaricus , Amalricus , Amauricus ; died c. 1204 - 1207 AD ) was a French theologian and sect leader , after whom the Amalricians are named .
William Whewell FRS FGS ( /ˈhjuːəl/ HEW - əl ; 24 May 1794 -- 6 March 1866 ) was an English polymath , scientist , Anglican priest , philosopher , theologian , and historian of science .
Paulino Rivero Baute ( born 11 February 1952 ; El Sauzal , Tenerife , Spain ) is a Spanish politician and teacher .
Juan de Valdés ( c.1500 -- August 1541 ) was a Spanish religious writer .
Massimo D'Alema ( Italian pronunciation : ( ˈmassimo daˈlɛma ) ; born 20 April 1949 ) is an Italian politician who was the 53rd Prime Minister from 1998 to 2000 .
Raymond Federman ( May 15 , 1928 -- October 6 , 2009 ) was a French--
Giovanni Sansone ( 24 May 1888 -- 13 October 1979 ) was an Italian mathematician , known for his works on mathematical analysis , on the theory of orthogonal functions and on the theory of ordinary differential equations .
Général Alexandre Percin was a French military officier , chief of staff for Louis André , the Minister of War responsible for the Affaire des Fiches , from 1900 to 1904 .
Mary Lorimer Beatrix Campbell , OBE ( born 3 February 1947 ) , née Barnes , is an English writer and activist who has written for a number of publications since the early 1970s .
Nora - Eugenie Gomringer ( born January 26 , 1980 in Neunkirchen , Saar ) is a German and Swiss poet and writer .
Marion Guillou ( born September 17 , 1954 in Marseille , France ) is a French agronomist specialized in global food security .
Born in Cedarville , Illinois , Jane Addams was the youngest of eight children born into a prosperous northern Illinois family of English - American descent which traced back to colonial New England ; her father was politically prominent .
Evelyn Insam ( born 10 February 1994 ) is an Italian ski jumper and the 2013 National Champion .
Sir Henry Furnese , 1st Baronet ( 30 May 1658 -- 30 November 1712 ) was an English merchant and politician .
Dimitar Talev ( Bulgarian : Димитър Талев ) ( 1 September 1898 -- 20 October 1966 ) was a Bulgarian writer and journalist .
Christian Heinrich Arthur Drews ( German : ( dʀɛfs ) ; November 1 , 1865 -- July 19 , 1935 ) was a German writer , historian , philosopher , and important representative of German monist thought .
Jean - Baptiste - Ambroise - Marcellin Jobard ( 17 May 1792 -- 27 October 1861 ) was a Belgian lithographer , photographer and inventor of French origin .
Jerónimo Luis de Cabrera ( 1528 -- 1574 ) was a Spanish Conquistador , early colonial governor over much of what today is northwestern Argentina , and founder of the city of Córdoba .
Luigi Ballerini ( born 1940 in Milan ) , currently living in New York and Los Angeles , is an Italian poet , professor of modern and contemporary Italian Literature at UCLA and a historian of gastronomy .
La Terremoto de Alcorcón ( in English , The Earthquake of Alcorcon ) , is a Spanish singer .
Gilles Kepel ( born 30 June 1955 ) is a French political scientist and specialist of the Islamic and contemporary Arab world .
Nguyễn Chí Thiện ( 27 February 1939 -- 2 October 2012 ) was a Vietnamese - born American dissident , activist and poet who spent a total of twenty - seven years in prison .
Shirley Brice Heath is an American linguistic anthropologist , and Professor Emerita , Margery Bailey Professorship in English , at Stanford University .
Yi I ( Hangul : 이이 ; hanja : 李珥 , December 26 , 1536 -- 1584 ) was one of the two most prominent Korean Confucian scholars of the Joseon Dynasty , the other being his older contemporary , Yi Hwang ( Toegye ) .
Mark Chadbourn is an English fantasy , science fiction , historical fiction , and horror author with more than a dozen novels ( and one non - fiction book ) published around the world .
Giovanni Becatti ( 1912 - -1973 ) was an Italian Classical art historian and archaeologist .
Dai Wangshu ( Chinese : 戴望舒 ; pinyin : Dài Wàngshū ) ( also Tai Wang - shu or Tai Van - chou ) ( March 5 , 1905 - -February 28 , 1950 ) was a Chinese poet , essayist and translator active from the late 1920s to the end of the 1940s .
Jules Baillaud ( born January 14 , 1876 in Paris , died November 28 , 1960 ) is a French astronomer .
François - Noël Babeuf ( French : ( babœf ) ; 23 November 1760 -- 27 May 1797 ) , known as Gracchus Babeuf , was a French political agitator and journalist of the French Revolutionary period .
Théophile Funck - Brentano ( 21 August 1830 -- 23 January 1906 ) was a Luxembourgian - French sociologist .
Sir John Shelley , 5th Baronet ( 1730 -- 11 September 1783 ) , of Michelgrove in Sussex , was an English Member of Parliament .
Rudolf Alexander Schröder ( January 26 , 1878 -- August 22 , 1962 ) was a German translator and poet .
Adnan Oktar ( born 2 February 1956 ) , also known as Harun Yahya , is a Turkish author as well as an Islamic creationist .
Honorat de Porchères Laugier ( 8 June 1572 , Forcalquier -- 26 October 1653 ) was a French poet .
Umberto Boccioni ( Italian pronunciation : ( umˈbɛrto botˈtʃoːni ) ; 19 October 1882 -- 17 August 1916 ) was an influential Italian painter and sculptor .
Petar Konjović ( Serbian Cyrillic : Петар Коњовић , pronounced ( pɛ̂tar kɔ̂ːɲɔʋit͡ɕ ) , 5 May 1883 -- 1 October 1970 ) was a Serbian composer .
Tevfik Başer ( born 12 January 1951 ) is a Turkish - German film director and screenwriter .
Shabtai Teveth ( Hebrew : שבתי טבת‎‎ ; 1925 -- 1 November 2014 ) , was an Israeli historian and an anti - Revisionist author .
François - Bernard Mâche ( born April 4 , 1935 , Clermont - Ferrand ) is a French composer of contemporary music .
Jan Werich ( Czech : ( ˈjan ˈvɛrɪx ) ; 6 February 1905 -- 31 October 1980 ) was a Czech actor , playwright and writer .
Rubén Caba , born in Madrid , is a Spanish novelist and essayist .
Alfred Alvarez ( born 5 August 1929 ) is an English poet , novelist , essayist and critic who publishes under the name A. Alvarez and Al Alvarez .
Vasile Alecsandri ( Romanian pronunciation : ( vaˈsile aleksanˈdri ) ; 21 July 1821 -- 22 August 1890 ) was a Moldavian poet , playwright , politician , and diplomat .
Sixto Agudo González ( born August 25 , 1916 , Torrijos , d. June 29 , 2004 ) was a Spanish politician and World War II resistance member .
Roberto Roversi ( 28 January 1923 -- 14 September 2012 ) was an Italian poet , writer and journalist .
Julius Wilhelm Albert Wigand ( April 21 , 1821 -- October 22 , 1886 ) was a German Botanist .
Thomas Anstey Guthrie ( 8 August 1856 - 10 March 1934 ) was an English novelist and journalist , who wrote his comic novels under the pseudonym F. Anstey .
Marcelino Martínez Cao ( born 29 April 1940 ) , known simply as Marcelino , is a Spanish retired footballer who played as a striker .
Luis García Forcada is a Spanish chemist , politician and businessman .
Guillaume de Nangis ( died 1300 ) , also known as William of Nangis , was a French chronicler .
Paul Crampel ( 17 November 1864 -- 9 April 1891 ) was a French explorer .
Gregorio López - Bravo y Castro ( 29 December 1923 in Madrid , Spain -- 19 February 1985 in Bilbao , Spain ) was a Spanish politician who served as Minister of Foreign Affairs between 1969 and 1973 .
Philippe Parreno is a French artist who lives and works in Paris , France .
James Bolton ( 1735 -- 7 January 1799 ) was an English naturalist , botanist , mycologist , and illustrator .
Robert Havemann ( 11 March 1910 -- 9 April 1982 ) was a chemist , and an East German dissident .
Jaume Huguet ( Catalan : ( ˈʒawmə uˈɣɛt ) ; 1412 - -1492 ) was a Catalan painter .
Sir Thomas Lee , 3rd Baronet ( 1687 - 1749 ) , of Hartwell , near Aylesbury , Buckinghamshire , was an English politician .
Víctor Balaguer i Cirera ( Catalan pronunciation : ( ˈbiktor βəɫəˈɣe ) ) ( 11 December 1824 -- 14 January 1901 ) , Spanish politician and author , was born at Barcelona on 11 December 1824 , and was educated at the university of his native city .
Raymond Domenech ( French pronunciation : ​(ʁɛmɔ̃ dɔmɛnɛk ) ; born 24 January 1952 in Lyon ) is a retired French footballer and the former manager of the French national football team .
Rafael Sánchez Mazas ( February 18 , 1894 - October 1966 ) was a Spanish nationalist writer and a leader of the Falange , a right - wing political movement created in Spain before the Spanish Civil War .
George Payne Rainsford James ( 9 August 1799 -- 9 June 1860 ) , was an English novelist and historical writer , the son of a physician in London .
Hydatius was born around the year 400 in the environs of Civitas Lemica , a Roman town near modern Xinzo de Limia in the Spanish Galician province of Ourense .
Dino Grandi ( 4 June 1895 -- 21 May 1988 ) , 1st Conte di Mordano , was an Italian Fascist politician , minister of justice , minister of foreign affairs and president of parliament .
Dr. Manuel Ferraz de Campos Sales ( Portuguese pronunciation : ( manuˈew feˈʁas di ˈkɐpus ˈsalis ) ; 15 February 1841 -- 28 June 1913 ) was a Brazilian lawyer , coffee farmer and politician .
Víctor García de la Concha , KOGF ( born 2 January 1934 , Villaviciosa , Asturias ) is a Spanish philologist .
Akshara Gowda ( born Harini Gowda on 24 December 1991 in Bangalore , Karnataka ) is an Indian film actress who has appeared in Hindi and Tamil films .
A French historian of international relations , Dr. Thomas Gomart ( History -- Paris I Panthéon - Sorbonne ) is Director of the Russia / NIS Center at IFRI ( Institut français des relations internationales ) and of the trilingual electronic collection Russie . NEI.Visions in English .
Lord Edward Thynne ( 23 January 1807 -- 4 February 1884 ) was an English nobleman .
Clifford Edmund Bosworth FBA ( 29 December 1928 -- 28 February 2015 ) was an English historian and Orientalist , specializing in Arabic and Iranian studies .
Hermann Rauschning ( 7 August 1887 -- February 8 , 1982 ) was a German Conservative Revolutionary who briefly joined the Nazis before breaking with them .
José Augusto Sánchez Pérez ( Madrid , 30 November 1882 -- 13 November 1958 ) was a Spanish mathematician and member of the Spanish Royal Academy of Sciences .
Nikolay Haytov ( Bulgarian : Николай Хайтов ) ( 15 September 1919 -- 30 June 2002 ) was a Bulgarian fiction writer , playwright , patriot and publicist known for his publications and research regarding the life of Bulgarian revolutioner Vasil Levski .
Hugh Fortescue , 4th Earl Fortescue KCB ( 16 April 1854 -- 29 October 1932 ) , styled Viscount Ebrington from 1861 to 1905 , was an English Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1881 until 1892 and later in the House of Lords having inherited his father 's peerages .
José María de Pereda ( born 6 February 1833 , Polanco , Cantabria -- died 1 March 1906 , Polanco ) was a modern Spanish novelists , and a Member of the Royal Spanish Academy .
Giora Romm ( Hebrew : גיורא רום‎ , born 1945 ) is a former deputy commander of the Israeli Air Force ( IAF ) , Israel 's former military attaché in the United States and the current director of the Civil Aviation Authority of Israel .
William Henry Wilkins ( 1860 - -1905 ) was an English writer , best known as a royal biographer and campaigner for immigration controls .
Gaston Jèze ( Toulouse , March 2 , 1869 -- August 5 , 1953 in Deauville ) was a French academic , humanitarian and Human Rights activist .
Andriy Shkil ( Ukrainian : Андрі́й Васи́льович Шкіль ; Andriy Vasilovich Shkil ) is a Ukrainian politician .
Frank Ripploh ( September 2 , 1949 -- June 22 , 2002 ) was a German actor , film director , and author .
Bhagyalakshmi ( Malayalam : ഭാഗ്യലക്ഷ്മി ; born 1 November 1962 ) is a leading dubbing artist of Malayalam film industry .
Nina Auerbach ( born May 24 , 1943 in New York City ) is the John Welsh Centennial Professor of English Emerita at the University of Pennsylvania .
Turhan Feyzioğlu ( 1922 -- 24 March 1988 ) was a Turkish academic and a politician .
Jaromír Štětina ( born April 6 , 1943 in Prague ) is a Czech journalist , writer and politician .
Maurice Halbwachs ( French : ( mɔˈʁis ˈalbvaks ) ; 11 March 1877 -- 16 March 1945 ) was a French philosopher and sociologist known for developing the concept of collective memory .
Gyula Madarász ( 3 May 1858 -- 29 December 1931 ) , also known as Julius von Madarász , was a Hungarian ornithologist and nature artist , who worked at the Hungarian National Museum .
Jacopo Facciolati ( 1682 - -1769 ) was an Italian lexicographer and philologist .
Enguerrand de Marigny ( 1260 -- April 30 , 1315 ) was a French chamberlain and minister of Philip IV the Fair .
Georg Pencz ( c. 1500 -- 11 October 1550 ) was a German engraver , painter and printmaker .
Gustave Malécot ( December 28 , 1911 -- November 1998 ) was a French mathematician whose work on heredity had a strong influence on population genetics .
Stanoje Stanojević ( Serbian Cyrillic : Станоје Станојевић ; 1874 in Novi Sad -- 1937 in Belgrade ) was a Serbian historian , university professor , academic and a leader of many scientific and publishing enterprises .
Peter Häberle ( born 13 May 1934 in Göppingen , Baden - Württemberg ) is a German legal scholar , specialising in constitutional law .
Vittorio Monti ( 6 January 1868 -- 20 June 1922 ) was an Italian composer , violinist , mandolinist and conductor .
Jacques Rohault ( French : ( ʁɔ.o ) ; 1618 - -1672 ) was a French philosopher , physicist and mathematician , and a follower of Cartesianism .
Giulio Claro ( or Clarus ) ( 1525 - -1575 ) was an Italian jurist .
Salama Moussa ( or Musa ; 1887 -- 4 August 1958 ) ( Arabic : سلامه موسى‎ pronounced ( sæˈlæːmæ ˈmuːsæ ) ) , born into a wealthy , land owning Coptic family in the town of Zagazig located in the Nile delta , Egypt .
Jean - Émile Charon ( Paris , 25 February 1920 -- Paris , June 1998 ) was a French nuclear physicist , philosopher and writer .
Rafael Rodríguez Mohedano ( 1725 - -1787 ) was a Spanish Franciscan , historian and writer .
Martin Schanz ( 12 June 1842 -- 15 December 1914 ) was a German classicist and Plato scholar .
Dominique Alexandre Godron ( March 25 , 1807 - August 16 , 1880 ) was a French physician and botanist born in the town of Hayange , in the département Moselle .
Mario de Carvalho ( born 25 September 1944 in Lisbon ) is a Portuguese playwright and novelist .
Petra Hartmann ( born 1970 in Hildesheim ) is a German literature scientist , journalist and author .
Raveneau de Lussan ( born 1663 in Paris ) was a French buccaneer .
Nicole Loraux ( 26 April 1943 -- 6 April 2003 ) was a French historian of classical Athens .
Henri Fursy or Furcy ( real name Henri Dreyfus , 26 February 1866 - 14 April 1929 ) was a French cabaret singer , director and lyricist .
Mesut Özil ( German pronunciation : ( ˈmeːzut ˈøːzil ) , Turkish : ( meˈsut ˈøzil ) ; born 15 October 1988 ) is a German footballer who plays for English club Arsenal and the German national team .
Maxime Jacob , or Dom Clément Jacob , ( 13 January 1906 , Bordeaux -- 26 February 1977 , Abbaye En - Calcat , Dourgne , Tarn ) was a French composer and organist .
François Le Diascorn ( Born January 10 , 1947 at La Flèche , near Mans , Sarthe département ) is a French photographer , close to the humanist school , who has developed a poetic vision of the world through his unusual images in which a dream - like world seems to superimpose itself upon reality .
Alexander Granach ( April 18 , 1893 -- March 14 , 1945 ) was a popular German actor in the 1920s and 1930s who later migrated to the United States .
Ana Francisca Abarca de Bolea ( 1602 - -1685 ) was a Spanish writer and poet born in Zaragoza on 19 April 1602 and died in Casbas ( Huesca ) around 1685 .
Haim Yisraeli ( Hebrew : חיים ישראלי‎;‎ 1927 -- 7 June 2011 ) was a senior Israeli civil servant .
Tomislav Ivančić ( born 1938 ) is a Croatian theologian and academic .
Feliks Topolski RA ( 14 August 1907 -- 24 August 1989 ) was a Polish expressionist painter and draughtsman working primarily in the United Kingdom .
John Amyand ( 6 November 1751 - 5 June 1780 ) was an English Whig politician .
Peter Jonas Bergius ( born 1730 in Kronoberg , Sweden - died 1790 ) was a Swedish medical doctor and botanist .
Samuel Crawley ( 16 December 1790 -- 21 December 1852 ) was an English Whig and Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons variously between 1818 and 1841 .
Carlos Labbé ( Spanish pronunciation : ( ˈkaɾlos laˈβe ) ) is a Chilean fiction writer born at Santiago de Chile in 1977 .
Albert Manent i Segimon ( 23 September 1930 -- 14 April 2014 ) was a Spanish writer and cultural activist .
Franco Arcalli ( 18 July 1929 - 24 February 1978 ) , also known as Kim Arcalli , was an Italian film editor and screenwriter best known for his work with Bernardo Bertolucci and Michelangelo Antonioni .
Frederick Luis Aldama is Arts and Humanities Distinguished Professor of English and University Distinguished Scholar at The Ohio State University , United States .
Paul Dubreil ( French : ( dybʁɛj ) ; 1 March 1904 -- 9 March 1994 ) was a French mathematician .
Théodule - Armand Ribot ( December 18 , 1839 -- December 9 , 1916 ) , French psychologist , was born at Guingamp , and was educated at the Lycée de St Brieuc .
Ilia Beshkov Dunov ( Bulgarian : Илия Бешков Дунов ; 24 July 1901 -- 23 January 1958 ) was a Bulgarian artist ( painter , graphic artist , cartoonist and illustrator ) , writer and pedagogue .
Rabbi Elazar ben Moshe Azikri ( Hebrew : אלעזר בן משה אזכרי‎ ) ( 1533 - -1600 ) was a Jewish kabbalist , poet and writer , born in Safed to a Sephardic family who had settled in the Land of Israel after the expulsion from Spain .
Joseph Kürschner ( 20 September 1853 , in Gotha -- 29 July 1902 , on a journey to Huben ) was a German author and editor most often cited for his critical edition of classics from German literature .
Ernst Friedrich Karl Rosenmüller ( December 10 , 1768 -- September 17 , 1835 ) was a German Orientalist and Protestant theologian born in Heßberg , which is now a part of Veilsdorf in the District of Hildburghausen , Thuringia .
Jean Meslier ( French : ( melje ) ; also Mellier ; 15 June 1664 -- 17 June 1729 ) , was a French Catholic priest ( abbé ) who was discovered , upon his death , to have written a book - length philosophical essay promoting atheism .
Ferdinando Fontana ( 30 January 1850 -- 10 May 1919 ) was an Italian journalist , dramatist , and poet .
Régis Blachère ( 30 June 1900 -- 7 August 1973 ) was a French orientalist and translator of the Qur'an .
Jacques Briard ( born November 7 , 1933 in Saint - Malo , France -- died June 14 , 2002 in Chantepie , France ) was a French prehistoric archaeologist .
Feliks Tych ( 31 July 1929 , Warsaw , Poland -- 16 February 2015 , Warsaw , Poland ) was a Polish Jewish historian and educator .
Admiral comte Pierre André de Suffren de Saint Tropez , bailli de Suffren ( 17 July 1729 -- 8 December 1788 ) , French admiral .
Manuel Francisco Álvarez de la Peña ( 1727 - -1797 ) , Spanish sculptor , was born at Salamanca .
Giuseppe Bardari ( 27 May 1817 -- 22 September 1861 ) was an Italian lawyer and writer .
Charles Étienne Louis Camus ( 25 August 1699 -- 2 February 1768 ) , was a French mathematician and mechanician who was born at Crécy - en - Brie , near Meaux .
Antoine Johannot , known commonly as Tony Johannot ( 9 November 1803 -- 4 August 1852 ) , was a French engraver , illustrator and painter .
Pierre Cally ( 25 September 1630 -- 31 December 1709 ) was a French Catholic Cartesian philosopher and theologian .
Romano Bilenchi ( 1909 - 1989 ) was an Italian novelist , short story writer and essayist .
Hedda Zinner , or Hedda Erpenbeck - Zinner ( 20 May 1905 -- 7 January 1994 ) was a German political writer , actress , comedienne , journalist and radio director .
Nigel North ( born 5 June 1954 ) is an English lutenist , musicologist , and pedagogue .
Jean - Baptiste Corneille ( 2 December 1649 -- 12 April 1695 ) was a French painter , etcher , and engraver .
William Aldam ( 20 August 1813 -- 27 July 1890 ) was an English Liberal Party politician and MP for the Yorkshire constituency of Leeds between 1841 and 1847 .
Domenico Tempio ( 1750 - -1821 ) was an Italian writer who mainly wrote in the Sicilian language or dialect .
Al - Mufaddal ibn Abi al - Fada'il ( Arabic : المفضل بن ابي الفضائل‎ ) was a 14th - century Egyptian historian .
Viktor Golyshev ( born 1937 ) is a well - known English - to - Russian translator .
Lluís Llach i Grande ( Catalan pronunciation : ( ʎuˈiz ˈʎak ) ) ( born 7 May 1948 in Girona , Catalonia , Spain ) is a Catalan composer and singer - songwriter .
Maurice Klippel ( 30 May 1858 -- 20 July 1942 ) was a French physician for whom the conditions Klippel - Feil syndrome and Klippel - Trenaunay - Weber syndrome are named .
Eileen Chang ( simplified Chinese : 张爱玲 ; traditional Chinese : 張愛玲 ; pinyin : Zhāng Ailíng ; Cantonese Yale : Zoeng Oiling ) ( September 30 , 1920 -- September 8 , 1995 ) was one of the most influential modern Chinese writers .
Hamid Notghi ( Persian : حمید نطقی‎‎ , 1920 - -1999 ) was an Iranian poet , writer , author , university professor .
Gérard Corbiau ( French : ( kɔʁbjo ) ; born 19 September 1941 ) is a Belgian film director .
Ernest Vessiot ( French : ( vesjo ) ; March 8 , 1865 -- October 17 , 1952 ) was a French mathematician .
The President of the Region of Murcia , ( Spanish : Presidente de la Región de Murcia ) is the head of government of the Spanish autonomous community of the Region of Murcia .
Maurice Duverger ( 5 June 1917 -- 16 December 2014 ) was a French jurist , sociologist and politician .
Donald Gee ( 1891 - -1966 ) was an English Pentecostal Bible Teacher .
Stefano della Bella ( 18 May 1610 -- 12 July 1664 ) was an Italian draughtsman and printmaker known for etchings of a great variety of subjects , including military and court scenes , landscapes , and lively genre scenes .
Samuel Elias Sawbridge ( 7 January 1769 - 27 May 1850 ) was an English politician who sat in the House of Commons of Great Britain and then of the United Kingdom from 1796 to 1797 and in 1807 .
Conrad Janninck ( `` Conrad Janningus '' in Latin ) was one of the Bollandists who worked on the Acts of the Saints .
Franco Zeffirelli , KBE Grande Ufficiale OMRI ( Italian pronunciation : ( ˈfraŋko ddzeffiˈrɛlli ) ; born 12 February 1923 ) is an Italian director and producer of operas , films and television .
Nawaf Massalha ( Arabic : نواف مصالحة‎ , Hebrew : נואף מסאלחה‎ , born 26 November 1943 , also spelt Nawaf Mazalha or Nawaf Masalha ) is an Israeli Arab politician .
Jyothirmayi is an Indian actress , model and television personality , who has primarily worked in Malayalam cinema .
Rabi Ghosh ( Bengali : রবি ঘোষ ) ( 24 November 1931 -- 4 February 1997 ) was an Indian actor who worked in Bengali cinema .
Rastko Petrović ( Belgrade , 3 March 1898 -- Washington , D.C. , 15 August 1949 ) was a Serbian poet , writer , diplomat , literary and art critic .
Chairil Anwar ( 26 July 1922 -- 28 April 1949 ) was an Indonesian poet and member of the `` 1945 generation '' of writers .
Hazari Prasad Dwivedi ( August 19 , 1907 -- May 19 , 1979 ) was a Hindi novelist , literary historian , essayist , critic and scholar .
Johannes Heinrich Schultz ( June 20 , 1884 -- September 19 , 1970 ) was a German psychiatrist and an independent psychotherapist .
Gaius Valgius Rufus , Latin poet , friend of Horace and Maecenas , and consul in 12 BC . He was known as a writer of elegies and epigrams , and his contemporaries believed him capable of great things in epic .
Thomas Tidholm ( born in Örebro on 11 April 1943 ) is a Swedish children 's writer , poet , playwright , photographer , translator , and musician .
Joseph Rawson Lumby ( 1831 - -1895 ) was an English cleric , academic and author and divine , Norrisian Professor of Divinity from 1879 and then Lady Margaret 's Professor of Divinity from 1892 .
Júlio Dantas , GCC ( 1876 in Lagos -- 1962 in Lisboa ) was a Portuguese doctor , poet , journalist , politician , diplomat and dramatist .
Stacy Doris ( May 21 , 1962 -- January 31 , 2012 ) was a poet who wrote in English and French .
Hannes Wader ( born Hans Eckard Wader on 23 June 1942 ) is a German singer - songwriter ( `` Liedermacher '' ) .
Anna Ancher ( 18 August 1859 -- 15 April 1935 ) was a Danish artist associated with the Skagen Painters , an artists ' colony on the northern point of Jutland , Denmark .
Aron Cotruș ( 2 January 1891 - 1 November 1961 ) was a Romanian poet and diplomat who was a supporter of the fascist Iron Guard .
John Creemer Clarke ( 1821 -- 11 February 1895 ) was an English merchant and manufacturer and a Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1874 to 1885 .
Niklas Luhmann ( December 8 , 1927 -- November 6 , 1998 ) was a German sociologist , and a prominent thinker in systems theory , who is increasingly recognized as one of the most important social theorists of the 20th century .
Nida Jay ( born September 2 , 1985 ) is a Pakistani novelist who writes in the English language .
Jürgen Kocka ( born 19 April 1941 , in Haindorf ) is a German historian .
Adam Asnyk ( 11 September 1838 -- 2 August 1897 ) , was a Polish poet and dramatist of the Positivist era .
Jeong Cheol ( 정철 , 1536 - -1593 ) was a Korean statesman and poet .
Moritz Lazarus ( 15 September 1824 -- 13 April 1903 ) , born at Filehne , in the Prussian province of Posen , was a German philosopher , psychologist , and a vocal opponent of the antisemitism of his time .
Jean - Louis - Marc Alibert ( May 2 , 1768 -- November 4 , 1837 ) was a French dermatologist born in Villefranche - de - Rouergue , Aveyron .
Hans Gerhard Gräf ( 1864 - -1942 ) was a German Goethe specialist .
Wilhelm Siegmund Teuffel ( German : ( ˈtɔɪfəl ) ; September 27 , 1820 -- March 8 , 1878 ) , German classical scholar , was born at Ludwigsburg in the Kingdom of Württemberg .
Samuel Thomas von Sömmerring ( 28 January 1755 -- 2 March 1830 ) was a German physician , anatomist , anthropologist , paleontologist and inventor .
Joseph Jules Dejerine ( 3 August 1849 -- 26 February 1917 ) , was a French neurologist .
Albrycht Stanisław Radziwiłł ( July 1 , 1595 -- November 12 , 1656 ) was a Polish nobleman , a Reichfürst and a politician from Polish - Lithuanian Commonwealth , who served as the Lesser Lithuanian Chancellor from 1619 , the Grand Chancellor of Lithuania and Governor of Vilnius from 1623 .
Giovanni Cantoni ( 31 December 1818 -- 15 July 1897 ) was an Italian physicist and political figure .
María Carmen Amoraga Toledo ( born 1969 ) is a Spanish writer .
Ettore Pozzoli ( July 23 , 1873 -- November 9 , 1957 ) was an Italian classical pianist and composer .
Hermann Rolfus ( b. at Freiburg , 24 May 1821 ; d. at Bühl , near Offenburg , 27 October 1896 ) was a German Roman Catholic priest and educator .
Szymon Szymonowic ( in Latin , Simon Simonides ; in Armenian , Շիմոն Շիմոնովիչ ; also , in Polish , `` Szymonowicz '' and `` Bendoński '' ; born Lwów , 24 October 1558 -- died 5 May 1629 , Czarnięcin , near Zamość ) was a Polish Renaissance poet .
Heinrich Joseph Wetzer ( Anzefahr , Hesse - Kassel ( or Hesse - Cassel ) , 19 March 1801 -- Freiburg , Baden , 5 November 1853 ) was a German Orientalist .
Jacques Antoine Charles Bresse ( 9 October 1822 , Vienne , Isère -- 22 May 1883 ) was a French civil engineer who specialized in the design and use of hydraulic motors .
Ritwik Ghatak ( Bengali : ঋত্বিক কুমার ঘটক , Ritbik Kumar Ghôţôk , listen ; 4 November 1925 -- 6 February 1976 ) was a Bengali filmmaker and script writer .
Louis - Joseph - Raphaël Collin ( 17 June 1850 -- 21 October 1916 ) was a French painter born and raised in Paris , where he became a prominent academic painter and a teacher .
Paweł Kubisz ( 12 May 1907 -- 19 August 1968 ) was a Polish poet , writer , journalist , and activist , one of the most important poets from the Zaolzie region of Cieszyn Silesia .
Bevis Hillier ( born 28 March 1940 ) is an English art historian , author and journalist .
Alberto Piazza ( born 1941 ) is an Italian human geneticist , Professor of Human Genetics at the University of Turin .
Atle Selberg ( 14 June 1917 -- 6 August 2007 ) was a Norwegian mathematician known for his work in analytic number theory , and in the theory of automorphic forms , in particular bringing them into relation with spectral theory .
Count Luigi Ferdinando Marsili or Marsigli ( Lat . Marsilius , 10 July 1658 -- 1 November 1730 ) , was an Italian - born scholar and eminent natural scientist , who also served as an emissary and soldier .
Fahadh Faasil is an Indian film actor known for his work in Malayalam cinema .
Martín de Mayorga Ferrer ( September 12 , 1721 in Barcelona , Spain -- 1783 in Spain ) was a Spanish military officer , governor of the Captaincy General of Guatemala ( from June 1773 to 1779 ) , and interim viceroy of New Spain ( from August 23 , 1779 to April 28 , 1783 ) .
Jules Simon Troubat ( 1836 - -1914 ) was a French littérateur , born at Montpellier .
Oduvil Unnikrishnan ( 13 February 1944 -- 27 May 2006 ) was an award - winning Indian film actor known for his versatile acting skills , shown in his portrayal of classical ancient aristocratic personalities in Malayalam cinema with his unique provincial linguistic style , expressions and dialect .
Otokar Fischer ( 20 May 1883 -- 12 March 1938 ) was a Czech translator , playwright , poet and critic .
Shammu ( Tamil:ஷம்மு ; born Sheerin Ramalingam on 14 June 1992 ) is an Indian actress who appears in Tamil films .
Hans Heinz Stuckenschmidt ( 1 November 1901 -- 15 August 1988 ) was a German composer , musicologist , and historian and critic of music .
John Italus or Italos ( Greek : Ἰωάννης ὁ Ἰταλός , Iōannēs o Italós ; Latin : Johannes Italus ) was a Neoplatonic Byzantine philosopher of the eleventh century .
Yves Allégret ( French : ( aleɡʁɛ ) ; 13 October 1905 -- 31 January 1987 ) was a French film director , often working in the film noir genre .
Marcin Baran ( born 1963 in Kraków ) is a Polish poet and journalist .
Sait Faik Abasıyanık ( 18 November 1906 -- 11 May 1954 ) was one of the greatest Turkish writers of short stories and poetry and considered an important literary figure of the 1940s .
Gregorio Morales ( 7 July 1952 -- 22 June 2015 ) , was a Spanish novelist .
Albertanus of Brescia ( Italian : Albertano da Brescia , ca . 1195 -- ca . 1251 ) , author of Latin social treatises and sermons .
Jean - Marc Lofficier ( born June 22 , 1954 ) is a French author of books about films and television programs , as well as numerous comics and translations of a number of animation screenplays .
Sergio Sollima ( April 17 , 1921 -- July 1 , 2015 ) was an Italian film director and script writer .
Catherine David ( born 1954 ) is a French art historian , curator and museum director .
Robert - François Damiens ( French pronunciation : ​(ʁɔbɛʁ fʁɑ̃swa damjɛ̃ ) ; 9 January 1715 -- 28 March 1757 ) was a French domestic servant whose attempted assassination of King Louis XV of France in 1757 culminated in his notorious and controversial public execution .
Arthur Robison ( June 25 , 1883 -- October 20 , 1935 ) was a German film director and screenwriter of the silent era .
Louis Bontes ( Dutch pronunciation : ( luˈi ˈbɔntəs ) ; born 28 February 1956 ) is a Dutch politician and former police officer .
Domenico da Cortona called `` Boccador '' ( ca 1465 -- ca 1549 ) was an Italian architect , a pupil of Giuliano da Sangallo .
A Trotskyist in his teenage years , François Duprat moved to the far right and became a member of the Jeune Nation wing of the French nationalist students ' federation ( Fédération des étudiants nationalistes FEN ) .
Anastas Al - Karmali ( Arabic : أنستاس الكرملي‎ ) , literally Anastas the Carmelite aka Père Anastase - Marie de Saint - Élie ( b. 5 Aug 1866-d . 1947 Jan 7 ) was a Lebanese Christian priest , most famed for his contributions to the field of Arabic linguistics .
Alix d'Unienville , MBE , LdeH , CdeG ( 8 May 1918 -- 10 November 2015 ) was a member of the Special Operations Executive ( SOE ) during World War II and worked as a courier for the French Section .
Youssef Chahine ( Arabic : يوسف شاهين‎ ; 25 January 1926 -- 27 July 2008 ) was an Egyptian film director , active in the Egyptian film industry from 1950 until his death .
Gitte Seeberg ( born on 25 June 1960 in Copenhagen ) is a Danish politician , lawyer , and current secretary general of the Danish branch of the WWF .
Magens Dorrien Magens ( ca . 1768 -- 30 May 1849 ) of Hammerwood Lodge , Sussex , was an English banker , Member of Parliament and author .
Antonio Blanco Freijeiro ( September 6 , 1923 - January 6 , 1991 ) was a Spanish archaeologist and historian .
Ludwig Gotthard Kosegarten ( 1 February 1758 -- 26 October 1818 ) , also known as Ludwig Theobul or Ludwig Theoboul , was a German poet and Lutheran preacher .
Ross Donnelly Mangles ( 1801 -- 1877 ) was an English politician , Member of Parliament for Guildford between 1841 and 1857 .
General Jean Joseph Amable Humbert ( 22 August 1767 -- 3 January 1823 ) was a French soldier , a participant in the French Revolution , who led a failed invasion of Ireland to assist Irish rebels in 1798 .
Louise von Gall ( 19 September 1815 , Darmstadt -- 16 March 1855 , Augsburg ) was a nineteenth - century German novelist and social critic .
Bolesław Wallek - Walewski ( born 23 January 1885 in Lviv , died 9 April 1944 in Kraków ) was a Polish composer and conductor , lecturer and Director of the Conservatory of Music in Kraków .
Josep Abril i Virgili ( 1869 - 1918 ) was a self - taught Catalan poet and playwright .
Jean Benner ( 28 March 1836 , Mulhouse -- 28 October 1906 , Paris ) was a French artist , and twin to fellow artist , Emmanuel Benner .
Célestin Port ( 23 May 1828 -- 4 March 1901 ) was a French archivist and historian .
Augusto Fantozzi ( born 24 June 1940 ) is an Italian lawyer , tax expert , academic , businessman and politician who served as economy and finance minister and then , foreign trade minister .
Verney Lovett Cameron ( 1 July 1844 -- 24 March 1894 ) was an English traveller in Central Africa and the first European to cross ( 1875 ) equatorial Africa from sea to sea .
María Goyri de Menéndez Pidal ( 1873 - -1955 ) was a Spanish Hispanist , literary critic , researcher , educator and advocate for women 's rights .
Caryl Brahms , born Doris Caroline Abrahams ( 8 December 1901 -- 5 December 1982 ) , was an English critic , novelist , and journalist specialising in the theatre and ballet .
David Flusser ( Hebrew : דוד פלוסר ) ( born 1917 ; died 2000 ) was a professor of Early Christianity and Judaism of the Second Temple Period at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem .
Marie - Félicité Brosset ( January 24 , 1802 -- September 22 , 1880 ) was a French orientalist who specialized in Georgian and Armenian studies .
Pere d'Abella was a 15th - century Catalan poet .
Yaakov Shabtai ( 1934 - -81 ) ( Hebrew : יעקב שבתאי‎ ) was an Israeli novelist , playwright , and translator .
Kåre Fasting ( 1907 -- 1983 ) was a Norwegian journalist , newspaper editor , novelist , biographer and non - fiction writer .
Manuel Altolaguirre ( 29 June 1905 -- 26 July 1959 ) was a Spanish poet , an editor , publisher , and printer of poetry , and a member of the Generation of ' 27 .
Abdeljelil Temimi , also transliterated as Abdoljalil Tamimi ( Arabic : عبد الجليل التميمي‎ ; born July 21 , 1938 ) , is a Tunisian historian .
Benvenuto Cellini ( Italian pronunciation : ( bemveˈnuːto tʃelˈliːni ) ; 3 November 1500 -- 13 February 1571 ) was an Italian goldsmith , sculptor , draftsman , soldier , musician , and artist who also wrote a famous autobiography and poetry .
Josep Soler i Sardà ( born 25 March 1935 in Vilafranca del Penedès ) is a Spanish composer , writer and music theorist , one of the main Catalan members of the Generación del 51 .
The last , and perhaps most popular , version of the legend of Macías appeared in the mid-16th century in the Historia de la nobleza del Andalucía by Gonzalo Argote de Molina ( in Spanish ) .
Per Erik Rundquist ( 1912 -- 1986 ) was a Swedish novelist and poet .
Lucien Musset ( August 26 , 1922 -- December 15 , 2004 ) was a French historian , specializing in the Duchy of Normandy and the history of the Vikings .
Álvaro Barreirinhas Cunhal , who used the name Álvaro Cunhal ( Portuguese pronunciation : ( ˈaɫvɐɾu kuˈɲaɫ ) ; 10 November 1913 -- 13 June 2005 ) , was a Portuguese communist revolutionary and politician .
Licia Ronzulli ( born : Milan , Italy 14 September 1975 ) is an Italian MEP representing the New Forza Italia party .
Gotthilf Heinrich von Schubert ( 26 April 1780 , in Hohenstein - Ernstthal -- 30 June 1860 , in Laufzorn , a village in Oberhaching ) was a German physician and naturalist .
Sir William Lowther , 3rd Baronet ( 1727 -- 15 April 1756 ) was an English landowner , of Marske Hall , Yorkshire and Holker Hall .
Johann Heinrich Tischbein the Elder , called the Kasseler , ( 3 October 1722 -- 22 August 1789 ) was one of the most respected European painters in the 18th century and an important member of the Tischbein dynasty of German painters , which spanned four generations .
José Félix Tapia Ruiz ( born Madrid , 1910 - Madrid , 1969 ) was a Spanish writer and journalist .
Pierre Dukan is a French medical doctor and nutritionist , and the creator of the famous Dukan Diet .
Kalpana Kartik ( born Mona Singha ) is a former Hindi film actress .
Philippe Ardant ( July 21 , 1929 -- June 6 , 2007 ) was a French jurist , former president of the Constitutional Court of the principality of Andorra , former president of the Arab World Institute and former president of Panthéon - Assas University .
Caroline Rudolphi ( also Karoline ; 1753 - -1811 ) was a German educationist and poet .
Pierre - Joseph Candeille ( 8 December 1744 - -24 April 1827 ) was a French composer and singer , born in Estaires .
Julien Vinson ( 21 January 1843 -- 21 November 1926 ) was a French linguist who specialized in the languages of India , mainly Tamil , and also in the Basque language .
Bernard Cribbins , OBE ( born 29 December 1928 ) is an English character actor , voice - over artist and musical comedian with a career spanning over seventy years .
Sir Anthony Hope Hawkins , better known as Anthony Hope ( 9 February 1863 -- 8 July 1933 ) , was an English novelist and playwright .
Louis Lazare Hoche ( 24 June 1768 -- 19 September 1797 ) was a French soldier who rose to be general of the Revolutionary army .
Shin Kanemaru ( 金丸 信 Kanemaru Shin ) , 17 September 1914 - 28 March 1996 ) was a Japanese politician who was a significant figure in the political arena of Japan from the 1970s to the early 1990s .
Dominique Sourdel ( 1921 , Pont - Sainte - Maxence -- 4 March 2014 ) was a French historian who specialized in Medieval Islam .
Elio Filippo Accrocca ( 17 April 1923 -- 11 March 1996 ) was an Italian poet , author , and translator .
Johann Gottfried Stallbaum ( September 25 , 1793 - January 24 , 1861 ) , German classical scholar , was born at Zaasch , near Delitzsch in Saxony .
Louis Boudan ( 16??--17 ? ? ) was an artist who worked for François Roger de Gaignières , a French genealogist , antiquary and collector who was active in the late 17th and early 18th centuries .
Victor of Tunnuna ( in Latin Victor Tunnunensis ) ( died circa 570 ) was Bishop of the North African town of Tunnuna , a chronicler from Late Antiquity , and considered a martyr by Isidore of Seville .
Milan Knížák ( Czech : ( ˈmɪlan ˈkɲiːʒaːk ) ; born 19 April 1940 ) is a Czech performance artist , sculptor , musician , installation artist , dissident , graphic artist , art theorist and pedagogue of art .
Lucien Denis Gabriel Albéric Magnard ( French pronunciation : ​(lysjɑ̃ dəni ɡabʁijɛl albeʁik maɲaːʁ ) ; 9 June 1865 -- 3 September 1914 ) was a French composer , sometimes referred to as the `` French Bruckner '' , though there are significant differences between the two composers .
Lance Comfort ( 11 August 1908 -- 25 August 1966 ) was an English film director and producer born in Harrow , London .
He was known artistically as Salvador Videgain , was a theatrical entrepreneur , author , actor , theater director , Spanish .
Taneli Kuusisto ( 19 June 1905 -- 30 March 1988 ) was a Finnish composer , music critic , teacher and choir leader .
Nicolas Rapin ( 1535 -- 16 February 1608 ) was a French Renaissance magistrate , royal officer , translator , poet and satirist , known for being one of the authors of the Satire Ménippée ( 1593/4 ) and an outspoken critic of the excesses of the Holy League during the Wars of Religion .
Friedrich Wilhelm Otto Modersohn ( 22 February 1865 , Soest - 10 March 1943 , Rotenburg ) was a German landscape painter .
Gertrudis Gómez de Avellaneda y Arteaga ( March 23 , 1814 -- February 1 , 1873 ) was a 19th - century Cuban - born Spanish writer .
Stefanie Zweig ( 19 September 1932 -- 25 April 2014 ) was a German Jewish writer and journalist .
Henri Rabaud ( 10 November 1873 -- 11 September 1949 ) was a French conductor and composer , who held important posts in the French musical establishment and upheld mainly conservative trends in French music in the first half of the twentieth century .
Michael Weiße or Weisse ( c. 1488 -- 19 March 1534 ) was a German theologian and hymn writer .
Claude de Mesmes , comte d'Avaux ( 1595 - -1650 ) was a 17th - century French diplomat and public administrator , one of France 's leading diplomats in the first half of the century .
Ismat Chughtai ( Urdu : عصمت چغتائی‎ ) ( August 1915 -- 24 October 1991)1 was an eminent Indian writer in Urdu , known for her indomitable spirit and a fierce feminist ideology .
Flavio Medina ( Spanish pronunciation : ( ˈflaβjo meˈðina ) ; born ; April 19 , 1978 ) is a Mexican actor .
Maurice Nicolle ( 1 March 1862 -- 20 August 1932 ) was a French physician and microbiologist born in Rouen .
Fyodor Sologub ( Russian : Фёдор Сологу́б , born Fyodor Kuzmich Teternikov , Russian : Фёдор Кузьми́ч Тете́рников , also known as Theodor Sologub ; March 1 ( O.S. February 17 ) 1863 -- December 5 , 1927 ) was a Russian Symbolist poet , novelist , playwright and essayist .
Stefano Guazzo ( 1530 - -1593 ) was an Italian writer from Casale Monferrato .
Abdul Samad Ismail ( 18 April 1924 -- 4 September 2008 ) , who often went by the moniker Pak Samad , was a Malaysian journalist , writer and editor .
Frode Grytten ( born 11 December 1960 in Bergen , but grew up in Odda ) is a Norwegian writer and journalist .
Lelio Lagorio ( born 9 November 1925 ) is an Italian politician who served as the first President of Tuscany from 1970 until 1978 .
Margarita Nelken ( 1894 - -1968 ) was a Spanish feminist and writer .
Nadje Sadig Al - Ali ( Arabic : نادية صادق العلي‎ ) is the author of Iraqi Women :
Patrick Blanc ( born June 3 , 1953 , Paris ) is a French botanist , working at the French National Centre for Scientific Research , where he specializes in plants from tropical forests .
Randeep Hooda ( pronounced ( rɳd̪iːp huːɖaː ) ; born 20 August 1976 ) is an Indian film actor who appears in Hindi - language films .
Filippo Buonaccorsi , called `` Callimachus '' ( Latin : Philippus Callimachus Experiens , Bonacursius ; Polish : Filip Kallimach ; 2 May 1437 -- 1 November 1496 ) was an Italian humanist and writer .
Ciro Procuna is a Latin sports announcer for ESPN Deportes ( ESPN in Spanish in the United States ) .
Óscar Pujol Muñoz ( born 16 October 1983 ) is a Spanish professional cyclist , who currently rides for Team Ukyo .
Jānis Poruks ( 13 October 1871 -- 25 July 1911 ) , was a Latvian poet and writer could be considered as a founder of the romantic branch of Latvian literature .
Koldo Mitxelena Elissalt ( Basque pronunciation : ( koldo mitʃelena ) ) ( also known as Luis Michelena ; 1915 , Errenteria , Gipuzkoa -- 11 October 1987 , San Sebastián ) was an eminent Basque linguist .
Claire Colebrook ( or Claire Mary Colebrook ) ( born 25 October 1965 ) , is an Australian cultural theorist , currently appointed Edwin Erle Sparks Professor of English at Pennsylvania State University .
Hudson Gurney ( 1775 - -1864 ) was an English antiquary and verse - writer , also known as a politician .
Lamberto Puggelli ( 1938 -- 11 August 2013 ) was an Italian stage and opera director .
Tristram Stuart ( born 1977 in London ) is an English author and campaigner .
Carlos Sainz Cenamor ( born 12 April 1962 in Madrid , Spain ) is a Spanish former rally driver .
Axel Reymond ( born 13 February 1994 at Paris in France ) is a French Marathon swimmer in open water swimming events ( 5 km ( 3.1 mi ) , 10 km ( 6.2 mi ) et 25 km ( 16 mi ) ) .
Kavya Madhavan is an Indian film actor who predominantly works in Malayalam cinema .
The Venerable Jean - Claude Colin , S.M. was a French priest ( 7 August 1790 - 15 November 1875 ) who became the founder of the Society of Mary ( Marists ) .
Ferdinando Sanfelice ( 1675 -- 1 April 1748 ) was an Italian late Baroque architect and painter .
Marshal of Italy Armando Diaz , 1st Duke of the Victory , OSSA , OSML , OMS , OCI ( 5 December 1861 -- 28 February 1928 ) was an Italian General and a Marshal of Italy .
Giovenale Vegezzi Ruscalla ( 4 December 1799 , Turin , Italy - December 1885 , Turin ) , was a liberal Italian journalist , foreign honorary member of the Romanian Academy , and secretary to the Subalpine Agrarian Association .
Kakarla Tyagabrahmam ( 4 May 1767 -- 6 January 1847 ) or Saint Tyagaraja , also known as Tyāgayya in Telugu or Tyāgarājar in Tamil , was one of the greatest composers of Carnatic music or Indian classical music .
Estíbaliz Urrutia González ( born 22 February 1970 in Bilbao ) is a retired Spanish long - distance runner who specialized in the 5000 metres .
Augustin de Saint - Aubin sometimes styled Auguste de Saint - Aubin ( 3 January 1736 - 9 November 1807 ) , belongs to an important dynasty of French designers and engravers .
Billy Wilder ( /ˈwaɪldər/ ; German : ( ˈvɪldɐ ) ; June 22 , 1906 -- March 27 , 2002 ) was an Austrian - born American filmmaker , screenwriter , producer , artist and journalist , whose career spanned more than fifty years and sixty films .
Professor Andreas Gestrich ( born 3 July 1952 ) is a German historian who has been director of the German Historical Institute London since September 2006 .
Carlo Ridolfi ( 1594 - -1658 ) was an Italian art biographer and painter of the Baroque period .
Guido Basile ( 16 July 1893 , Messina - 1 December 1984 ) was an Italian politician .
William Rawson Shaw ( 1 May 1860 -- 14 April 1932 ) was an English Liberal politician who represented Halifax .
Ilya Glazunov ( Russian : Илья Глазунов ) , contemporary Russian artist from Saint Petersburg , born June 10 , in 1930 .
Bruno Giordano Sanzin ( Trieste , 14 February 1906 -- 12 January 1994 ) was an Italian poet .
Gisela May is a German actress and singer born May 31 , 1924 , in Wetzlar , Rhine Province .
Ion Minulescu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( iˈon minuˈlesku ) ; 6 January 1881 -- 11 April 1944 ) was a Romanian avant - garde poet , novelist , short story writer , journalist , literary critic , and playwright .
James Brindley ( 1716 -- 27 September 1772 ) was an English engineer .
Karidja Touré ( born 14 February 1994 ) is a French actress best known for starring in the film Girlhood .
Gaetano Giulio Zumbo ( 1656 - -1701 ) was an Italian sculptor in wax or wax modeller of the Baroque era .
Filippo Giuseppe Maria Ludovico Buonarroti , more usually referred to under the French version Philippe Buonarroti ( 11 November 1761 -- 16 September 1837 ) , was an Italian utopian socialist , writer , agitator , freemason , and conspirator ; he was active in Corsica , France , and Geneva .
Luigi Dallapiccola ( February 3 , 1904 -- February 19 , 1975 ) was an Italian composer known for his lyrical twelve - tone compositions .
Gábor Döbrentei ( December 1 , 1786 -- March 28 , 1851 ) was a Hungarian philologist and antiquary .
Ventseslav Konstantinov ( Bulgarian : Венцеслав Константинов ) ( born September 14 , 1940 in Sofia ) is a Bulgarian writer , aphorist and translator of German and English literature .
Ogier Ghiselin de Busbecq ( 1522 in Comines -- 28 October 1592 ; Latin : Augerius Gislenius Busbequius ; sometimes Augier Ghislain de Busbecq ) was a 16th - century Flemish writer , herbalist and diplomat in the employ of three generations of Austrian monarchs .
Jan Zachwatowicz ( March 4 , 1900 -- August 18 , 1983 ) was a Polish architect , architectural historian , and restorer .
Narcis Bosch is a Spanish pornographic film director .
Friedrich Wilhelm Basilius von Ramdohr ( 21 July 1757 -- 26 July 1822 ) was a German conservative lawyer , art critic and journalist based in Dresden .
Nguyễn Trọng Trí , penname Hàn Mặc Tử ( September 22 , 1912 - November 11 , 1940 ) was a Vietnamese poet .
Elsa Martinelli ( born Elisa Tia ; 30 January 1935 ) is an Italian actress and former fashion model .
Jeanne Agnès Berthelot de Pléneuf , marquise de Prie ( 1698 -- 7 October 1727 ) , was a French noblewoman who for a brief period exercised extraordinary control of the French court during the reign of Louis XV .
Raphaël Alibert ( 17 February 1887 , Saint - Laurent , Lot -- 5 June 1963 , Paris ) was a French politician .
Tova Ilan ( Hebrew : טובה אילן‎ , born 1 June 1929 ) is an Israeli educator and former politician who briefly served as a member of the Knesset for Meimad between January and April 2006 .
Jean de Coras , also called Corasius ( 1515 - -1572 ) was a French jurist .
Giacomo Torelli ( 1 September 1608 -- 17 June 1678 ) was an Italian stage designer , engineer , and architect .
Pavel Eisner ( 16 January 1889 -- 8 July 1958 ) , also known as Paul Eisner and under the pseudonym Vincy Schwarze , was Czech - German linguist and translator and the author of many studies about Czech language .
Curt Wittlin ( born 1941 , Reinach , Baselland ) is a Swiss philologist and an expert of medieval Catalan language and literature .
William John Swainson FLS , FRS ( 8 October 1789 -- 6 December 1855 ) , was an English ornithologist , malacologist , conchologist , entomologist and artist .
Narciso Pascual Colomer , also known as Narciso Pacual y Colomer , ( 1808 in Valencia -- 1870 in Madrid ) was a Spanish architect .
Violette Lecoq ( 1912 -- 2003 ) was a French nurse , illustrator , and a resistance member during World War II . She is known for her drawings from the Ravensbrück concentration camp , which were also used as evidence at the first Ravensbrück Trials in 1946 .
Jan Erik Vold ( born 18 October 1939 , Oslo ) is a Norwegian lyric poet , Jazz vocal reciter , translator and author .
Charles - Emmanuel Sédillot ( 18 September 1804 -- 29 January 1883 ) was a French military physician and surgeon .
Melchior Acontius ( 1515 , Oberursel ( Taunus ) - 22 June 1569 ) was a German poet at the beginning of the 16th century .
Ernst Wiechert ( 18 May 1887 -- 24 August 1950 ) was a German teacher , poet and writer .
Pooja Bhatt ( Hindi : पूजा भट्ट ; born 24 February 1972 ) is an Indian film actress , voice actress , model and film maker .
Leila Abouzeid ( Arabic : ليلة أبو زيد‎ ) ( born 1950 , El Ksiba ) is a Moroccan author .
Fabrizio Barca ( born 8 March 1954 ) is an Italian senior civil servant and politician , who served as a state minister without portfolio for territorial cohesion in the Monti cabinet from 2011 to 2013 .
Jean - Marie Lehn ( born September 30 , 1939 ) is a French chemist .
Grzegorz Fitelberg ( 18 October 1879 -- 10 June 1953 ) was a Polish conductor , violinist and composer .
Alfred - Armand - Louis - Marie Velpeau ( 18 May 1795 -- 24 August 1867 ) was a French anatomist and surgeon .
Arthur Qwak ( born as François Hemen , December 25 , 1961 ) is a French animator and comic - book writer .
Bikash Roy was an actor in Bengali cinema .
Roselyne Sibille is a French poet who was born in 1953 in France .
Józef Wieniawski ( 23 May 1837 -- 11 November 1912 ) was a Polish pianist , composer , conductor and teacher .
Sargon Boulus ( Syriac : ܣܪܓܢ ܦܘܠܘܨ , Arabic : سركون بولص‎ , 1944 -- October 22 , 2007 ) was an Iraqi - Assyrian poet and short story writer .
Susanna Moodie ( born Strickland ; 6 December 1803 -- 8 April 1885 ) was an English - born Canadian author who wrote about her experiences as a settler in Canada , which was a British colony at the time .
Pradeep Kumar ( Bengali ) ( born Pradeep Batabyal ; 4 January 1925 -- 27 October 2001 ) was an Indian actor in Bengali and Hindi films .
Charles Savile Roundell ( 19 July 1827 -- 3 March 1906 ) was an English cricketer , lawyer and Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons in two periods between 1880 and 1895 .
Victor Massé ( born Félix - Marie Massé ; 7 March 1822 -- 5 July 1884 ) was a French composer .
José Suárez Carreño ( 1915 - -2002 ) was a Spanish writer associated with the Generation of ' 36 movement .
Elihu Thomson ( March 29 , 1853 -- March 13 , 1937 ) was an English - born American engineer and inventor who was instrumental in the founding of major electrical companies in the United States , the United Kingdom and France .
Claude Érignac ( 15 October 1937 -- 6 February 1998 ) was a French prefect on the island of Corsica .
Eugène Lefèvre - Pontalis ( 12 February 1862 -- 31 October 1923 ) was a French medievalist and archeologist .
Vlado Milošević ( Serbian : Владо Милошевић ; 1901 - -1990 ) was a Serbian composer and ethnomusicologist from Banja Luka , Bosnia - Herzegovina .
Miles Joseph Berkeley ( 1 April 1803 -- 30 July 1889 ) was an English cryptogamist and clergyman , and one of the founders of the science of plant pathology .
Stefan Żeromski ( ( ˈstɛfan ʐɛˈrɔmski ) ; 14 October 1864 -- 20 November 1925 ) was a Polish novelist and dramatist .
Birte Weiss ( born 1 May 1941 ) is a Danish journalist and social democrat politician , who served in various capacities in the government of Denmark .
Jean de Schelandre ( c.1585 -- 18 October 1635 ) , Seigneur de Saumazènes , was a French poet .
Sebastián Hurtado de Corcuera ( b. Lantarón , Spain , d. August 12 , 1660 , Tenerife , Canary Islands ) was a Spanish soldier and colonial official .
Erika Mitchell ( born 7 March 1963 ) , known by her pen name E. L. James , is an English author .
Dora Schaul ( born Dora Davidsohn , 21 September 1913 -- 8 August 1999 ) was a German activist whose Jewish provenance made it necessary for her to emigrate after 1933 .
Berthold Konrad Hermann Albert Speer ( German : ( ˈʃpeːɐ̯ ) ; March 19 , 1905 -- September 1 , 1981 ) was a German architect who was , for a part of World War II , Minister of Armaments and War Production for Nazi Germany .
Rosemary Verey , OBE , VMH ( 21 December 1918 in Chatham , Kent -- 31 May 2001 in Cheltenham ) was an internationally known English garden designer , lecturer and prolific garden writer who designed the famous garden at Barnsley House , near Cirencester .
Jomol ( Gowri ) is a popular film actress in Malayalam cinema .
Aditya Roy Kapur ( pronounced ( ədiːtyəˈ royˈ kəˈpuːr ) ; born 16 November 1985 ) is an Indian film actor who works in Hindi films .
Blaže Koneski ( Macedonian : Блаже Конески ) ( December 19 , 1921 -- December 7 , 1993 ) ( born in Nebregovo , near Prilep , Kingdom of Serbs , Croats and Slovenes , now Republic of Macedonia ) was one of the most distinguished Macedonian poets , writers , literary translators , and linguistic scholars .
Henry Care ( 1646 - -1688 ) was an English political writer and journalist , or `` Whig propagandist '' , whose speciality was anti - Catholicism .
Kazimierz Sakowicz ( ? -1944 ) was a Polish journalist .
Fabio Vittorini ( born 19 December 1971 ) is an Italian literary critic , currently Professor of Comparative Literature at IULM University of Milan ( Italy ) He is known for his studies on melodrama and on Italo Svevo .
Serge Baudo ( born 16 July 1927 , Marseille ) is a French conductor , the son of the oboist Étienne Baudo .
Inés Marful ( born June 1965 , Mieres , Spain ) is a Spanish writer from Asturias , known for her works on Federico García Lorca .
Thomas Sternhold ( 1500 - -1549 ) was an English courtier and the principal author of the first English metrical version of the Psalms , originally attached to the Prayer - Book as augmented by John Hopkins .
Pierre Gagnaire ( born 9 April 1950 in Apinac , Loire , France ) is a well known French chef , and is the Head Chef and owner of the eponymous Pierre Gagnaire restaurant at 6 rue Balzac in Paris ( in the 8th arrondissement ) .
Beatriz Hernanz is Spanish poet and critic .
Raffaele Calzini ( 29 December 1885 -- 2 September 1953 ) was an Italian art critic and writer .
Edmond Roudnitska ( 1905 -- 1996 ) was a French master perfumer and author .
Franz Josef Degenhardt ( 3 December 1931 -- 14 November 2011 ) was a German poet , satirist , novelist , and -- first and foremost -- a folksinger / songwriter ( Liedermacher ) with decidedly left - wing politics .
Michelle Perrot ( born 18 May 1928 , Paris ) is a French historian , and Professor emeritus at the Paris Diderot University .
Soheib Bencheikh ( born 1961 , Jeddah , Saudi Arabia ) is an Islamic religious leader and author and would - be French politician .
René de Saussure ( 17 March 1868 -- 2 December 1943 ) was a Swiss Esperantist and professional mathematician ( he defended in 1895 a doctoral thesis on a subject in geometry in Geneva ) , who composed important works about Esperanto and interlinguistics from a linguistic viewpoint .
Norbert Gastell ( 14 October 1929 -- 26 November 2015 ) was an Argentinian - born , German voice actor , who specialized in dubbing .
Kornel Filipowicz ( 27 October 1913 -- 28 February 1990 ) was a Polish novelist , poet and screenwriter , most notable for his short stories .
Gerd Schmückle ( 1 December 1917 -- 28 May 2013 ) was a German four - star general .
Quirino Principe ( Gorizia , 19 November 1935 ) is an Italian philosopher of music , Germanist , translator , dramatist , actor .
Viktor Suvorov ( Russian : Ви́ктор Суво́ров , real name Vladimir Bogdanovich Rezun , Russian : Влади́мир Богда́нович Резу́н , born April 20 , 1947 in Barabash , Primorsky Krai ) is a Russian writer , historian and a former Soviet military intelligence officer who defected to the United Kingdom .
Michal Ajvaz ( born October 30 , 1949 in Prague ) is a Czech novelist , poet and translator , an exponent of the literary style known as magic realism .
Charles Le Goffic ( 14 July 1863 -- 12 February 1932 ) was a French poet , novelist and historian whose influence was especially strong in his native Brittany .
Alejandro Catalán ( El Pobo de Dueñas,11 December 1968 ) better known as Alex Catalán , is a Spanish director of photography , who has worked in more than 20 feature films and other short films which have won several prizes .
Étienne Charles de Loménie de Brienne ( 9 October 1727 -- 19 February 1794 ) was a French churchman , politician and finance minister of Louis XVI .
Frank Le Gall ( born September 23 , 1959 in Rouen ) , is a French author of comics .
André Souris ( French : ( suʁi ) ; 10 July 1899 -- 12 February 1970 ) was a Belgian composer , conductor , musicologist , and writer associated with the surrealist movement .
Alexis Rosenbaum ( born 1969 , in Paris ) is a French essayist .
Domenico Leccisi born 20 May 1920 in Molfetta was an Italian politician best known for stealing the corpse of the fascist dictator Benito Mussolini from an unmarked grave in 1946 .
Khwaja Ahmad Abbas ( Hindi : ख़्वाजा अहमद अब्बास ) ( 7 June 1914 -- 1 June 1987 ) , popularly known as K. A. Abbas , was an Indian film director , novelist , screenwriter , and a journalist in the Urdu , Hindi and English languages .
Pierre Février ( 1696 - -1760 ) was a French baroque composer , organist and harpsichordist .
Joan de Sagarra i Devesa ( Paris , 6 January 1938 ) is a Catalan journalist and writer , son of the poet Josep Maria de Sagarra .
Fernándo Norzagaray y Escudero was a Spanish soldier and colonial governor .
Mogens Rukov ( 4 August 1943 -- 18 December 2015 ) was a Danish screenwriter and playwright .
Jean Broc ( 1771 - -1850 ) was a French Neo - Classical painter .
Henry Currie Leigh - Bennett ( 1852 - 7 March 1903 , Windlesham ) was a Conservative Member of Parliament for the English constituency of Chertsey from 1897 until his death in 1903 .
Imre Makovecz ( November 20 , 1935 -- September 27 , 2011 ) was a Hungarian architect active in Europe from the late 1950s onward .
Ahmed Adnan Saygun ( Turkish pronunciation : ( ahˈmed adˈnan sajˈɡun ) ; 7 September 1907 -- 6 January 1991 ) was a Turkish composer , musicologist and writer on music .
Jean Jouzel , ( born 5 March 1947 ) is a French glaciologist and climatologist .
George Goring , Lord Goring ( 14 July 1608 -- 1657 ) was an English Royalist soldier .
Avdo Humo ( 1 February 1914 -- 24 January 1983 ) was a Yugoslav and Bosnian communist politician , writer and an Order of the People 's Hero recipient .
André - Pierre Nouvion ( born 1939 ) is a French lawyer and historian of French law .
Xuan Bello Fernán ( born 1965 in Tineo , Asturias , Spain ) is a poet and one of the best - known contemporary Asturian writers .
Charles Henry Dessalines d'Orbigny was a French botanist and geologist specializing in the Tertiary of France .
Alessia Mosca ( born 23 May 1975 ) is an Italian politician who has been a Member of the European Parliament since 2014 .
Berta Collado ( Talavera de la Reina , Toledo , Spain , July 3 , 1979 ) is a Spanish TV presenter and journalist .
Esther Tusquets ( 30 August 1936 -- 23 July 2012 ) was a Spanish publisher , novelist and essayist .
Sir George Augustus Pilkington ( 7 October 1848 -- 28 January 1916 ) was an English doctor and Liberal politician .
Pep Blay ( Josep Blay Boqué , born 2 September 1966 in Tarragona , Spain ) is a Catalan writer , script writer and music journalist .
Raymond Cauchetier ( born January 10 , 1920 ) is a French photographer , known for his work as the set photographer from 1959 to 1968 on many of the seminal films of the French New Wave .
Zhu Shenghao ( Chinese : 朱生豪 ; pinyin : Zhū Shēngháo ) ( February 2 , 1912 - December 26 , 1944 ) was a Chinese translator .
Cherek River ( Russian : Черек ) is a river in Kabardino - Balkaria in Russia , a right tributary of the Baksan River ( Terek 's basin ) .
The Toce ( Italian pronunciation : ( ˈtoːtʃe ; ˈtɔːtʃe ) ) is a river in Piedmont , Italy , which stretches the length of the Val d'Ossola from the Swiss border to Lake Maggiore into which it debouches near Fondotoce in the commune of Verbania .
Motala ström is the river system that drains lake Vättern , the second largest lake in Sweden , into the Baltic Sea in Norrköping .
The Nishnabotna River is a tributary of the Missouri River in southwestern Iowa , northwestern Missouri and southeastern Nebraska in the United States .
The Iton is a river in Normandy , France , left tributary of the river Eure .
Hess Hollow is an unofficially named tributary of Coles Creek in Columbia County , Pennsylvania , in the United States .
The Gardner River ( also known as the Gardiner River ) is a tributary of the Yellowstone River , approximately 25 miles ( 40 km ) long , in northwestern Wyoming and south central Montana in the United States .
The River Seeve is a tributary of the Elbe in northern Germany .
The River Dodder ( Irish : An Dothra ) is one of the three main rivers in Dublin , Ireland , the others being the Liffey , of which the Dodder is the largest tributary , and the Tolka .
Lyari River ( Urdu : لیاری ندی ‎ ) is a small ephemeral stream that flows through the Pakistani megacity of Karachi from north east to the center and drains into the Arabian Sea at the Manora channel .
Llanquihue River flows in a south and westward and outflows in Panguipulli Lake .
The Bushman 's River ( Afrikaans : Boesmansrivier ) is an east to north - easterly flowing tributary of the Tugela River , in the KwaZulu - Natal province of South Africa .
The Bellamy River , in Strafford County , southeastern New Hampshire , is a tributary of the Piscataqua River about 15 miles ( 24 km ) long .
The Branch River rises on south west of the settlement of Crawford River , below Girvan , south southwest of Bulahdelah , and flows generally south and then southwest , joined by five minor tributaries , before reaching its confluence with the Karuah River north of Karuah .
The Toad River flows generally north and northeast , passing through Muncho Lake Provincial Park , to join the Liard River .
The Vyatka River ( Russian : Вя́тка ; IPA : ( ˈvʲatkə ) ; Tatar Cyrillic : Нократ , Latin : Noqrat ; Mari : Виче , Viče , Udmurt : Ватка , Vatka ) is a river in Kirov Oblast and the Republic of Tatarstan in Russia , a right tributary of the Kama River .
The Conestoga River , also referred to as Conestoga Creek , is a 61.6-mile - long ( 99.1 km ) tributary of the Susquehanna River flowing through the center of Lancaster County , Pennsylvania .
The Bumping River is a tributary of the Naches River , in Washington in the United States .
The Casamance River flows westward for the most part into the Atlantic Ocean along a path about 200 miles ( 320 km ) in length .
The La Pêche River is a river in western Quebec , in Canada , which flows from La Pêche Lake ( Lac La Pêche ) , in Gatineau Park and empties into the Gatineau River at Wakefield .
Again at a right angle it empties the Thamalakane River and forms the Boteti River , which incurs seasonal desiccation in some lower reaches .
The Warrego River is northernmost tributary of the Darling River .
The Fuyuan River ( Chinese : 富源溪 ; pinyin : Fùyuán Xī ) is a tributary of the Xiuguluan River in Taiwan .
The Michipicoten River is a river in the Algoma District of northern Ontario , Canada , which flows from Dog Lake and joins with the Magpie River to empty into Michipicoten Bay on Lake Superior near the town of Wawa .
West Branch Run ( also known as West Branch Little Fishing Creek ) is a tributary of Little Fishing Creek in Lycoming County and Columbia County , in Pennsylvania , in the United States .
Paul Louis Courier ( French : ( kuʁje ) ; January 4 , 1772 -- April 10 , 1825 ) , French Hellenist and political writer , was born in Paris .
Mathias Malzieu ( born 1974 ) , the lead singer of the French band Dionysos , co - founded the group in 1993 when he lived in Valence in Drôme .
Théodore Steeg ( French pronunciation : ​(teodɔʁ stɛɡ ) ) ( 19 December 1868 -- 19 December 1950 ) was a lawyer and professor of philosophy who became Premier of the French Third Republic .
Martin Bangemann ( born 15 November 1934 in Wanzleben ) is a German politician and a former leader of the FDP ( 1985 - -1988 ) .
Blanche d'Antigny ( May 9 , 1840 -- June 30 , 1874 ) was a French singer and actress whose fame today rests chiefly on the fact that Émile Zola used her as the principal model for his novel Nana .
Hector Bianciotti ( French pronunciation : ​(ɛktɔʁ bjɑ̃ʃoti ) ; 18 March 1930 -- 12 June 2012 ) was an Argentine - born French author and member of the Académie française .
Pierre - Édouard Lémontey ( 14 January 1762 , Lyon -- 26 June 1826 , Paris ) was a French lawyer , politician , scholar and historian .
Jean Laroche ( 1921 - -2010 ) is a French poet born in Nantes .
Štěpán Kopřiva ( born in 1971 ) is a Czech comics person , science fiction writer , and screenwriter .
