Alain Danilet ( 3 June 1947 in Noyon ( Oise ) - 8 February 2012 in Villevieille ( Gard ) was a French politician .
Dietrich Wersich ( born 1964 ) is a German politician of the German Christian Democratic Union ( CDU ) , and physician .
Carole Bouquet ( born 18 August 1957 ) is a French actress and fashion model , who has appeared in more than 50 films since 1977 .
Juliette Drouet , born Julienne Josephine Gauvain ( 10 April 1806 - 11 May 1883 ) was a French actress .
Baron Jean - Conrad Hottinguer ( 15 February 1764 , Zurich -- 12 September 1841 , Castle Piple , Boissy - Saint - Léger ) was a Swiss - born banker who later became a Baron of the French empire .
Vital d'Audiguier ( Najac , 1565 - Paris , 1624 ) , was a French poet and writer .
Thomas Gray ( 26 December 1716 -- 30 July 1771 ) was an English poet , letter - writer , classical scholar and professor at Cambridge University .
Dámaso Alonso y Fernández de las Redondas ( 22 October 1898 -- 25 January 1990 ) was a Spanish poet , philologist and literary critic .
Jean - Michel Ribes ( born 15 December 1946 in Paris ) is a French actor , playwright , screenwriter , theatre director and film maker .
Hiroshi Yoshino ( Japanese : 吉野弘 ; 1926 -- 15 January 2014 ) was a Japanese poet .
Yanette Delétang - Tardif ( Roubaix , 18 June 1902 -- Paris , 1976 ) was a French poetess , translator into French of Spanish and German works , painter and illustrator .
Bernard Cerquiglini ( born 8 April 1947 in Lyon , France ) , is a French linguist .
Peter van der Veer is a Dutch anthropologist who has made important scholarly contributions by challenging earlier perceptions regarding Indian religion and society .
Pierre Fresnay ( 4 April 1897 , Paris , France -- 9 January 1975 ) was a French stage and film actor .
Cui Jian ( ( tsʰwéɪ tɕjɛ̂n ) ; born 2 August 1961 ) is a Beijing - based Chinese singer - songwriter , trumpeter and guitarist .
Guillaume - Antoine Delfaud ( 1733 - -1792 ) was a French Jesuit .
Philippe - Auguste Jeanron ( 10 May 1809 -- 8 April 1877 ) was a French painter , curator and writer .
Damien Luce ( born 1978 ) is a French pianist , actor , and writer .
Jean Charles - Brun was an Occitan French proponent of autonomy of France 's regions and then founded the French Regionalist Federation in 1901 .
Capucine ( 6 January 1928 -- 17 March 1990 ) was a French fashion model and actress known for her comedic roles in The Pink Panther ( 1963 ) and What 's New Pussycat ? ( 1965 ) .
Michel Jonasz ( born 21 January 1947 in Drancy , France ) is a French composer - songwriter , singer and actor .
Eva Gräfin Finck von Finckenstein , née Schubring ( 3 December 1903 , in Berlin -- 13 March 1994 ) was a German politician , representative of the German Christian Democratic Union .
Roxane Duran ( born 27 January 1993 ) is a French - Austrian actress .
Claire Duhamel ( September 6 , 1925 -- February 7 , 2014 ) was a French film and stage actress , whose credits included Stolen Kisses in 1968 and Bed and Board in 1970 .
Bonaventura van Overbeek ( 1660 - -1705 ) was a Dutch Golden Age draughtsman and engraver .
Jean de Tinan , a.k.a . Jean Le Barbier de Tinan , ( 1874 - -1898 ) was a French writer .
Jeanne Sylvanie Arnould - Plessy ( 4 September 1819 -- 30 May 1897 ) was a French stage actress .
Octavian Goga ( Romanian pronunciation : ( oktaviˈan ˈɡoɡa ) ; 1 April 1881 -- 7 May 1938 ) was a Romanian politician , poet , playwright , journalist , and translator .
Laura Antonelli ( born Laura Antonaz ; 28 November 1941 -- 22 June 2015 ) was an Italian film actress , who appeared in 45 films between 1965 and 1991 .
Giunta Pisano ( also named Giunta da Pisa or Giunta Capitini ) was an Italian painter .
Quentin Elias ( 10 May 1974 -- 25 February 2014 ) was a French singer , actor and model .
Françoise Vatel ( born Françoise Watel , 28 November 1937 , Clichy , Hauts - de - Seine -- 24 October 2005 in Soissons ) , was a French actress .
Yann Gaillard ( born 9 October 1936 in ) is a French politician and he has been a member of the Senate of France .
Moussa Ali Abdoulkader ( January 1 , 1923 in Djibouti -- September 26 , 1986 in Paris ) was a politician from Djibouti who served in the French National Assembly from 1967 - 1973 .
Georges Brassens ( French : ( ʒɔʁʒ bʁasɛ̃s ) ; 22 October 1921 -- 29 October 1981 ) was a French singer - songwriter and poet .
Madeleine Vernet ( 3 September 1878 -- 5 October 1949 ) was a French teacher , writer , libertarian and pacifist .
François Bégaudeau ( French pronunciation : ​(fʁɑ̃swa beɡodo ) ; born 27 April 1971 ) is a French writer , journalist and actor .
Jean - Claude Dreyfus ( born 18 February 1946 in Paris ) is a French actor , comedian and author .
Martine Pascal ( born 1939 ) is a French theatre , cinema , and television actress .
Corinne Narassiguin ( born March 7 , 1975 , in Saint Paul , Réunion ) is a French politician and former member of the National Assembly of France .
Yun Heunggil ( born 14 December 1942 ) is a South Korean novelist known for his treatment of conflicts between the individual and society .
Xavier Bertrand ( French pronunciation : ​(ɡzavje bɛʁˈtʁɑ̃ ) ; born 21 March 1965 ) is a French politician .
André Dhôtel ( Attigny , Ardennes 1900 -- Paris 1991 ) was a French writer , novelist , storyteller , and poet .
Frédéric Lefebvre ( French pronunciation : ​(fʁedeʁic ləˈfɛvʁ ) ; born October 14 , 1963 ) is a French politician and was Secretary of State for Trade , Small and Medium Enterprises , Tourism , Services , Liberal professions and Consumption under the Minister of Economy , Finance and Industry , François Baroin .
Willem Albert Wagenaar ( 30 June 1941 in Utrecht -- 27 April 2011 ) was a Dutch psychologist noted for his work on the reliability of memory .
Educated with diplomas in psychology and philosophy , Aimé Michel joined the French Radio Broadcasting in 1944 .
Gérard Rinaldi ( February 17 , 1943 -- March 2 , 2012 ) was a French actor , a voice actor and a singer with Les Charlots .
Pierre Moinot ( 29 March 1920 , Fressines , Deux - Sèvres -- 6 March 2007 , Paris ) was a French novelist .
Jacques Maurice Hatry ( Strasbourg , 12 February 1742 - Paris , 30 November 1802 ) was a French general .
Jérôme Kircher ( born 21 November 1964 ) is a French actor known for A Very Long Engagement ( 2004 ) , Louise Wimmer ( 2011 ) and Café de Flore ( 2011 ) .
Floor Jansen ( pronounced ( ˈfloːr ˈjɑnsə(n ) ) ; born 21 February 1981 in Goirle ) is a Dutch singer - songwriter and vocal coach .
Martin - Michel - Charles Gaudin , 1st Duc de Gaete ( 19 January 1756 -- 5 November 1841 ) was a French statesman , Napoleon I Bonaparte 's Minister of Finances from November 1799 to March 1814 , including the Cent Jours following Napoleon 's return from Elba .
Serge Lamothe ( born February 15 , 1963 ) is a French - Canadian writer .
Catherine Millot ( born 1944 ) is a French Lacanian psychoanalyst and author , professor of psychoanalysis at the University of Paris - VIII . Millot studied philosophy before turning to psychoanalysis .
Wolfgang Nešković ( born June 3 , 1948 in Lübeck ) is a German politician , former judge at the German Federal Court of Justice and an independent member of the German Federal Parliament , representing Cottbus --
Pierre Magne ( 3 December 1806 -- 17 February 1879 ) was a lawyer and French politician .
Baron Jacques - Antoine - Adrien Delort ( 16 November 1773 -- 28 March 1846 ) was a French general and deputy .
Benoît Fourneyron ( October 31 , 1802 -- July 31 , 1867 ) was a French engineer , born in Saint - Étienne , Loire .
Pascal Bruckner ( French : ( bʁyknɛʁ ) ; born 15 December 1948 in Paris ) is a French writer , one of the `` New Philosophers '' who came to prominence in the 1970s and 1980s .
Marc Lescarbot ( c. 1570 - -1641 ) was a French author , poet and lawyer .
Antonín Holý ( 1 September 1936 -- 16 July 2012 ) was a pioneering Czech scientist .
Doris Pack ( born 18 March 1942 , Schiffweiler ) is a German politician , President of EPP Women and former Member of the European Parliament 1989 - 2014 .
Léontine Zanta ( 14 February 1872 -- 15 June 1942 ) was a French philosopher , feminist and novelist .
Mathieu Madénian ( born July 23 , 1976 ) is a French comedian , actor and columnist .
Winy Maas ( born 1958 in Schijndel ) is a Dutch architect , landscape architect , professor and urbanist .
Jacques Perrin ( born Jacques André Simonet ; 13 July 1941 ) is a French actor and filmmaker .
Victor Noir , ( 27 July 1848 in Attigny , Vosges -- 11 January 1870 in Paris ) , was a French journalist who is famous for the manner of his death and its political consequences .
Vilis Lācis ( May 12 , 1904 -- February 6 , 1966 ) was a Latvian writer and communist politician .
Caroline Huppert ( born 28 October 1950 ) is a French film director and screenwriter .
Pierre Billaud ( 21 May 1970 -- 11 November 2001 ) was a French radio reporter and journalist .
Ignaz Kiechle ( 23 February 1930 in Kempten i m Allgäu , Bavaria -- 2 December 2003 Reinharts near Kempten ) was a German politician of the Christian Social Union of Bavaria .
Rachid Arhab ( born 26 June 1955 in Larbaâ Nath Irathen in Algeria ) is a French journalist , current member of the Conseil supérieur de l'audiovisuel ( CSA ) .
Renate Sommer ( born 10 September 1958 , Bochum ) is a German politician and Member of the European Parliament for North Rhine - Westphalia .
Pascal Pia ( 15 August 1903 , Paris -- 27 September 1979 , Paris ) , born Pierre Durand , was a French writer , journalist , illustrator and scholar .
Björn Engholm ( born 9 November 1939 ) is a Lübeck born German SPD politician .
Annemarie Renger ( née Wildung ) , ( 7 October 1919 in Leipzig -- 3 March 2008 in Remagen - Oberwinter ) , was a German politician for the `` Sozialdemokratische Partei Deutschlands '' ( Social Democratic Party of Germany - SPD ) .
Dr. Joseph - Ignace Guillotin ( French pronunciation : ​(ɡijɔtɛ̃ ) ; 28 May 1738 -- 26 March 1814 ) was a French physician and freemason who proposed on 10 October 1789 the use of a device to carry out death penalties in France , as a less painful method of execution .
Richer of Senones ( sometimes in French : Richer le Lorrain ) ( circa 1190 - -1266 ) was a monk and chronicler of Senones Abbey in Lorraine , a traveller and one of the very few chroniclers or historians of the Vosges whose works have survived complete .
Pierre Repp ( 5 November 1909 in Saint - Pol - sur - Ternoise , France -- 1 November 1986 in Plessis - Trévise , France ) was a French humorist and actor .
Thierry Cornillet ( born 23 July 1951 in Montélimar , Drôme ) is a French politician and Member of the European Parliament for the south - east of France .
Claude Esteban ( 26 July 1935 , Paris -- 10 April 2006 , Paris ) was a French poet .
Dionysis Savvopoulos ( Greek : Διονύσης Σαββόπουλος ) ( born 2 December 1944 ) is a prominent Greek singer - songwriter .
Jean Henri Latude ( 23 March 1725 -- 1 January 1805 ) , often called Danry or Masers de Latude , was a French writer famous for his lengthy confinement in the Bastille , at Vincennes , and for his repeated escapes from those prisons .
Edmond Jaloux ( 19 June 1878 , Marseille -- 22 August 1949 , Lutry ) was a French novelist , essayist , and critic .
Maxime Bono ( born 1 November 1947 in Algiers , Algeria ) is a French politician and a member of the Socialist party .
François Jules Edmond Got ( 1 October 1822 , Lignerolles , Orne -- 21 March 1901 , Passy , a district in Paris ) , was a French stage actor , comedian , and opera librettist .
Antoine - Éléonor - Léon Leclerc de Juigné ( 2 November 1728 , Paris -- 19 March 1811 , Paris ) was the Archbishop of Paris during the French Revolution .
Jan Geurt Gaarlandt ( born October 9 , 1946 ) is a Dutch journalist , poet , translator , editor and novelist .
Dominique Mainard is a French translator of English novels , short story writer and novelist .
Toyo Shibata ( June 26 , 1911 -- January 20 , 2013 ) was a bestselling Japanese poet ; her first anthology Kujikenaide ( `` Do n't lose heart '' ) , published in 2009 , has sold 1.58 million copies .
Jacques Marin ( 9 September 1919 -- 10 January 2001 ) was a French actor on film and television .
Claude Moine ( born 3 July 1942 ) , better known by his stage name Eddy Mitchell , is a French singer and actor .
Jürgen Creutzmann ( born 4 October 1945 in Speyer , Germany ) is a German politician and member of the liberal Free Democratic Party of Germany ( FDP ) .
Robert Dun , whose real name is Maurice Martin ( 1920 - 8 March 2002 ) was a French self - taught writer , supporter of european nationalism and neo - paganism .
Lutz Heilmann ( born September 7 , 1966 in Zittau , GDR ) is a German politician of the left - wing party Die Linke .
Michel Baron ( 8 October 1653 -- 22 December 1729 ) was a French actor and playwright .
Roger Monclin ( 31 January 1903 -- 26 July 1985 ) was a French militant pacifist and anarchist .
Ludovico Antonio Muratori ( 21 October 1672 -- 23 January 1750 ) was an Italian historian , notable as a leading scholar of his age , and for his discovery of the Muratorian fragment , the earliest known list of New Testament books .
Karl - Hans Kern ( 3 October 1932 -- 21 May 2014 ) was a German politician ( SPD ) and member of the Bundestag from 1967 until 1976 .
Otto Friedrich Wilhelm Freiherr von der Wenge Graf Lambsdorff , known as Otto Graf Lambsdorff , ( 20 December 1926 -- 5 December 2009 ) was a German politician of the Free Democratic Party .
Albert Likuvalu ( born November 14 , 1943 ) is a French politician , former member of the National Assembly of France .
Björn Höcke ( born 1 April 1972 in Lünen ) is a German politician for the right - wing - populist party Alternative for Germany ( AfD ) .
Charles Spinasse ( 22 October 1893 in Égletons , Corrèze -- 9 August 1979 in Rosiers - d'Égletons ) was a French politician .
Claude Clerselier ( 1614 , Paris -- 1684 , Paris ) was a French editor .
Philippe François Nazaire Fabre d'Églantine ( 28 July 1750 -- 5 April 1794 ) , commonly known as Fabre d'Églantine ( French pronunciation : ​(fabʁ deɡlɑ̃tin ) ) , was a French actor , dramatist , poet , and politician of the French Revolution .
Stella Baruk ( born 1930 ) is an influential Iranian - born French teacher , mathematician , author and educationalist .
Clair Tisseur ( 27 January 1827 , Sainte - Foy - lès - Lyon , Rhône -- 30 September 1896 , Nyons , Drôme ) , was a French architect whose best known work is Église du Bon - Pasteur , a prominent Romanesque Revival church in the 1st arrondissement of Lyon .
Jean - Jacques Gautier ( 4 November 1908 , Essômes - sur - Marne , Aisne -- 20 April 1986 ) was French theatre critic , novelist and essayist .
Lindsey Davis ( born 1949 ) is an English historical novelist , best known as the author of the Falco series of historical crime stories set in ancient Rome and its empire .
Jacques Delille ( French : ( dəlil ) ; 22 June 1738 -- 1 May 1813 ) was a French poet , freemason and translator .
Aurore Clément ( born 12 October 1945 ) is a French actress who has appeared in French language and English language motion pictures and television productions .
Marc Rivière is a French director , actor and screenwriter .
Gaston Monmousseau ( 17 January 1883 -- 11 July 1960 ) was a French railway worker , trade union leader , politician and author , from a rural working - class background .
Marie Rivière ( French pronunciation : ​(maʁi ʁivjɛʁ ) ; born 22 December 1956 ) is a French actress and filmmaker .
Gérard Barray ( born 2 November 1931 in Toulouse ) is a French comedian and film and television actor .
Georges Antoine Chabot ( 1758 - -1819 ) , known as Chabot de Lallier , was a French jurist and statesman .
Lucien - Anatole Prévost - Paradol ( 8 August 1829 , Paris -- 20 July 1870 , Washington , D.C. ) was a French journalist and essayist .
Corinne Marchand ( born 4 December 1937 in Paris ) is a French actress .
Adrien Duport ( 6 February 1759 -- 6 July 1798 ) was a French politician , and lawyer .
Claude Évin ( born 29 June 1949 ) is a French politician and lawyer .
Christophe Honoré ( born 10 April 1970 ) is a French writer and film director .
Kad Merad ( born Kaddour Merad ; 27 March 1964 ) is a French - Algerian filmmaker and actor who has acted both on stage and on screen .
Dany Saval ( born Danielle Nadine Suzanne Savalle on January 5 , 1942 , in Paris , France ) is a former French actress .
Pierre Joxe ( born 28 November 1934 in Paris ) is a former French Socialist politician and has been a member of the Constitutional Council of France since 2001 .
Jean - Philippe Jaworski ( born 1969 ) is a French author of fantasy literature and role - playing games .
Thomas Händel ( born 27 August 1953 in Nuremberg ) is a German politician and trade unionist who has served as an MEP for the Left party since 2009 .
Park Nam - su ( Hangul : 박남수 ) was a South Korean poet .
René Marx Dormoy ( 1 August 1888 - -26 July 1941 ) was a French socialist politician , noted for his opposition to the far right .
Louisy Mathieu ( June 17 , 1817 in Basse - Terre ( Guadeloupe ) -- November 4 , 1874 in Basse - Terre ) ) was a politician from Guadeloupe who served in the French National Assembly from 1848 - 1849 .
Franz Blücher ( 24 March 1896 -- 26 March 1959 ) was a German politician and member of the German Parliament ( Bundestag ) .
Michel Crépeau ( 30 October 1930 , Fontenay - le - Comte , Vendée -- 30 March 1999 , Paris ) was a French centre - left politician .
Ben - Ousséni Mansour , alias Manou Mansour ( Mamoudzou , Mayotte , February 24 , 1980 ) is a French poet .
Philippe Douste - Blazy ( born 1 January 1953 ) is a United Nations official and former French centre - right politician .
Joseph Laniel ( French pronunciation : ​(ʒɔzɛf lanjɛl ) ; 12 October 1889 , Vimoutiers , Orne -- 8 April 1975 , Paris ) was a French conservative politician of the Fourth Republic , who served as Prime Minister for a year from 1953 to 1954 .
Antoine Christophe Saliceti ( baptised in the name of Antonio Cristoforo Saliceti : Antoniu Cristufaru Saliceti in Corsican ; 26 August 1757 -- 23 December 1809 ) was a French politician and diplomat of the Revolution and First Empire .
Jean Marquès - Rivière ( 1903 - -2000 ) was a French journalist , writer and screenwriter .
Jean Joseph Mounier ( 12 November 1758 -- 28 January 1806 ) was a French politician and judge .
Claude Charles Marie du Campe de Rosamel ( 24 June 1774 -- 27 March 1848 ) was a French politician and naval officer .
Étienne Jodelle , seigneur de Limodin ( 1532 -- July 1573 ) , French dramatist and poet , was born in Paris of a noble family .
Edgar Le Bastard was a French industrialist and politician in the nineteenth century .
Hamide Akbayir ( born 10 May 1959 in Frac , Tunceli Province , Turkey ) is a German politician and member of the Left North Rhine - Westphalia , a state chapter of the Left Party of Germany .
Jean - Pierre Worms ( born 16 July 1934 in Courbevoie , Hauts - de - Seine ) , is a sociologist , a former French parliamentarian , and is active in the associative sector .
Roger Lise ( born July 26 , 1927 in Martinique ) is a politician from Martinique who was elected to the French Senate in 1977
Willi Eichler ( January 7 , 1896 -- October 17 , 1971 ) was a German journalist and politician with the Social Democratic Party of Germany ( SPD ) .
Alexandre Mercereau , Paris , 22 October 1884 -- 1945 , was a French symbolist poet and critic associated with Unanimism and the Abbaye de Créteil .
Ernest Granger ( 20 April 1844 -- 21 May 1914 ) was a French politician , a veteran of the Paris Commune of 1871 , a Blanquist socialist and subsequently a Boulangist nationalist .
Valérie Lemercier ( French pronunciation : ​(va.le.ʁi lə.mɛʁ.sje ) ; born 9 March 1964 ) is a French actress , screenwriter , director and singer .
Daniel Russo ( born 13 May 1948 ) is a French film actor , comedian and director .
Valery Rozov ( Nizhny Novgorod , December 26 , 1964- ) is a Russian BASE jumper , who on May 5 , 2013 , jumped off Changtse ( the north peak of the Mount Everest massif ) from a height of 7,220 metres ( 23,690 ft ) .
Francis de Miomandre ( born 22 May 1880 -- 1959 ) was a French novelist and well - known translator from Spanish into French .
Guy Sorman ( born March 10 , 1944 , Paris , France ) is a French professor , columnist , author , and public intellectual in economics and philosophy .
Bruno Nicolini ( born 16 June 1969 ) , better known by his stage name Bénabar , is a French songwriter and singer , who could be compared to Vincent Delerm and other singers from his generation .
Robert Desnos ( French : ( dɛsnɔs ) ; 4 July 1900 -- 8 June 1945 ) , was a French surrealist poet who played a key role in the Surrealist movement of his day .
Pierre de Chevigné ( 16 June 1909 , Toulon -- 4 April 2004 ) was a French politician , who was the Minister of Defence in the Fourth Republic between 14 May and 1 June 1958 .
Jean Louis Barthou ( French pronunciation : ​(ʒɑ̃ lwi baʁtu ) ; 25 August 1862 -- 9 October 1934 ) was a French politician of the Third Republic who served as Prime Minister of France for eight months in 1913 .
Barry Levey ( August 7 , 1930 -- February 5 , 2004 ) was a Republican politician and a former member of the Ohio General Assembly .
Dinesh Krishnan is an Indian cinematographer He graduated from the prestigious M.G.R. Film and Television Institute , Taramani , Chennai , Tamil Nadu .
Hsu Chun - yat or Jack Hsu ( Chinese : 許俊逸 ; pinyin : Xǔ Jùnyì ) is a politician in the Republic of China .
Dan van Husen ( born April 30 , 1945 ) is a German actor who has also performed in Hollywood films .
Z'EV ( born Stefan Joel Weisser , February 8 , 1951 ) is an American poet , percussionist , and sound artist .
Juha Kylmänen ( born 1981 ) is a Finnish vocalist of gothic metal bands For My Pain ... and Reflexion .
Tom Matlack is an American entrepreneur , venture capitalist and author .
Siddhartha Sarma ( Assamese : সিদ্ধাৰ্থ শৰ্মা ) is an Indian English novelist and journalist from Assam .
Johnny Schuler is an author , chef and restaurateur , distiller and television personality from Lima , Peru .
Martin Liivamägi ( born July 5 , 1988 ) is an Estonian swimmer , who specialized in breaststroke and individual medley events .
William Thomas Lambie ( 1837 - -1900 ) was a civil engineer who worked on construction projects throughout the American Southwest in the 19th Century and was a member of the Los Angeles , California , Common Council , the governing body of that city .
Goetz Oertel ( born August 24 , 1934 ) is an American physicist and science manager .
Edmund Bergler ( /ˈbɛrɡlər/ ; German : ( ˈbɛɐ̯glɐ ) ; 1899 - -1962 ) was an Austrian - born American psychoanalyst whose books covered such topics as childhood development , mid - life crises , loveless marriages , gambling , and self - defeating behaviors .
Bryan Suits is an American war veteran of three military conflicts in Kuwait , Bosnia , and Iraq , and has been a talk radio host for more than 10 years and active in the Tea Party .
Krista Detor is a singer - songwriter and pianist from Indiana whose music has been featured on NPR and with Mike Harding on the BBC .
Andrea England is a Canadian singer - songwriter from Nova Scotia , now based in Toronto , Ontario .
Jerome B. Posner is an American neurologist and co - author of Plum and Posner 's Diagnosis of Stupor and Coma . Dr .
Antonio José Martínez ( January 17 , 1793 -- July 27 , 1867 ) was a New Mexican priest , educator , publisher , rancher , farmer , community leader , and politician .
Jennifer Egan ( born September 7 , 1962 ) is an American novelist and short story writer who lives in Fort Greene , Brooklyn .
Stefan Kiesbye is a German novelist and poet .
I Made Subandi ( born February 1966 , Batubulan ) is a gamelan composer and performer from Gianyar , Bali .
Moissaye Boguslawski ( November 1 , 1887 -- August 30 , 1944 ) was an American pianist , composer , editor and teacher .
Ben Montague is a British musician , singer - songwriter and multi instrumentalist from Farnborough , Kent .
Irina Borogan ( Russian : Ирина Петровна Бороган , born in Moscow , Russia ) is a Russian investigative journalist .
Herman Maxwell Batten ( August 4 , 1909 -- October 17 , 1991 ) was a Canadian politician , school principal and teacher .
Bobby Vernon ( born Sylvion de Jardin on March 9 , 1897 in Chicago , Illinois -- June 28 , 1939 in Hollywood , California ) was an American comedic actor in silent films .
Jonne Valtonen ( born March 23 , 1976 ) is a Finnish composer , arranger and orchestrator .
Mikhail Gennadiyevich Dmitriyev ( Russian : Михаил Геннадьевич Дмитриев ) is a Soviet and Russian mathematician .
Chun Lee - kyung ( Hangul : 전이경 , Hanja : 全利卿 ; born January 6 , 1976 in Okcheon , Chungcheongbuk - do ) is a retired South Korean short track speed skater .
Don Dubbins , originally Donald George Dubbins ( June 28 , 1928 - August 17 , 1991 ) , was an American actor of film and television who in his early career usually played younger military roles , particularly in such classic pictures as From Here to Eternity ( 1953 ) and The Caine Mutiny ( 1954 ) .
Kelli White ( born April 1 , 1977 , in Oakland , California ) is an American former sprinter .
Lucinda Childs ( born June 26 , 1940 ) is an American postmodern dancer / choreographer and actress .
Andy Prieboy ( born April 17 , 1955 ) is an American musician , songwriter , and author .
Richard Henry Hall ( November 7 , 1830 -- September 7 , 1909 ) was an American politician who served as the Mayor of Taunton , Massachusetts .
Patrick Wilde is an English playwright and screenwriter for both television and film .
Geoffrey Mauncell ( fl . 1399 ) of Salisbury , Wiltshire , was an English goldsmith and politician .
From 1980 on Marcel van den Broecke studied historical maps and specialized in the life and work of the cartographer Abraham Ortelius ( 1527 - -1598 ) .
Tony Cummings is the founding editor of the magazine Cross Rhythms .
Gwen Arner is an American television director and actress .
Ralph Loring was an architect of Lewiston , Idaho .
Claire Weaver is a British screenwriter , journalist and short story writer , and a former Magazine Editor and book award judge .
Richard Prior is an English conductor , composer and professor of music .
Ivar Stakgold ( born December 13 , 1925 ) is a Norwegian - born American academic mathematician and bridge player from Newark , Delaware .
Jimmy Clanton ( born September 2 , 1938 , Baton Rouge , Louisiana , United States ) is an American singer who became known as the `` swamp pop R&B teenage idol '' .
Hazel Rose Markus is a prominent social psychologist and a pioneer in the field of cultural psychology .
Maksim Zuyev ( Russian : Макси́м Зу́ев ; born November 11 , 1975 in Kaliningrad -- died March 18 , 2010 ) was an award - winning journalist and blogger who spent his entire life in Kaliningrad promoting human rights .
As well as being a politician , Miran Mohammad Shah was a prominent Sindhi literary personality .
Bartolomeo degli Organi ( 24 December 1474 -- 12 December 1539 ) was an Italian composer , singer and organist of the Renaissance .
Owen Rand Kenan , ( March 4 , 1804 -- March 3 , 1887 ) was a North Carolina politician .
Al Seeger ( born January 23 , 1980 ) , nicknamed `` The Quiet Storm '' , is a boxer from the United States .
Ned Scott ( April 16 , 1907 -- November 24 , 1964 ) was an American photographer who worked in the Hollywood film industry as a still photographer from 1935 - 1948 .
Allison Melnick ( born June 4 , 1971 ) is an American socialite , bar owner , and reality TV star originally from Long Island , New York .
Chung Il - kwon ( Korean : 정일권 ; Hanja : 丁一權 , November 21 , 1917 -- January 17 , 1994 ) was a South Korean politician , diplomat and soldier .
Mamang Dai ( Assamese : মামাং দাই ) is an Indian journalist , author , poet , and former civil servant based in Itanagar , Arunachal Pradesh .
Paul Meany ( born July 2 , 1976 ) is the lead singer and keyboardist for the indie band Mutemath .
Grace Parra ( born June 27 , 1984 ) is an American screenwriter , presenter , and actress who is a contributor on The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore .
Dave Gillespie was an Australian rules footballer who played with Carlton in the Victorian Football League .
János Kintzig was a Hungarian politician , who served as Minister of Agriculture in the Counter - revolutionary Government of Arad and Szeged during the Hungarian Soviet Republic .
Dinah Silveira Ribeiro , better known as Diná Silveira de Queirós ( November 9 , 1911 in São Paulo -- November 27 , 1982 in Rio de Janeiro ) was a Brazilian writer of novels , short stories , and chronicles .

Sanjeeb Choudhury ( December 25 , 1964 -- November 19 , 2007 ) was a Bangladeshi singer , lyricist , and journalist .

Bryan Johanson ( born 1951 ) is an American classical guitarist & composer .
Max Reichmann ( 1884 - 1958 ) was a German film director active during the silent and early sound eras .
Megan Terry ( born July 22 , 1932 ) is an American playwright , screenwriter , and theatre artist having produced more than 50 discrete works for theatre , radio , and television .
Alkinoos Ioannidis ( Greek : Αλκίνοος Ιωαννίδης ; born September 19 , 1969 ) is a Greek - Cypriot composer , lyricist , singer , and orchestrator .
Susan Mitchell ( born in 1944 ) is an American poet , essayist and translator who wrote the poetry collections Rapture and Erotikon .
Bill Deck ( September 28 , 1915 -- February 22 , 2011 ) was an American baseball player who played for the Negro National League 's Philadelphia Stars in 1939 .
Ulla Wessels ( born 1965 ) is a German analytic philosopher working in practical philosophy , particularly ethics .
Nicole Bass - Fuchs ( born August 10 , 1964 ) is an American bodybuilder , actress , professional wrestler and valet previously working for companies such as Extreme Championship Wrestling , World Wrestling Federation , XPW , and the National Wrestling Alliance .
David Schiff ( born August 30 , 1945 in New York City ) is an American composer , writer and conductor whose music draws on elements of jazz , rock , and klezmer styles , showing the influence of composers as diverse as Stravinsky , Mahler , Charles Mingus , Eric Dolphy and Terry Riley .
Gershon Benjamin ( January 6 , 1899 -- September 2 , 1985 ) was an American modern painter .
Cozi Zuehlsdorff ( born August 3 , 1998 ) is an American actress and singer known for her role as Hazel Haskett in the movie Dolphin Tale ( 2011 ) and the sequel , Dolphin Tale 2 ( 2014 ) .
Dave Calloway ( born October 7 , 1968 in Woodbury , New Jersey ) is an American college basketball coach and the former head men 's basketball coach at Monmouth University .
Kim Sok - pom , also spelled Kim Suok - puom ( born October 2 , 1925 ) is a Zainichi Korean novelist who writes in Japanese .
Sophie Rodriguez ( born July 7 , 1988 ) is a French snowboarder who won a bronze medal in halfpipe at 2013 FIS Snowboarding World Championships , behind Arielle Gold and Holly Crawford .
Loretta Napoleoni ( born 1955 ) is an Italian journalist and political analyst .
Simon Sweeney is an English author and lecturer in international political economy and business based at the University of York .
Evrard Wendenbaum ( born March 13 , 1979 ) is a French outdoor photographer , filmmaker , geologist and explorer .
Gary S. Scott is an American film composer who has contributed music to over forty movies , TV shows , and television movies , beginning with the 1981 horror movie Final Exam .
Francesco Capuano Di Manfredonia ( flourished 15th century ) was an Italian astronomer .
Russell J. Flanagan ( May 21 , 1974 -- February 5 , 2008 ) , better known as Russ Flanagan , was a journalist for The Express - Times in Easton , Pennsylvania and The New Jersey Herald in Newton , New Jersey .
Judith Ann Mayotte ( born January 25 , 1937 ) is an American humanitarian , author , theologian , producer , former Catholic Religious Sister , ethicist , and university professor .
Hamza Jeetooa is a British actor and film - maker .
Lowell Blair Nesbitt ( October 4 , 1933 - July 8 , 1993 ) was a painter , draughtsman , printmaker and sculptor .
Janette Beckman is an English documentary photographer born in London and living and working in New York .
August Gebert was born in Mecklenburg , Germany and was a joiner by profession .
Harrison Chad ( born July 17 , 1992 in Plainview , New York , U.S. ) is an American actor and voice actor .
Gabriel Crouch is a British baritone , choral conductor and record producer .
Jill Enfield ( born August 8 , 1954 in Miami Beach , Florida ) is a photographer and hand coloring artist best known for her work in alternative photographic processes such as Cyanotype and Collodion process .
Václav Vokolek ( born January 1 , 1947 in Děčín ) is a Czech writer and painter .
Jeff LeBlanc , ( born February 9 , 1986 ) is an independent American singer and songwriter .
Boris Buzančić ( March 13 , 1929 - October 9 , 2014 ) was a Croatian actor and politician .
Felix Weber ( born December 1 , 1960 in Hassfurt , Bavaria ) is a German composer , songwriter and record producer .
Jay Alders is an American fine artist , photographer and graphic designer .
Shlomo Zalman Schneersohn ( 1830 -- 1900 ) was a Ukrainian Habad Hasidic rabbi who was the second leader of Kopust Hasidism from 1866 to his death in 1900 .
Emigdio Flores Calpiñeiro ( born July 30 , 1950 , Cobija ) is a Bolivian politician and sociologist , educated at the French Paul Valéry University .
Saul Zaentz ( /ˈzænts/ ; February 28 , 1921 -- January 3 , 2014 ) was an American film producer and record company executive .
Nelly Bodenheim or Johanna Cornelia Hermana Bodenheim ( May 27 , 1874 -- January 7 , 1951 ) was a Dutch illustrator known for her silhouettes .
Brian Keith Tochihara ( born May 2 , 1963 ) , better known by his professional name Brian Tochi , is an American actor , screenwriter , film director , and producer .
C.D. Stuart , known under her stage name Madame Stuart ( fl . 1772 ) , was a ballet dancer , acrobat , tightrope - walker , singer , musician , actress , dance teacher , composer and beer brewer .
Chris Pureka is an American acoustic singer - songwriter from Northampton , Massachusetts .
John Scagliotti is an Emmy Award - winning American film director and producer , and radio broadcaster .
Julita Ross ( March 21 , 1919 -- June 29 , 1981 ) was a singer of Puerto Rican danzas , also known as `` The Great Lady of the Danzas '' .
Leo Maslíah is a Uruguayan musician , humorist and writer .
Paola Zizzi is an Italian theoretical physicist who is most notable for her work in the field of loop quantum gravity , which regards the universe as a kind of super computer .
Jonathan Everett Sargent ( October 23 , 1816-January 6 , 1890 ) was an American lawyer and politician who served as the Speaker of the New Hampshire House of Representatives , as the President of the New Hampshire Senate and as the Chief Justice of the New Hampshire Superior Court of Judicature .
In the last ten years , Bruce Parramore has been working as a film director with advertising films , music videos , short films , TV series and features As of 2013 he has directed around 300 commercials and won several international awards .
Tony Lambert is a former British diplomat to Beijing , China and Tokyo , Japan and author of several significant books regarding Christianity in China .
Benny Moss ( born April 18 , 1970 ) is an American former basketball player and the former men 's basketball coach at UNC Wilmington .
Salim Saifullah Khan ( Urdu : سلیم سیف اللہ خان ) is a Pakistani politician and President of a faction of the Pakistan Muslim League and a Senator of Pakistan and Chairman of Pakistan 's Senate Foreign Relations , Kashmir Affairs and Gilgit Baltistan Committee .
Bernard B. Brown ( July 24 , 1898 -- February 20 , 1981 ) was an American sound engineer and composer , who wrote the scores for many early animated cartoons produced by Leon Schlesinger Productions for distribution by Warner Bros. Pictures .
Chrétien François de Lamoignon de Bâville , also written as Chrétien François de Lamoignon de Basville ( 1735 - -1789 ) was a French statesman and magistrate .
Jean Sutherland was a writer , performer and photographer , who lived for most of her life in the village of Newburgh , in Fife , Scotland .
Erika Lauren Wasilewski , known on - air simply as Erika Lauren , is an American radio personality , singer - songwriter and former reality television personality .
Kostas Ouranis ( Greek : Κώστας Ουράνης , pen name of Κώστας Νιάρχος ; 1890 - -1953 ) was an acclaimed Greek poet , travel writer and journalist .
Walter Beasley is an American saxophonist , a professor of music at the Berklee College of Music , and founder of Affable Publishing and Affable Records .
Alexa Woodward is an American indie / folk singer and songwriter .
Darren LaCroix is a keynote speaker , author , comedian and founder of The Humor Institute , Inc. He is the 2001 World Champion of Public Speaking .
Lynn Schooler 's first book , The Blue Bear - A True Story of Friendship , Tragedy , and Survival ' tells the story of the author 's friendship with the Japanese wildlife photographer Michio Hoshino , who was killed by a grizzly in the Kurilskoya brown bear refuge on the Kamchatka peninsula on August 8 , 1996 .
Kendra Spotswood is an American soul singer and is considered to be one of the most underrated singers of the girl group era .
Archie Stout ( March 30 , 1886 -- March 10 , 1973 ) , A.S.C. was a second unit photographer whose career spanned from 1921 to 1954 .
Ieuan Lewis ( by 1511-?97 ) , of Gladestry , Radnorshire , was a Welsh politician .
Rasa Kaušiūtė ( born on March 29 , 1977 ) is a Lithuanian singer , composer , and vocal teacher ( works at Lithuanian Youth Center and prepares children for various song contests ) .
Maurice Tougas ( born February 19 , 1956 ) is a Canadian politician , who formerly represented the electoral district of Edmonton Meadowlark in the Legislative Assembly of Alberta .
Herbert Kraus ( January 2 , 1884 -- March 15 , 1965 ) was a German professor of public international law .
James Cruz is a Grammy Award winning audio mastering engineer and owner of Zeitgeist Sound Studios in Long Island City , New York .
Scott Weinger is an American actor , writer and producer , best known as the voice of the title character in Disney 's Aladdin .
Artie D. Valentine ( born August 25 , 1927 ) , was an American politician who was a Democratic member of the Nevada General Assembly .
Peter Som ( born in 1970 ) is a Chinese American fashion designer .
Elvis Stojko , MSC , MSM ( born March 22 , 1972 ) is a Canadian figure skater .

Ronnie Davies is a former England l darts player , from Byker , Newcastle upon Tyne Davies won the 1978 Winmau World Masters , beating Keith Harvey , Colin Baker and Cliff Lazarenko before beating Tony Brown in the final .
Leslie Bradley Cutler was an American politician who served in the Massachusetts Senate .
Athas Hrysoulakis ( born 5 January 1969 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with Collingwood in the Victorian / Australian Football League ( VFL / AFL ) .
Federico Celestini ( b. December 5 , 1964 ) is an Italian musicologist .
José Lezama Lima ( December 19 , 1910 -- August 9 , 1976 ) was a Cuban writer and poet who is considered one of the most influential figures in Latin American literature .

Norman Maltby is an English former cricketer active from 1972 to 1974 who played for Northamptonshire ( Northants ) .

Shawn Ku is a U.S. choreographer and motion picture director .
Jane Sherman ( June 14 , 1908 -- March 16 , 2010 ) was an American writer , performer , composer , and one - time dancer and member of the Rockettes the famed in - house dance troupe of Radio City Music Hall .
Norman Madhoo ( born April 9 , 1964 ) is a Guyanese darts player .
Walter Wischniewsky ( 1912 - -1995 ) was a German film editor who worked on over a hundred productions during his career .
David ben Yom Tov ibn Bilia was a Portuguese Jewish philosopher who lived in the thirteenth and fourteenth centuries .
Michael G. Bellotti ( born March 21 , 1963 in Boston , Massachusetts ) is an American politician who is the current Sheriff of Norfolk County , Massachusetts and a former member of the Massachusetts House of Representatives from Quincy .

Eleanore Mikus ( born July 25 , 1927 in Detroit , Michigan ) is an American artist who began painting in the late 1950s in the Abstract Expressionist mode .

Yale Boss ( October 18 , 1899 -- November 16 , 1977 ) was an American child actor of the silent screen .
Carlo Pollonera ( Alexandria , Egypt , March 27 , 1849 - Turin , June 17 , 1923 ) was an Italian painter , particularly of landscapes , and also an important malacologist .

Fiona Bevan is an English singer - songwriter from Suffolk , who lives in Hackney , London .
Maria Margherita Grimani ( fl . 1713 -- 1718 ) was an Italian composer who , at some points in her life , was active in Vienna .
Harmon Jones ( June 3 , 1911 -- July 10 , 1972 ) was a Canadian - born film editor and director who worked for many years at the 20th Century - Fox studio in southern California .
Stephen Briers is a British clinical psychologist .
Stephen Gaboury is an American musician , producer , composer , arranger , and musical director .
Virginia Kidd ( June 2 , 1921 -- January 11 , 2003 ) was an American literary agent , writer and editor , who worked in particular in science fiction and related fields .
Zhang Liyin ( born February 28 , 1989 ) , better known in South Korea as Jang Ri - in , is a Chinese singer active in China and South Korea , She is a member of the South Korean group S.M. The Ballad .
Norman Orentreich ( /ˈnɔːrmən ˈɒrəntraɪk/ ; ) is a pioneering New York dermatologist and the father of modern hair transplantation .

Albert Liurette ( born July 3 , 1904 , date of death unknown ) was a Guinean physician and politician .
Didymus the Musician was a music theorist in Rome of the end of the 1st century BC or beginning of the 1st century AD , who combined elements of earlier theoretical approaches with an appreciation of the aspect of performance .
Hans J. Salter ( January 14 , 1896 -- July 23 , 1994 ) was an American film composer .
Jennifer L. Holm is an American children 's writer , and recipient of three Newbery Honors and the Eisner Award .
Michael Lavery is an American artist , and brain fitness author .
Andreas Poach ( c.1515 -- April 2 , 1585 ) was a German Lutheran theologian and Reformer .
Henry Lehrman ( March 30 , 1886 -- November 7 , 1946 ) was an American actor , screenwriter , director and producer .
As a botanist , Paul Émile de Puydt notably wrote on orchids .
Catrine Näsmark ( Stockholm , Sweden , 1970 ) is a Swedish artist , painter and set designer .
Dustin Lance Black ( born June 10 , 1974 ) is an American screenwriter , director , film and television producer and LGBT rights activist .
Delia Ephron ( EHF - rihn ; born July 12 , 1944 ) is an American bestselling author , screenwriter , and playwright .
Wong Kew - Lit ( 黄巧力 ) is a Malaysian Chinese film director and producer .
John Wyman is a British actor probably best known for his role as Erich Kriegler in the James Bond film For Your Eyes Only .
Nicolas Chauvin ( French : ( ʃɔvɛ̃ ) ) is a legendary , possibly apocryphal French soldier and patriot who is supposed to have served in the First Army of the French Republic and subsequently in La Grande Armée of Napoleon .
Dev Raj Joshi ( Nepali : देवराज जोशी ) is a Nepalese politician , belonging to the Nepali Congress .
Blayre Turnbull ( born July 15 , 1993 ) is a women 's ice hockey player for the Wisconsin Badgers women 's ice hockey program .
On 23 July 1923 , Gertrude Bacon and botanist and illustrator Lady Joanna Charlotte Davy ( 1865 - 1955 ) made the first discovery of Carex microglochin or Bristle Sedge in Great Britain .
K. Raman Pillai is an Indian politician , the president of Kerala Janapaksham .
Mike Bocklet ( born November 3 , 1984 in South Salem , New York ) is a professional lacrosse player with the Denver Outlaws of Major League Lacrosse and the head coach of the Purchase College men 's lacrosse team .
Mildred Seydell ( born Mildred Rutherford Woolley ; March 21 , 1889 -- February 20 , 1988 ) was a pioneering woman journalist in Georgia breaking the gender barrier in newspapers in the state .
Pietro Montana ( June 29 , 1890 -- July 6 , 1978 ) was a 20th - century Italian - American sculptor , painter and teacher , noted for his war memorials and religious works .
Lynn Poole ( August 11 , 1910 -- April 14 , 1969 ) was the creator and host of an early U.S. science television program , The Johns Hopkins Science Review ( 1948 - -1955 ) , and the author of more than 20 popular science books .
Some consider Derek Warwick to be the best Formula One driver never to win a single race .
Dr. T. Ryan Gregory ( born May 16 , 1975 ) is a Canadian evolutionary biologist and genome biologist and a tenured Associate Professor in the Department of Integrative Biology and the Biodiversity Institute of Ontario at the University of Guelph in Guelph , Ontario , Canada .
Colton Harris Moore ( born March 22 , 1991 ) is an American criminal and former fugitive from Camano Island , Washington .
Christie Van Hees ( born July 5 , 1977 ) is a retired Canadian racquetball player .
Catherine B. Gulley ( fl . 1908 - 1962 ) , was an English watercolour portrait and genre painter who lived and worked in Bristol .
John Q. Jordan was an African - American journalist who covered all - black marine units in Italy during World War II . While there , he filed dispatches as a correspondent for the black - oriented Norfolk Journal and Guide .
Will Lyons is a journalist , newspaper columnist , award - winning wine writer and broadcaster .
Henry Abbey ( July 11 , 1842 -- June 7 , 1911 ) was an American poet who is best remembered for the poem , `` What do we plant when we plant a tree ? ''
Tomasz Pohl - poet , author of songs , publicist , menedżer and animator of culture .
Potenciano Lesaca was a Filipino politician and businessman who became the first civil governor of Zambales , a province of the Philippines located in the Central Luzon region .
Roberto García Morillo ( January 22 , 1911 -- October 26 , 2003 ) was an Argentine composer , musicologist , music professor and music critic .
Fredric Lieberman ( d. May 4 , 2013 ) was an American ethnomusicologist , composer , music professor , and author .
Alex Cohen is an American radio journalist , roller derby skater and author .
Víctor Yturbe ( born Víctor Manuel De Anda Iturbe ; May 8 , 1936 -- November 28 , 1987 ) was a Mexican singer , nicknamed `` El Pirulí '' .
Erna Fergusson ( January 10 , 1888 -- July 30 , 1964 ) was an avid writer , historian , and storyteller , who documented the culture and history of New Mexico for more than forty years .
Mantle Hood ( June 24 , 1918 -- July 31 , 2005 ) was an American ethnomusicologist .
Henry Monro ( 1791 - -1814 ) was a British painter , associated with the Monro ' Academy ' founded by his father Thomas Monro ( 1759 - -1833 ) .
Kuselo Moyake is a South African rugby union player , currently playing with Romanian side Baia Mare .
Michael Waller Robinson ( October 13 , 1837 -- July 23 , 1912 ) was an American lawyer , educator , and politician from Missouri .
Dave Keller ( born September 28 , 1959 ) is a former minor league baseball player , coach and manager and major league coach for the Cleveland Indians .
Henry Rollins ( born Henry Lawrence Garfield ; February 13 , 1961 ) is an American musician , writer , journalist , publisher , actor , motivational speaker , television and radio host , spoken word artist , comedian , and activist .
Howard Fried ( born June 14 , 1946 , in Cleveland , Ohio ) is an American conceptual artist who became known in the 1970s for his pioneering work in video art , performance art , and installation art . He lives and works in Vallejo , California .
Florian Ceynowa ( Kashubian Florión Cenôwa ) ( May 4 , 1817 -- March 26 , 1881 ) was a doctor , political activist , writer , and linguist .
Archibald Williamson , 1st Baron Forres PC ( 13 September 1860 - -29 October 1931 ) , known as Sir Archibald Williamson , 1st Baronet , from 1909 to 1922 , was a Scottish businessman and Liberal politician .
J. Anderson Thomson , Jr. is an American psychiatrist and writer .
Shungo Oyama ( 大山 峻護 Ōyama Shungo ( oːjama ɕɯŋɡo ) ; born April 11 , 1974 ) is a Japanese mixed martial artist with an extensive and successful background in judo and sambo .
Verne Harris has been the archivist for the papers of Nelson Mandela since 2004 , as Head of the Memory Programme at the Nelson Mandela Foundation 's Centre of Memory and Dialogue .
John S. Rodwell ( 1946 -- present ) is an ecologist who was based at the University of Lancaster , noted for his role in the development of the British National Vegetation Classification and as editor of the five volumes of British Plant Communities .
Phil Seaman ( born 1947 ) was an English piano based singer - songwriter who found fame with his hit single `` Rain '' in 1972 , and the album Vermillion Memoirs of the same year .
Robert Ferro ( October 21 , 1941 - July 11 , 1988 ) was an American novelist whose semi - autobiographical fiction explored the uneasy integration of homosexuality and traditional American upper - middle - class values .
Colin Munro MacLeod ( January 28 , 1909 -- February 11 , 1972 ) was a Canadian - American geneticist .
Donald J. Leonard ( born July 11 , 1933 ) is an American electrical engineer and AT&T executive , who received the 1996 IEEE Simon Ramo Medal .
David Burroughs Mattingly ( born June 29 , 1956 , Fort Collins , Colorado ) is an American illustrator and painter , best known for his numerous book covers of science fiction and fantasy literature .
Gertrude Kayaga Mulindwa is a Ugandan librarian who has been the director of the National Library of Uganda since its founding in 2003 .
Casey Kauffman is an American journalist who works for Al Jazeera English , the first English - language news channel headquartered in the Middle East .
Yuan Xianchen ( simplified Chinese : 袁显臣 ; traditional Chinese : 袁顯臣 ; pinyin : Yuán Xiǎnchén ) is a mainland Chinese lawyer and human rights activist from Heilongjiang province .

Charles R. Brayton ( August 16 , 1840 -- September 23 , 1910 ) was a prominent Republican politician and lobbyist in Rhode Island in the late 19th and early 20th centuries .

Ellen Lendra Hight ( born February 13 , 1981 ) is a Zambian swimmer , who specialized in freestyle and butterfly events .
Sumner Howard ( May 7 , 1835 -- September 6 , 1890 ) was an American jurist and politician who served as Chief Justice on the Arizona Territorial Supreme Court , Speaker of the Michigan House of Representatives , and Mayor of Prescott , Arizona Territory .
Derrelle Owens ( born June 9 , 1981 ) , better known by his stage name Shorty Mack , is a rapper and actor .
Oliver McCall ( born April 21 , 1965 ) is an American professional boxer best known for winning the WBC heavyweight title in 1994 , after scoring an upset knockout victory over Lennox Lewis .
Marcelle Dormoy ( 1895 - 1976 ) was a French couturier , fashion designer , and former model active from 1928 to 1950 .
Norman Snow ( born March 29 , 1950 ) is an American actor who is probably best known for his role as the evil tyrant Xur in the science fiction film The Last Starfighter ( 1984 ) .
Wayne Hope is an Australian actor , writer , director , and producer .
Huang Tsing - tung ( Chinese : 黃慶東 ; pinyin : Huáng Qìngdōng ) is a politician in the Republic of China .
Liraz Charhi ( Hebrew : לירז צ'רכי‎ ; born May 31 , 1978 in Ramla ) is an Israeli actress , singer and dancer of Iranian descent , living in the United States .
Verónica Romero is a Spanish singer who rose to fame in 2001 after appearing on the reality singing contest Operación Triunfo , in which she finished in sixth place .
Lawrence Foanaota OBE , born on Malaita , is a Solomon Islander archaeologist .
David Ackroyd ( born May 30 , 1940 ) is an American actor , who first came to prominence in soap operas such as The Secret Storm and Another World .
Boyé Lafayette De Mente is an American author , journalist , and adventurer who has written over 100 books mainly related to Mexico and East Asia , in particular Japanese culture .
Adolph Frank ( January 20 , 1834 -- May 30 , 1916 ) was a German chemist , engineer , and businessman .
Shauna Cross is an American screenwriter , novelist and former roller derby athlete .
Antonio Agri ( May 5 , 1932 -- October 17 , 1998 ) was an Argentine violinist , composer and conductor prominent in both the tango and classical music genres .
Michael Jonzun , a musician and producer of electro , and especially electro funk , was born in Florida , and formed the Jonzun Crew in Boston with Steve Thorpe and Gordy Worthy .
Mohammad Hashemi Rafsanjani ( also Mohammad Hashemi ) is an Iranian politician who has been a member of the Expediency Discernment Council since 1997 .
Ziya Mammadov Arzuman oglu ( Azerbaijani : Ziya Məmmədov Arzuman oğlu ) is an Azerbaijani politician who serves as the Minister of Transportation of Azerbaijan Republic .
Richard Corrigan ( born 10 February 1964 ) is an Irish chef .
Samuel Bell Thomas ( July 6 , 1868 - October 11 , 1943 ) was a New York lawyer who defended William Sulzer during his impeachment in 1913 .
Haji Bektash Veli or Ḥājī Baktāsh Walī ( Persian : حاجی بکتاش ولی ‎‎ Ḥājī Baktāš Walī ; Turkish : Hacı Bektaş Veli ) was an Alevi Muslim mystic , Sayyid , humanist and philosopher , who lived from 1209 to 1271 .
Jean - Joseph Marcel ( November 24 , 1776 -- March 11 , 1854 ) was a French printer and engineer .
Raymond John Barry ( professionally known as Raymond J. Barry ) ( born March 14 , 1939 ) is an American film , television , and stage actor .
Tracy Davidson ( born June 10 , 1963 ) is a news presenter for WCAU in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania .
Cristi Puiu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( ˈkristi ˈpuju ) ; born 3 April 1967 ) is a Romanian film director and screenwriter .
Pál Sajgó ( born April 28 , 1922 ) was a Hungarian cross country skier and biathlete who competed in the 1950s .
Mohammad Ali Ghouchani ( 1771 in Ghouchan - 3rd of march 1877 in Tabriz ) , also known as Mirza Sanglakh , was a Persian author , poet , mystic and calligrapher in the era of Fath Ali Shah , Mohammad Shah and Naser al - Din Shah .
Coleman Dupont Donaldson ( 1922 - -2009 ) was a fluid physicist and aeronautical engineer who specialized in turbulent flow and computational fluid dynamics .
Ding Wenjiang ( Chinese : 丁文江 ; March 20 , 1887 - January 5 , 1936 ) , courtesy name Zaijun , was a Chinese geologist , polymath , writer , politician , administrator , and social activist , active especially in the Republic of China ( 1912 - -49 ) .
Cratippus of Pergamon ( Greek : Κράτιππος ) , was a leading Peripatetic philosopher of the 1st century BC who taught at Mytilene and Athens .
Gautam Bhattacharya is a sports journalist and the Associate Editor of Ananda Bazar Patrika in India .
Jonathan Yudis ( born in Philadelphia on December 22 , 1971 ) is an American film director .
Vaughan Bell is a British clinical psychologist at the South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust specialising in psychological interventions for psychotic outpatients and in training other professionals to deal with such patients .
Kendall Baisden ( born March 5 , 1995 ) is an American track and field sprinter who specializes in the 400-meter dash .
Doug Whitsett ( born 1943 ) is an American politician who serves in the Oregon State Senate , representing District 28 .
Count Eustachy Tyszkiewicz h. Leliwa ( 1814 , Lahojsk -- 1874 in Wilno ) was a Polish noble , archaeologist and historian from the former Grand Duchy of Lithuania and White Ruthenia , then part of the Russian Empire .
Celina Murga ( born December 1973 ) is an Argentinian filmmaker , screenwriter , and producer .
Le Tari ( April 21 , 1946 -- April 4 , 1987 ) was an American actor who appeared in movies and on television .
Nina Pušlar ( born October 25 , 1988 , in Ivančna Gorica , Slovenia ) is a Slovenian singer - songwriter .
Gabriel Aragón , better known as Gaby , ( Madrid , 1920 -- Madrid , January 10 , 1995 ) was a Spanish clown and saxophonist , member of the trio Gaby , Fofó and Miliki .
Scott Bitz ( born October 29 , 1973 , in Regina , Saskatchewan ) is a Canadian curler .
Ellen Fanning is an Australian journalist and was the last host of the Nine Network 's Sunday television program .
Marcos Vidal ( born December 10 , 1967 ) , is a Dove Award - nominated Spanish Christian singer / songwriter .
Shiferaw Shigute Wolassa ( Amharic : ? ) is an Ethiopian politician who is currently the country 's Minister of Education , and previously served as President of the Southern Nations , Nationalities , and Peoples ' Region from 2006 to 2013 .
Franz Gabl ( December 29 , 1921 -- January 23 , 2014 ) was an Austrian alpine skier and Olympic medalist .
Bartolommeo Penni was a Florentine High Renaissance painter active in the 16th century , the brother of the painters Luca Penni and Gianfrancesco Penni - the three brothers originally came from a family of weavers .
Sonja Gaudet ( born in North Vancouver , British Columbia on July 22 , 1966 ) is a Canadian Paralympic curler .
Binem Heller is a Polish poet and activist .
Mark Janicello ( born November 3 , 1962 , in Brooklyn , New York ) is an American singer , actor , painter and author .
Don Perlin ( born August 27 , 1929 ) is an American comic book artist and occasional writer best known for Marvel Comics ' Werewolf by Night , The Defenders , and Ghost Rider .
Dr. Mohan Agashe is an Indian theatre and film actor .
John Lloyd Vaughan Watkins ( 1802 -- 28 September 1865 ) was a Welsh Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons in three periods between 1832 and 1865 .
Martha Hollander ( born March 24 , 1959 ) is an American poet and art historian .
Mike Birbiglia ( born June 20 , 1978 ) is an American comedian , writer , actor , and director .
Jarvis Mills ( born September 11 , 1983 ) , better known by his stage name Jae Millz , is an American rapper from Harlem , New York , who is signed to Lil Wayne 's record label Young Money Entertainment and Cash Money Records .
Bikash Ranjan Das ( Bengali : বিকাশ রঞ্জন দাশ ) ( born July 14 , 1982 , Dhaka ) is a Bangladeshi cricketer who played in one Test in 2000 .
Wallace Ronald Roy ( born April 29 , 1940 ) , or Ron Roy , is an American writer of children 's fiction , primarily mysteries for young readers .
Levy Mayer ( October 23 , 1858 -- August 14 , 1922 ) was an American lawyer from Virginia .
Henrik Stehlik ( born December 29 , 1980 ) is a German trampoline gymnast and three - time Olympic athlete .
Jana Carpenter is an American actress , singer and guitarist based in the UK .
Jules Harlow ( born June 28 , 1931 ) is a Conservative Jewish rabbi and liturgist ; son of Henry and Lena Lipman Harlow .
Ronald Radosh ( born 1937 ) is an American writer , professor , historian , and former Marxist .
Thomas Patch ( 1725 - -1782 ) was an English painter , engraver , physiognomist and art historian .
Lyn Coffin ( born November 12 , 1943 ) is an American poet , fiction writer , playwright , translator , non - fiction writer , editor .
Kara Magsanoc - Alikpala is a Philippine broadcast journalist who produces news documentaries .
Francis D. Lee ( 1826 - -1885 ) was an American architect and inventor from Charleston , South Carolina .
Edwin Francis Gay ( October 27 , 1867 -- February 8 , 1946 ) was an American economist , Professor of Economic History and first Dean of the Harvard Business School .
Robin Givhan ( September 11 , 1964 ) is the fashion editor for The Washington Post .
Paul Kreppel ( born June 20 , 1947 ) is an actor , producer , director .
Anthony Loke Siew Fook ( simplified Chinese : 陆兆福 ; traditional Chinese : 陸兆福 ; pinyin : Lù Zhào Fú ; born 28 April 1977 ) is a Malaysian politician .
A fellowship run by The Frank Sargeson Trust in association with Auckland University and sponsored by law firm Grimshaw & Co supports writer(s ) to live in the Sargeson Centre , adjacent to the University of Auckland , with an annual stipend .
Joseph R. Driscoll is an American politician who was a member of the Massachusetts House of Representatives from 2003 to 2011 , representing the 5th district of Norfolk County .
Thrasyvoulos Zaimis ( Greek : Θρασύβουλος Ζαΐμης , 1822 - -1880 ) was a Greek politician and Prime Minister .
Eva Rueber - Staier ( sometimes spelled Eva Reuber - Staier ) is an Austrian actress , TV Host , model and beauty queen who won Miss World 1969 .
Kate Micucci ( pronounced /mᵻˈkuːtʃi/ ; born March 31 , 1980 ) is an American actress , comedian , singer - songwriter , and artist .
Soumitra Sen was a former judge of the Calcutta High Court .
Benjamin Peltonen ( born April 15 , 1997 ) is a Finnish singer , who originally became famous through the photo - sharing service Instagram , where his profile , opened in 2012 , has more than 229,000 followers .
Yohanan Simon ( Hebrew : יוחנן סימון ) was a German - born , award - winning Israeli painter .
Rickey William Kelman , known as Ricky Kelman or Rick Kelman ( born July 6 , 1950 ) , is a former child and young adult actor who apperared in film and on television from 1954 to 1974 .
Alan Lelchuk is a novelist , professor , and editor from Brooklyn , New York .
Alfred Pink ( June 1 , 1853 in Fratton , Portsmouth , Hampshire -- January 12 , 1931 in Portsmouth ) was an English cricketer who played one first - class match for Hampshire in 1885 .
Walter Paul Sieber ( October 2 , 1933 -- July 5 , 2009 ) was a Canadian professional wrestler under the ring name Waldo Von Erich .
Menahem ben Moshe Bavli ( Bavli meaning Roman ) , also known as Menahem Ben Moshe ha - Bavli , ( ? -1571 ) was a Jewish rabbi and author of the 1571 book Ta'amei Ha - Misvot ( `` The Reasons For The Precepts '' ) .
Carlton Ward Jr. is a photographer with National Geographic Society .
Arthur T. Benjamin ( born March 19 , 1961 ) is an American mathematician who specializes in combinatorics .
Maurice Lim ( born 1984 ) is a Dutch figure skater who was a two - time champion of the Dutch Figure Skating Championships .
Søren Nils Eichberg ( born 1973 ) is a German / Danish composer .
Kim Manners ( January 13 , 1951 -- January 25 , 2009 ) was an American television producer , director and actor best known for his work on The X - Files and Supernatural .
Ignacio Tuason Arroyo , Jr. ( October 24 , 1950 -- January 26 , 2012 ) , also known as Iggy Arroyo , was a Filipino politician .
Kirk Earlywine ( born July 4 , 1964 ) is an American college basketball coach , currently the director of player development at the University of Idaho and the former head men 's basketball coach at Eastern Washington University .
Lowrell Simon ( born March 18 , 1943 , Chicago ) is an American soul singer .
Jason Howland is a musical theatre composer , playwright , conductor , music director , and producer .
Jennifer Donnelly ( born August 16 , 1963 ) is an American writer of young - adult fiction best known for the historical novel A Northern Light .
Bert Lahr , born Irving Lahrheim ( August 13 , 1895 -- December 4 , 1967 ) , was an American iconic actor , particularly of stage and film and comedian .
William Wallace Burns McInnes ( April 8 , 1871 -- August 4 , 1954 ) was a Canadian politician , lawyer and served as the Yukon 's fifth Commissioner .
Peter Askim is an American composer of modern classical music , conductor , music educator and a double bassist .
Naeem Juwan , better known by his stage name Spank Rock , is an American rapper and songwriter from Baltimore .
Murray John Sawchuk ( born November 25 , 1973 , stage name Murray SawChuck ) is a stage illusionist , magician , comedian , actor , and host .
William Stephan Spider Ledesma II ( born April 6 , 1964 ) is an American professional basketball player and the current CEO of the Native American Olympic Team and Buyorsellnetwork.com .
Andrej Kroen was a politician of the late 16th century and early 17th century in Slovenia when the country was under the Holy Roman Empire .
Yutaka Fukumoto ( 福本 豊 , born November 7 , 1947 in Osaka , Osaka ) is a retired Japanese professional baseball player in Nippon Professional Baseball .
William Graves Sharp ( March 14 , 1859 -- November 17 , 1922 ) was an American lawyer , manufacturer , three - term congressman , and diplomat .
J. Roy Helland ( born January 28 , 1943 in Glendale , California ) is a make - up artist .
Theo Kamecke ( born October 18 , 1937 ) is a sculptor , who previously worked as a film director during the 1960s and 1970s .
Jug Suraiya is a prominent Indian journalist , author and columnist .
Tommy Vig ( July 14 , 1938 ) is a jazz vibraharpist , drummer , percussionist , arranger , big band leader , film , television , and classical concert composer , inventor , author , and educator .
Erma Duricko is an American theatre director specializing in new plays and the works of Tennessee Williams .
Herman Watzinger was a Norwegian engineer in the area of cooling technique from NTH ( now NTNU ) in Trondheim and a crewmember on the Kon - Tiki expedition .
Zelma O'Neal ( May 29 , 1903 - November 3 , 1989 ) was an actress , singer , and dancer in the 1920s and 1930s .
Julia Boseman is an American politician and a former Democratic member of the North Carolina Senate .
Ivan Ivanji is a Jewish - Serbian author of many internationally renowned novels .
Mark Gonzales ( born June 1 , 1968 ) , also known as `` Gonz '' and `` The Gonz '' , is an American professional skateboarder and artist .
Jørgen Stubberud ( 17 or 19 April 1883 -- 12 February 1980 ) was a Norwegian polar explorer who participated in the Amundsen Antarctica Expedition between 1910 and 1912 .
Shep Meyers ( October 5 , 1936 - July 18 , 2009 ) was an American pianist , composer , arranger and conductor .
Melinda O'Neal is a conductor of choral music and choral - orchestral music .
Redell Olsen ( born in 1971 ) is a British poet and academic .
Charles David Allis ( born March 22 , 1951 ) is an American molecular biologist , and is currently the Joy and Jack Fishman Professor and Head of the Laboratory of Chromatin Biology and Epigenetics at The Rockefeller University .
Carl Mitcham ( born 1941 ) is a philosopher of technology .
Josh Linkner ( born Joshua M. Linkner , July 28 , 1970 ) is an entrepreneur , keynote speaker , and author .
W Kulabindu Singh ( born June 25 , 1926 ) is an Indian politician from Manipur and is a member of the Janata Dal party .
Veer Pratap Singh is an Indian cricketer who plays first - class cricket for Bengal .
S. P. Muthukumaran was an Indian politician and incumbent Member of the Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly from the Pudukottai constituency .
Paul Glastris is an American journalist and political columnist .
Henry C. Koch ( March 20 , 1841 -- May 19 , 1910 ) was a German - American architect , based in Milwaukee , Wisconsin .
Michael Yellowlees ( born 1959 ) is a former Scottish field hockey player who played for the Scotland national outdoor and indoor teams during the 1980s and early 1990s .
Adriano de Micheli ( born June 20 , 1975 , in Genoa ) is an Italian auto racing driver .
Sean Andrew Faden ( born July 23 , 1973 ) is a computer graphics animator .
Raymond Arrieta ( born March 26 , 1965 ) is a Puerto Rican comedian , actor , singer and philanthropist .
Kolmas , Josef ( 1982 ) Ferdinand Stoliczka ( 1838 - -1874 ) the life and work of the Czech explorer in India and high Asia .
Tim Fain is an American violinist , perhaps best known for his performances in the movie Black Swan and his work with American composer Philip Glass .
Ariel Gore ( born June 25 , 1970 , in Carmel , California ) is a journalist , memoirist , novelist , nonfiction author , and teacher .
Ali Abdoh ( Alan Morgan ) ( Persian : علی عبده‎ ) was an Iranian boxer and founder of Persepolis Athletic and Cultural Club .
Liliana Mayo ( born March 30 , 1952 ) is a Peruvian psychologist and special education teacher .
Shane Endsley is an American trumpeter , drummer , and composer .
Eliza Lanesford Cushing ( October 19 , 1794 -- May 4 , 1886 ) was an American - Canadian dramatist , short story writer , and editor .
Nua Mailo Saoluaga ( born ? ) is an American Samoan politician .
Paul Koering ( born December 17 , 1964 ) is a Minnesota politician and a former member of the Minnesota Senate from Fort Ripley .
Berwick Kaler ( born 1946 ) is a British actor most famous for playing the dame in York Theatre Royal 's annual pantomime , which he also writes and directs .
José María Peralta Lagos ( 1873 - 1944 ) , was a Salvadoran writer , military engineer , and politician .
Saeed Jalili ( Persian : سعید جلیلی‎‎ ; born September 1965 ) is an Iranian conservative politician and diplomat who was secretary of the Supreme National Security Council from 2007 to 2013 .
Tihon Konstantinov ( August 13 , 1898 - -1957 ) was a Moldavian SSR and Moldavian ASSR politician .
Ryuichi Kihara ( 木原 龍一 Kihara Ryūichi , born August 22 , 1992 ) is a Japanese figure skater .
John Vance Cheney ( December 29 , 1848 in Groveland , New York -- May 1 , 1922 ) was an American poet , essayist and librarian .
William Reyna ( born in San Cristóbal ) , better known by his stage name Sensato del Patio or simply Sensato , is a Dominican rapper from the Bronx borough of New York City .
Cris Alexander ( born Alan Smith ; January 14 , 1920 -- March 7 , 2012 ) was an American actor , singer , dancer , designer , and photographer .
Arthur Banfield ( January 28 , 1897 -- January 3 , 1972 ) was an English cricketer who played first - class cricket for Essex in the 1921 season .
Ria Ritchie ( /riˈɑː/ ree - AH ; born 24 September 1987 ) is an English singer - songwriter and recording artist .
Max Sandvoss ( born Stephen James Sandvoss ; June 23 , 1980 ) is an American former actor .
Sheri Fink is an American journalist who writes about health , medicine and science .
Joseph Aloys Schmittbaur ( also Schmittbauer ; November 8 , 1718 - October 24 , 1809 ) was a German composer , Kapellmeister , instrument maker and music teacher .
Lorraine Pascale ( born 17 November 1972 ) is a British former model and television cook , best known for selling almost one million books in the UK alone .
Joe Dietl is an American actor , writer , director and producer .
Helen Kane ( August 4 , 1904 -- September 26 , 1966 ) was an American popular singer ; her signature song was `` I Wanna Be Loved By You '' .
Athenodoros Cordylion ( or Athenodorus , Ancient Greek : Αθηνόδωρος Κορδυλίων ; fl . early - mid 1st century BC ) was a Stoic philosopher , born in Tarsus .
Leroy F. Greene ( January 31 , 1918 -- September 29 , 2002 ) was a Democratic politician in the State of California .
Mahmuduzzaman is a First class and List A cricketer from Bangladesh who made his debut for Khulna Division in 2006/07 , taking 6 wickets in his first season in the first class game .
Alfred Buckham began his career in photography in 1905 and joined the Royal Naval Air Service as a reconnaissance photographer in 1917 .
Roberto Amoroso ( Italian pronunciation : ( roˈbɛrto amoˈroːzo ) ; 1911 - -1994 ) was an Italian screenwriter and film producer .
R. Slater ( full name dates of birth and death unknown ) was an English cricketer .
Prince Alexey Fyodorovich Orlov ( 19 October ( O.S. 8 October ) 1787 -- 21 May 1862 ) was a Russian diplomat , the natural son of Count Fyodor Grigoryevich .
Rhett Reese is an American film producer , television producer and screenwriter .
Thomas Mellon Evans ( September 8 , 1910 -- July 17 , 1997 ) was a financier who was one of the early corporate raiders in American business as well as a philanthropist and a prominent Thoroughbred racehorse owner and breeder who won the 1981 Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes .
John Speidell ( fl . 1600 - -1634 ) was an English mathematician .
Susannah Cahalan is an American journalist and author , known for writing her memoir , Brain on Fire , about her hospitalization with a rare auto - immune disease , anti - NMDA receptor encephalitis .
Tim Kent is an American painter represented by SLAG Gallery in New York .
Jacob Bitzer ( January 16 , 1865- ) was an American businessman , real estate agent , and politician who served as a member of the Massachusetts House of Representatives .
Franz Anton Schiefner ( July 18 , 1817 -- November 16 , 1879 ) was a Baltic German linguist and tibetologist .
Aimee Bender ( born June 28 , 1969 ) is an American novelist and short story writer , known for her surreal plots and characters .
Alan Gilmour is a playwright and librettist .
Marilyn Price - Mitchell ( born March 1 , 1949 ) is an American psychologist , columnist and youth development expert .
In 1985 , Cazuza took part in Rock in Rio with Barão Vermelho ( Red Baron ) , and around this time , Caetano Veloso claimed he was the greatest Brazilian poet of his generation .
Franz Pacher ( born April 28 , 1919 in Prostřední Suchá , present - day Czech Republic ) is an Austrian engineer and pioneer of modern tunneling , who is one of three men notable as the chief developers of the New Austrian Tunneling method .
Pranciškus Baltrus Šivickis ( born September 30 , 1882 , in the Raseiniai region of central Lithuania -- died October 12 , 1968 ) was a Lithuanian zoologist who moved to the United States where he completed his education .
Neako Bailey ( born April 23 , 1986 ) , better known by the stage name Neako is an American rapper , producer and songwriter .
Joe Seneca ( January 14 , 1919 -- August 15 , 1996 ) was an American film and television actor who had a lengthy Hollywood career , portraying bit parts in many major films and television sitcoms spanning from the 1970s to the 1990s .
Doug Cotler is a Grammy Award - winning composer and an accomplished singer , songwriter and musician .
Quintus Aemilius Lepidus ( possibly Quintus Aemilius Lepidus Barbula ) ( fl . 1st century BC ) was a Roman senator and military officer who was appointed Roman consul in 21 BC .
J.D. Malone officially started his career as a singer / songwriter , getting involved with the local music scene of the Philadelphia area in the early 1990s .
Mikkel Thorup ( born 1965 ) is a Danish computer scientist jointly affiliated at AT&T Labs in Florham Park , New Jersey , USA and at Copenhagen University .

Henry Eichheim ( January 3 , 1870 -- August 22 , 1942 ) was an American composer , conductor , violinist , organologist , and ethnomusicologist .
Phyllis O'Donnell ( born 1937 ) is an Australian surfer who became the first Women 's World Surfing Champion .
Joshua Knobe is an experimental philosopher , whose work ranges across issues in philosophy of mind and action and ethics .

James R. Powell is an American physicist notable -- together with Dr. Gordon Danby -- for his work on superconducting Maglev , for which he shared the Franklin Institute `` Medal 2000 for Engineering '' .

Shelley - Ann Brown ( born March 15 , 1980 ) was a Canadian bobsledder who has competed since 2006 .

Mel Bartels ( born 1954 ) is an amateur astronomer after whom the asteroid 17823 Bartels was named .
Richard L. Samuels ( born August 13 , 1926 - died April 14 , 2001 in Flossmoor ) was a Cook County Circuit judge at the Sixth Municipal District Courthouse in Markham , Illinois for nearly 30 years .
Josh Werner ( born September 17 , 1974 ) is an American bassist , producer and songwriter .
Ozil de Cadartz was a troubadour known for only one surviving canso , `` Assatz es dregz , pos jois no.m pot venir '' .

Richard Teitelbaum ( born May 19 , 1939 ) is an American composer , keyboardist , and improvisor .
Mike Sacks is an American author , humor writer , and magazine editor based in New York City .
Benjamin Kendall Emerson ( December 20 , 1843 -- April 7 , 1932 ) was an American geologist and author .
Ally Burguieres ( born November 21 , 1982 ) is a New Orleans - based American visual artist and writer .
Milan Jurčo ( born September 14 , 1957 in Liptovský Mikuláš ) was a Czechoslovak professional road bicycle racer .
Uladislau Herculano de Freitas Guimarães ( Arroio Grande , November 25 , 1865 - Rio de Janeiro , May 14 , 1926 ) was a Brazilian politician and an advocate .

Kim Chan ( December 28 , 1917 -- October 5 , 2008 ) , also known as Kim S. Chan , was a Chinese - American actor and producer .
Edgar Nelson Transeau ( 1875 - 1960 ) was an American botanist and phycologist who served as president of the Botanical Society of America and the Ecological Society of America .
Ron Rose ( born September 4 , 1944 in Vancouver , Washington ) is an American poker player from Dayton , Ohio , and a two time World Poker Tour ( WPT ) Champion with a World Series of Poker bracelet .
François Poeydebasque was a rugby union player , who represented France .
Carlos Sandoval Mendoza ( born 1956 , Mexico City ) Is a Mexican / German freelance composer and multimedia artist mostly recognized for his work joining technology , nature and art .
Paul Osborn ( September 4 , 1901 -- May 12 , 1988 ) was an American playwright and screenwriter best known for writing the screen adaptation of East of Eden as well as South Pacific , The Yearling , The World of Suzie Wong and Sayonara .
Eoghan Grace is a rugby union player for Plymouth Albion .
Mylon Watkins is a former boxer in the Junior middleweight division .
Mike Moyle ( born December 7 , 1964 ) is an American politician and a Republican member of the Idaho House of Representatives since 1998 in the District 14 A seat .
Cheng Wai ( simplified Chinese : 郑慧 ; traditional Chinese : 鄭慧 ; pinyin : Zhèng Huì ) is a Hong Kong classical pianist .
Tokuro Fujiwara ( 藤原 得郎 Fujiwara Tokurō ) , sometime credited as Professor F or Arthur King , is a Japanese video game designer , best known for creating Ghosts ' n Goblins and producing the Mega Man series .
Kimya Dawson ( born November 17 , 1972 ) is an American singer - songwriter , best known as a solo performer and as one half of The Moldy Peaches .
Tofig Gasimov Masim oglu ( Azerbaijani : Tofiq Qasımov Məsim oğlu ; born April 10 , 1938 ) is a retired Azerbaijani politician and diplomat .
Sebastiaan Verschuren ( born 7 October 1988 ) is a Dutch competitive swimmer who specializes in short and middle - distance freestyle events .
Paul Rein ( born Pauli Kaj Olavi Reinikainen , May 20 , 1965 ) is a leading Swedish songwriter based in Stockholm .
Thomas Diflo , M.D. , F.A.C.S. is a transplant surgeon and Professor of Surgery at Westchester Medical Center .
Józef Cyrankiewicz ( ˈjuzɛf t͡sɨranˈkʲɛvit͡ʂ ) ( April 23 , 1911 -- January 20 , 1989 ) was a Polish Socialist and after 1948 Communist politician .
