Peter Gellhorn ( October 24 , 1912 -- February 13 , 2004 ) was a German conductor , composer , pianist and teacher who settled in London and made a career in Britain that lasted unbroken until his death .
Eleni Vitali ( Ελένη Βιτάλη ) is a Greek popular singer and composer the last 30 years .
Brett McDermott is an English mixed martial artist and retired professional rugby league player who represented for Ireland , and at club level for all the Cumbrian clubs , in particular Barrow Raiders .

Ken Billington ( born October 29 , 1946 ) is an American lighting designer .
Lindsey Pollard is an animator from Victoria , British Columbia , Canada , now residing in Los Angeles , California .
Osher Zilberstein ( 1888 - -1973 ) , a noted Torah scholar , was a tenth generation rabbi from Mezritch , Wolyn .
Chad Leonhardt ( born February 19 , 1980 ) is an American mixed martial artist who fought for Strikeforce and Bellator Fighting Championships .
Torsten Krol is an Australian writer resident in Queensland .
Michelle Clark - Heard ( born July 27 , 1968 ) is the current head coach for the Western Kentucky University women 's basketball team .
Charles D. Conover ( March 21 , 1881 -- July 27 , 1937 ) was a Republican politician in the U.S. state of Ohio who was Speaker of the Ohio House of Representatives 1915 - 1916 .
Stuart Linder is a Beverly Hills , CA plastic surgeon best known for his appearances on several reality and news television shows .
John Dominis ( June 27 , 1921 -- December 30 , 2013 ) was an American documentary photographer , war photographer and photojournalist .
Carlton Moss ( February 14 , 1909 in Newark , New Jersey -- August 10 , 1997 ) was an African - American screenwriter , actor and film director .
Allen Munroe ( March 10 , 1819 -- October 6 , 1884 ) was an American merchant , manufacturer , banker and politician from New York .

Keça Kurd ( 1948 ) is a contemporary Kurdish writer , poet , linguist and translator .
John Leonard Riddell ( February 20 , 1807 -- October 7 , 1865 ) was a science lecturer , botanist , geologist , medical doctor , chemist , microscopist , numismatist , politician , and science fiction author in the United States .
Hannah M. Jones is an artist and musician from Athens , Georgia .
Alphonso Johnson ( born February 2 , 1951 ) is an American jazz bassist , who has been influential since the early 1970s .
Yves Chauvin ( French : ( ʃɔvɛ̃ ) ; October 10 , 1930 -- January 27 , 2015 ) was a French chemist and Nobel Prize laureate .

Ludwig Merwart ( September 1 , 1913 -- July 13 , 1979 ) was an influential Austrian painter and graphic artist .
Dan Seymour ( February 22 , 1915 -- May 25 , 1993 ) was an American character actor who frequently played villains in Warner Bros. films .

Tina Tyus - Shaw ( born in Griffin , Georgia ) is a television news anchor and journalist at WSAV - TV in Savannah , Georgia .
Gavin Baddeley is an ordained Reverend in the Church of Satan , and an experienced journalist who has worked for The Observer and Metal Hammer .
Andrew Form is an American film producer , best known for producing the films like Friday the 13th , Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles , and The Purge .
Thomas E. Crow ( born 1948 ) is an American art historian and art critic who is best known for his influential writing on the role of art in modern society and culture .
Charles Urban ( April 15 , 1867 -- August 29 , 1942 ) was an Anglo - American film producer and distributor , and one of the most significant figures in British cinema before the First World War .
Carl Leverkus ( November 5 , 1804 - February 4 , 1889 ) was a German chemist and chemistry entrepreneur .

Toni Press - Coffman is an American playwright , living and working in Tucson , Arizona .

Vilhelm Klein ( 1835 - -1913 ) was a Danish architect who adopted the Historicist approach , frequently emulating the so - called Rosenborg style and the Italian Renaissance style .

Mary Waters was a native of Dublin who was a prominent nurse in the United States forces during the American Revolutionary War .

Johan Petter Johansson ( December 12 , 1853 -- August 25 , 1943 ) , sometimes known as JP , was a Swedish inventor and industrialist .
Maxim Bouchard ( born September 18 , 1990 ) is a Canadian diver who competes for the national team .
Nicolae Sulac ( September 9 , 1936 , Sadâc -- April 8 , 2003 , Chişinău ) was a musician from Moldova .
Kate Pullinger is a Canadian novelist and author of digital fiction , lecturing at De Montfort University , England .
Rocky Carson is an American professional racquetball player ( born May 21 , 1979 ) .
Oscar Walker ( March 18 , 1854 -- May 20 , 1889 ) , was an American professional baseball player who played center field and at first base for five different teams in six seasons , from 1875 to 1885 .
Clarice Assad is a classical and jazz composer , arranger , pianist , and vocalist .
Cameron Butterwick is a British actor best known for his role as ' Josh ' on the Disney Channel UK series As the Bell Rings .
Noemí Gerstein ( 1910 - 1996 ) was an Argentine sculptor , illustrator and plastic artist .
William Dale Phillips was a chemist , nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopist , federal science policy advisor and member of the National Academy of Sciences .
Marian Call ( born February 24 , 1982 in Gig Harbor , Washington ) , is an American singer - songwriter based in Juneau , Alaska .
John Sieg ( February 3 , 1903 -- October 15 , 1942 ) was a railroad worker and journalist who publicized Nazi atrocities through the underground Communist press and fought against National Socialism in the German Resistance .
Robert Brown Young ( April 1 , 1854 - January 29 , 1914 ) was a Canadian - born architect who designed buildings in California .
Mihai Codreanu ( July 25 , 1876 -- October 23 , 1957 ) was a Romanian poet , particularly noted for his sonnets .
Alexander Rives ( June 17 , 1806 -- September 17 , 1885 ) was a Virginia lawyer , politician , and federal judge .
Livy Jeanne ( raised in Edmonton , Alberta ) is a Canadian country music singer .
C. B. Embry Jr. ( born July 29 , 1941 ) is an American politician and a Republican member of the Kentucky Senate representing District 6 .
Paul Marino is a film director , producer , animator , voice actor , and author currently focused on machinima , the art of using engines from video games to create films .
Bernie LaBarge ( born March 11 , 1953 in Ottawa , Ontario ) is a Canadian guitarist , singer , and songwriter .
Caleb Blood Smith ( April 16 , 1808 -- January 7 , 1864 ) was an American journalist and politician , serving in the Cabinet of Abraham Lincoln during the American Civil War .
Rose Jean Coulter is a former unionist politician in Northern Ireland .
Miss Pooja ( born 4 December 1979 as Gurinder Kaur Kainth ) is an Indian singer and actress .
Claudio Sillero - Zubiri was born in Argentina and is a British zoologist .
Federico Degli Esposti ( born June 2 , 1980 in Bologna ) is an Italian pairs figure skater and roller skater .
Mathias Klenske ( born 25 October 1983 ) is a Danish actor and voice actor who is best known for his role as Adam in the film Frække Frida og de frygtløse spioner - an adaption based on a series of books by Lykke Nielsen .
Paul Cheung Kwok Wing ( simplified Chinese : 张国荣 ; traditional Chinese : 張國榮 ) , a Chinese entrepreneur , is the founder and CEO of Kingboard Chemical Holdings Limited in Hong Kong .
Anil Yadav is a North Indian actor who has notably portrayed the character of Demon king Ravana in the `` Jai Hanuman '' teleserial directed by Sanjay Khan in the mid-1990s .
Per Kristian Hunder ( born 28 April 1989 ) is a Norwegian freestyle skier .
John Chandler ( February 1 , 1762 -- September 25 , 1841 ) was an American politician and soldier of Maine .
James McCosh ( April 1 , 1811 -- November 16 , 1894 ) was a prominent philosopher of the Scottish School of Common Sense .
Alethea Kontis ( born January 11 , 1976 ) is an American writer of picture books and speculative fiction , primarily for children .
Paolo Veneziano , also Veneziano Paolo or Paolo da Venezia ( born before 1333 , died after 1358 ) was a medieval painter from Venice .
Kevin Shum ( born July 3 , 1997 ) is an American figure skater .
Trad Hamadeh is a Shia Lebanese politician and was one of Hezbollah 's two representatives in the Lebanese Prime Minister of Fouad Siniora 's cabinet .
Robert Warington FRS ( 1807 - 1867 ) was an English chemist considered the driving force behind the creation of the world 's first enduring chemistry society , The Chemical Society of London , which later became the Royal Society of Chemistry .
The Master of the Saint Lambrecht Votive Altarpiece was an Austrian painter active between about 1410 and 1440 .
Leon Klatzkin ( 1914 - -1992 ) was an American composer notable for his work in television .
Moorkoth Kumaran ( 1874 - -1941 ) was a teacher and a prominent short story writer in Malayalam .
Jagori Tanna ( born Andrew Koshowski , in Hamilton , Ontario ) is a Canadian musician .
Charles Minshall Jessop ( 1861 -- March 9 , 1939 ) was a mathematician at the University of Durham working in algebraic geometry .
Guido Karl Anton List , better known as Guido von List ( October 5 , 1848 -- May 17 , 1919 ) was an Austrian occultist , journalist , playwright , and novelist .
Mariano Iberico Rodríguez ( * Cajamarca , 1892 - died Lima , 1974 ) was a Peruvian philosopher .
Sandra Mihanovich ( born April 24 , 1957 ) is an Argentine singer , musician , and composer of Rock , Blues , and Tango rhythms .
William Augustus Hall ( October 15 , 1815 -- December 15 , 1888 ) was an American politician who served as a member of the United States House of Representatives .
Scott Spaven is an English rugby league player who currently plays for Doncaster in the Championship .
Thomas J. Smrt is an American inventor , businessman and entrepreneur who is best known as the inventor of the upside - down aerosol spray paint can .
Mary McSorley is a former Irish nationalist politician .
Pedro Regas ( April 18 , 1897 -- August 10 , 1974 ) was born in Sparta , Greece and was the brother of actor George Regas .
Lucky Peterson ( born Judge Kenneth Peterson , December 13 , 1964 , Buffalo , New York ) is an American musician who plays contemporary blues , fusing soul , R&B , gospel and rock and roll .
Loveland Munson ( July 21 , 1843 -- March 24 , 1921 ) was a Vermont attorney , politician and judge who served as President of the Vermont State Senate and Chief Justice of the Vermont Supreme Court .
Gilbert Emery ( June 11 , 1875 - October 28 , 1945 ) was the stage name of Gilbert Emery Bensley Pottle , an American actor who appeared in over 80 movies from 1921 to his death in 1945 .
Louis Marshall ( December 14 , 1856 -- September 11 , 1929 ) was an American corporate , constitutional and civil rights lawyer as well as a mediator and Jewish community leader who worked to secure religious , political , and cultural freedom for all minority groups .
Kenneth C. Dahlberg is an American engineer and corporate executive .
Siegfried Wolff is a now - retired Degussa chemist noted for first recognizing the potential of using silica in tire treads to reduce rolling resistance .
Jon Bruning ( born April 30 , 1969 ) is an American politician who served as the 31st Attorney General of the state of Nebraska from 2003 to 2015 .
Jacques Larocque is a Canadian saxophonist , arranger , music educator , and university administrator .
Benjamin Carr ( September 12 , 1768 -- May 24 , 1831 ) was an American composer , singer , teacher , and music publisher .
Syed Asif Masood Shah ( Urdu : آصف مسعود شاہ‎ ; born January 23 , 1946 , in Lahore , Punjab ) is a former Pakistani cricketer who played in 16 Tests and 7 ODIs from 1969 to 1977 .
Jeff Vande Zande is an American writer who is best known for his novel called American Poet which won him the Stuart and Vernice Gross Literature Award .
Hendrik Geldenhuys ( date of birth March 21 , 1983 ) is a Namibian cricketer .
Gay Courter ( born October 1 , 1944 ) is an American film writer , author , and novelist .
Tony Trujillo ( born August 23 , 1982 ) is an American professional skateboarder and musician .
Josef Hopmann ( December 22 , 1890 -- October 11 , 1975 ) was a German astronomer ( also see List of German astronomers ) .
Nicola Conte is an Italian DJ , producer , guitarist , and bandleader , known initially for introducing an innovative style of acid jazz that incorporates bossa nova themes , melodies drawn from Italian film scores of the 1960s , easy listening themes , and traditional Indian music .
Jon Micah Sumrall ( born October 13 , 1980 ) , is the lead vocalist of the Christian rock band Kutless .
Ned Hender was an Australian rules footballer from South Australia .
Karl Thomas Stenström ( born January 19 , 1988 ) , is a Swedish artist , singer and songwriter .
Mark Solonin ( born May 29 , 1958 , in Kuybyshev , USSR ) is a Russian historian of World War II , an aviation engineer by training .
Aaron E. Miller , M.D. is an American neurologist , the first Chairman of the Multiple Sclerosis section of the American Academy of Neurology ( AAN ) and recognized as a multiple sclerosis clinician .
Hassan Bubacar Jallow ( born 1950 ) is a Gambian lawyer , politician , and jurist and has been the Prosecutor of the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda ( ICTR ) since 2003 .
Cory Harrower ( born July 20 , 1989 ) is a Canadian Paralympic wheelchair basketball player .
Ryan Marks is the men 's basketball coach at the University of St. Francis , and the former head coach of the Texas - Pan American Broncos men 's basketball team .
Samantha Saint ( born June 8 , 1987 ) is the stage name of an American pornographic actress , model and Penthouse Pet of the Month for October 2012 .
Sung Won Sohn ( born 1944 ) is a Korean American economist , noted for his skill in economic forecasting .
Donfeld ( July 3 , 1934 -- February 3 , 2007 ) was an American costume designer who was perhaps best known for his work on films such as Spaceballs , Prizzi 's Honor and The Great Race .
James Lee Barrett ( November 19 , 1929 -- October 15 , 1989 ) was an American producer , screenwriter , and writer .
Joanna Connor ( born August 31 , 1962 ) is an American Chicago - based blues singer , songwriter , and a virtuoso guitarist .
Edon Molla ; ( born March 8 , 1994 ) is an Albanian American basketball player who currently plays for St. Francis College of the National Collegiate Athletic Association ( NCAA ) .
Carl Steinfort ( born 1 April 1977 ) is an Australian rules footballer who played for both the Geelong ( 1996 - -2000 ) and Collingwood ( 2001 - -2002 ) football clubs in the Australian Football League ( AFL ) .
J. Chandulal Jain was a popular Kannada film director and producer of almost 40 films , notably , Thaaye Devaru , Bhootayyana Maga Ayyu , Tabbaliyu Neenade Magane , Bhakta Siriyala , and many more .
John Statz is a folksinger / singer - songwriter , currently residing in Denver , Colorado , though he is originally from Wisconsin .
Moses Billings ( January 15 , 1809 -- August 14 , 1884 ) was an American painter and photographer known mainly for his portraits .
Morna Edmundson is a Canadian choral conductor .
Erdoğan Toprak ( born 1961 ) is a Turkish politician and businessman from the Republican People 's Party ( CHP ) , who has served as the Member of Parliament for İstanbul 's third electoral district since 2011 .
Nathan Chan ( born 1993 ) is a Chinese - American cellist from Hillsborough , CA .
Walter Wink ( May 21 , 1935 -- May 10 , 2012 ) was an American biblical scholar , theologian , and activist who was an important figure in Progressive Christianity .
Johann Werlin ( died ca . 1680 ) was a German Baroque composer .
Greg Walloch ( born July 8 , 1970 in San Bernardino , California ) is an American comedian , actor , author , and monologist .
Olivier Sedra is a public address announcer for the Cleveland Cavaliers of the National Basketball Association .
Samuel Collings ( fl . 1780 - -1790 ? ) was a British painter and caricaturist of 18th century .
Wayne Bloom ( born March 22 , 1958 ) is an American retired professional wrestler .
Thomas Danneberg ( born June 2 , 1942 ) is a German actor and voice - actor .
Johann Nepomuk Rust ( April 5 , 1775 -- October 9 , 1840 ) was a surgeon and military physician born at Jánský Vrh , Javorník , Austrian Silesia ( today in the Czech Republic ) .
Hardo Aasmäe ( February 11 , 1951 -- December 29 , 2014 ) was an Estonian geographer , entrepreneur and politician .
Conor McPhillips ( Irish name : Conchobhar MacPhilib ; born 9 February 1981 ) is a former Irish rugby union player .
Coroebus of Elis , commonly spelled Koroibos ( Greek : Κόροιβος Ἠλεῖος ) was a humble Greek cook , baker and athlete from Elis , who won the stadion race in the first recorded Ancient Olympic Games in 776 BC .
Aaron of Canterbury was an English rabbi and halakhic exegete , mentioned in Minhat Yehudah ( `` The Offering of Judah '' ) by Judah ben Eliezer on Deuteronomy xxvi.2 , in association with Rashi and Rabbi Jacob of Orleans , and thus , seemingly , of the twelfth century .
In 1873 , Henry Withy proceeded to Govan , to the historic shipyard of Robert Napier ( engineer ) , afterwards putting in some time with the Fairfield Shipbuilding and Engineering Company .
Anton Hansen ( 1891 - -1960 ) was a Danish cartoonist and painter .
James Alan Shelton ( November 3 , 1960 -- June 3 , 2014 ) was an American bluegrass guitarist .
André - Philippe Gagnon ( born December 17 , 1962 in Loretteville , Quebec ) is a Canadian comedian and impressionist .
Ewan Dobson is a Canadian fingerstyle guitarist and Candyrat Records recording artist .
Betsy Ancker - Johnson ( born April 29 , 1927 ) is an American plasma physicist .
Elmer Ferguson ( February 25 , 1885 -- April 26 , 1972 ) was a Canadian sports journalist .
Charles Frankel ( December 13 , 1917 -- May 10 , 1979 ) was an American philosopher , Assistant U.S. Secretary of State , professor and founding director of the National Humanities Center .
Gülben Ergen ( pronounced ( ˈɟylben ˈeɾɡen ) ; born August 25 , 1972 ) , also known as Gülben Ergen Çelik , is a Turkish singer and occasional actress .
Richard B. Wathen ( June 26 , 1917 -- March 14 , 2001 ) was an American ( Indiana ) politician , journalist , and author .
Antonio Pontarelli ( born April 1 , 1991 ) , is an American singer - songwriter and rock violinist .
Tony Doogan is a Scottish record producer who runs Castle of Doom Studios in Glasgow .
Peter G. Klein is an American Austrian economist who studies managerial and organizational issues .
Judith Skillman ( born 1954 ) is an award - winning contemporary northwest American poet and the author of fifteen books of verse .
Exili was an Italian chemist and poisoner in the 17th century .
Diana Vincent ( born in 1958 in Trenton , New Jersey ) is an American jewelry designer and businesswoman .

Michael Gulezian is an American composer and Fingerstyle guitarist .
Aaron Douglas ( May 26 , 1899 -- February 3 , 1979 ) was an African - American painter , illustrator and arts educator .

Christina Goh is a French singer , songwriter and poet .
Harriet Chalmers Adams ( October 22 , 1875 -- July 17 , 1937 ) was an American explorer , writer and photographer .
Mazhamangalam Narayanan Namboodiri was a scholar , poet , astrologer and an author who lived in Peruvanam , Cherpu in Thrissur District , Kerala .
Jarunee Sannok ( Thai : จารุณี สารนอก ) is a Thai beach volleyball player .

Stet Howland ( born Aug. 14 , 1960 ) is an American professional drummer from Plymouth , Massachusetts , United States .
Peter Murnoy was a nationalist politician and political activist in Northern Ireland .
Ed Cash ( born August 6 , 1971 ) is a producer , songwriter , engineer , and multi - instrumentalist .
Alonzo de Barcena ( also called de Barzana ) was a Spanish Jesuit missionary and linguist .
Mark Maremont is an American business journalist with the Wall Street Journal .
Sara Groves ( born Sara Lee Colbaugh , September 10 , 1972 ) is an American contemporary Christian singer , record producer , and author .
Ciara Whelan is an Irish television presenter who is best known for fronting TV3 's prime - time travel series The Holiday Show .
Poj Arnon ( Thai : พจน์ อานนท์ ) is a Thai film director .
Knox Martin ( born February 12 , 1923 ) is an American painter , sculptor and muralist .
Frederick William Rowe ( September 28 , 1912 -- June 20 , 1994 ) was a Canadian politician and Senator .
Serge Fontaine ( born September 17 , 1947 ) is a Canadian politician in the province Quebec .
Cidny Bullens ( born Cindy Bullens March 21 , 1955 ) is an American singer - songwriter who grew up in Massachusetts .
Maciej Kalenkiewicz ( Polish pronunciation : ( ˈmat͡ɕɛj kalɛnˈkʲɛvit͡ʂ ) ; 1906 - -1944 ; nom de guerre Kotwicz ) was a Polish engineer and military officer , a podpułkownik of the Polish Army .
Mary Lu Zahalan is a Canadian rock singer and actress .
Bob Nanna ( born June 14 , 1975 ) is an American musician best known as the singer and guitarist for the bands Braid and Hey Mercedes .
Jody Chiang or Jiang Hui ( Chinese : 江蕙 ; pinyin : Jiāng Huì ; Pe̍h - ōe - jī : Kang Hūi ) , born Jiang Shuhui ( 江淑惠 ) , is a Taiwanese popular singer .

Alberto Inocente Álvarez Cabrera ( October 28 , 1905 -- February 6 , 1985 ) was a Cuban lawyer , diplomat , and politician .
Blake Young - Fountain ( born Sept 13 , 1981 ) is an American actor , model , and producer .
Janez Zorko ( born 1937 in Podgorje ob Sevnični ) is a Slovenian sculptor and mountain climber .
Juan Manuel Blanes ( June 8 , 1830 -- April 15 , 1901 ) was a noted Uruguayan painter of the Realist school .
Peter Herdic ( 1824 - -1888 ) was a lumber baron , entrepreneur , inventor , politician , and philanthropist in Victorian era Williamsport , Lycoming County , Pennsylvania in the United States .
On June 1 , 2007 it became public knowledge that a Republican activist , lawyer Dana Jill Simpson of Rainsville , Alabama , filed a sworn statement suggesting Leura Canary was directed to use her office for political purposes .
Henry Luke Bolley ( February 1 , 1865 -- November 10 , 1956 ) was an American botanist and plant pathologist known for his work that led to the control or eradication of several major crop diseases .
John Davis Paris ( 1809 -- 1892 ) was an American Christian missionary to the island of Hawaii .
Chris Brokaw ( born August 1 , 1964 ) is an American musician , mostly known for his work with the bands Come and Codeine , in addition to his many collaborative projects and original soundtracks .
Carlotta Ferrari ( 27 January 1837 -- 23 November 1907 ) was an Italian composer noted for opera .
Cleo Virginia Andrews ( June 6 , 1923 -- December 19 , 1986 ) , better known as V. C. Andrews or Virginia C. Andrews , was an American novelist .
Rodrigo de la Rosa is a Mexican actor , best known for a list of telenovas .
Octavius Mathias ( 27 February 1805 -- 18 June 1864 ) was a pioneering Anglican priest in New Zealand in the mid - nineteenth century .
Khachig Oskanian was a journalist and writer of The New York Herald newspaper and is one of the first Armenian settlers to the United States .
Robyn Thurman , writing under the name Rob Thurman , is a New York Times Best Selling American novelist .
Saeed Naqvi is senior Indian journalist , television commentator , interviewer .
Félix Geoffrion , PC ( October 3 , 1832 -- August 7 , 1894 ) was a Canadian notary and politician .
Mario Maccaferri ( 1900 - 1993 ) was an Italian luthier , classical guitarist , businessman , and inventor .
Dick Waterman ( born July 14 , 1935 , Plymouth , Massachusetts , United States ) is an American writer , promoter and photographer , who has been influential in the development and recording of the blues since the 1960s .
Stanley Price ( December 31 , 1892 -- July 13 , 1955 ) was an American film supporting actor who appeared in over 200 films between 1922 and 1956 .
Irwin Hoffman ( born November 26 , 1924 ) is an American conductor , born in New York .
Anders Henriksson i Vinstorp ( 1870- ? ) was a Swedish politician .
Constantin Nour ( June 13 , 1906 or June 15 , 1907 , Tiraspol - November 17 , 1986 ) was a Romanian champion middleweight boxer and national team trainer .
Christopher Charles Benninger is an American - Indian architect and planner .
Curt Malawsky ( b. May 10 , 1970 in Coquitlam , British Columbia ) is a former box lacrosse player and currently the Assistant General Manager and Head Coach of the Calgary Roughnecks of the National Lacrosse League .
Adolf Fritz , generally called Dr. Fritz ( Munich , ? -- Estonia , 1918 ) , was a hypothetical German surgeon whose spirit has allegedly been channeled by several Brazilian psychic surgeons , starting with Zé Arigó in the 1950s and continuing up to the present .
Erik Palladino ( born May 10 , 1968 ) is an American actor , best known for his portrayal of Dr. Dave Malucci in the NBC medical drama ER . He starred in the critically praised FX war drama Over There .
Frank Marshall Davis ( December 31 , 1905 -- July 26 , 1987 ) was an American journalist , poet , political and labor movement activist , and businessman .
Lamont Jody Hawkins ( born October 11 , 1970 ) , better known as U - God ( short for Universal God ) , is an American rapper and member of the hip hop collective , Wu - Tang Clan .
Harriette Cole , is a life stylist , author , nationally syndicated advice columnist , motivational speaker , media trainer , magazine editor , lifestyle writer , wife and mother .
Sengiin Erdene ( Mongolian : Сэнгийн Эрдэнэ ) is a well - known Mongolian novelist and writer .
John Morton Downey ( November 14 , 1901 -- October 25 , 1985 ) was a singer popular in the United States , enjoying his greatest success in the late 1920s and early 1930s .
Allan Rumbolt is a Canadian politician , who was elected as the Member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Hudson Bay in the Legislative Assembly of Nunavut in the 2008 territorial election .
Attila Szalay - Berzeviczy ( born May 6 , 1972 ) is a Hungarian economist and global head of Global Securities Services at UniCredit Group in Milan .
Héctor Arredondo Casillas ( November 12 , 1970 -- November 16 , 2014 ) , was a Mexican television , film and stage actor .
Andre Louis Hicks ( July 5 , 1970 -- November 1 , 2004 ) , better known by his stage name Mac Dre , was an American rapper , and the initial founder of Thizz Entertainment , and the now defunct Romp Productions .
Sanchit Balhara is an Indian film score composer , best known for composing the score of Sanjay Leela Bhansali 's 2015 epic historical romance film , Bajirao Mastani .
Po Bronson ( born 1964 ) is an American journalist and author who lives in San Francisco .
Ernest William Hawkes ( born 1881 or 1883 , died 1954 or 1957 ) was an American anthropologist best known for his work studying the indigenous peoples of Alaska and northern Canada .
Eddie Sinclair ( May 5 , 1937 -- January 2005 ) was a Scottish professional snooker player .
John Randall Nelson is a painter and sculptor based in Phoenix , Arizona .
Orkhan Mustafazadeh ( Azerbaijani : Orxan Mustafazadə ) , better known by his stage name Okaber , is an Azerbaijani rapper , songwriter .
Ryhaan Shah is an Indo - Guyanese writer born in Berbice , Guyana .
Robert Deniston Hume ( October 31 , 1845 -- November 25 , 1908 ) was a cannery owner , pioneer hatchery operator , politician , author , and self - described `` pygmy monopolist '' who controlled salmon fishing for 32 years on the lower Rogue River in U.S. state of Oregon .
Joanna Russ ( February 22 , 1937 -- April 29 , 2011 ) was an American writer , academic and feminist .
Eduardo Benito was a Spanish fashion illustrator and painter , noted for his Vogue covers of the 1920s and 1930s .
Ipuki was an Ancient Egyptian sculptor of the 18th Dynasty , who worked in Thebes and is known from his tomb there .
Elva Hsiao ( Chinese : 蕭亞軒 , born August 24 , 1979 ) is a Taiwanese singer .
Henryk Ruder was a Polish engineer , a long - time head and member of Warsaw - based Road Network Planning Bureau and member of the board of the `` Autostrady Polskie '' think - tank .
Emmanuel Nnadozie is an educator , economist , professor of economics and author .
John Llewellyn Moxey ( born February 26 , 1925 ) , sometimes credited as John L. Moxey or John Moxey , is an Argentinian film and television director .
Angel De Cora Dietz ( 1871 - -1919 ) was a Winnebago ( Ho - Chunk ) painter , illustrator , Native American rights advocate , and teacher at Carlisle Indian School .
Michael Franti ( born April 21 , 1966 ) is an American rapper , musician , poet , spoken word artist and singer - songwriter .
Floyd Holmes ( March 6 , 1910 -- January 1 , 1970 ) , better known as Salty Holmes , was an American country musician and Western B - movie actor .
Kamahl is the stage name of Kandiah Kamalesvaran AM ( Tamil : கந்தையா கமலேஸ்வரன் ; born 13 November 1934 ) , a singer and recording artist active in Australia , perhaps best known for `` The Elephant Song '' , and his repertoire of popular music .
Erwin Extercatte ( born 16 April 1981 in Delden , Overijssel ) is a Dutch darts player who competes for the Professional Darts Corporation .
George Gamow ( March 4 ( O.S. February 20 ) 1904 -- August 19 , 1968 ) , born Georgiy Antonovich Gamov ( Russian : Гео́ргий Анто́нович Га́мов ; IPA : ( ɡʲɪˈorɡʲɪj ɐnˈtonəvʲɪtɕ ˈɡaməf ) ) , was a theoretical physicist and cosmologist -- notably an early advocate and developer of Lemaître 's Big Bang theory .
Heinrich Schläppi ( April 30 , 1905 - February 15 , 1958 ) was a Swiss bobsledder who competed during the early 1920s .
Sherali Bozorov ( Tajik : Шерали Бозоров ; born October 23 , 1981 in Kulob , Khatlon ) is a Tajikistani judoka , who played for the half - middleweight category .
Roger Camp is a photographer and educator .
Philip Palmer Green is a theoretical and computational biologist noted for developing important algorithms and procedures used in Gene mapping and DNA sequencing .
Tyler Barnett ( born October 19 , 1983 ) is an entrepreneur , business consultant and American television personality .
Andrey Tokarev is a Russian cross country skier , biathlete , sighted guide and Paralympic Champion .
He was born to the merchant John Slidell and the former Margery Mackenzie , a Scot .
Wally Gacek ( born c. 1927 ) is a former ice hockey player who was a member of the Michigan Wolverines team that won the first NCAA Frozen Four ice hockey championship in 1948 .
Emanuel Augustus ( born January 2 , 1975 ) , previously known as Emanuel Ya'kov Burton , is an American former professional boxer who fought out of Brownsville , Texas .
Leopoldo Laborde ( born November 6 , 1970 ) is a Mexican film director , screenwriter , photographer , editor and self - made producer .
Giorgi Javakhishvili ( Georgian : გიორგი ჯავახიშვილი ; Russian : Георгий Дмитриевич Джавахишвили , Georgy Dmitriyevich Dzhavakhishvili ; born June 10 , 1941 ) is a Georgian academic , politician , and diplomat .
Margaret Louis Ebey ( born October 5 , 1935 ) , known professionally as Margie Singleton , is an American country music singer and songwriter .
Josh Lattanzi is an American musician best known for his collaborations with Norah Jones , Ben Kweller , The Lemonheads , Albert Hammond Jr. , and The Candles .
Ram Barkai ( born October 22 , 1957 ) is a South African open water swimmer and former businessman , specializing in winter swimming and known for his ability to withstand extremely cold waters .
Derrin Hansen is an American college basketball coach and the current head men 's basketball coach at University of Nebraska Omaha .
Gordon Tucker is a prominent rabbi , with a reputation as both a political and a theological liberal in Conservative Judaism .
Sandra Truccolo is an Italian paralympic archer and all round athlete .
John Andrew Quale is an American singer , songwriter , and performer best known by the stage name and persona of Prince Poppycock .
He is better known as the lead singer and guitarist for the Afrikaans Rock band , Willim Welsyn en die Sunrise Toffies and as former photographer , features writer and podcast host for the South African Rolling Stone magazine .
Marc Laidlaw ( born 1960 ) is an American writer of science fiction and horror and also a former computer game designer with Valve Corporation .
Finbarr Clancy ( born March 5th , 1970 ) is an Irish folk singer and musician .
Masoud Khosravinejad ( Persian : مسعود خسروی نژاد‎ ; born March 25 , 1980 in Tehran ) is an Iranian judoka who competed in the men 's half - heavyweight category .
Wax Mannequin is the stage name of Chris Adeney , a Canadian indie rock singer - songwriter .
Jordannah Elizabeth ( born October 16 , 1986 ) is an American music journalist , editor , music promoter and alternative , folk , soul musician .
Lai Ying Tong ( Chinese : 賴映彤 ; born 4 January ) , known professionally as Siu Tung ( Chinese : 小彤 ) , is a Hong Kong Cantopop songwriter , arranger and performer as well as music educator .
Shawn Lawrence Otto is an American novelist , nonfiction author , filmmaker , political strategist , speaker , science advocate , and screenwriter and co - producer of the movie House of Sand and Fog .
Jeannette Bell ( born September 2 , 1941 ) is an American Democratic politician and social worker from Wisconsin .
Westdon Martin Abay ( born April 5 , 1971 ) , popularly known as Dong Abay , is a poet and a Pinoy rock musician .
Nicolás Lúcar de la Portilla has been a Peruvian journalist since the 1980s .
Rajko Dodic ( born May 13 , 1952 ) is a Canadian politician , who was elected the 25th mayor of Lethbridge , Alberta in the 2010 municipal election .
Earl W. Bascom ( June 19 , 1906 -- August 28 , 1995 ) was an American painter , printmaker , rodeo performer and sculptor , raised in Canada , who portrayed his own experiences cowboying and rodeoing across the American and Canadian West .
Ray Shell is an African - American film , TV and stage actor , as well as an author , director and producer .
Sotades ( Greek : Σωτάδης ; 3rd century BC ) was an Ancient Greek poet .
Harry Bassi ( born 26 November 1969 ) is a former Scottish rugby union player , normally playing at Centre or Fullback His career spanned the amateur era and the professional era and Bassi represented Glasgow District at various levels before finally representing the professional Glasgow side , now Glasgow Warriors .
Nathan Barr ( born February 9 , 1973 ; also known as Nate Barr ) is a film and television composer known for playing the majority of the instruments heard in his compositions .
Joanna Manganara is a Greek diplomat , women 's rights activist and the incumbent President of the International Alliance of Women ( IAW ) and its Chief Representative to the United Nations .
Jess Winfield ( born March 8 , 1961 ) is an American novelist , self - help author , and television writer .
Manuel Neri ( born April 12 , 1930 ) is an American sculptor , painter , and printmaker and a notable member of the `` second generation '' of the Bay Area Figurative Movement .
Benjamin Khoh ( born Jan 14 , 1992 ) is a Singaporean model , social media personality , recording artist , actor and socialite .
Christian Schoeler ( born 1978 in Hagen , Germany -- December 28 , 2015 ) was a contemporary painter known for his watercolors and oil paintings , who lived and worked in Düsseldorf .
Wendy Pepper ( born August 23 , 1964 ) is a fashion designer who appeared on the first season of the reality television show Project Runway , which aired on Bravo , from December 2004 through February 2005 .
Vincent Hallinan ( December 16 , 1896 -- October 2 , 1992 ) was an American lawyer and a candidate for President of the United States for the Progressive Party in the 1952 election .
Daniela Eleftheraki ( Greek : Ντανιελα Ελευθεράκη ) , once known as the Lolita of the Greek fashion world , is a top Greek fashion model represented by Ace Models Agency .
Georgina Harland ( born 14 April 1978 ) , is a former modern pentathlete from Great Britain .
Marco Antonio Rubio ( born June 16 , 1980 ) is a Mexican professional boxer and former WBC interim middleweight champion .
Joan Fraser ( born October 12 , 1944 ) is a Canadian Senator and former journalist .
Melville Jacobs ( July 3 , 1902 -- July 31 , 1971 ) was an American anthropologist known for his extensive fieldwork on cultures of the Pacific Northwest .
Philippe Legendre was head chef of the Michelin three - star ( 2003 - 2007 ) restaurant Le Cinq at the George V Hotel in the 8th arrondissement in Paris , France .
Joanna E. Cole is an American politician and educator from Burlington , Vermont .
Dottie Rambo ( March 2 , 1934 -- May 11 , 2008 ) was an American gospel singer and songwriter .
Nikolai Zykov ( Russian : Николай Зыков ) ( born May 8 , 1965 ) is a Soviet and Russian actor , director , artist , designer , puppet - maker , master puppeteer .
Francesco La Vecchia ( born September 10 , 1954 ) is an Italian classical conductor .
Stanley Bahorek is an American actor who has appeared on Broadway .
Leslie Howard Gordon was a British screenwriter and actor of the silent and early sound film eras .
James Manning Tyler ( April 27 , 1835 -- October 13 , 1926 ) was an American politician , lawyer and judge from Vermont .
Joel Stoffer is an American actor know for playing Taylor in Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull and Dr. Franklin in The One ( 2001 film ) .
Rodolfo Terragno ( born November 16 , 1943 ) is an Argentine politician and lawyer , former Senator and journalist .
Ali Nasuh Mahruki ( born May 21 , 1968 ) is a professional mountain climber , writer , photographer and documentary film producer .
William Warsop ( dates unknown ) was an English professional cricketer who made 3 known appearances in major cricket matches from 1789 to 1791 .
Ian Little is a record producer who is best known for the single `` Is There Something I Should Know '' and the album Seven and the Ragged Tiger , both by Duran Duran .
Ernst Witt ( June 26 , 1911 -- July 3 , 1991 ) was a German mathematician , one of the leading algebraists of his time .
Benjamin Fitton is an English singer songwriter .
Hedda Berntsen hails from Filtvet , and is the older sister of freestyle skier Ingrid Berntsen .
Betty Reed ( born on May 5 , 1941 ) is a Democratic politician who served as a member of the Florida House of Representatives from 2006 to 2014 , representing the 59th District from 2006 to 2012 and the 61st District , which included downtown Tampa in northern Hillsborough County , from 2012 to 2014 .
Vijaygupta Maurya ( Gujarati : વિજયગુપ્ત મૌર્ય ) was a pioneer science writer in the Gujarati .
Detrick DeBurr ( born October 25 , 1969 ) is an entrepreneur , author , and computer / website specialist .
Edward Digges ( 29 March 1620 -- 15 March 1674/75 ) was an English barrister and colonist who served as Colonial Governor of Virginia from March 1655 to December 1656 .
Ganesh Janardhanan , also known by his stage name VTV Ganesh is an Indian actor , comedian and film producer .
Donald Pennington is a British psychologist who is also the Pro - Vice - Chancellor and professor of psychology at Coventry University where he teaches personality psychology to undergraduate students .
Friedrich Paul Cilliers ( 25 December 1956 -- July 31 , 2011 ) was a South - African philosopher , complexity researcher , and Professor in Complexity and Philosophy at the Stellenbosch University .
Kim Spalding was an American actor who appeared on television and in film between 1950 and 1961 .
Del Reisman ( April 13 , 1924 -- January 8 , 2011 ) was an American television producer , story editor and screenwriter whose lengthy credits included The Twilight Zone and The Untouchables .
Walter Kaner ( May 5 , 1920 -- June 27 , 2005 ) was an American journalist and philanthropist .
Ion Cristoiu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( iˈon krisˈtoju ) ; born November 16 , 1948 , Găgești , Vrancea County ) is a Romanian journalist .
Carl Stone ( born Carl Joseph Stone , February 10 , 1953 ) is an American composer , primarily working in the field of live electronic music .
Roberto Fidel Ernesto Sorokin Espasa , who performs under the stage name Coti , is an Argentine singer - songwriter , best known for collaborations with other Spanish - language artists like Andrés Calamaro ( Arg ) , Julieta Venegas ( Mex ) , Paulina Rubio ( Mex ) and Luis Miguel in his last album .
Kabir Akhtar ( born January 11 , 1975 ) is an American television director and Emmy - nominated editor , and is also the creator of The Tool Page , the oldest website dedicated to the Grammy - winning band Tool .
Lorenzo Ratti ( ca . 1589 - -1630 ) was an Italian baroque composer .
Jesse Burnett ( born February 8 , 1946 in Los Angeles , California ) was a light - heavyweight and cruiserweight boxer .
Vikram Usendi is an Indian politician who was the member of the Chhattisgarh Legislative Assembly from Narayanpur Assembly constituency ( no 62 ) then Kanker district , ( now narayanpur district ) , during 2003 - 2008 .
Toine van Peperstraten ( born December 18 , 1967 in Achthuizen , Zuid - Holland ) is a Dutch sports journalist , best known for hosting the NOS TV sports program Studio Sport .
Grigory Drozd ( Russian : Григорий Дрозд ; born 26 August 26 1979 ) is a Russian professional boxer .
Park Hae - jin ( Hangul : 박해진 , born May 1 , 1983 ) is a South Korean actor .
Aree Wiratthaworn ( Thai : อารีย์ วิรัฐถาวร ; born February 26 , 1980 ) is a Thai weightlifter .
Lajos Pukánszky was a Hungarian and American mathematician noted for his work in representation theory of solvable Lie groups .
Jean - Claude Kavumbagu is a Burundian Internet journalist who has been arrested on multiple occasions for issues related to his reporting .
Misty Woods is a Welsh singer and lyricist , currently living in London .
Niven Busch ( April 26 , 1903 -- August 25 , 1991 ) was an American novelist and screenwriter of movies such as the acclaimed The Postman Always Rings Twice .
Henry Mathwin ( 23 August 1852 -- 31 December 1911 ) was an English schoolmaster and cricketer who played in one first - class cricket match for Cambridge University in 1874 .
In Portrait of Dora Maar ( 1937 ) ... the artist 's new lover is portrayed with acidic colors and angular forms .
Sumio Iijima ( 飯島 澄男 Iijima Sumio , born May 2 , 1939 ) is a Japanese physicist , often cited as the inventor of carbon nanotubes .
Beatrice Forbes Manz is an American historian of the Middle East and Central Asia who specializes in nomads and the Timurid dynasty .
Ingūna Butāne ( born February 24 , 1986 ) , sometimes simply known as Inguna , is a Latvian model .
Harriet Brooks ( July 2 , 1876 -- April 17 , 1933 ) was the first Canadian woman nuclear physicist .
Jonathan `` Jon '' Good ( born December 7 , 1985 ) is an American professional wrestler and actor , signed to WWE under the ring name Dean Ambrose .
Jase Daniels ( born Jason Daniel Knight , July 18 , 1982 ) is a former United States Navy Hebrew linguist who was discharged from the military twice under the policy known as `` Do n't Ask , Do n't Tell '' ( DADT ) .
Lee Soo - sung ( born March 10 , 1939 , South Hamgyong , Hamhung ) is a South Korean politician and legal scholar .

Sam Maccarone is an actor , film director , and writer .
Jorge Rosenblut Ratinoff ( 7 July 1952 ) is a Chilean engineer , academic , businessman and consultant , and the former president of ENDESA , the Latin American branch of the Italian based ENEL Group .

Nadia Röthlisberger - Raspe ( b. June 30 , 1972 - d. February 9 , 2015 ) was a Swiss curler and Olympic medalist .
Anne Hollingsworth Wharton ( December 15 , 1845 -- July 29 , 1928 ) was an American writer and historian .

Chip Giller is an American journalist and environmentalist .
Clement Liebert ( fl . 1433 - -1454 ) was a Franco - Flemish singer and composer of the early Renaissance , active in Rome and at the Burgundian court .

Antonia Moraiti ( born May 2 , 1977 ) is a Greek water polo player and Olympic silver medalist .

Wazir Agha ( Urdu : وزیر آغا ‎ ) was a Pakistani Urdu language writer , poet , critic and essayist .
Robert Salaburu ( born May 9 , 1985 ) is a professional poker player from Texas , who is best known for his 8th place ( $ 971,360 ) final table finish in the 2012 World Series of Poker .
Anthony Barrile is an actor , musician , writer , and native New Yorker who has starred in many film and stage productions .

Alfred W. Blomfield ( 1879 - 1949 ) was a British architect , who worked as the in - house architect for the brewer Watney Combe & Reid from 1919 to 1940 .

Jussier da Silva , better known as Jussier Formiga , ( born April 14 , 1985 ) is a Brazilian mixed martial artist currently signed with the UFC and competing in the Flyweight division .

Wendell Mitchell Latimer ( April 22 , 1893 -- July 6 , 1955 ) was a prominent chemist notable for his description of oxidation states in his book `` The Oxidation States of the Elements and Their Potentials in Aqueous Solution '' ( ASIN B000GRXLSA , first published 1938 ) .
Jan Mandel is a Czech - American mathematician .
Linda Mancini is an American writer , actor and Bessie Award winning performance artist .
Sudesh Mishra is a contemporary Fijian - Australian poet and academic .

Eilidh Shaw is a Scottish fiddle player and singer .
Colonel Leroy W. Stutz ( born November 13 , 1939 ) was a U.S. Air Force officer , pilot and prisoner of war for 2,284 days ( 6.25 years ) during the Vietnam War .

Martha Sharp Joukowsky ( born 1936 ) is a Near Eastern archaeologist and a retired member of the faculty of Brown University known for her fieldwork at the ancient site of Petra in Jordan .
Zhou Peiyuan ( Chinese : 周培源 ; August 28 , 1902 - -November 24 , 1993 ) was a renowned theoretical physicist of China .

Salomon Formstecher , in English also Solomon , ( 1808 - 1889 ) was a German rabbi and student of Jewish theology .
Gakuryō Nakamura ( 中村岳陵 , Nakamura Gakuryō ) ( 1890 - 1969 ) was a Japanese Nihonga painter and designer .

Branko Despot ( born July 6 , 1942 , Zagreb ) is Croatian philosopher .

Carmen Rodgers is an African American R&B , neo soul singer and songwriter , from Dallas , Texas , United States .

Peter Donato , is a marathon runner from Toronto , Canada .
Jouko Hassi ( born November 19 , 1959 in Rantsila ) is a Finnish former sprinter .

Roman Serbyn is an historian , and an professor emeritus of Russian and East European history at the University of Quebec at Montreal , and an expert on Ukraine .
Major Dodge , ( born August 14 , 1978 ) is an American actor .
Darian Cowgill ( born November 7 , 1972 , Pasadena , California , United States ) , is an American mix engineer , mastering engineer and record producer .
Maximilian Toch ( July 17 , 1864 -- May 28 , 1946 ) was an American paint manufacturer and industrial chemist who developed a concrete filler method that was used in the construction of the Panama Canal .

Carl Andre ( born September 16 , 1935 ) is an American minimalist artist recognized for his ordered linear format and grid format sculptures .

Theodor Kery ( died May 9 , 2010 ) was an Austrian politician , who was the Governor of Burgenland ( 1966 - -1987 ) .

Charles Proteus Steinmetz ( April 9 , 1865 -- October 26 , 1923 ) was a German - born American mathematician and electrical engineer .
Dan Naturman ( born October 20 , 1969 ) is an American stand - up comedian , who has made numerous appearances on television .
Shim Mina ( born December 10 , 1972 ) , known by her stage name , Mina ( 미나 ) , is a South Korean singer and dancer .
Rachel Sarah Herz is both a psychologist and a cognitive neuroscientist , and a recognized expert on the psychology of smell .
Jesús Reyes González ( born March 10 , 1958 ) is a Mexican Luchador , or professional wrestler , best known under the ring name Máscara Año 2000 or Máscara Año Dos Mil . His ring name is Spanish for `` Mask of the year 2000 '' , originally referring to the mask Reyes wore while wrestling .
In June 2010 , Han Han was interviewed by CNN as China 's rebel writer who has become the unofficial voice for his generation .
William Anthony Granville ( December 16 , 1863 -- February 4 , 1943 ) was an American mathematician , and served as president of Gettysburg College from 1910 until 1923 .

Lou Donaldson ( born November 1 , 1926 ) is a jazz alto saxophonist .
Robert Warwick ( October 9 , 1878 -- June 6 , 1964 ) was an American stage , film and television actor with over 200 film appearances .
Anastasiya Bespalova ( Russian : Анастаси́я Беспа́лова ) is a Russian composer .
Marc Bouwer is a fashion designer who was raised in South Africa and now works in New York City .
Elaine de Kooning ( March 12 , 1918 -- February 1 , 1989 ) was an Abstract Expressionist and Figurative Expressionist painter in the post - World War II era .
José David Sierra ( born June 10 , 1980 ) , better known as Jessica Wild , is a Puerto Rican drag queen , professional make - up artist , and reality television personality .
Geraldine Valentino - Smith ( born March 5 , 1964 ) is an American politician who represents district 23A in the Maryland House of Delegates and a former member of the Bowie City Council .
Anthony Lapsley ( born February 13 , 1980 ) is an American professional mixed martial artist , who most recently competed in the Welterweight division of the Ultimate Fighting Championship .
Nancy Nash is a Canadian blues and pop singer , who has recorded and performed both under her birth name and as Sazacha Red Sky .
Vernon Louis Parrington ( August 3 , 1871 -- June 16 , 1929 ) was an American literary historian and scholar .
Bill Aron is an American photographer known as an environmental portrait photographer and a chronicler of Jewish communities around the world .
Kevin Ceballo ( born October 12 , 1977 ) is a singer of salsa music of Puerto Rican descent .
Alley Baggett ( born July 14 , 1973 ) is an American glamour model .
Ann S. Almgren is an American applied mathematician who works as a staff scientist and acting group leader of the Center for Computational Sciences and Engineering at the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory .
Dawn Langstroth ( born April 16 , 1979 ) is a Toronto - based singer / songwriter and painter .
Samuel Isham ( 1855 - -1914 ) was an American portrait and figure painter , born in New York .
Mohsen Ghanebasiri ( born 1949 in Tehran ) is an epistemologist , chemist , author and theorist on economy , culture , arts ( cybernetics ) and management .
Thomas Horsley was a sixteenth - century English magistrate and Lord Mayor .
Walter Matthysse ( born August 29 , 1978 ) is an Argentine professional boxer who fights at light middleweight , and is a former welterweight world title challenger .
Nenad Borovčanin ( Serbian Cyrillic : Ненад Боровчанин ) ( born March 25 , 1979 in Loznica ) is a Serbian boxer .
Michael Wiseman ( born 1966 or 1967 ) is an American television and film actor .
George Rex Graham ( January 18 , 1813 -- July 13 , 1894 ) was a journalist , editor , and publishing entrepreneur from Philadelphia , Pennsylvania .
Jim Banks ( born July 16 , 1979 ) is an American politician and Republican member of the Indiana Senate .
Olivia Palermo ( born February 28 , 1986 ) is an American socialite .
Haakon Shetelig ( June 25 , 1877 - July 22 , 1955 ) was a Norwegian archaeologist , historian and museum director .
Helge N. Albrektsen ( born 1950 ) is a Norwegian lawyer , writer and former politician .
Charles Eugene Branstool ( born December 13 , 1936 ) is an American politician of the Democratic party .
Dylan McGrath ( born 1977 ) is an award - winning Irish celebrity head chef .
Imre Simon ( August 14 , 1943 -- August 13 , 2009 ) was a Hungarian - born Brazilian mathematician and computer scientist .
Kathryn Rosemary Bullard ( born January 27 , 1987 ) , known as Katy Rose , is an American singer , songwriter , producer , musician and actress .
Jean de Cointac , also Contat or Cointa , was a former French Dominican friar who was one of the voyagers attempting the French colonization of Brazil called France Antarctique .
Aaron of Alexandria was a physician active in the 7th century .
Dean E. Fischer ( born ca . 1936 ) was a United States journalist with Time who served as Assistant Secretary of State for Public Affairs from 1981 to 1982 .
Dr. W. Gene Corley , P.E. was an American structural engineer and `` preeminent expert on building collapse investigations and building codes . ''
Jonas Folger ( born August 13 , 1993 ) is a Grand Prix motorcycle racer who currently is a rider in the Moto2 World Championship .
At around the same time , Perpessicius focused some of his studies on the work of Lazăr Şăineanu , a linguist and folklorist whom specialized criticism of the time had come to ignore .
Farhatullah Babar ( Urdu : فرحت اللہ بابر ‎ ) is a Pakistani technocrat , left - wing statesman , Chemical engineer , and former press secretary of the former President Asif Zardari .
Hani Elteir ( Arabic : هاني الطير‎ ; born May 10 , 1981 ) is an Egyptian former swimmer , who specialized in long - distance freestyle events .
Guillaume Alexis ( precise birth and death dates unknown ) was a French Benedictine monk and poet of the late 15th and early 16th centuries , nicknamed the `` Good Monk '' .
Paul Baskis is an Illinois biochemist , who , in the 1980s found a way of synthetically producing oil from industrial and household wastes without expending more energy than is produced .
Harry Horner ( July 24 , 1910 - December 5 , 1994 ) was an Austro - Hungarian - born American art director who made a successful career in Hollywood as an Academy Award winning art director and as a feature film and television director .
Horace Grant Underwood ( July 19 , 1859 - October 12 , 1916 ) was a Presbyterian missionary , educator , and translator who dedicated his life to developing Korean society and Christianity .
Yehua Dennis Wei ( Simplified Chinese : 魏也华 , born in Zhejiang , China in 1963 ) is a Chinese - American geographer .
Charles I. Dawson ( February 13 , 1881 -- April 24 , 1969 ) was a lawyer and politician from Kentucky who ran several high profile campaigns as the nominee of the Republican party , and served for ten years as a United States federal judge .
Bedo Aeddren ( fl . c. 1500 ) was a Welsh language poet from the area that is now Denbighshire , north - east Wales .
Steven P. Perskie ( born January 10 , 1945 in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania ) is a former New Jersey Superior Court judge in Atlantic City , New Jersey and a former Democratic Party politician from Margate City , New Jersey .
Helen C. Frederick ( born 1945 in Pennsylvania ) is an American artist , known mainly for printed media and large - scale works created by hand papermaking as a medium of expression that often incorporate the use of language .
Jerzy Dąbrowski ( September 8 , 1899 - September 17 , 1967 ) was a Polish aeronautical engineer .
Arturo Santos Hernández ( born July 9 , 1987 ) is a Mexican Luchador or professional wrestler and bodybuilder , better known by his ring name Mini Charly Manson .
Peter Buchman ( born July 13 , 1967 ) is an American screenwriter and his writing credits include the screenplays for Jurassic Park III .
Alex Nevil ( born January 25 , 1965 ) is an American actor and younger brother of 1980s pop musician Robbie Nevil .
Cameron McGlinchey is the former drummer of the Australian band Rogue Traders .
Mangesh Panchal ( born December 27 , 1973 ) is an Indian - born Dutch One Day International cricketer .
Lisa Owen , is a Mexican actress and writer .
Kevin J. Tracey , a neurosurgeon and inventor , is the president and CEO of the Feinstein Institute for Medical Research , professor of neurosurgery and molecular medicine at Hofstra North Shore LIJ School of Medicine , and President of the Elmezzi Graduate School of Molecular Medicine in Manhasset , New York .
Donald Alexander Cochrane is a Canadian composer , responsible for compositions , including symphonies , quintets and mixed choral / orchestra pieces .
Michael Arabian was a playwright and novelist of the early 20th century .
Sheila Scott Macintyre ( née Sheila Scott , April 23 , 1910 - March 21 , 1960 ) was a Scottish mathematician best known for her work on the Whittaker constant .
David Peck Todd ( March 19 , 1855 -- June 1 , 1939 ) was a noted American astronomer .
Maria Markova ( Russian : Мария Александровна Маркова ) is a Russian poet .
William Thomas Rawleigh was a businessman and politician in the state of Illinois .
Martín López - Zubero Purcell ( born April 23 , 1969 ) , also known as Martin Zubero , is a former competition swimmer and Olympic gold medalist .
Susumu Yokota ( 横田 進 Yokota Susumu , or ススム・ヨコタ Susumu Yokota ) was a Japanese composer .
Roland Manookian ( born 8 September 1979 ) is an English actor , who is most notable for his role as Zebedee , in the 2004 film The Football Factory , and as Craig Rolfe in Rise of the Footsoldier in 2007 .
Paul Westcott ( born April 22 , 1984 ) is an American radio host , political commentator , and blogger .
Ahmad Khalaf al - Dulaimi ( Arabic : احمد خلف الدليمي‎ , also Ahmad Khalaf Muhammad al - Dulaimi , Ahmed Khalaf Dheyabi ) is an Iraqi politician and the Governor of Al Anbar province since August 2013 .
David Bravo Bueno ( born February 20 , 1978 ) is a Spanish lawyer specialized in intellectual property rights .
Gijs Hoetjes , writing under the pseudonym Gijs IJlander ( born Alkmaar , May 19 , 1947 ) is a Dutch writer .
Samuel Hafenreffer ( 1587 - -1660 ) was a German physician , who in 1660 introduced the definition of pruritus .
Mitchell Kennerley ( August 14 , 1878 - February 22 , 1950 ) was an American publisher , editor , and gallery owner .
Morton DaCosta ( March 7 , 1914 -- January 26 , 1989 ) was an American theatre and film director , film producer , writer , and actor .
Paul O'Dea ( July 3 , 1920 -- December 11 , 1978 ) was an American professional baseball player , manager and scout .
Randall W. Eberts ( born May 18 , 1951 ) is an American economist who specializes in the public workforce system , public finance , urban economics , labor economics , infrastructure and productivity , and policies promoting student achievement .
Violet Kazue de Cristoforo ( September 3 , 1917 -- October 3 , 2007 ) was a Japanese American poet , composer and translator of haiku .
Jan Goodwin is an author and investigative journalist with a focus on war , conflict and human rights , women 's issues and the Islamic world .
Nawang Dorje Sherpa , is a Nepalese mountaineer and mountain guide , best known for the first ascent of Dhaulagiri , as a member of Helvetic - Austrian expedition and many ascents in the mountains of the Himalaya Range .
Ian Shepherd ( born 1971 ) is a British mastering engineer , Blu - ray and DVD author .
Nataliya Khudyakova ( Ukrainian : Наталія Худякова ; born February 8 , 1985 in Brovary , Kiev Oblast ) is a Ukrainian swimmer , who specialized in freestyle events .
Blanche Marvin MBE , ( born 1925 , formerly Blanche Zohar ) , is a UK - based , American theatre critic , producer , playwright and former actor .
Charles Henry Webb ( January 24 , 1834 -- May 24 , 1905 ) was an American poet , author and journalist .
Florence Hershman is an American writer of over a dozen romance novels since 1977 , well known as Diana Haviland , she also wrote a novel as Diana Browning .
Robert E. Kent ( 1911 in Canal Zone , Panama -- 1984 ) was an American film writer and film producer .
Dino Geromella ( Pula , Croatia , 1984 ) is an Italian journalist , author and cultural manager , also known for a controversy with his editor , after they offered him cakes instead of payment for his work .
Judith Josephine Grossman ( January 21 , 1923 -- September 12 , 1997 ) , who took the pen - name Judith Merril about 1945 , was an American and then Canadian science fiction writer , editor and political activist , and one of the first women to be widely influential in those roles .
Tamara Černá is a Czech photographer .
Charles Neal Barney ( June 27 , 1875 - April 24 , 1949 ) was a Massachusetts politician who served as a member of the Common Council and as the 31st Mayor of Lynn , Massachusetts .
Michael Sergio is an actor , most famous for parachuting into Shea Stadium during Game 6 of the 1986 World Series , wearing a sign proclaiming `` Let 's Go Mets '' .
Elisa Gabbai was a German - singing Israeli singer who became famous in the late 1960s .
Sharron Kraus is an English singer , songwriter and musician with strong ties to the US .
Narding Anzures was a Filipino film actor and convicted murderer .
James Griffith ( February 13 , 1916 -- September 17 , 1993 ) was an American character actor , musician and screenwriter .
Rupinder Nagra is an actor who has been working Internationally .
Dianne Cohler - Esses , who grew up in New York , is the first Syrian - Jewish woman to become a rabbi , and the first Syrian - Jewish non - Orthodox rabbi .
Serafino Raffaele Minich or Serafin Rafael Minić ( December 8 , 1808 -- May 29 , 1883 ) was a Croatian - Italian mathematician .

Dimosthenis Dogkas ( Greek : Δημοσθένης Δόγκας , died October 25 , 1905 ) was a Greek politician from Elis .

Scott McQuaig ( born January 27 , 1959 , in Meridian , Mississippi ) is an American country music singer - songwriter .

Annie Gallup is an American singer / songwriter .
Mattos Nascimento is a Brazilian musician , singer , composer and trombonist .
A prolific writer , Chrysippus expanded the fundamental doctrines of Zeno of Citium , the founder of the school , which earned him the title of Second Founder of Stoicism .

Carlos Cortez ( August 13 , 1923 -- January 19 , 2005 ) was a poet , graphic artist , photographer , muralist and political activist , active for six decades in the Industrial Workers of the World .
Ray Weymann is a retired astronomer and astrophysicist , associated with the Carnegie Institution of Washington .

Sirilal Kodikara is a novelist , poet , journalist , and radio play writer who writes in Sinhala .

Heather Graham Pozzessere ( born March 15 , 1953 ) is a best - selling US writer , who writes primarily romance novels .
Stacy Landis , better known by his stage name Skatterman ( pronounced Scātterman ) , is an American rapper from Kansas City , Missouri .
Santiago Fierro Fierro ( born October 29 , 1921 ) is a Mexican politician and medical doctor .
Irva Hertz - Picciotto ( born c. 1948 ) , is an environmental epidemiologist best known for her studies of autism .

Kurt Philipp ( born July 11 , 1928 ) is a prominent Austrian painter .
Michael Halsey is a British actor who has appeared in many series including Blake 's 7 and Are You Being Served ? .
Tim Rogerson is an American painter of Disney Fine Art who was an official artist of the 2006 Winter Olympic Games in Turin , Italy .
Paul Pastur ( February 7 , 1866 -- June 8 , 1938 ) was a Belgian lawyer and politician from Hainaut .

Serranus Clinton Hastings ( November 22 , 1814 -- February 18 , 1893 ) was a 19th - century politician , rancher and a prominent lawyer in the United States .
Tyson Gay ( born August 9 , 1982 ) is an American track and field sprinter , who competes in the 100 and 200 meters dash .
Patrice Stellest , ( a.k.a . `` Stellest '' ; born May 23 , 1953 ) is a Swiss , painter , sculptor and filmmaker .
Marjorie Bransfield is an American former actress , who was married to actor James Belushi ( 22 September 1990 - April 1992 ) .
Nobu McCarthy ( November 13 , 1934 -- April 6 , 2002 ) was a Japanese Canadian actress , stage director , and fashion model .
Mike Campese ( born April 2 , in Albany , New York ) is an American guitarist and composer best known for being a member of the multi - platinum group Trans - Siberian Orchestra .
Richard Divall AO , OBE ( born 9 September 1945 , Sydney ) is a conductor and musicologist .
Abdias do Nascimento ( March 14 , 1914 -- May 23 , 2011 ) was a prominent Afro - Brazilian scholar , artist , and politician .
PeterLicht is a German electropop musician and author from Cologne signed with the record label Motor Music , best known for his 2001 single Sonnendeck .
Rodolfo González Pacheco ( 1882 - -1949 ) was an Argentine writer , playwright , orator , anarchistic journalist and activist .

Lincoln Peirce ( pronounced `` purse '' ) is an American cartoonist , best known as the creator of the Big Nate comic strip .

Senenmut ( sometimes spelled Senmut , Senemut , or Senmout ) was an 18th dynasty ancient Egyptian architect and government official .
Robert Terry Everett ( born February 15 , 1937 ) is an American politician and a Republican former member of the United States House of Representatives from Alabama 's 2nd congressional district .
Jackie Gayle ( March 1 , 1926 -- November 23 , 2002 ) , born Jack Potovsky , was an American standup comedian and actor .
Joe Minoso is an American theater and television actor .
Aaron Arrowsmith ( 1750 - -1823 ) was an English cartographer , engraver and publisher and founding member of the Arrowsmith family of geographers .
Henry Sargent ( baptized November 25 , 1770 -- February 21 , 1845 ) , American painter and military man , was born in Gloucester , Massachusetts .
Elizabeth Chadwick is an author of historical fictions .
The travel writer Pausanias listed Solon among the seven sages whose aphorisms adorned Apollo 's temple in Delphi .
Anthony D. Galluccio ( born 1967 ) is a former US Massachusetts State Senator , and a Democratic politician having won the seat vacated by Jarrett T. Barrios .
Nicolas Antoine ( c.1602 -- April 20 , 1632 ) was a French Protestant theologian and pastor who attempted to convert to Judaism , although he was never officially admitted to Judaism , due to fears by the Jewish community that persecutions would happen if it became known that he was an apostate of Christianity .

Lou Rae is a Tasmanian author and historian of the West Coast of Tasmania .
Jaffar Nazir ( born August 16 , 1977 in Muridke , Punjab ) is a Pakistani first class cricketer .
Emlyn Aubrey ( born January 28 , 1964 ) is an American professional golfer who played on the PGA Tour , Nationwide Tour and the predecessor to the Asian Tour .

Youssouf Sambo Bâ ( born May 10 , 1942 in Boborgou , Niger ) is a Burkinabé politician and retired teacher .

Caroline Watt ( born 1962 ) is a Scottish parapsychologist and psychologist .
Dale Houston ( April 23 , 1940 -- September 27 , 2007 ) was an American singer who , along with his performing partner , Grace Broussard , hit the Billboard chart as Dale & Grace with two rock and roll singles .

Abby Zotz is a Canadian singer - songwriter , multi - instrumentalist , and actress .
William C. Lamont ( born November 25 , 1827 Charlotteville , Schoharie County , New York ) was an American lawyer and politician from New York .
Erasmus Reinhold ( October 22 , 1511 -- February 19 , 1553 ) was a German astronomer and mathematician , considered to be the most influential astronomical pedagogue of his generation .
Gabriel Garrido is an Argentinian conductor specialising in Italian baroque and the recovery of the baroque musical heritage of Latin America .
Henry - Russell Hitchcock ( 1903 - -1987 ) was a leading American architectural historian of his generation .
Big Herk ( born Amery Dennard on August 30 , 1969 ) is an American rapper from Detroit , Michigan .
Marcelo Del Debbio ( born September 9 , 1974 ) is a Brazilian architect ( graduated from FAU - USP ) and writer , with specialization in semiotics , History of Art and World Religion , best known from his several works in Role Playing Games , comparative mythology , comparative religion , esoteric and masonic texts .
Sean Punch ( born July 27 , 1967 ) is a Canadian writer and game designer .
Stanisław Chełchowski ( February 26 , 1866 , Chojnowo near Przasnysz -- March 23 , 1907 , Ciechanów ) was a Polish naturalist ( botanist and mycologist ) , ethnographer and activist ( social , educational and political ) .
Roger Wehrbein ( born August 18 , 1938 ) is an American politician and a former member of the unicameral Nebraska Legislature .
Gavin Bradley is an award - winning Canadian singer - songwriter and producer based in Toronto who has worked with artists like Nelly Furtado , Tori Amos and Jane Siberry .
Yadin Dudai ( born December 8 , 1944 ) is a neuroscientist , the Sara and Michael Sela Chair of Neurobiology at the Weizmann Institute of Science in Rehovot , Israel , and the Albert and Blanche Willner Family Global Distinguished Professor of Neural Science at New York University ( NYU ) .
James W. Parkinson ( born 1949 ) is a California lawyer and an activist for reparations to be paid to Americans who were slave laborers for private Japanese companies during World War II . Parkinson was born in New Orleans , Louisiana .
Roy London ( March 3 , 1943 -- August 8 , 1993 ) was an American actor , acting coach and teacher .
Simon Hale is a British composer , arranger , and keyboardist .
Shai Linne ( born August 21 , 1974 ) is an American East Coast Christian rapper .
Robert Lima is an American , poet , literary critic , bibliographer , playwright , editor , biographer , and translator .
Jane Wenham - Jones is an author , journalist , presenter , interviewer , creative writing tutor , writing competition judge , and speaker who lives in Broadstairs , Kent , a town that appears in two of her novels .

Juliana Hatfield ( born July 27 , 1967 ) is an American musician and singer - songwriter from the Boston area .

Baek Ji - young ( Hangul : 백지영 , born March 25 , 1976 ) is a South Korean pop ballad singer .

Barry A. Love M.D. is a cardiologist specializing in pediatric and congenital heart problems .

Alan Gauld ( born 1932 ) is a British parapsychologist , psychologist and writer best known for his research on the history of hypnotism .

Mark Ronald is an American engineer with strong ties to the defense industry .
Rafael Quiñones Vidal ( November 13 , 1892 in Mayagüez , Puerto Rico -- March 7 , 1988 ) was a journalist and a radio and television Master of Ceremonies .
Víctor Manuel Báez Chino ( died 14 June 2012 ) was a Mexican crime journalist and editor for the digital edition of the Milenio newspaper in Xalapa and an editor for the crime - oriented website Reporteros Policiacos .
Nat Quansah is a botanist from Ghana , and a doctorate in philosophy .
Joseph Hitches ( dates unknown ) was an English cricketer who played in major matches during the 1740s , chiefly associated with London Cricket Club .
Panos G. Georgopoulos , Ph.D. is a scientist working in the field of Environmental Health and specializing in Mathematical Modeling of Environmental and Biological Systems .
Yung Ho Chang ( Chinese : 张永和 ; pinyin : Zhang Yonghe ) is a Chinese - American architect and Professor of MIT Architecture .
Shri Mool Chand Meena is an Indian politician and former Member of Parliament ( 1992 - 2006 . )
Simon Carless is an English video game industry publisher , journalist , editor and game designer .
Josann McGibbon is an American screenwriter working in partnership with Sara Parriott .
Nii Allotey Odunton , a mining engineer from Ghana , is Secretary - General of the International Seabed Authority , serving a four - year term from January 1 , 2009 .
Rachida Triki is a philosopher , art historian , and art curator , currently full Professor of Philosophy at Tunis University specialized in Aesthetics .
Eugene Pidgeon is a dwarf actor / writer / activist .
Benedict Sandiford is a British actor who is best known for his role as son Neil on the British sitcom Barbara and for ' Harry Enfield & Chums ' in 1997 .
Mitch Byrd is a comic book artist , who works primarily as a penciller .
Howard Martin Temin ( December 10 , 1934 -- February 9 , 1994 ) was a U.S. geneticist and virologist .
Antonio Pettigrew ( November 3 , 1967 -- August 10 , 2010 ) was an American sprinter who specialized in the 400 meters .
Calvin Bellamy , better known as Coo Coo Cal , is an American rapper from Milwaukee , WI .
José Garriga Picó ( born March 19 , 1948 ) is a Puerto Rican politician and former senator affiliated with the New Progressive Party ( PNP ) .
José Roberto Cea is a pre - eminent contemporary Salvadoran novelist and poet .
Selahattin Özmen is a Turkish plastic surgeon .
Brendan Bower is an Australian rules footballer who played for Richmond , Essendon and North Melbourne .
Roger Greenwald is an American poet , translator , and editor based in Toronto , Canada .
In the 2000s he also befriended the poet , artist and photographer Adam Donaldson Powell , with whom he authored in 2009 Gaytude , a volume of poetry encompassing the gay experience on the five continents with photography by Albert Russo .
Reza Allamehzadeh ( Persian : رضا علامه‌زاده ) is an Iranian - born Dutch filmmaker , film critic and writer who lives in the Netherlands .
Christopher D. M. Fletcher ( born March 13 , 1958 ) is a British pathologist who has written more than 500 peer reviewed articles and is a chairman of the World Health Organization 's Working Group .
Keshinro Ololade ( born March 14 , 1995 ) , popularly known by his stage name Lil Kesh , is a Nigerian singer , rapper and songwriter .
Barbara Loden ( July 8 , 1932 -- September 5 , 1980 ) was a Broadway Tony award - winning American stage and film actress , model , and stage / film director .
Molly Bee ( August 18 , 1939 -- February 7 , 2009 ) , born Mollie Gene Beachboard , was an American country music singer famous for her 1952 recording of the early perennial , `` I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus '' , and as Pinky Lee 's sidekick on The Pinky Lee Show .
Susan Charlotte ( born July 21 , 1954 ) is an award - winning American playwright , screenwriter and author .
Mahasti Shahrokhi ( Persian : مهستی شاهرخی ‎‎ ) is an Iranian novelist , poet , and winner of numerous literary prizes .
John Forster Charlton ( 1915 - -89 ) , was an English traditional musician , originally from near Hexham , Northumberland , who later settled in Gateshead .
Robert Sterling Arnold ( January 26 , 1905 -- February 8 , 2003 ) was an American shape note music publisher , singer , composer , singing school teacher , and is a cousin to famed country western singer , Eddie Arnold .
Frédéric Guesdon ( born October 14 , 1971 ) is a French former professional road bicycle racer who competed as a professional between 1995 and 2012 , most notably for UCI ProTeam FDJ - BigMat , spending 16 years of his career with the team .
Gerrit van Santen or Gerard Cornelisz van Santen ( 1591/92 - -1656 ) was a Dutch Golden Age painter and writer .
Charles Major ( July 25 , 1856 -- February 13 , 1913 ) was an American lawyer and novelist .
Tanee McCall ( born April 17 , 1981 ) is an American actress and dancer notable for her appearance as the lead in music videos as well as her role as Toya in You Got Served .
Luther Jewett ( December 24 , 1772 -- March 8 , 1860 ) was an American doctor , minister and politician .
Cornelia Hancock ( February 8 , 1840 -- December 31 , 1927 ) was a celebrated volunteer nurse , serving the injured and infirmed of the Union Army during the American Civil War .
John McKinnon Crawford ( 1931 - -2005 ) was a Scottish painter and teacher .
Elliott Baker ( December 15 , 1922 -- February 9 , 2007 ) , born Elliot Joseph Cohen , was a screenwriter and novelist .
Larry Clinton ( August 17 , 1909 -- May 2 , 1985 ) was a trumpeter who became a prominent American bandleader and arranger .
Aislinn Hunter , BFA , MFA , MSc Writing and Cultural Politics , ( born in Belleville , Ontario ) is a Canadian poetry and fiction author .
Friedrich August von Alberti ( September 4 , 1795 -- September 12 , 1878 ) was a German geologist whose ground - breaking 1834 publication recognized the unity of the three characteristic strata that compose the sedimentary deposits of the Triassic period in Northern Europe .
Erik Naggum ( June 13 , 1965 -- June 17 , 2009 ) was a Norwegian computer programmer recognized for his work in the fields of SGML , Emacs and Lisp .
Broadus Mitchell ( December 27 , 1892 -- April 28 , 1988 ) was a historian , professor , and author .
Iraj Rahmanpour ( Persian : ایرج رحمانپور‎ ) is an Iranian poet , singer , songwriter , and writer .
William S. Gaither ( December 3 , 1932 -- September 11 , 2009 ) was a civil engineer and former president of Drexel University .
Eric Hays is a former University of Montana basketball player who served as head basketball coach of at Hellgate High School in Missoula , Mont. , for 25 years .
Orbán Kolompár ( born September 24 , 1963 ) is a Hungarian Romani politician and activist , who served as President of the National Gypsy Council ( OCÖ ) from 2003 to 2011 .
Major - General William Roy FRS , AS ( 1726 - -1790 ) was a Scottish military engineer , surveyor , and antiquarian .
Ian Michael Smith ( born May 5 , 1987 ) is an American actor , known for his starring role in Simon Birch .
Sheila Lowe is a British - born novelist and graphologist who has lived in the United States since 1964 .
Beebe Steven Lynk , an African American chemist , was born in Mason , Tennessee , on October 24 , 1872 , the daughter of Henderson and Judiam ( Boyd ) Steven .
Kumari Kanchan Dinkerao Mail ( March 16 , 1950 -- July 26 , 2004 ) was an Indian singer best known as part of the husband - wife group Babla & Kanchan .
Joseph Runningfox is a Pueblo actor who resides in Santa Fe , New Mexico .
Alejandro Gómez Maganda ( March 3 , 1910 -- September 14 , 1984 ) was a Mexican politician and a former Governor of Mexican state of Guerrero from 1951 to 1954 .
Nor Aini Shariff is a Malaysian fashion designer and founder of the JARUMAS label .
Michael Dellaira ( born August 5 , 1949 ) is a composer of classical music .
Neşe Şensoy Yıldız ( born June 10 , 1974 in Istanbul ) is a Turkish judoka , who competed in the women 's extra - lightweight category .
Hansel Ndumbe Eyoh ( November 11 , 1949 -- September 7 , 2006 ) was a Cameroonian theatre director , critic , and playwright , and professor of Theatre Arts at the University of Yaoundé I. Ndumbe Eyoh was born in Kurume , Southwest Province .
Mary Olive McKean ( August 10 , 1915 -- March 31 , 2006 ) , also known by her married name Olive Mucha , was an American competition swimmer and swimming coach .
Jonny Blair is a Scottish film director and screenwriter best known for his short film The Groundsman starring David O'Hara .
Susan Neiman ( born March 27 , 1955 ) is an American moral philosopher , cultural commentator , and essayist .
Galen Yuen is an Asian American character actor who played a number of bit parts in Hollywood action and martial arts films from the early 1990s onward .
As a diplomat , Ivan Muravyov - Apostol applied efforts to intensify the activity of the Second Coalition against France .
