Sean Elsbernd ( born February 7 , 1976 ) is an American politician who represented District 7 on the San Francisco Board of Supervisors .
Joan Weber ( December 12 , 1935 -- May 13 , 1981 ) was an American popular music singer .
R. A. Mihailoff is an American actor and former professional wrestler .
Alexa Loo ( born on October 6 , 1972 in Richmond , British Columbia ) is a Canadian snowboarder of Chinese descent .
Luca Zordan is a photographer based in New York City who specializes in photographing children .
Aleksandra Vrebalov ( born September 22 , 1970 in Novi Sad , Yugoslavia ) is a Serbian composer based in New York City .
Maxine Allen ( November 7 , 1913 -- September 16 , 1995 ) was an American bowler specializing in duckpin bowling , although when duckpin lanes began disappearing in the 1960s she switched to in ten pins .
Drew van Coller ( born 9 February 1987 ) is a South African rugby union player who most recently played for the Pumas in the Vodacom Cup and Currie Cup competitions .
Boris Farmakovsky ( 1870 , Vyatka -- July 29 , 1928 near Leningrad ) was a Russian archaeologist , who began professional excavations of the ancient Greek colony of Olbia in Ukraine .
Diomedes Matos is a Puerto Rican musician and master instrument maker who is most famous for building string instruments .
Walter Hendl ( January 12 , 1917 -- April 10 , 2007 ) was an American conductor , composer and pianist .

Stefano Bizzarri known as Bizzo ( born March 30 , 1990 in Seattle , Washington ) is an Italian racing driver .
G. Anil Kumar ( born 1972 , Bangalore , India ) is noted Indian journalist , columnist and writer .
William C. Brown ( May 22 , 1916 -- February 3 , 1999 ) was an American electrical engineer who helped to invent the crossed - field amplifier in the 1950s and also pioneered microwave power transmission in the 1960s .
Samba Diouldé Thiam is a Senegalese politician and mathematician from Matam .
Josua Koroibulu is a rugby league player for Armidale .
Sue Jameson is an Anglo - Australian journalist and television presenter , best known for her roles on GMTV , Daybreak and Good Morning Britain as a news correspondent .
Kalamandalam Kesavan was an Indian kathakali percussionist , playwright and actor in Indian cinema .
Benjamin Dudley Tarlton ( October 18 , 1849 -- September 22 , 1919 ) was an American lawyer , legislator , judge , and professor .
Irina Armstrong ( Russian : Ирина Армстронг , born December 6 , 1970 in Vologda ) is a Russian - born German darts player , nicknamed Ice Baby .
Louis Jacques Senghor ( born February 24 , 1952 ) is a Senegalese politician , and was a candidate in the February 2007 presidential election .
Henry Forbes Bigelow ( 1867 -- 1929 ) was a Bostonian architect in the firm Bigelow and Wadsworth .
Travis Demsey was the former drummer for The Living End from May 1996 to February 2002 .
Janet Badjan - Young ( born 1937 ) is a Gambian playwright and administrator , `` easily one of the most prolific playwrights '' in the country .
Andy Razaf ( December 16 , 1895 -- February 3 , 1973 ) was an African American poet , composer and lyricist of such well - known songs as `` Ai n't Misbehavin ' '' and `` Honeysuckle Rose '' .

Park Shin - hye ( Hangul : 박신혜 ; born February 18 , 1990 ) is a South Korean actress , singer and dancer .
Christopher Haigh is a British historian specialising in religion and politics around the English Reformation .
Beverly McDermott , C.S.A. ( December 21 , 1926 -- January 19 , 2012 ) was an American casting director whose career spanned more than forty years .
André Lauren Benjamin ( born May 27 , 1975 ) , better known by his stage name André 3000 ( formerly known as André ) , is an American rapper , singer - songwriter , multi - instrumentalist , record producer and actor , best known for being part of hip hop duo Outkast alongside fellow rapper Big Boi .
Ernst Lohse ( 1944 - -1994 ) was a Danish architect and designer known for his colourful post - modernistic style as well as stylised country and cityscapes of quintessential Danish motifs .
Hans Povel ( born ca . 1954 ) is a retired Dutch rower who won three medals at the World Lightweight Rowing Championships in 1977 - -1979 in the coxless fours and coxed eights .
Calcidius ( or Chalcidius ) was a 4th - century philosopher ( and possibly a Christian ) who translated the first part ( to 53c ) of Plato 's Timaeus from Greek into Latin around the year 321 and provided with it an extensive commentary .
Malvina Reynolds ( August 23 , 1900 -- March 17 , 1978 ) was an American folk / blues singer - songwriter and political activist , best known for her song - writing , particularly the songs `` Little Boxes '' and `` Morningtown Ride . ''
Margherita Pillini was an Italian painter , active mainly in the late 19th century in Turin and Paris .
Jess Barker ( June 4 , 1912 -- August 8 , 2000 ) was an American film actor of the 1930s and 1940s .
Clarence Fok Yiu - leung ( 霍耀良 ) is a Hong Kong film director and actor from Ottawa , Ontario , Canada .
Gour Das Bysack ( sometimes parts of his name have been transliterated as Gaur , Dass , Dos , Bysac ) was a Bengali writer prominent in the late 19th century .
Vera Yurasova is a Russian physicist who has contributed to the study of the processes of interactions between ion beams and solid surfaces , both their experimental characteristics and their physical mechanisms .
Carlo Prater ( born June 25 , 1981 ) is a Brazilian professional mixed martial artist currently competing in the Lightweight division .
Stanisław Nogaj was a Polish journalist and writer from Silesia .
Bern Bennett ( October 19 , 1921 -- May 29 , 2014 ) was an American radio and television announcer .
Jane Kean was the sister - in - law of actor Lew Parker , best known as Lou Marie , the father of Marlo Thomas 's character , Ann Marie , on That Girl .
Josh Rhett Noble ( born September 6 , 1980 ) is an award - winning American stage , television , and film actor best known for his role as Gaston in Disney 's Beauty and the Beast in theaters across the country and various guest star roles in Television .
Karl Ricks Anderson ( born 1937 ) is a Latter - day Saint historian whose specialty is the Kirtland period in the history of the Latter Day Saint movement .
Ron Bochar is an American film sound engineer .
Henry Shelton Sanford ( June 15 , 1823 -- May 21 , 1891 ) was a wealthy American diplomat , businessman , and aristocrat from Connecticut who served as United States Ambassador to Belgium from 1861 to 1869 .
Bernard Kates was an American actor on television , in movies and on the stage .
Noel Jenke is a former linebacker in the National Football League and minor league baseball player in the Boston Red Sox organization .
Samuel Vernon Washington ( August 10 , 1927 -- June 7 , 1988 ) was an American actor who starred in film and television .
Renato Brozzi ( 1887 - 1963 ) was an Italian sculptor , mainly in bronze , as well as sculptor .
Dion Lam ( 林迪安 ; Lam Dik - On ) is a Hong Kong action choreographer and actor .
Harold Hotelling ( /ˈhoʊtəlɪŋ/ ; September 29 , 1895 -- December 26 , 1973 ) was a mathematical statistician and an influential economic theorist , known for Hotelling 's law , Hotelling 's lemma , and Hotelling 's rule in economics , as well as Hotelling 's T - squared distribution in statistics .
James Clayden is an Australian director and painter based in Melbourne .
Protogenes ( /proʊˈtɒdʒəˌniz/ ; Greek : Πρωτογένης ; fl . 4th century BC ) was an ancient Greek painter , a contemporary rival of Apelles .
Otto René Castillo ( 1934 -- 1967 ) was a Guatemalan poet and revolutionary .
Anaïs Mitchell ( /ɑːˈneɪs/ ; born March 26 , 1981 ) is an American singer - songwriter and musician .
George Alfred Townsend ( January 30 , 1841 -- April 15 , 1914 ) , was a noted war correspondent during the American Civil War , and a later novelist .
Kate Seredy ( 1899 - -1975 ) was a Hungarian - born writer and illustrator of children 's books .
Nene Tomita ( 冨田寧寧 ; Tomita Nene ) , born September 30 , 1982 is a former volleyball player who played for Toray Arrows .
Richard Winn ( 1750 -- December 19 , 1818 ) was an American merchant , surveyor , and politician from Winnsboro , South Carolina .
Wyndham Guise was a British actor who appeared on stage in Edwardian musical comedies beginning in the 1890s and became a film actor during the silent era .
Paulina Ayala ( born June 25 , 1962 ) is a Canadian politician , who served as Member of Parliament for the riding of Honoré - Mercier from 2011 to 2015 .
Barnaby Conrad , Jr. ( March 27 , 1922 -- February 12 , 2013 ) was an American artist and author .
Jahangir Mahmoudi is an Iranian lawyer , human rights activist and politician .
Howard Colquhoun is a British chemist currently at the University of Reading .
Leonard Bacon ( February 19 , 1802 -- December 24 , 1881 ) was an American Congregational preacher and writer .
B. Ajaneesh Loknath ( Kannada : ಬಿ. ಅಜನೀಶ್ ಲೋಕನಾಥ್ , born 20 November ) is an Indian composer who works predominantly in Kannada cinema .
Jean Malouel , or Jan Maelwael in his native Dutch , ( c. 1365 -- 1415 ) was a Netherlandish artist , sometimes classified as French , who was the court painter of Philip the Bold , Duke of Burgundy and his successor John the Fearless , working in the International Gothic style .
Lewis Merrill ( 1834 - -1896 ) was a career officer in the United States Army noted for his work in resisting the early Ku Klux Klan organization in several Southern states .
Seymour Rexite ( January 18 , 1908 -- October 14 , 2002 ) , originally Rechtzeit , was an actor and singer of the Yiddish theater , film and radio in the United States , and for some time president of the Hebrew Actors Union .
Roy Hamilton ( April 16 , 1929 -- July 20 , 1969 ) was an American singer , who achieved major success in the United States R&B and pop charts in the 1950s .
Chandrasekhar Billavara is a poker player who won a World Series of Poker bracelet in a $ 1,500 No - Limit Hold'em event .
Jacob Needleman ( born October 6 , 1934 ) is an American philosopher , author and religious scholar .
Joseph Edgar Foreman ( born July 28 , 1974 ) , better known by his stage name Afroman , is an American hip - hop recording artist and musician .
Menachem Youlus is a Baltimore rabbi and Torah scribe who falsely claimed he had rescued Holocaust - era Torah scrolls from Eastern Europe , selling the scrolls at inflated prices .
Edmund Brice ( fl . 1648 -- 1696 ) was an English translator and schoolmaster .
Mary Herrera ( born August 27 , 1959 ) is an American politician , who is the former New Mexico Secretary of State , being first elected in 2006 and leaving office in 2011 after being defeated in her re - election bid .
Roald H. Fryxell ( February 18 , 1934 -- May 18 , 1974 ) was an American educator , geologist and archaeologist .
David Riesman ( September 22 , 1909 -- May 10 , 2002 ) was a sociologist , educator and best - selling commentator on American society .
Robert Hilferty ( December 14 , 1959 -- July 24 , 2009 ) was a New York based journalist , filmmaker and AIDS activist .
LeRoy Fjordbotten ( born November 4 , 1938 ) is a former provincial level politician , farmer and auctioneer .
Ron Fricke is an American film director and cinematographer , specializing in time - lapse photography and large format cinematography .
Andrew Telegdi , PC ( born András Telegdi ; May 28 , 1946 ) is a Canadian politician .
Jill Singer is a well - known Australian journalist , columnist and television presenter .
Waldo Brian Donlevy ( February 9 , 1901 -- April 5 , 1972 ) , later known as Brian Donlevy , was an Irish - American actor , noted for playing dangerous tough guys from the 1930s to the 1960s .
Shozab Raza ( Urdu : شوزيب رضا ) is Pakistani cricket umpire .
Shiraz Uppal is a Pakistani singer , songwriter and music producer .
Mahmoud Sadri is a full professor of sociology at the Federation of North Texas Area Universities that includes Texas Woman 's University , University of North Texas , and A&M University , Commerce .
Carl Daniel Ekman ( March 17 , 1845 -- November 3 , 1904 ) was a Swedish chemical engineer who invented the form of the sulfite process of wood pulp manufacturing which was first established on a firm commercial basis , helping to replace rags as the main raw material of paper with wood pulp .
Antara Chowdhury is a singer and composer of Bengali songs .
Arnold Zellner ( January 2 , 1927 -- August 11 , 2010 ) was an American economist and statistician specializing in the fields of Bayesian probability and econometrics .
Emanuel Sandhu ( born November 18 , 1980 ) is a Canadian figure skater and dancer .
Lorenzo Sawyer ( May 23 , 1820 -- September 7 , 1891 ) was an American lawyer and judge who was appointed the Supreme Court of California in 1860 and served as Chief Justice of California from 1868 - -70 .
Ken Schilz ( born January 17 , 1969 ) is an American politician who is currently a member of the unicameral Nebraska Legislature .
Vincent Signorelli ( more commonly known by Vinny ) is a drummer from New York City , more specifically Brooklyn .
Domiziana Giordano ( born September 4 , 1959 ) is an artist , actress , photographer and video artist .
Gabriel Brühl ( died 1743 ) was a well - known robber in the then Duchy of Limburg , whose criminal career started in the 1720s and ended with his being hanged in 1743 .
Takeshi Yoshida is chief engineer for the 2000 Toyota Corolla and a Senior Managing Director of Toyota Motor Corporation .
George H. Walker ( October 22 , 1811 -- September 20 , 1866 ) was an American trader and politician who helped found the city of Milwaukee , Wisconsin .

As a distinguished poet , Firaq Gorakhpuri was well - versed in all traditional metrical forms such as ghazal , nazm , rubaai and qat'aa .

Junix Inocian ( born Rufino Duran Inocian , Jr. ; March 17 , 1951 -- June 13 , 2015 ) was a Filipino actor and comedian .

Antoinette McKenna is a singer and harp player who accompanies her husband , Joe McKenna , a piper .
Philip Hoby became a diplomat , largely thanks to the support he gave to the Protestant Reformation during the reign of King Henry VIII . By 1540 he had married Elizabeth Stonor , daughter of Walter Stonor of Hawton , Nottinghamshire and Fenny Compton , widow of Sir William Compton and of Walter Walshe .

Phoebe Hoban is an American journalist perhaps known best for her biographies of the artists Jean Michel Basquiat ( `` A Quick Killing in Art '' : Viking 1998 ) and Alice Neel ( Alice Neel : The Art of not Sitting Pretty `` : St. Martin 's Press 2010 ) .

Bernice Eddy ( 1903 - -1999 ) was an American virologist and epidemiologist .

Henri Fazy ( January 31 , 1842 , Berne - December 22 , 1920 , Geneva ) was a Swiss politician and historian .

José Javier Rodríguez is a Puerto Rican politician and the current mayor of Las Marías .
Leonard J. Fick ( September 6 , 1915 -- February 4 , 1990 ) was an American Roman Catholic priest , scholar and educator , college president , author in Ohio whose educational career spanned over fifty years .
Michael Jai White ( born November 10 , 1967 ) is an American actor and martial artist who has appeared in numerous films and television series .
Peter Lee Shih Shiong ( Chinese : 李偲菘 ; pinyin : Lǐ Sīsōng ; born 1966 ) is a Singaporean music producer and composer .
Chien - Shiung Wu ( simplified Chinese : 吴健雄 ; traditional Chinese : 吳健雄 ; pinyin : Wú Jiànxióng , May 31 , 1912 -- February 16 , 1997 ) was a Chinese American experimental physicist who made significant contributions in the field of nuclear physics .
Ebbe Grims - land ( June 11 , 1915 -- January 27 , 2015 ) was a Swedish composer and viola player .
In addition to his active career as a film director and producer , David Hillenbrand has had an active music career in film and television .
Hester Jonas ( around 1570 -- December 24 , 1635 ) was a German midwife and cunning woman .
Mahmoud Alavi ( محمود علوی in Persian ; born 4 May 1954 ) is an Iranian cleric , politician and the minister of intelligence in Hassan Rouhani 's government .
Susan Hussey ( June 1 , 1954 -- February 19 , 2009 ) was an American playwright and co - founder of the Gorilla Theatre performing arts venue in Tampa , Florida .
Scott Kelby ( born July 7 , 1960 in Lakeland , Florida ) is an American photographer and an author and publisher of periodicals dealing with photography and Adobe Photoshop software , specifically for design professionals , photographers , and artists .
Mihály Lukács ( November 19 , 1954 -- October 18 , 2012 ) was a Hungarian Romani politician , a founding member of the Lungo Drom party .
Harvey D. Strassman ( September 19 , 1922 -- January 30 , 2011 ) was a psychiatrist , psychoanalyst , medical educator , and clinical researcher .
David Thomas Roberts ( born January 16 , 1955 ) is an American composer and musician , known primarily as a modern ragtime composer .
John Porry Murray ( July 14 , 1830 -- December 21 , 1895 ) was a Confederate politician who served in the Confederate States Congress during the American Civil War .
Nina Dittrich ( born November 20 , 1990 in Vienna ) is an Austrian swimmer , who specialized in freestyle and butterfly events .
George W. Myers ( April 30 , 1864 -- November 23 , 1931 ) was an American astronomer , mathematician and progressive educator .
Bill Reardon ( born June 24 , 1941 ) is an American politician and educator .
Maeve Murphy is an award winning screen writer and film director .
James M. Early ( July 25 , 1922 -- January 12 , 2004 ) was an American engineer , best known for his work on transistors and charge - coupled device imagers .
Orsi Kocsis ( Hungarian pronunciation : ( ˈorʃɪ ˈkoʧiʃ ) given birth name Orsolya ( ˈorʃojɒ ) ) is a Hungarian fashion , glamour , and former art nude model who was 2005 's Hungarian Playmate of the Year ( which she won by audience election as a special prize ) .
Mattheus Terwesten ( 1670 - -1757 ) was a Dutch painter of portraits , architectural , and historical themes .
Hernán Orjuela Buenaventura ( 1957 - - ) is a Colombian television presenter .
Herbert Warren Wind ( August 11 , 1916 -- May 30 , 2005 ) was an American sports writer noted for his writings on golf .
Ramanujam Varatharaja Perumal is an aeronautical scientist and an aerospace engineer of India .
Sabrina Malheiros ( born 1979 ) is a Brazilian MPB singer / songwriter .
Eleanor Clift ( born July 7 , 1940 ) is an American liberal political reporter , television pundit , and author .
Robert Cooley Angell ( April 29 , 1899 - May 12 , 1984 ) was an American sociologist that is prominently known for his studies of individuals interacting in groups of people in a social environment .
Franklin J. Moses , Sr . , born Israel Franklin Moses , ( August 13 , 1804 -- March 6 , 1877 ) was an attorney , planter , politician and judge in South Carolina .
Artur Kyshenko ( Ukrainian : Артур Кишенко , born November 14 , 1986 ) is a Ukrainian middleweight kickboxer , fighting out of Mike Passenier 's Gym in Amsterdam , Netherlands .
Donnie Iris ( born Dominic Ierace on February 28 , 1943 ) is an American rock musician known for his work with the Jaggerz and Wild Cherry during the 1970s , and for his solo career beginning in the 1980s with his band , the Cruisers .
Satcha Pretto ( born April 5 , 1980 ) is a Honduran Emmy Award - winning journalist and news co - anchor of the Univision Network 's popular morning show Despierta America .
Fred Weir is a Canadian journalist who lives in Moscow and specializes in Russian affairs .
Kenneth Casey Robinson ( October 17 , 1903 -- December 6 , 1979 ) was an American producer and director of mostly B movies and a screenwriter responsible for some of Bette Davis ' most revered films .
Hooray for Boobies is the third studio album by American alternative rock band Bloodhound Gang , released on October 4 , 1999 , in Europe and February 29 , 2000 , in the US .

Let 's Change the World with Music is the eighth album English pop band Prefab Sprout .
`` Let 's Do n't Call It a Night '' is a debut song co - written and recorded by American country music singer and American Idol season 9 finalist Casey James .
Digital Crimes ( 2002 ) is an album by Memorain .
Elizete Cardoso 's 1958 album Canção do Amor Demais is officially considered the first bossa nova album , mostly because it was the first time João Gilberto 's guitar beat , from then on the official bossa beat , was heard ( Gilberto played on the tracks `` Chega de Saudade '' and `` Outra Vez '' ) .

Det er mig der holder træerne sammen is a 2002 album by the Danish band Under Byen .
On the Cobbles was the final studio album by John Martyn released during his lifetime ( his last studio album , `` Heaven and Earth '' , was released posthumously ) , released in 2004 .
The first released version of `` Oh No Not My Baby '' was by Maxine Brown , according to whom the song had first been recorded by her Scepter Records ' roster - mates the Shirelles with the group 's members alternating leads , an approach which had rendered the song unreleasable .
Se hace por los suenos asesinos is the third full - length studio album by Japanese doom metal band Corrupted .
`` Heartache Tonight '' is a song written by Don Henley , Glenn Frey , Bob Seger and J. D. Souther , and recorded by the Eagles .
`` Gon na Raise Hell '' is a song written by Rick Nielsen and originally released on Cheap Trick 's 1979 album Dream Police .
Cease to Begin is the second album by Band of Horses , released on October 9 , 2007 .
Night Eternal is the ninth studio album by Portuguese gothic metal band Moonspell , released on May 16 , 2008 in Europe and on June 10 , 2008 in North America .
Plays the Theme from The V.I.P.s and Other Great Songs is an album of theme music by jazz pianist Bill Evans with an orchestra conducted by Claus Ogerman recorded in 1963 for the MGM label .

Nilsson Sings Newman is an album of Randy Newman compositions sung by Harry Nilsson , with Newman on piano .

`` Elvis Presley and America '' is the ninth track from U2 's 1984 album , The Unforgettable Fire .

`` Temporary Home '' is a song written by Zac Maloy , Luke Laird and co - written and recorded by American country artist Carrie Underwood .

Where You Goin' Now is a single from the band Damn Yankees .
`` Two Out of Three Ai n't Bad '' is a love song performed by the American musician Meat Loaf in his solo career , preceded by `` You Took the Words Right Out of My Mouth '' and followed by `` Paradise by the Dashboard Light '' .
Dimanche à Bamako ( English : Sunday in Bamako ) is the fourth album by Malian duo Amadou & Mariam featuring , and produced by , French singer Manu Chao .
`` Walk Me Home '' is a pop song by singer Mandy Moore from her debut album , So Real , and released as a single in 1999 .
`` When I Held Ya '' is a song performed by singer Moa Lignell , who finished third on Swedish Idol 2011 .
`` Imaginary Monsters '' is the third EP by the Canadian rock band The Birthday Massacre , and contains three new tracks , and five remixes .

Cole Porter in a Modern Mood is the debut album by American jazz pianist Randy Weston , recorded in 1954 and released on the Riverside label as a 10-inch LP .
`` ( Let Me Be Your ) Teddy Bear '' is a popular song first recorded by Elvis Presley in 1957 for the soundtrack of his second motion picture , Loving You , during which Presley performs the song on screen .
`` Walkin ' on the Sun '' is the debut single by American rock band Smash Mouth , from the album Fush Yu Mang .

Must 've Been High is the fourth studio album and the first cowpunk album by the American rock and roll band Supersuckers .
`` Seven Bridges Road '' is a song written by American musician Steve Young , recorded in 1969 for his Rock Salt & Nails album .
`` Step on My Old Size Nines '' is the third single from rock band the Stereophonics taken from the their third album Just Enough Education to Perform .
Fear of a Unique Identity is the fifth album by the UK band Antimatter .
`` Young Grow Old '' is a bonus track from the European edition of American rock band Creed 's album Human Clay .
Fried Brains is the tenth studio album by punk rock band The Lurkers .
`` One Night In Heaven 〜真夜中のエンジェル〜 '' ( One Night in Heaven ( Mayonaka no Angel ) ) is Wink 's sixth single .
`` Kiss or Kiss '' is the fifth single released by Japanese rock singer Nana Kitade .
`` Playing in the Band '' is a Grateful Dead song .
Acts of Love is an album of 50 poems by Penny Rimbaud of the anarchist punk band Crass , set to classical music composed and arranged by Penny Rimbaud and Paul Ellis , and performed by Steve Ignorant and Eve Libertine .
Uncover Me is the seventh album from Canadian singer - songwriter Jann Arden , released in 2007 .
`` Empty Garden ( Hey Hey Johnny ) '' is a song composed and performed by English musician Elton John , with lyrics by longtime collaborator Bernie Taupin .
Worship the Glitch is the only album to be released by `` ELpH vs. Coil '' , though an EP called Born Again Pagans is credited to `` Coil vs. ELpH '' .
Dirty King is the third album by Canadian rock band The Cliks , to be released June 23 , 2009 on Warner Music Canada and Tommy Boy Records .
`` Sunday Morning Call '' is a song by the English rock band Oasis , taken from their fourth studio album , Standing on the Shoulder of Giants .
Verbalni delikt is the 2011 album by Croatian rapper General Woo .
Remixion ( stylized as REMIXion ) is a remix extended play by Japanese band Sakanaction .
Larks ' Tongues in Aspic is the fifth studio album by the English progressive rock group King Crimson , originally released in 1973 .
`` Out of My Mind / Holy Water '' is a fund - raising two - track CD single from the supergroup WhoCares , a Tony Iommi and Ian Gillan collaboration , a direct continuation of the Rock Aid Armenia project .
`` Another Sad Love Song '' is the first official single from Toni Braxton 's self - titled debut album , Toni Braxton ( 1993 ) .
`` Semi - Mental '' is a song by Biffy Clyro and the first single from their fourth album , Puzzle , and is a download only single .
Questamation , released on Mar 9 , 2009 , is the first full - length semi - programmed album by Canadian band Ubiquitous Synergy Seeker , alias USS , consisting of Ashley Boo - Schultz on guitar and vocals , and Jason Parsons , aka Human Kebab , on turntables and programming .
Slania is the second full - length album by the Swiss folk metal band Eluveitie .
`` Hanabi Sky '' ( lit . Fireworks Sky ) is the fifth major - label physical single by Japanese soul singer Miho Fukuhara , released on June 17 , 2009 .
`` Make It with You '' is a song written by David Gates and originally recorded by the pop - rock group Bread , of which Gates was a member .
`` Miami 2017 ( Seen the Lights Go Out on Broadway ) '' is a song written and originally recorded by Billy Joel which appeared as the final song on his album Turnstiles in 1976 .
`` Try Honesty '' is a song by Canadian group Billy Talent .
`` Come a Little Bit Closer '' is a song by the 1960s rock and roll band Jay and the Americans that reached number 3 on the Billboard Hot 100 in 1964 , making it the band 's highest ranking single ever ( it remains their most popular song , according to the Last.fm song rankings ) .
There 's Beauty in the Purity of Sadness is the second album by industrial metal band Red Harvest .
Mo ' Greens Please is the second album by American organist Freddie Roach recorded in 1963 and released on the Blue Note label .
`` I Do n't Wanna Live Without Your Love '' is a Billboard Hot 100 # 3 hit song which was written by Diane Warren and Albert Hammond for the group Chicago and recorded for their album Chicago 19 ( 1988 ) , with Bill Champlin singing lead vocals .
`` The Crow , the Owl and the Dove '' is the second single from the Finnish symphonic metal band Nightwish 's seventh studio album Imaginaerum and was released on March 2 , 2012 .
Become You is the eighth studio album by the Indigo Girls , released in 2002 .
`` Certain People I Know '' was a single by Morrissey released in December 1992 .
Baby Beluga is a children 's music album by children 's entertainer Raffi , released in 1980 .
`` I 'll Take the Rain '' is the third and final single released by R.E.M. from their twelfth studio album Reveal in 2001 .
The Incredible Urban Myth of the Invincible Criminal is a 2009 audiobook reading by Mark Mallman of his graphic novel of the same name due out in 2010 .
Solid Brass is a compact disk of rock music released by the band Circus Lupus in 1993 .
Where Greater Men Have Fallen is the eighth full - length album by Irish metal band Primordial .
`` Wild Tiger Woman '' is a song recorded by The Move , and as with all the other A - sides of their singles , written by Roy Wood .
Alex Taylor With Friends and Neighbors is the debut album by Alex Taylor , brother of James , Livingston and Kate Taylor .
Concerto delle menti ( `` Concerto of minds '' ) is a progressive rock album released in 1973 by Italian band Pholas Dactylus .
Johnny the Fox is the seventh studio album by Irish band Thin Lizzy , released in 1976 ( see 1976 in music ) .
Drunk on the Moon is the first full - length album by No Knife , released in April 1996 on Goldenrod Records .
Professional Dreamers is the fifth album by the Swedish hip hop group Looptroop Rockers .
View from the Vault , Volume Four ( or View from the Vault IV ) is the fourth release in the `` View from the Vault '' series of rock concert recordings by the Grateful Dead .
`` Edwould '' was the third single from Larrikin Love , and the first to be taken from their debut album The Freedom Spark .
Victims of this Fallen World is the third album by the Canadian death metal band Kataklysm .
`` Break Up to Make Up '' was a 1973 hit by the Philadelphia soul group The Stylistics .
`` The Living Proof '' is a song by American recording artist Mary J. Blige for the soundtrack of the 2011 film The Help .
¿ Spicchiology ? is the second album from Xiu Xiu Larsen , the collaborative effort of experimental rock bands Larsen and Xiu Xiu .
Anthony Francis Sharma S.J. ( December 12 , 1937 -- December 8 , 2015 ) was a Nepalese Jesuit prelate and educator who became the first Roman Catholic bishop of Nepal .
Nick Barborak is a former Democratic member of the Ohio House of Representatives for the 5th district .
Saint Louis of Toulouse ( 9 February 1274 -- 19 August 1297 ) was a cadet of the royal French house of Anjou who was made a Catholic bishop .
Edgar Moreira da Cunha , ( August 21 , 1953 ) is a prelate of the Roman Catholic Church serving as bishop of the Diocese of Fall River , Massachusetts .
Henri Swinkels ( born 25 October 1963 ) is a Dutch politician , he was a temporary member of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands for the Socialist Party from 14 May 2014 until 29 May 2014 when he replaced Renske Leijten who was on pregnancy and maternity leave .
Annette Polly Williams ( January 10 , 1937 -- November 9 , 2014 ) was an American counselor , clerical worker and politician from Milwaukee who served 10 terms as a Democratic Party member of the Wisconsin State Assembly , representing her assembly district from her election in 1980 until January 3 , 2011 .
Giovanni Salviati ( March 24 , 1490 -- October 28 , 1553 ) was a Florentine diplomat and cardinal .
Chibly Langlois ( La Vallée , 29 November 1958 ) is a Haitian cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church .
Flaithbertach mac Inmainén ( died 944 ) was abbot of Inis Cathaig ( Scattery Island ) and sometime King of Munster in the south of Ireland .
Darius Mead ( July 9 , 1787 - - January 28 , 1864 ) was a member of the Connecticut Senate representing the 12th District from 1844 to 1846 .
Frank A. Howard , also known as Frankie Howard ( born December 1 , 1938 ) , is a former sheriff of Vernon Parish in western Louisiana , who has been since 2008 a Republican member of the Louisiana House of Representatives from District 24 , which includes De Soto , Red River , Sabine , and Vernon parishes .
Cao Jianming ( Chinese : 曹建明 ; pinyin : Cáo Jiànmíng ; born September 24 , 1955 in Nantong , Jiangsu ) is the Procurator - General of the Supreme People 's Procuratorate of the People 's Republic of China .
Richard W. DeKorte ( 1936 -- March 16 , 1975 ) was a New Jersey Republican member of the New Jersey General Assembly .
Mandubracius or Mandubratius was a king of the Trinovantes of south - eastern Britain in the 1st century BC .
Alexander Mair ( 25 August 1889 -- 3 August 1969 ) was an Australian politician and served as the Premier of New South Wales from 5 August 1939 to 16 May 1941 .
Savita Behen was an Indian politician , social worker , educationist and a former member of Rajya Sabha , the upper house of the bicameral Indian Parliament .
André - Hercule de Fleury , Bishop of Fréjus ( 22 June or 26 June 1653 -- 29 January 1743 ) was a French cardinal who served as the chief minister of Louis XV .
Brian Monteith ( born 8 January 1958 ) is a Scottish public relations consultant , politician and commentator , who was a Conservative Member of the Scottish Parliament between 1999 and 2007 .
Manuel Isidro Orozco Manrique de Lara ( 1681 - -1745 ) was a Spanish bishop who served as Grand Inquisitor of Spain from 1742 to 1745 .
Halinard was Archbishop of Lyon from 1046 to 1052 and served as abbot from 1031 to 1052.He was once a candidate for the papacy , but turned it down .
Dean DePiero was the mayor of Parma , Ohio , and a former Cleveland - area member of the Ohio House of Representatives .
Charles - François Baillargeon ( April 26 , 1798 -- October 13 , 1870 ) was a Canadian Roman Catholic priest and archbishop .
Rubin Phillip ( b. circa 1948 ) is bishop of the Anglican Diocese of Natal .
Juan Natalicio González Paredes ( 8 September 1897 -- 6 December 1966 ) was a Paraguayan poet who served as President of Paraguay from 15 August 1948 to 30 January 1949 .
Kenneth Edward Untener ( August 3 , 1937 -- March 27 , 2004 ) was a Roman Catholic bishop , serving the Diocese of Saginaw from 1980 until his death .
Francesco Contarini ( Venice , 28 November 1556 -- Venice , 6 December 1624 ) was the 95th Doge of Venice , reigning from 8 September 1623 until his death fourteen months later .
Carl J. Strikwerda ( born 1952 ) is an American historian , and president of Elizabethtown College .
Joseph Kabila Kabange ( known commonly as Joseph Kabila , born 4 June 1971 ) is a Congolese politician who has been President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo since January 2001 .
Levi Ankeny ( August 1 , 1844 -- March 29 , 1921 ) was a Republican United States Senator from the state of Washington .
John of Thoresby ( died 6 November 1373 ) was an English clergyman and politician , who was Bishop of St Davids , then Bishop of Worcester and finally Archbishop of York .
Mehibtawy Sekhemkare Amenemhat Sonbef ( also Amenemhat Senbef ) was an Egyptian pharaoh of the 13th Dynasty during the Second Intermediate Period .
James Hamilton Peabody ( August 21 , 1852 -- November 23 , 1917 ) was the 13th and 15th Governor of Colorado , and is noted for his public service in Cañon City .
Achille Locatelli ( born 15 March 1856 in Seregno , Milan , Italy , died 5 April 1935 in Rome ) was a Roman Catholic cardinal .
Rajeev Chandrasekhar ( Kannada : ರಾಜೀವ್ ಚಂದ್ರಶೇಕರ್ ; born 31 May 1964 ) is an Indian politician currently serving a second term as an independent member of the Rajya Sabha , the upper house of the Parliament of India .
Moshe Nissim ( Hebrew : משה נסים‎ , born 10 April 1935 ) is a former Israeli politician , minister and Deputy Prime Minister .
James Arthur Ewing ( born c. 1916 ) was the 40th Governor of American Samoa .
Igor Lukšić ( Montenegrin : Igor Lukšić , Игор Лукшић , pronounced ( îɡor lûkʃit͡ɕ ) , born 14 June 1976 ) is a Montenegrin politician , who became acting Prime Minister of Montenegro upon the resignation of Milo Đukanović , and was elected as Đukanović 's permanent replacement on 29 December 2010 .
William Poynter ( born 20 May 1762 , at Petersfield , Hampshire ; died 26 November 1827 , in London ) was an English Catholic priest , bishop as vicar apostolic in London .
Montserrat Gibert i Llopart ( born 1948 , Barcelona ) was the mayor of Sant Boi de Llobregat ( a Catalan town near Barcelona , Catalonia , Spain ) until 2007 .
John Dubois , S.S. ( French : Jean Dubois ) , served as the third bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of New York .
The Servant of God Pietro La Fontaine ( 29 November 1860 -- 9 July 1935 ) was an Italian cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church who served as the Patriarch of Venice .
Marlene Anielski ( born November 25 , 1961 ) is a member of the Ohio House of Representatives who represents the Sixth District .
Aurel Percă ( born August 15 , 1951 ) is a Romanian cleric , auxiliary bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Iaşi .
Juan Bernardino Caballero de Añasco y Melgarejo ( 20 May 1839 , Ybycuí , Paraguay -- 26 February 1912 , Asunción ) was the President of Paraguay from 1881 until 1886 and founder of the Colorado Party .
Norman Knudson was a member of the Wisconsin State Senate from the 15th district from 1899 to 1902 .
Pericle Felici ( 1 August 1911 , Segni , Rome -- 22 March 1982 , Foggia ) was a cardinal of the Catholic Church .
César - Constantin - François de Hoensbroeck or Hoensbroech ( 28 August 1724 - 3 June 1792 ) was a German ecclesiastic of the Van Hoensbroeck family , most notable as prince bishop of Liege from 1784 to 1792 , in which post he was nicknamed the `` bourreau roux '' or `` red executioner '' .
Václav Klaus ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈvaːtslaf ˈklaus ) ; born 19 June 1941 ) is a Czech economist and politician who served as the second President of the Czech Republic from 2003 to 2013 .
Walter Skirlaw ( also Walter de Skirlaw , Walter Skirclaw , Walter Skirlaugh , Walter Shirlagh , or Walter Skarlawe ) ( born Swine parish , Holderness , brought up at Skirlaugh ; died 1406 ) was an English bishop and diplomat .
Lodovico Altieri ( 17 July 1805 - 11 August 1867 ) was an Italian cardinal and he served as the Camerlengo of the Roman Catholic Church .
Sir John See , KCMG ( 14 October 1844 -- 31 January 1907 ) was a member of the New South Wales Legislature from 26 November 1880 to 15 June 1901 , and was then Premier of New South Wales from 1901 to 1904 .
Jeremy John Durham Ashdown , Baron Ashdown of Norton - sub - Hamdon , GCMG CH KBE PC ( born 27 February 1941 ) , usually known as Paddy Ashdown , is a British politician and former diplomat who served as Leader of the Liberal Democrats from 1988 until August 1999 .
Sir John James Cowperthwaite , KBE , CMG (; 25 April 1915 -- 21 January 2006 ) , was a British civil servant and the Financial Secretary of Hong Kong from 1961 to 1971 .
Michele Pellegrino ( 25 April 1903 -- 10 October 1986 ) was an Italian cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church who served as Archbishop of Turin from 1965 until 1977 .
Constantin Bosianu ( 10 February 1815 , Bucharest -- 21 March 1882 , Bucharest ) was a Romanian jurist and politician , honorary member of the Romanian Academy , Prime Minister of Romania from 26 January to 14 June 1865 .
Osvaldo Cacciatore ( 1924 - -2007 ) was an Argentine Air Force brigadier and former de facto Mayor of Buenos Aires during the National Reorganization Process military dictatorship .
Roger B. Wilson ( born October 10 , 1948 ) is an American politician who served as the 52nd Governor of Missouri from October 16 , 2000 to January 8 , 2001 .
Hadrian (; ; 24 January , 76 AD -- 10 July , 138 AD ) was Roman emperor from 117 to 138 .
Len Fasano is a Republican member of the Connecticut Senate , representing the 34th District since 2003 , and has served as the Senate Minority Leader since 2015 .
Intef III was the third pharaoh of the Eleventh Dynasty of Egypt during the late First Intermediate Period in the 21st century BC , at a time when Egypt was divided in two kingdoms .
William W. Reed ( February 8 , 1825 - 1916 ) was an American physician and politician from Jefferson , Wisconsin who served as a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly and the Wisconsin State Senate .
Aloysius Balina ( January 21 , 1945 -- November 6 , 2012 ) was the Roman Catholic bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Shinyanga , Tanzania .
Anastasios Charalambis ( Greek : Αναστάσιος Χαραλάμπης , 22 September 1862 -- 11 March 1949 ) was a Greek Lieutenant General and interim Prime Minister of Greece for one day in 1922 .
Christine May ( born 23 March 1948 , Dublin ) is a Labour Co - operative politician , and was Member of the Scottish Parliament for Fife Central constituency from 2003 to 2007 .
Lisa Scaffidi ( née Sanders ) ( born 12 February 1960 ) is the first female lord mayor of Perth , Western Australia .
Evangelos Venizelos ( Greek : Ευάγγελος Βενιζέλος , pronounced ( eˈvaɲɟelos veniˈzelos ) ; born 1 January 1957 ) is a Greek politician who was Deputy Prime Minister of Greece and Minister for Foreign Affairs from 25 June 2013 to 27 January 2015 .
Federico di Sanseverino ( died 1516 ) was an Italian Roman Catholic cardinal of the 16th century .
Steve Dyer is a former Democratic member of the Ohio House of Representatives , who represented the 43rd District from 2007 to 2010 .
Fernando Belaúnde Terry ( October 7 , 1912 -- June 4 , 2002 ) was President of Peru for two non - consecutive terms ( 1963 - -1968 and 1980 - -1985 ) .
Ram Baran Yadav ( Nepali : रामवरण यादव ; born 4 February 1948 ) is a Nepali politician and physician who was the President of Nepal from 23 July , 2008 to 29 October 2015 .
John J. Ely , Esq . ( April 7 , 1778 - January 11 , 1852 ) was an American politician who served as a freeholder , as sheriff of Monmouth County , New Jersey , and as a member of the New Jersey General Assembly .
Noreen Evans ( born April 22 , 1955 ) is an American lawyer and politician who was a member of the California State Senate .
Russell McWhortor Cunningham ( August 25 , 1855 -- June 6 , 1921 ) was an American Democratic politician who was the acting Governor of Alabama from April 25 , 1904 to March 5 , 1905 .
Pope Clement XI ( Latin : Clemens XI ; 23 July 1649 -- 19 March 1721 ) , born Giovanni Francesco Albani , was pope from 23 November 1700 to his death in 1721 .
George Reinhardt was an American politician from Milwaukee , Wisconsin who spent one term as a Republican member of the Wisconsin State Assembly .
Edward Shippen ( 1639 , Hillham , Cheshire , England -- October 2 , 1712 , Philadelphia , Pennsylvania ) was the second mayor of Philadelphia , although under William Penn 's charter of 1701 , he was considered the first .
Ann K. Covington is a former chief justice of the Supreme Court of Missouri .
Johann Adam Rieger ( 16 July 1753 , Orb -- 30 July 1831 , Fulda ) was a bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Fulda from 1812 to 1831 .
Hans Urs von Balthasar ( 12 August 1905 -- 26 June 1988 ) was a Swiss theologian and Catholic priest who was to be created a cardinal of the Catholic Church but died before the ceremony .
Tiberius Coruncanius ( died 241 BC ) was a consul of the Roman Republic in 280 BC . As a military commander in that year and the following , he was known for the battles against Pyrrhus of Epirus that led to the expression `` Pyrrhic victory '' .
Michel Suleiman or Sleiman ( Arabic : ميشال سليمان‎ Arabic pronunciation : ( miːʃaːl sulajmaːn ) , born 21 November 1948 ) was the President of Lebanon from 2008 to 2014 .
Eliezer Mizrahi ( Hebrew : אליעזר מזרחי‎ , born 19 April 1945 ) is an Israeli former politician who served as a member of the Knesset between 1988 and 1992 , and as Deputy Minister of Health from 1990 until 1992 .
Xu Kuangdi KmstkNO FREng ( Chinese : 徐匡迪 ; pinyin : Xú Kuāngdí ; born December 1937 ) is a Chinese politician and scientist , best known for his term as Mayor of Shanghai from 1995 to 2001 .
Eddie Lee Jackson is a Democratic member of the Illinois House of Representatives , representing the 114th District since his appointment on January 9 , 2009 to replace Wyvetter H. Younge .
Giovanni Battista Mellini ( 1405 - -1478 ) ( called the Cardinal of Urbino ) was an Italian Roman Catholic bishop and cardinal .
Saint Leobinus ( French : Lubin ) ( died 14 March 557 ) was a hermit , abbot , and bishop .
John Denis Wakeling ( 12 December 1918 -- 10 October 2004 ) was an Anglican bishop in the Church of England .
Eusebius , a layman who later became the bishop of the neighbouring Dorylaeum , was the first to accuse Nestorius of heresy but his most forceful opponent was Patriarch Cyril of Alexandria .
Giovanni Battista Rinuccini ( 15 September 1592 -- 28 December 1653 ) was an Italian Roman Catholic archbishop in the mid - seventeenth century .
Joe Stegner ( born December 17 , 1949 in Clarkston , Washington ) moved to Lewiston , Idaho and is a Republican member of the Idaho Senate since 1998 and represents the 7th District .
Trương Tấn Sang ( born 21 January 1949 ) is a Vietnamese politician , currently serving as the President of Vietnam and one of the country 's top leaders , alongside prime minister Nguyễn Tấn Dũng and Party general secretary Nguyễn Phú Trọng .
Ronald Gerard Connors ( November 1 , 1915 -- November 27 , 2002 ) was an American - born bishop in the Catholic Church .
Richard Grisé ( born 15 January 1944 in Saint - Bruno - de - Montarville , Quebec ) was a member of the House of Commons of Canada .
Yisrael Kessar ( Hebrew : ישראל קיסר‎ , born 20 May 1931 ) is a former Israeli politician who served as a Knesset member for the Alignment and Labor Party between 1984 and 1996 .
Curt Cobb ( born December 28 , 1971 ) is an American politician and a Democratic member of the Tennessee House of Representatives for the 62nd district , which encompasses Bedford County and parts of Lincoln County and Rutherford County .
John of Montecorvino or Giovanni da Montecorvino in Italian ( 1247 - -1328 ) was an Italian Franciscan missionary , traveller and statesman , founder of the earliest Roman Catholic missions in India and China , and archbishop of Peking , and Latin Patriarch of the Orient .
Norodom Monineath Sihanouk ( Khmer : នរោត្ដម មុនីនាថ ; born Paule Monique Izzi , 18 June 1936 ) is the queen mother of Cambodia .

Abba Hushi was the father - in - law of Knesset member Amnon Linn .
Hugh Campbell Wallace ( February 10 , 1864 -- January 1 , 1931 ) was an American businessman , political activist , and diplomat who is best known for his service as the United States Ambassador to France from 1919 to 1921 .

Martin Ziguélé ( born 12 February 1957 ) is a Central African politician who was Prime Minister of the Central African Republic from 2001 to 2003 .
Adam de Senlis ( died 1191 ) , also called Adam of Evesham , was a Benedictine monk who became abbot of Evesham Abbey .
Samuel Prentiss ( March 31 , 1782 -- January 15 , 1857 ) was a United States Senator from Vermont and later a United States federal judge .
Maurizio Galbaio ( Latin : Mauricius Galba ) ( died 797 ) was the seventh traditional , but fifth historical , Doge of Venice from 764 to his death .
John Gavin Nolan ( March 15 , 1924 -- November 17 , 1997 ) was a Roman Catholic bishop who served the Archdiocese for the Military Services .
Victor Hermann Balke ( September 29 , 1931 ) is the former Roman Catholic bishop of Crookston from 1976 - -2007 .
Frederick Joseph Agnich , known as Fred Agnich ( July 19 , 1913 - October 28 , 2004 ) , was a Minnesota - born geophysicist who served from 1971 to 1987 as a Republican member of the Texas House of Representatives .
Khaled Chehab ( 1886 - -1978 ) ( in Arabic خالد شهاب ) was a Lebanese politician and Prime Minister of Lebanon for two terms .
Hekimoğlu Ali Pasha ( 1689 -- 13 August 1758 ) was an Ottoman statesman and military leader who served as Grand Vizier of the Ottoman Empire three times .
Lise - Lotte Rebel ( born 23 . January 1951 ) is bishop of the Church of Denmark who since April 2 , 1995 she has served as the bishop of the Diocese of Helsingør in the Evangelical Lutheran Church of Denmark .
He was a member of the Liberal Party and served as Prime Minister of Denmark from 1973 to 1975 in the Cabinet of Poul Hartling .
William Richardson Davie ( June 20 , 1756 -- November 29 , 1820 ) was a military officer and the tenth Governor of North Carolina from 1798 to 1799 , as well as one of the most important men involved in the founding of the University of North Carolina .

Saint Acarius ( died 27 November 639 ) was bishop of Doornik and Noyon , which today are located on either side of the Franco - Belgian border .
Bernard d'Anduze was a bishop of Nîmes , France from 949 to 986 .
John Patrick Connick , known as Patrick Connick ( born March 1961 ) , is an attorney in Marrero , Louisiana , who has been since 2008 a Republican member of the Louisiana House of Representatives from District 84 in suburban Jefferson Parish .
Samuel Marvin ( 1664 - -1754 ) was a member of the Connecticut House of Representatives from Norwalk , Connecticut Colony in the May 1718 session .
Agnello Participazio ( Angelo Particiaco , Latin : Agnellus Particiacus ) was the tenth ( traditional ) or eighth ( historical ) Doge of Venice from 811 to 827 .

Rawghlie Clement Stanford ( August 2 , 1879 -- December 15 , 1963 ) was the fifth Governor of Arizona and served from 1937 to 1939 .

Ludwig von Erlichshausen ( 1410 - -1467 ) was the 31st Grand Master of the Teutonic Knights , serving from 1449/1450 to 1467 .

Carl Julius Otto Liebe ( 24 May 1860 -- 21 March 1929 ) was Prime Minister of Denmark 30 March 1920 to 5 April 1920 .
Otreius of Melitene ( fl . late 4th century ) was a Roman Catholic bishop of Melitene .
Emanuel Willis Wilson ( August 11 , 1844 -- May 28 , 1905 ) was the seventh Governor of West Virginia in 1884 .

Cayetano Arellano y Lonzón ( March 2 , 1847 -- December 23 , 1920 ) was the first Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Philippines under the American Civil Government .

Eruera Hamiora Tumutara ( 1859 - -1930 ) was a notable New Zealand ringatu bishop .
Domingos Gabriel Wisniewski CM ( March 2 , 1928 -- July 21 , 2010 ) was a Brazilian Roman Catholic prelate and bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Apucarana , Brazil .

Saint Emygdius ( Latin : Emidius , Æmedius , Emigdius , Hemigidius ; Italian : Sant'Emidio ; c. 279 -- c. 309 AD ) was a Christian bishop who is venerated as a martyr .
James , son of Zebedee ( Hebrew : יַעֲקֹב Yaʿqob , Greek : Ἰάκωβος ; died 44 AD ) was one of the Twelve Apostles of Jesus , and traditionally considered the first apostle to be martyred .
Daniel Marsin ( born November 13 , 1951 in Pointe - à - Pitre , Guadeloupe ) is a member of the Senate of France , representing the island of Guadeloupe .
Sir Thomas Kerry Burke ( born 24 March 1942 ) served as Speaker of the New Zealand House of Representatives from 1987 to 1990 .
Elizabeth Brater ( born April 12 , 1951 ) is a Democratic former member of the Michigan Senate , who represented the 18th District from 2003 to 2010 , and served as the Assistant Minority Leader .
Kurt Frank was a Wisconsin lawyer who served three terms as a Democratic member of the Wisconsin State Senate .
Sardar Mohammed Daoud Khan or Daud Khan ( July 18 , 1909 -- April 28 , 1978 ) was the Prime Minister of Afghanistan from 1953 to 1963 , and later became the first President of Afghanistan .
Joseph Hugh Allen ( January 27 , 1940 -- May 24 , 2008 ) was a Democratic member of the Texas House of Representatives from the industrial city of Baytown , who fought for ethics reform .
Jürgen Linden ( born January 13 , 1947 ) is a German politician ( Social Democratic Party of Germany ) and was Lord Mayor of Aachen from 1989 to 2009 .
Parkash Singh Badal ( born 8 December 1927 ) is an Indian politician who has been the Chief Minister of Punjab since 2007 .
Gregorio Pacheco Leyes ( 4 July 1823 -- 20 August 1899 ) was the constitutional President of Bolivia from 1884 to 1888 .

William F. O'Hare , S.J. ( January 23 , 1870 -- October 11 , 1926 ) was an American - born bishop of the Catholic Church .
Platt Whitman ( February 5 , 1871 -- 1935 ) was a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly and the Wisconsin State Senate .
Almond Gaston Crowe , Jr. , known as A. G. Crowe ( born May 8 , 1948 ) , is a Republican departing member of the Louisiana State Senate from District 1 in St. Tammany Parish .
Simon Bamberger ( February 27 , 1846 -- October 6 , 1926 ) was the fourth Governor of Utah ( 1917 - -1921 ) after it achieved statehood from territorial status in 1896 .
Pope Urban I ( Latin : Urbanus I ) was Bishop of Rome or pope from 222 to 23 May 230 .
Heikki Ritavuori ( 23 March 1880 , Turku -- 14 February 1922 , Helsinki ; surname until 1906 Rydman ) , was a Finnish lawyer , a politician from the National Progressive Party , a member of the Parliament of Finland and Minister of the Interior .
François Paul de Neufville de Villeroy ( 1677 - -1731 ) was archbishop of Lyon from 15 August 1714 to 6 February 1731 .
James Fairman Fielder ( February 26 , 1867 -- December 2 , 1954 ) was an American politician of the Democratic party , who served as the 35th Governor of New Jersey , from 1913 to 1917 , with a break of several months when he stepped down from office to avoid constitutional limits on serving successive terms .
Josie McFarlane is a fictional character that appeared in the BBC soap opera EastEnders .
Lu Zhishen , nicknamed `` Flowery Monk '' , is a fictional character in Water Margin , one of the Four Great Classical Novels of Chinese literature .
In all of the accounts in the Hebrew Bible that mention Zerubbabel , he is always associated with the high priest who returned with him , Joshua ( Jeshua ) son of Jozadak ( Jehozadak ) .
Lyta Alexander is a character from the fictional universe of the science - fiction television series Babylon 5 , played by Patricia Tallman .
In the Bible , Meshech or Mosoch ( Hebrew : משך‎ ( meˈʃex ) `` price '' or `` precious '' ) is named as a son of Japheth in Genesis 10:2 and 1 Chronicles 1:5 .
Allison Taylor is a fictional character portrayed by Cherry Jones on the TV series 24 .
The Dread Pirate Roberts is a fictional character in the novel The Princess Bride ( 1973 ) and its 1987 film adaptation .
Tracey Kibre is a fictional Homicide Bureau Chief ADA on Law & Order : Trial by Jury , portrayed by Bebe Neuwirth .
Uncle Petrie or , Petrie J. Martin is a fictional character in the long - running American television series Lassie .
Sun Erniang ( lit . `` Second Sister Sun '' ) is a fictional character in Water Margin , one of the Four Great Classical Novels of Chinese literature .
Sokka is a fictional character in Nickelodeon 's animated television series Avatar : The Last Airbender .
Martin Riggs is a fictional character from the Lethal Weapon franchise .
Peredurus ( Welsh : Peredur ) is a legendary king of the Britons in Geoffrey of Monmouth 's pseudohistorical chronicle Historia Regum Britanniae .
Declan Macey is a fictional character in the British soap opera Emmerdale , introduced on 15 April 2010 .
Nisha Batra is a fictional character in the British soap opera Brookside .
Oddjob ( often written as `` Odd Job '' ) is a henchman to the villain Auric Goldfinger in the 1959 James Bond novel Goldfinger and its 1964 film adaptation .
Sammy Jo Carrington ( born Samantha Josephine Dean ; formerly Fallmont ) is a fictional character on the American TV series Dynasty .
Talia Winters is a fictional character appearing on the science fiction television show Babylon 5 during its first and second seasons .
The Purple Dragons are the name of a street gang in the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles franchise .
Arthur Branch is a fictional character on the TV crime drama Law & Order and one of its spinoffs , Law & Order : Trial by Jury .
Professor John Nerdelbaum Frink , Jr. , or simply Professor Frink , is a recurring character in the animated television series The Simpsons .
Natalie Snyder is a fictional character on the soap opera As the World Turns .
Nathan Petrelli , portrayed by Adrian Pasdar , is a fictional character on the NBC science fiction drama series Heroes .
Olivia Spencer ( previously Lewis , O'Neill , and Spaulding ) ( born February 28 ) is a fictional character on the popular CBS daytime soap opera , Guiding Light .
Doctor John A. Zoidberg ( often shortened to Zoidberg ) is a fictional character in the television series Futurama .
Jael or Yael ( Hebrew Ya'el , יָעֵל , meaning Ibex ) is a woman mentioned in the Book of Judges in the Bible , as the heroine who killed Sisera to deliver Israel from the troops of King Jabin .
Crystal Crazy is an arcade game , published by Casady & Greene for Mac OS in 1993 .
Bad Luck Blackie is a 1949 animated cartoon produced by Metro - Goldwyn - Mayer .
Cuthbert Goes Walkabout is a 1983 computer game for the Dragon 32/64 , TRS-80 CoCo , Commodore 64 and Atari 8-bit family home computers .

Save the Tiger is a 1973 film about moral conflict in contemporary America .
In Old Montana is a 1939 American Western film about the conflict existing between sheepherders and cattleman in the 19th century .
Jag och min far is a song written and recorded by Olle Ljungström , and released as a single in 1997 as well as on the 1998 album Det stora kalaset 1998 .
Bury Me in Redwood Country is a 2009 documentary film about the Redwood forest landscape .
New World Disorder III - Freewheel Burning is the title of the third film of the series of New World Disorder Mountain - biking film series , the film was released in 2002 and was a success that was popular enough that another film was produced as a result of it .
The Idol of Paris is a 1948 film based on the novel Paiva , Queen of Love by Alfred Schirokauer , about a mid-19th century French courtesan Theresa who sleeps her way from poverty to the top of Second Empire society .
Barnaby and Me is a 1978 Australian TV movie about a girl and her talking koala who are pursued by criminals .
Digvijaya ( Kannada : ದಿಗ್ವಿಜಯ ) is a 1987 Indian Kannada film , directed by Somu and produced by Geetha Srinath , Somu and M S Karanth .
Mannai Thottu Kumbidanum is a 1995 Tamil language drama film directed by R. Umashankar .
The Odd Couple II is the 1998 sequel to 1968 's The Odd Couple .
Captive Flock ( Bulgarian : Пленено ято , translit . Pleneno yato ) is a 1962 Bulgarian drama film directed by Ducho Mundrov .
Pioneer Heroes ( Russian : Пионеры-герои , Pionery - geroi ) is a 2015 Russian drama film directed by Natalia Kudryashova .
Yeh Adam ( Punjabi : یہ آدم ) is 1986 Pakistani Punjabi language action , directed by Irshad Sajid and produced by Basheer Ahmad Butt M - Abdullah .
Our South African Birds is an album of South African birds published in 1941 .
A Letter from Bataan is a 1942 `` Victory Short '' documentary film or propaganda film made by Paramount Pictures in collaboration with the U.S. Office of War Information and the United States Government .
Night Eyes 3 is a 1993 erotic thriller film and the third within the Night Eyes series .
Mickybo and Me is a 2004 Northern Irish comedy - drama film written and directed by Terry Loane and based on the stage play Mojo Mickybo by Owen McCafferty .
Cyrano Fernandez is a 2007 Venezuelan drama film based on the plays of Cyrano de Bergerac but set in contemporary times .
Kalavathi ( Tamil : கலாவதி ) is a 1951 Indian Tamil film directed by L. S. Ramachandran and written by Sundara Vathiyar and Chidambaram Natarajan .
Il giro del mondo degli innamorati di Peynet , internationally released as Around the World with Peynet 's Lovers and The Turn of the World of the Sweethearts of Peynet , is a 1974 Italian animation film directed by Cesare Perfetto .
Balablok is a 1972 animated short written and directed by Břetislav Pojar exploring the human propensity for resorting to violence over reason .
Janma Rahasya ( Kannada : ಜನ್ಮ ರಹಸ್ಯ ) is a 1972 Indian Kannada film directed by S. P. N. Krishna .
The Woman Disputed is a 1928 American drama film .
The Price of a Party is a 1924 American silent melodrama produced by Howard Estabrook and distributed by Associated Exhibitors .
Dragonworld is a 1994 film that was released Direct - to - Video .
My Name Is Sultan released on 20 August 2012 .
Beyond the Limits is a 1992 book continuing the modeling of the consequences of a rapidly growing global population that was started in Limits to Growth .
Challenge of the Tiger is a 1980 Hong Kong , American , and Italian Bruceploitation martial arts film .
Kiss of the Death ( Vietnamese : Nụ Hôn Thần Chết ) is a comedy released in 2008 that stars Thanh Hang and Johnny Tri Nguyen .
Night in the City ( Chinese : 城市之夜 ; pinyin : Chéngshì zhī yè ) ( also known as City Nights ) was a 1933 Chinese silent film .
Johnny Does n't Live Here Any More is a 1944 American comedy / romance film starring Simone Simon , James Ellison , William Terry , and featuring Robert Mitchum in an early role .
To Kill a Dead Man is a short film made in 1994 by the trip hop group Portishead .
The Ape Man 's Brother is a 2013 novella written by American author Joe R. Lansdale . This novel was originally published as an ebook by Subterranean Press.and has now been issued as a hardcover book on 31 January 2014 .
From the Clouds to the Resistance ( Italian Dalla nube alla resistenza , literally From the Cloud to the Resistance ) is a 1979 Italian drama film directed by Danièle Huillet and Jean - Marie Straub .
Bolo Raam is a 2009 Bollywood film directed by Rakesh Chaturvedi , released on 31 December 2009 .
The Epic of Everest is a 1924 documentary about the Mallory and Irvine Mount Everest expedition .
Innisai Mazhai ( English : Rain of music ) is a 1992 Tamil romance film directed by Shoba Chandrasekar .
Last Clear Chance is a 1959 American short film produced and directed by Robert Carlisle .
Two Girls and a Sailor is a 1944 musical film about two singing sisters who are helped to set up a canteen to entertain soldiers by a mysterious wealthy admirer .
Gypsy Colt is a 1954 film about an eponymous horse .
Giacomo l'idealista ( also known as Giacomo the Idealist ) is a 1943 Italian drama film .
Failure of Engineer Garin ( Russian : Крах инженера Гарина , translit . Krakh inzhenera Garina ) is a 1973 Soviet television film in four parts loosely based on a novel Hyperboloid of Engineer Garin ( `` Гиперболоид инженера Гарина '' ) by Alexei Tolstoy .
I Wish I Had a Wife is a 2001 South Korean film about a lonely banker who meets a schoolteacher .
Sanikizhamai Saayangalam 5 Mani is a 2010 Tamil crime thriller Movie written and directed by Rathi Bharathi , and starring Sarath and Malaini .
Often an Orphan is a 1949 cartoon in the Merrie Melodies series .
Thanatos , Drunk ( Chinese : 醉.生夢死 ; pinyin : Zuì Shēng Mèng Sǐ ) is a 2015 Taiwanese drama film directed by Chang Tso - chi .
Federal Operator 99 or F.B.I 99 on its edited television release , is a 1945 Republic film serial .
Bulat - Batır or Bulat - batyr ( Russian : Була́т-Баты́р , Tatar : بولات باتر ) is a 1927 silent film , believed to be the first Tatar film and probably the only Tatar full - length feature silent film .
The animated television series of the same name first aired in 1984 , the same year Hallmark licensed Rainbow Brite to Mattel for a range of dolls and other merchandise .
Thief of Hearts is a 1984 film drama produced by Don Simpson and Jerry Bruckheimer .
Telugabbai ( English translation - Telugu boy ) is a 2013 Telugu film written and directed by OS Avinash .
Nirantharam is a 1995 Telugu Socio Political film written and directed by Rajendra Prasad , based on the 1948 Telangana Movement .
The Anderssons Hit the Road ( Swedish : Sune på bilsemester ) is a Swedish comedy , children and family film opening on 25 December 2013 .
Paiyaa ( English : Boy ) is a 2010 Indian Tamil romantic action film written and directed by N. Linguswamy .
Tapper , also known as Root Beer Tapper , is a 1983 arcade game released by Bally Midway .
Somari ( Russian : Сомари ; also known as Somari the Adventurer ) is an unlicensed port of Sega 's flagship video game Sonic the Hedgehog , produced for the Nintendo Famicom and sold primarily around Asia , Russia , and other regions where pirate Famicom cartridges were distributed , in 1994 .
72 Heroes is a 2011 Chinese historical drama film directed by Hong Kong film director Derek Chiu based on the story of the 72 Martyrs who sacrificed their lives in the Second Guangzhou Uprising .
Canción de Juventud ( Song of Youth ) is a 1962 Spanish language musical directed by Luis Lucia comedy film starring Rocío Dúrcal , also stars Helga Liné & Carlos Estrada .
Gang War ( released as All Square in the UK ) is a 1928 part - talking gangster film , best known for being the main feature attached to Steamboat Willie , the debut of Mickey Mouse in sound .
Akela the Alone is a 2014 Indian psychological horror film that includes elements of crime and murder genres .
The Berlin File ( Hangul : 베를린 ; RR : Bereullin ; lit . `` Berlin '' ) is a 2013 South Korean spy thriller written and directed by Ryoo Seung - wan .
Before Twilight ( Polish : Jeszcze nie wieczór ) is a 2008 Polish comedy film drama directed by Jacek Bławut .
The Circus Clown is a 1934 American Pre - Code comedy film about a man who wants to join the circus against the wishes of his ex - circus clown father .
Nancy Goes to Rio is a musical comedy film released by Metro - Goldwyn - Mayer in 1950 .
Hosa Belaku ( Kannada : ಹೊಸ ಬೆಳಕು ) is a 1982 Kannada romantic drama film directed by Dorai - Bhagwan duo .
Onti Salaga ( Kannada : ಒಂಟಿ ಸಲಗ ) is a 1989 Indian Kannada film , directed by V Somashekar and produced by Halaguru Venkatesh .
Nipples & Palm Trees is a 2012 American sex comedy film directed by Dylan Reynolds , written by Matthew James , and starring James , Sadie Katz , Akihiro Kitamura , and Vanessa Rose Parker .
My Marriage is a 1936 American drama film directed by George Archainbaud and written by Frances Hyland .
Transporter 3 ( French : Le Transporteur 3 ) is a 2008 French action thriller film , and the third installment in the Transporter franchise .
The Litterbug is a 1961 animated short subject produced by Walt Disney Productions and featuring Donald Duck .
Corporal Rod Webb and his faithful dog Chinook were the major characters in a series of films made by the American studio Monogram Pictures between 1949 and 1954 .
Lucifera Demon Lover ( Italian : L'amante del demonio ) is a 1972 Italian horror movie .
History of the Eagles is a 2013 two - part authorized documentary about the career of the American rock group the Eagles , directed by Alison Ellwood and co - produced by Alex Gibney .
Novio a la vista , or Boyfriend in Sight is a 1954 Spanish comedy film directed by Luis García Berlanga .
Lovelorn Leghorn is a 1951 cartoon short starring Foghorn Leghorn , the Barnyard Dawg , and Miss Prissy .
Where Soldiers Come From is a 2011 American documentary film directed by Heather Courtney .
My Scary Girl ( Hangul : 달콤 , 살벌한 연인 ; RR : Dalkom , salbeorhan yeonin ; lit . `` Sweet , Bloodthirsty Lover '' ) is a 2006 South Korean black / romantic comedy film written and directed by Son Jae - gon .
Pixote : a Lei do Mais Fraco ( Portuguese pronunciation : ( piˈʃɔtʃi a ˈlej du ˈmajʃ ˈfɾaku ) , lit . `` Pixote ( small child ) : The Law of the Weakest '' ) is a 1980 Brazilian drama film directed by Hector Babenco .
Spencer Halpin 's Moral Kombat is a 2009 documentary film , directed by Spencer Halpin , an American independent filmmaker .
Charavalayam is a 1988 Indian Malayalam film , directed by KS Gopalakrishnan and produced by KS Gopalakrishnan .
Conquest of Cochise is a 1953 fictional and anachronistic Technicolor Western set in 1853 at the time of the Gadsen Purchase .
Pärlor åt svin ( Pearls before swine ) is a song with lyrics by Magnus Uggla , and music by Anders Henriksson , and recorded by Magnus Uggla , and released as a single in 2007 , topping the Swedish singles chart .
Diary of a Sex Addict is a 2001 video drama .
Une blonde comme ça is a 1962 French - Argentine film .
Gaai Aur Gori ( cow and girl ) is a 1973 Indian film directed by M. A. Thirumugham .
Kazablan ( Casablan or Kasablan in its first production ; Hebrew : קזבלן ) is an early Israeli Hebrew language play , staged first as a 1954 drama followed by a 1964 screen adaptation , later as a 1966 musical comedy , and still later produced as a 1974 musical comedy film .
Chicks in White Satin is a 1994 American short documentary film about the Jewish same - sex marriage of two lesbians , including interviews with the Rabbi and various family members .
Nate and Hayes , also known as Savage Islands ( UK title ) , is a 1983 swashbuckling adventure film set in the South Pacific in the late 19th century .
17th Parallel , Nights and Days ( Vietnamese : Vĩ tuyến 17 ngày và đêm ) is a 1973 Vietnamese drama film directed by Hai Ninh .

Blue Rhythm is a 1931 American animated short film produced by Walt Disney Productions and released by Columbia Pictures .
Bargon Attack is a 1992 adventure game , originally released in Spain and France .
Buzzy Boop at the Concert is a 1938 Fleischer Studios animated short film starring Betty Boops young Tomboy cousin Buzzy Boop .
Kudumbasammetham is a 1992 Indian Malayalam film , directed by Jayaraj , starring Madhu and Srividya in the lead roles .
Harrison Montgomery is a 2008 film directed by Daniel Dávila and starring Martin Landau , who plays the title role , a game show - obsessed recluse with magical powers and a large stash of money that Ricardo Papa , a small time drug dealer with artistic pretensions , tries to steal .
Mouna Guru ( Tamil : மௌன குரு ; English : The Silent Teacher ) is a 2011 Tamil thriller film directed by Santha Kumar and produced by M. K. Thamizharasu .
Dong Woo Animation and SBS Production produced Olympus Guardian Movie , an animated film adaptation of the series that was released on 2005 .
Wretches & Jabberers is a 2010 American documentary film directed by Gerardine Wurzburg and produced by Wurzburg and Douglas Biklen about two autistic men who travel the world helping other autistic people break out of their isolation .
Do n't Go in the House is a 1980 horror film written and directed by Joseph Ellison , and co - written by Ellen Hammill and Joe Masefield .
Lambert the Sheepish Lion is a Disney animated short film that was released in 1952 .
Target Kolkata is a 2013 Bengali film directed by Kartick Singh , produced by Shyamol Biswas and presented by SRB Films .

Space Station 3D ( simply known as Space Station in 2D format ) is a 2002 Canadian - American 3D short documentary film about the International Space Station written , produced , edited , and directed by Toni Myers .

Ready , Set , Zoom ! is a 1955 Warner Bros. cartoon in the Looney Tunes series featuring Wile E. Coyote and The Road Runner ( released April 30 , 1955 ) .
Chupacabra vs. The Alamo is a 2013 made - for - TV movie about a pack of Chupacabra that use a tunnel to escape from Mexico to San Antonio , Texas .

Suppressed Duck is a 1965 Warner Bros. Looney Tunes theatrical cartoon starring Daffy Duck .

Emperor 's Holidays ( Chinese : 爸爸的假期 ) is a 2015 Chinese family film directed by Wang Yuelun .

Beyond All Boundaries is a 2009 short film depicting the battles of World War II . The film is shown in 4-D , and includes archive footage and special effects .
Buddy 's Beer Garden is an American animated short film , released November 18 , 1933 ( though at least one source gives November 11 as the date . )
Our Story Our Voice is a 2007 independent political documentary that looks at the social tension in the world today .

Hard Luck Hero is a 2003 Japanese film written and directed by Japanese film director Sabu to showcase the Japanese boy band V6 .

`` The Battle at Shadow Ridge '' was directed by Michael Grossman and written by David Graziano , who creator Richard Hatem described as having the most interesting past of anyone on the Miracles production team , `` who was willing to share , anyway '' .
The Possessors ( French : Les Grandes familles ) is a 1958 French drama film directed by Denys de La Patellière , starring Jean Gabin , Pierre Brasseur , Bernard Blier , Jean Desailly , Françoise Christophe and Annie Ducaux .
Degueyo ( also known as De Guello , Deguejo and Deguello ) is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuseppe Vari .
Lymelife is a 2008 independent comedy - drama film written by brothers Derick Martini and Steven Martini , and directed by Derick Martini , depicting aspects of their life in 1970s Long Island from the perspective of a teenager .
Texas , Adios ( Italian : Texas , addio ) is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Ferdinando Baldi and starring Franco Nero .
